Reviews.Title: “Cochroaches...............”
Reviews.Author: Amanda W
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip. We arrived April 2nd, 2012 and we were suppose to be there until April 7th. Needless to say, the second night we saw cochroaches in our kitchen. I called down at 3:00 Am to tell them. They did not have a room available for us to go into so they said to have our things packed and ready to be moved by 11:00 Am the next morning. Of course, I had everything ready eager to get out. I might add I have a 7 month old and 4 year old. I wanted out quickly. 11:00 AM, 12:00 PM, 1:00 PM, still nothing. Finally someone showed us another room. I was thinking of maybe moving until the girl said that there were complaints about roaches in the room we were in before. They had it sprayed....THEREFORE, it is an ongoing problem. We lost a complete day of our vacation trying to get another room or out of there. It was the Easter weekend so everything was booked. We finaly got a room at the Radisson down the road. it was AWESOME!!!! If there are roaches in one room, chances are they are in the other ones too...

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: mrshkendrick
Reviews.Content: My first time at hotel enjoyed everything at hotel. Service, food, and safety was wonderful will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: gopack32
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in the Orlando area for 2 days for 2 couples. After reading some reviews, we decided on the Royal Parc Suites because although it was an older hotel, it said it was newly renovated. I'm pretty sure they skipped our room. The carpet was raveling in several places, the cabinet doors were lopsided and hanging and it just looked old. It said there was 2 bedrooms with TVs. However, only one bedroom had a tv. The other TV was in the living room. If you are just looking for a place to lay your head and you get a good price, it's ok but is definitely not one of the better places in Orlando to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations Not Too Far from Parks”
Reviews.Author: BocaRatonMom
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about this place given some of the not-so-glowing reviews. I was chaperoning a group of Girl Scouts so I did not pick this place myself. I was very pleased with the accomodations. I was in a one-bedroom suite with some other moms, which included one bathroom, a "living room" with a foldout couch and a small kitchenette. The room was clean, spacious and well-appointed. Most of the kids in our group were in the two-bedroom, two bath suites. A big plus is the breakfast buffet, which is included in the price. While this is not the lavish buffet you would find on a cruise ship, it was good. There were scrambled eggs, sausage and biscuits, pancakes, fruit, oatmeal, and a number of pastries, cereals and breads. I believe you could also make your own Belgian waffles. It was more than enough to sustain you until you got to the parks. There is a nice pool area with a bar, which we really did not have time to take advantage of. The hotel also has a nice small gift shop with decent prices. I never took the shuttle, though some of the older kids in our group did. They said it was on time and was a big bus. One group caught the last bus home at night and they did say it was kind of hard to find since they had not taken it to the park. that is the only glitch. It's about 4 miles to drive to the nearest park but it is a fast drive. While this certainly does not have the convenience of a Disney property--which has constant shuttles and other amenities--for a group like ours this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what expected”
Reviews.Author: Sabanized
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what was expected. A clean 3 star hotel with large family rooms, nice pool area, for a reasonable price. It blows me away when people expect a 5 star hotel for 2 star prices. It was the perfect price and stay for a trip to Disney and a place to let our 2 year old takes naps in the afternoon. The hotels location is very close and an easy drive to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near Disney”
Reviews.Author: CouponLockerDotCom
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Disney and cannot say enough about the hotel we stayed at. It was a very good experience for the family and for me. Our son loved the pool day and night and we got a kick out of eating their Pizza and Wings - as an entirely new experience for us while visiting the area. Normally we head out to explore but on our first night we were done for the day and figured we'd keep it "light" so ordered in - cautiously. We were pleasantly surprised, great taste and delivered hot to our door and added to our hotel tab. We did not take advantage of the shuttle service since we wanted to be on our own schedule but vowed to try it at least once, next time. We have not had good experiences with park shuttles at other locations since there are always far too many stops etc. The breakfast was awesome, the staff was really nice and the rooms are huge - the hotel is basically an Embassy Suites without the roof (and the price tag) which is far better in my opinion for those using the pool! NOTE - It is a family hotel - so for the couples that want peace and quite without little ones running around on the pool deck, go somewhere else, especially if you cannot tolerate that kind of environment. I noticed one guy that seemed to be disturbed about the kids in and around the pool deck and he should have read comments from others about this particular aspect. We will definitely be back this summer and fall!

Reviews.Title: “nothing great”
Reviews.Author: NDjackie
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 room suite there were 5 of us the beds were doubles not queens. Free drinks for an hour was good breakfast was a joke no meat

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: wheresh0uldweg0next
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice large suite and it was very clean. It had a frig, microwave and dishes. Also had 2 flat screenTVs and a large bathroom. The wireless access only worked if I put my computer on the windowsill in the living area which was a pain. Breakfast was mediocre at best. The common areas could have used some work. The elevators were dirty especially the glass windows. Very close to Disney parks and many restaurants.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Lots of room for families on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant about booking with this hotel due to the mixed reviews. I'm very glad I opted to give it a try. The rate was so low at the time we booked that it seemed a little too good to be true. We have a family of 5 and were very pleasantly surprised by the accomodations for the price. The room was very clean and had 2 very large closets as well as 2 dressers. There was a living room, kitchen area with a dishwasher, and large bedroom with 2 double beds. The couch in the living room converts to a queen sized bed. It was the perfect amount of space for our large family. We also loved that there were 2 tv's, which came in handy so the kids could watch what they wanted and we could relax in the other room watching what we wanted. My one and only complaint is that the free buffet breakfast is terrible and we ended up eating somewhere else. We only paid $55 a night to stay there so we could afford to splurge a little on breakfast anyway :)

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: jim b
Reviews.Content: We have 6 in our family and needed a hotel with separate bedrooms/suite. I am a business traveler and stay in hotels throughout the world (12-20 days/month) and I am very qualified to give an honest review of this property. The property itself is VERY dated inside and out and appears to have been built in the early 70's. Now, it all depends on what your expectations are. We paid $169.00/night and I'm here to tell you that there are other properties that may be a little more expensive but are a quantum leap ahead in quality. For instance, Floridays Resort was $30.00 more per night but was recently built and has the same two bedroom suite layout. Check out their website (we moved to there after two nights at the Royale Parc). Anyway, it seems like the location of the property in relation to attractions is good. But, the immediate surroundings at the property are run-down. I would NOT let my kids walk outside the hotel at night and I'm not over protective. The pool is basic, a 2 out of 5. The roooms are large but as I said earlier - VERY dated. Knobs missing from AC units, toilets that need flapper valves and run constantly (I had to stick my hand in the tank to seat the valve and stop the water). The shower heads have calcium build-up and were 30% blocked. And the internet absolutely sucks! I know, who wants to "surf" when you should be vacationing? How about trying to find restaurants or book tickets to shows or check airline info and have the signal fail!! The internet worked 40% of the time! FInally, I learned that photos of rooms and buildings can be photo-shopped just like people can! The vibrant colors of the pool, shrubbery, flowers, even the room were enhanced. The first impression will leave you quite surprised. Bottom line - We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give 0 stars, I would! You need to read this!”
Reviews.Author: Joel B
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that overall I would equate this to the luxury of a Motel 6. Be extremely wary of what you see posted on their website. Look at some of the pictures submitted by visitors instead, because they actually reflect the truth. For example, the beautiful picture they have of the hotel entrance on their website is nice and all, but they completely left out the giant Gift Shop building that masks the entrance. I am guessing they took that picture from the roof of the Gift Shop. Shuttle System: Another example is when they say that they are located only 1 mile from Disneyworld, which would have most first time visitors thinking that they could walk to the park like I did. In reality it’s about a 10 minute shuttle ride to Epcot, the only place where the shuttle takes and picks you up from. You have to ride Disney transportation to get everywhere else which adds about another 30 minutes of travel time to get to your final destination. Pay attention to this because you have to leave the park an hour early to get back to Epcot in time to catch the return shuttle. The shuttle service is absolutely horrible. They only "shuttle" at specific times during the morning and then at night. For instance, the drop off is at 0745, 0930, 1115 and so on and then the only pickups are at 6:00p.m., 8:45p.m. and 10:00p.m. Almost every time we took the shuttle it was standing room only because the shuttle services four other hotels in addition to Royal Parc. So remember that when you take the late shuttle home and you are already tired from the day and you realize that Royal Parc is the last stop of five and the shuttle ride home is going to take you 45 minutes. They say the shuttle is an 80 passenger bus...I counted 16 seats on the biggest one we took, but I guess you could probably squeeze the rest in the back where the strollers go. Customer Service: When we first arrived, check in was uneventful and we made our way to our room without any issues. First impression was that they pictures did the resort WAY too much justice. When my mother in law booked the hotel she requested one of the renovated suites. She was told that it would be no problem and was noted in their system. When we got to our room and realized that the room looked like it had seen one too many spring breaks, my wife went to the desk and asked why we weren’t given a renovated room. Their response was "we already put you on a poolside bottom floor so deal with it." Wow, great first impression guys! Our very first attempt at taking the shuttle pretty much summed it up for us the kind of customer service you can expect from both the Hotel and the shuttle service Platinum they contract out to. We were on the curb 15 minutes prior to the pickup time and waited until about 20 minutes after the scheduled time without seeing any shuttle. My wife went in to ask where the shuttle was and the manager, Ricky, said that the shuttle had already come and left. When my wife told him that we have been out there the whole time, Ricky said "the shuttle company told me they came and they have a GPS, the GPS doesn’t lie." She tried to argue with him that we were out there the whole time and nothing came, but he stuck to his story. My wife came out and told me this and that Ricky had more or less called her and her mother a liar which made me absolutely livid. When I went in and confronted Ricky, one of the desk clerks mentioned that they have sidewalk cameras that would have recorded the shuttle. I asked to see the video to prove that we were right and Ricky said no problem, but again pointed out to me that the video and GPS does not lie, so we were wrong. Ricky disappeared behind the counter for about 10 minutes. When he came out he apologized to me and my wife and said that he called the company again and they did in fact NOT make the stop as contracted. I was not that mad about the shuttle, but having my wife and I called liars was unacceptable. Ricky did arrange for the shuttle to come and make a special pick up for us...gee, thanks Ricky, that sure made up for the crap we got from you. If you plan on bringing small children here who need their sleep at night I would also reconsider. What they don’t advertise on their site is that every night by the pool, which every room faces, is an open bar. This bar really enjoys blasting music as loud as the speakers will allow. That in conjunction with the paper thin exterior wall means you get to hear it until they finally turn it off for the night...which is about 2 or 3 in the morning (no joke). When we asked about it we were told that we could ask the bar tender to turn it down if we wanted. Again, what the crap, really? Breakfast: I love how their website advertises a great "hot" continental breakfast. Here is what it consists of...Soggy and sometimes stale pancakes, stale biscuits and watery gravy, eggs (I think that’s what they were), fruit loops, cheerios, raisin bran, bread, pastries and coffee. Basically, take what they say with a grain of salt, because they would be much better off just putting out doughnuts. Overall, the breakfast is very lacking. What brings it down for me is the absolute terrible service, cleanliness, and lack of family friendly environment. I would never stay here again, even if they offered it for free

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room for families”
Reviews.Author: CKRyan
Reviews.Content: This trip was a wonderful break for our family and the Royale Parc suites met our sleeping needs for a family of 6. Overall, the hotel gave us the space we needed for a big family without having to book 2 rooms. If we had less people traveling with us, we would probably have stayed somewhere else.The web site makes this hotel seem much nicer than it really is. The rooms were clean and tidy, although I don't think the carpet was that clean. The hotel is tucked back behind a gift shop, surrounded by other hotels and very close to a small amusement park, although the web site makes it appear that the hotel stands alone. If you are staying on the east side, you could have lights in your window all night. (they do have privacy blinds and the windows are mostly sound proof.) This area of Kissimmee is VERY busy! Breakfast was filling, but not great; scrambled eggs, small pancakes, danishes, small, dry biscuits, gravy, toast, dry cereal, oatmeal packets, juice, coffee, milk, and canned fruit cocktail. Fresh fruit of some kind would have been so nice! The "gourmet coffee bar" (as stated on the web site) in the lobby is nothing more than 2 carafes of coffee and packets of sugar and half-n-half. MY TIP: Get breakfast at the breakfast buffet and carry it up to your room. We used their disposable plates at the breakfast bar to serve our breakfast and covered it with another plate to keep it warm and took it to our room where we ate it at our clean table. With a family of 6, I took one of our kids to help me and we loaded everyone's breakfast on a tray to take to our room. (They do not have trays, so purchase or bring your own.) Even a reusable grocery bag would work. The pool was nice and my kids loved it. We were at Disney World during the happy hour most of the time, but when we were at the hotel, the happy hour was great! Bar tenders were very friendly. The shuttle offers very limited departure and pick up times for the parks, usually once a day for each park. We had a rental car, so we paid for parking at the amusement parks. The staff was easy to work with. We left 2 days early to go to the coast and stay there. There was no cancellation fee or early leaving fees. I called before our trip to make sure that was the case. Overall, we had a wonderful trip! We were there for the amusement parks, beach and warm weather, not for the hotel. It served our needs, but did not exceede our exceed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “just fine for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: MNnice07
Reviews.Content: My family originally booked this hotel for the two bedroom suite layouts. Two bedrooms and two bathrooms was essential as we all wanted our own space. After doing some research, we decided that the Quality Suites would work best for us, based on their website, TripAdvisor reviews, and free breakfast. As others have mentioned, their website leaves quite a bit to be desired. I wouldn't say it's false advertising--but the photos have been touched up a bit.The room that we got was nice enough, almost like a small apartment with a living room, 2 baths, 2 bedrooms, fridge, microwave, blender, and stove top. The rooms are a bit worn, but they were clean, which is most important to us. We requested a couple extra blankets and pillows, which were brought up to us no problem. The beds are comfortable, and we all slept well--also a huge bonus. The pool area is very nice. In fact, we spent the majority of our time hanging out in the sun and in the pool or hot tub. The pool towels frequently went unfilled, but that's semi understandable since it was constantly busy. There are quite a few lawn chairs and small tables to relax and enjoy the great weather. Tip: If you want a chair, you need to get to the pool area by about 10am, they go quickly when the weather is nice out! Breakfast was fine. It's served cafeteria style. The options are the same each day--scrambled eggs, mini pancakes, rolls, biscuits and gravy, milk, juice, coffee, toast, cereal, and fruit cocktail. It was okay, but it would have been nice to see some real fruit and maybe some sausage or bacon. I realize these items cost a bit more, but would add a lot more value to the stay. Tip: The 7/11 gas station behind the hotel has bananas for .50 a piece, and other fruit and healthier snack options for low cost. As others have mentioned, the staff working breakfast is less than friendly, and seem unconcerned about the messy sitting area. There's a great outdoor patio that was nice to sit at, though those tables were also missed after breakfast turnover. The food was decent enough and is still a great cost savings for those looking to get the most for their dollar. The poolside bar was great also. The drinks were good, but a bit pricey. However, the free happy hour definitely made up for that! From 6-7pm, they have free wine and beer. The bartenders were friendly and you definitely can't beat a couple free beers! :) That alone was a huge bonus. The majority of the staff--housekeeping, front desk, engineers were friendly and greeted us in the hallway. We did not utilize the concierge service while here for tickets or shuttle services, so I can't comment on that. Overall, the stay was nice, and great for families or a group of friends traveling. I would caution business travelers as there are many kids and the pool area/bar can be loud into the evening . If you are looking for a quiet work place, this probably wouldn't work best for you.

Reviews.Title: “Basic family hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsBrooklynUSA
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in this hotel for a week while visiting Disney parks during a busy week in twon. It proved to be a pretty good option as far as its location (15 min by car to Disney parks), close to fast-food and regular restorants. The hotel has a spacious well-kept pool that my kids enjoyed a lot. The breakfast was included so that saved us precious time in the mornings. The 1 bedroom suite was good size for us New Yorkers with a full kitchen and a fridge. You can happily stay in the hotel if you can overlook a wear and tear on the property - chipping paint, unwashed windows, dust here and there and a persistent smell of smoke in the bathroom, though our room was advertised as a non-smoking. The breakfast did not have much variety if any throughout the week, though the pancakes and eggs were made fresh every morning. The bus shuttle would leave at 7:45 am and would not come back till 6pm, which was too long of a day for us, so we ended up using taxis a lot. Wifi connection was free, but was not super powerful and tend to drop often. All in all, it was an OK experience for an affordable price since we had all the important basics our family needed for travel and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..”
Reviews.Author: kmf00000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel February 2012. The hotels New Orleans theme is quite cheesy. There is a large clown looking figure on the front of the hotel that is a little creepy. The rooms were standard. The sheets on the beds were a little worn and could use more pillows on the beds. But for the price we paid it was fine. The free breakfast was decent, pancakes, eggs, toast, cereal...

Reviews.Title: “Great potential-Run down & Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: atltouristmcc
Reviews.Content: Family drove all the way from Michigan to stay here while visiting Disney and Legoland. Upon check in at 4pm room was not ready. No biggee. Waited 30 mins & got room as requested on ground floor. Checked into room and didn't do thorough an inspection because why would we after a 10 hour drive from Atlanta? Dropped bags, kids swam went out to dinner. Returned from dinner and started noticing these things at 10pm, too late and too tired to deal with. Charged entire amount of stay to credit card immediately at check-in instead of holding card for incidentals and charging for room upon check out like most hotels. No hand towels, not enough towels for 6 people as booked - called & rec'd them quickly, no problem. Bathroom exhaust fan falling out of ceiling in one of the bathrooms by 3inches - probably not safe. Corners & edges of both bathrooms full of grime, mold & dust. Lots of rust on all door hinges & door jams in entire room, shower stalls rusty & moldy. Both bathrooms sinks wouldn't drain properly. Bedrooms looked like have not been adequately vacuumed in years. Piles of dust along edges & corners of carpeted rooms. Had to plug in both alarm clocks, absolutely filthy behind nightstands. God only knows what is behind the headboards. Floors & corners throughout suite in general just grimy! Niece got into bed to find a black sock between the sheets either left behind from hotel not changing sheets or it got into hotel laundry, either way the maid should have found this upon making bed. Morning 1 - coffee pot had a moldy used coffee filter/bag still in it. I left it and upon checkout 3 days later it was still there even after complaining about it. On first day came home after a 14 hour day at the MK to find the trash not emptied. Breakfast - (and my kid will eat anything) was over crowded, food cold, eating area dirty & dark. No staff in there consistently cleaning up after such a large crowd. I have seen cleaning crews in many other establishments cleaning during breakfast turnover. We ended up eating drive through every morning. Last night a chainsaw was left outside our door unattended by landscapers. My nephew almost tripped over it. We stayed 3 nts. Tried to politely complain on morning 2 on way to Legoland was told "everyone's opinions are different" and "sure if we wanted to check out early our last night would indeed be refunded." No concern about any issues, just a lazee' fare attitude and pretty much leave if you don't like it. On way home spoke to general manager and she was friendly & thanked me for bringing these items to her attention. I politely indicated that I have stayed at other Choice hotels and none were ever this filthy. Explained that poor condition is one thing and for the most part can be acceptable if clean BUT poor cleanliness is another. This property has both poor condition and poor cleanliness. It was unfortunate because the property has great potential. The suite layouts were the reason we booked it but outside of that it is not a preferred property with all the other choices in the Disney area. Don't be fooled by the website!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TL B
Reviews.Content: This place is better called 'budget suites' than Luxury suites. We stayed here in Feb of 2012 for over a week. Our room was run down, and the floors were dirty. The bathroom towels were Motel 6 quality- small and thin. The daily "full hot breakfast" was neither. There was no bacon or sausage, fresh fruit, gourmet coffee and the pancakes tasted greasy. When we complained, we were told they had changed their menu to a mostly continental breakfast. My husband and son ended up going out for breakfast everyday, costing us extra. The Kitchenette was poorly stocked. There were two pots, four plates, not enough cutlery for a family of four, and a small refridge with no separate freezer (just the compartment for ice) As for outside, the pools were clean, but the hot tub was sometimes cold, and they often forgot to restock the pool towels, causing us to need to use our room towels for the pool. Also, the shuttle service was very limited, and sometimes early and left before their schduled pick up time, leaving us stranded until the next shuttle. This place is okay if you don't mind mediocre services and facilities, otherwise look for someplace else. I don't think it was accurately represented online and did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ScottMc37
Reviews.Content: For the money I expected a lot more, the breakfast was gross, the hotel is showing its age. It was OK but would not stay there again, not at the price I paid. I was in the hotel 3 years earlier but its been a tough 3 years.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: hoosierhiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of a weekend volleyball tournament. Seemed like a good place for families visiting Disney parks because the suites (separate living and sleeping areas) are furnished with complete kitchens in which to fix light meals. There is plenty of storage. Bathroom is very small. Breakfast area needs to be updated as it is rather dark and worn. Variety of food choices is adequate and similar to other hotels serving "free" breakfast. Shuttle service to theme parks is available. Because of the number of children, noise could be a problem for some people. Overall this was a nice property priced right for groups of four to six in one room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for large families!!”
Reviews.Author: beckyspencer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in with our four teenagers. The room was clean, pool and hot tub nice and clean. great managers reception every night which included free beer, wine, and soda outside at the poolside bar. breakast was the usual free breakfast fare. nice location. right next to old town. We ordered Flipper's pizza take out twice cus it was sooo good! Staff friendly and fair prices. We saved it under "favorites" on our laptops to be sure to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag depending on the room”
Reviews.Author: bsorge
Reviews.Content: We have been using this hotel for a couple of days each year for an annual convention. Most of the users at this Hotel are non business people heading for Disneyworld. This means a lot of children who sometimes mistreat the rooms. I have found you are safer with a Single king then a double room. The rooms are tastefully decorated, but they are cheap in providing thin towels and sometimes no bath mats for the floor. They often don't replace the shampoo after the first day. One problem that I have with them is that they fail to include the "Resort fee" in your booking and surprise you with a $ 7.99 daily fee after arrival. I argued that this should be included with the booking costs. They also try to not give you your choice Hotels frequent points for stays. They provide a decent hot breakfast each morning although they call it a continental breakfast. This includes scrambled eggs, juice, bread, pancakes, grits, and some cereals. Most of the Hotels are 3 star or less on this road. Main feature is convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest concierge lady ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not what we expected. The photos are deceiving. The hotel was in a good location. We had shuttles that took us to Universal Studios and Disney World daily and it was only 15 minutes away. So that was convenient. However, we experienced the worst customer service ever by the lady wearing casual clothes at the concierge desk. She was rude, blunt and didn't offer us help at all. After asking her if they sold Disney tickets, she responded with "Depends, are you single?". The next day, when we approached her, she greeted us with "What do you want?". When we asked for a taxi to the mall, she didn't inform us that the hotel had a deal with a shuttle service and would be calling them to take us there. She also didn't tell us how much it would have cost and told us the mall was 10 minutes away when it was a 45 minute ride. We could have called a taxi ourselves and saved $50! How can someone with terrible service be working there? Front office on the other hand, were friendly and helpful. Good location, terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: traveler2702
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The beds were not the most comfortable. The pool was nice since it was heated. They give out free drinks in the evening but I feel they are too liberal as there are many people there that are drunk and there are many children down there and the people do tend to be loud. Granted the bar is next to the pool and it is open but they shoud really cut off someone that has had too much. The shuttle is very limited going back and forth to the parks as it goes only a few times a day.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: orchardview58
Reviews.Content: good location, pool area was nice with a heated pool and hot tub. free breakfast was average, cereal toast boiled eggs juice coffee. beds were lumpy with lots of pillows. clean rooms, kitchenettes were average everything worked. staff was friendly. they have a n evening reception every night from 6-7pm cocktails no charge. room rates are cheaper if you book online.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very clean”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirlOntario
Reviews.Content: Close to everything. Has laundry facilities, kids park and even free drinks from 6-7 pm. Nice clean suites with all amenities. A very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, not so great housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: wanttogotherenow
Reviews.Content: Good location to easily get to Disney, Universal and SeaWorld. Free shuttle to all parks provided, but times are very limited, especially to Universal and SeaWorld. Within walking distance to Old Town (worth a visit) and many restaurants and shops. Hotel had fairly good free breakfast buffet daily. Housekeeping wasn't so great as they kept forgetting to replenish items and give us enough towel etc. Also room was dusty. Pool area was nice and suites were roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value.......”
Reviews.Author: whatalife
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family of 5 for a week in this 3 star hotel during January on our trip to Orlando. I was looking for a reasonable priced hotel which offered shuttle services to the parks and had multi room suites. The Good - 2 bedroom suites , we didn't have to jam into the rooms or pay extra for more rooms, the staff were pleasant and the pool was nice and not to busy. The Bad - Breakfast is plentiful.........but always exactly the same every day- served on paper plates. You can imagine that by day 3......Also the rooms in the pictures look renovated and new - the rooms we stayed in were definitely NOT. Old and worn, with a drastic face lift required. The Ugly - Shuttle service is scheduled EARLY in the morning and late at night only, so be prepared to spend all day at the park or, pay for a Taxi - one shuttle per day both ways, that is it. We also asked about late check out - $25, per hour up to 3 hours and full room rate after that......seems a little excessive if you ask me, as was the daily fee for the use of the room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: GLMUIR
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at this hotel two times. Once in 1995 and then in 2004. Both times we had the suite with two bedrooms, two baths and the living area with kitchenette. Each time it was a good value and the closeness to Disney a plus. We are hoping to visit again and bring the whole family of 12 people. I am already checking out the prices and are considering visiting again. Thank you for a good value for our money. If the breakfast served is not to your liking go to the grocery store and do your own in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great value for large group”
Reviews.Author: IRA W
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of 10, My wife and I,my married chldren and their kids, It is not high end, but well worth it. The room was great: clean and large enough. The crib we requested was waiting. The staff was friendly and the breakfast a plus. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando with friends”
Reviews.Author: Gator-Fan-from-CT
Reviews.Content: Rooms were basic but fine. Having multiple bedrooms/bathrooms an absolute plus as well as on-site laundry. Very secure property. Pool area nice and happy hour fun. Breakfast not really a breakfast. Business center very basic. Staff helpful and friendly. Grocery store nearby so in-room kitchen a plus.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Day 2012”
Reviews.Author: Sonniam
Reviews.Content: I am so thankful for the honesty of your staff. My mother left her backpack with all of her "treasures' and we received a call from you to advise us of the finding. My mom was so delighted when her backpack arrived to our home. She was so happy. Thank you again. You made her day!

Reviews.Title: “don't believe what you read or hear!”
Reviews.Author: prettytulips
Reviews.Content: Sorry, we have stayed at WAAAY BETTER MOTEL 6's.....

Reviews.Title: “Everything is not always what it seems!!”
Reviews.Author: Deand67
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is a definate plus and the rooms although having some minor flaws are comfy and handy with two rooms and a kitchen for cooking.The reason my wife and i decided to go with this hotel was because of the location affordable pricing and breakfast buffet.Now with that said,the breakfast buffet was cold eggs and frozen pancakes and nasty coffee.When my wife tried to use the microwave to heat her food she was snapped at by hotel staff that she was in the way and could warm her pancakes in the toaster.When we aproached the staff at the front we were told that their site hadnt been updated since 2009.i never did see and meat products or an apple orange or even a 59 cent bannana.The walls are paper thin so if you like the sound of banging doors at 1am then this is your place.Holes in the wall and a cleaning staff rummaging through your belongings while you are away then there again this is the place for you,oh and did i mention that the power went out in half of our room causing the alarm clock not to go off and my kids to miss a few hours of park time but of course we all know money grows on trees and that is how we picked our cash for this trip to disney all year long.......Well enough of my grumbling...a thousand plus miles away is home sweet home and when we return next year it will be a Disney Resort for us.....Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Worth your money for Disney vacation...”
Reviews.Author: winjasy
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at this hotel to visit Disney. The hotel is located in a convenient area. 7/11 is adjacent to the hotel. Lots of restaurant are within walking distance. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The room is spacious and clean. The kitchenette only has a limited utensils. Don't expect to cook a meal from this kitchenette. I agreed with others on the comment about the breakfast. It consists of watery scramble eggs, cold french toast or pancake, self serve toast..... You definately get what you paid for. Don't expect a decent "hot breakfast"....The only hot items were scramble eggs, coffee and instant oatmeal. By day three, we only picked up the coffee & milk from the cafe and started to make our own breakfast at our room. Shuttle bus has limited hours and it's inconvenient. We paid the $14 to park at the theme parks. Wi-fi connection is poor. We had to stay outside the room to get a signal. Staff are friendly. For the price we paid, it was worth your money. Like others, we will probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for night before Disney and close”
Reviews.Author: surfpa
Reviews.Content: We needed accommodations for one night before Disney, and this hotel is 4 miles from Pop Century Resort. Our 2nd floor 2 bedroom/2 bath suite with a small living room & kitchenette was just right for two couples. It was clean. The kitchen area is dated and a cupboard door wouldn't stay closed. We used the small refrigerator but not the microwave. There was a flat screen tv in one bedroom and one in the living area. The suite had 2 double beds in each bedroom which was fine for one night. One room had newer beds than the other, but all were comfortable. One bathroom was a bit bigger than the other; both had single bowl vanities. There was lots of storage space in the suite if people intended to stay and shuttle to Disney with the Inn. We attended the manager's reception where beer and wine was provided from 6-7 p.m. It was fine for free. The coffee in the snack area was empty, but an employee got us some from behind the counter. It was lukewarm and a bit strong, so I got plain hot tea instead. I didn't notice any herbal tea. Housekeeping responded in adequate time to get us more towels. For all the food we knew we would consume at Disney with the dining plan we did light dinner at the local Wendy'son arrival night. We went to the local Walmart for some room supplies. Disney checks all bags upon entering parks, and they allowed us to take water bottles and snacks. Since we left the Inn early for Disney's extra morning early hour for resort guests we didn't utilize the included breakfast at the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: jrehder
Reviews.Content: The hotel is disgusting...the rooms are dirty, everything is broken and there was mold in the kitchen. The breakfast was scrambled eggs and frozen French toast you had to warm up in the microwave...the ONE small microwave! Overall gross...do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night..”
Reviews.Author: sara c
Reviews.Content: Be careful! the website is a bit misleading. The room was spacious and clean, but the amenities were not what was expected. I expected a more "resort" type hotel based on the website. It was not that at all. For one night, it was fine. It had free shuttles to the parks (which saved a lot of $$), and the price was good. The haul to the airport was a bit steep. The hotel staffer who called the cab did not do her due dilligence to get us a nice, reliable cab either. I'm pretty sure the driver was a friend of hers.....just be aware. And the heavy curtains do not close...

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty, Unsafe, Bad Part of town”
Reviews.Author: Travelerinpa
Reviews.Content: This is a very very dirty unkempt operation. We stayed in Room number 131. Upon entering our room the first thing we check are the beds. The sheets were clean but cheap along with the two puny pillows on the beds. We next checked the bathroom. Very dirty. Would not allow our daughter to walk barefoot. She kept here socks on and they turned black. Paint was peeling in the bathroom ceiling. The bottom of the door was rotting. Mold on the tile and around bottom of toilet. Red splatter above the sofa which looked like dried blood. The worst issue dealing with safety was the electrical sockets were all loose and three were unattached. I noticed this when I attempted to charge my phone and laptop. A major fire hazard. We decided to check out and brought this to the attention of the manager. He listened, no apology and just gave me the bill. Not a word. The location is kind of sketchy. It is set back from the road behind a gas station and the neighboring buildings seem to look like typical $15 a night flea bag Motels. Many abandoned/closed businesses in this part of town. Pot holes in the parking lot and broken/cracked cement curbs all around which is unsafe. The inner pool/ hotel access area looked great online but in actuality is dirty with cigarette butts everywhere and landscaping which is sloppy. The morning breakfast was horrible. There were self serve scrambled eggs on a Styrofoam plate, white bread, box cereal and a messy coffee area. That's it!...So we ran for Denny's across the street. Lastly the non lobby access doors which are supposed to be access by a key card were never locked. This really killed our moral and kinked our first family Disney Trip. We decided to end our trip and reschedule it for next week as we live in Palm Beach County. I took videos which I will attempt to upload on my face-book page. Will update.

Reviews.Title: “Much better available for the same money”
Reviews.Author: fenrirsget
Reviews.Content: The problems started at check-in. It took more than 30 minutes. There had been a pipe burst earlier in the day, but by 10:00 PM when we were checking in it shouldn't have still been causing that kind of chaos. The next bad news was that our room had been flooded by the burst pipe. Origionally we had booked a two bedroom suite for our kids and ourselves. They did try to make things right by giving us two single bedroom rooms right next to each other, but running back and forth from one room to another was awkward at best, if not down right inconvienent. The next problem we discovered was that there are no curtains that can be closed in the rooms. There were shears, but they did nothing to block out light, and little to obscure the veiw from outside the room. Since we were on the ground floor the lights from the cars at the gas station across the way kept flashing through the bedroom all night. In the morning when we showered we couldn't help but think that since you could clearly see the people through the shears as they walked to breakfast, they could probably see you as you stepped out of the ( somewhat small) bathroom nude to make it back to your bedroom (who's shears did little to obscure the veiw of the people going to their cars behind the room). If your proclivities run towards exhibitionism this might be a plus, but for us it was a definite drawback. The hot breakfast was also dissapointing. The eggs had a unique rubberized quality I have never seen associated with food before. The corned beef hash was obviously dumped from a can and then partially heated through. The french toast was served frozen, with the expectation that you would make it to one of the two toasters to unthaw it and make it edible. I will say that the rooms were large, the beds reasonably comfortable, and overall things were clean. The negatives however far outwieghed the positives. When you add into this the per day "resort" charge they have the audacity to add, this becomes a losing proposition. In short, do not stay here. You won't be happy with it, and your money will be much better spent elsewhere. (unless of course your an exhibitionist connoisseur of bad breakfast ordeals).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel around for golf groups”
Reviews.Author: miketruitt
Reviews.Content: Best bartenders, and the room setups (quads) are the best you will find. clean and couteous staff and a great location, location,location. This was our 15th yr in this hotel and we will be there next year also with a group of 24 retired fireman from illinois.

Reviews.Title: “Good but breakfast was terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Beccahill
Reviews.Content: Great price. Rooms were clean. Restaurant was dirty and breakfast was not great. It's free but I'd rather pay and have quality food.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, relaxing place with great service and close to Old Town Orlando”
Reviews.Author: theobxlocal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week this November. Upon arrival, I wasn't too sure about this place. It's the kind of place that had to grow on me a little. Once I walked through the lobby and entered the courtyard, there was a beautiful pool with palm trees, an outside bar and small arcade. The pool was heated & the hot tub was scorching hot (a good thing). The suite was cozy and spacious. The beds were very soft and comfortable. I made an effort to sleep in as long as possible without feeling like I was missing out on the vacation. The suite also has a small fridge and ice bucket in the kitchen area for the ice machine located outside. There were two nice flat screen TV's, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. The one in the bedroom had a DVD player. The bathrooms were pretty standard for what you would find in your average hotel room, but not too small. The bar in the courtyard is called the Frenchman's Cove, which serves free beer & wine every night during happy hour from 6PM to 7PM. Jen & Liz are the regular bartenders and they're both great! The housekeeping service was very polite and were always available whenever we needed them, although they're not available too late in the evening. If you need something, don't hesitate to call the front desk. My only dislike was that it was not close to downtown Orlando, although, you are within walking distance to Old Town which you definitely shouldn't miss out on. There are fun small scale rides, to-carts, number cars and a couple of daring others such as the slingshot and the sky coaster. I recommend the sky coaster! Looks scary but it's a thrill! And all of his in Old Town is just a short walk down the street without having to cross the main roads. Would I stay here again, sure, if I wanteqd to be in Kissimmee, but I think I may look for something closer to downtown Orlando (personal preference, it's all about what you want to do! Certainly give this place a try!

Reviews.Title: “Basically Good- few things need to be upgraded”
Reviews.Author: Canadianmom71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Nov 8-18, 2011,there were two adults and 3 children in one of the two bedroom suites, when we arrived we were warmly greeted and set up in our room right away-before check in time, the room was definatley recently well cleaned and was always maintained to a high standard of cleaning during our entire stay. The room was a great size and functionable. The hotel itself is nice, not fancy but not nasty either, for the price the room itself is worth it. Never had any problem with any staff they were all polite and helpful. On the negative side- we chose this hotel because it offered a free breakfast but honestly could not stomach the food- it was bad but we chose to buy our own and the local grocery store and did fine, Another problem was that we reserved our booking on one credit card but gave a different one during check in so both cards were charged at one point but they did get it fixed quickly. The pool area was nice and only once they ran out of pool towels but once they knew about it- they found them,... Location was good distance to the parks however the shuttle service sent very small buses sometimes so a number of people had to stand and the departure times at night can be inconvienent leaving the parks- sometimes not leaving until an hour and a half after the park closed- in this case we took a taxi to the tune of $35 Overall , for the budget minded traveller its decent, clean and serves its purpose well, a number of shops/restaurants close by that are reasonably priced and offer good food as well. We travel alot and felt this place does a good job- just need to fix the breakfast food soon,...

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoIlLilly
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers suite apartment style accomodations. We had a 2 bedroom with 2 full baths and a sleeper bed in the living room. The accomodations were very clean too and quite large in size . There is a kitchen with a 2 burner stove, microwave and small refrig. There is no oven. Dishes, utensils and kitchen ware are provided too. One could make tacos, spagetti, salads, sandwiches or heat up soup easily for an inexpensive family meal. The hotel has a pizzeria on site and it sells pizza which was actually quite good at a very reasonable price. This pizza area is also opened during breakfast hours and offers a complimentary full hot breakfast for guests. The breakfast offered a wonderful variety of food selections. There is a nice pool and playground too. For an hour each evening at the pool bar there is a managers hour with complimentary beer, wine or soft drinks for guests too. This hotel offers a lot for a very reasonable cost. The front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant. There is a gift shop in the hotel lobby. A Publix grocery store and a Walgreens is across the street and is walkable. Several restaurants and the Old Town area of amusement rides are also nearby and walkable .It's a great location near Disney and transportation to the parks is available from the hotel.. This is a great family choice and truly an amazing bargain.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stays and Counting”
Reviews.Author: Howard1028
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for the last 5 summer trips of 11 days each. We had stayed at alot of other hotels over the years and 41 trips to Disney World. We had to continuously upgrade our hotels over the years as the family grew to grandchildren, etc. Found this one on the internet and it met all of our needs, especially having two bathrooms as that definately helps in getting ready in the morning in preperation to going to the parks. Breakfast was good, pool also and so convient as all you have to do is cross the street and shoot in to Disney World. Already booking our next trip and they will definately be in our plans.

Reviews.Title: “An avereage place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kvonhoene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in October while we was at a conference nearby. The room was clean and efficient. It had a living area with a couch, TV, table and chairs and a small kitchette. The bedroom was seperate with a nice large king bed with ample closet space. The pool was nice with many chairs. I would recommend this hotel for families. The hotel itself is older, but the rooms were kept clean and updated and the breakfast was suitable for a family. The hotel is close to Disney Parks. The wireless internet was not useable in our room. The signal was so week. I used my laptop in the lobby for a few hours one morning because that is where I could get a strong enough signal without it dropping. If you need access to the internet from your room I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just ok, better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: brnc1968
Reviews.Content: Was a little shocked when we entered the facility. From the picture, you have no idea you sit next to a busy highway right behind a 7-11! Check in was fine. We were then directed to the "concierge" to purchase tickets for the parks. What a joke! After wasting 30 minutes of our time, it was only a timeshare scam. No deal. The facility did not just go through a renovation as stated. If they did, they missed a few spots. The rooms were adequate, the furnished kitchen had 2 plates, 2 forks and 1 knife and one skillet. The towels were thread bare, and we had only one towel and no soap when we arrived. They did correct that after being called. The staff is polite for the most part- definently nothing above and beyond. The shuttle service they advertise is only to certain parks and at certain times...not always convenient. You are better walking somewhere and paying for breakfast. Powdered eggs, cold sausage, and a breakfast staff that would obviously prefer to be elsewhere. Spent most of the time out of the room or likely would have opted to move to another hotel. A little disappointing for a Quality property.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Mondon
Reviews.Content: Dirty room. Stained sheets. Lots of scary noise at night from the back of the hotel. Needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “clean, tidy,affordable”
Reviews.Author: heusm
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean and tidy in a nice quiet location, close proximity to disneyland. Hotel offered free shuttles to the theme parks which was a bonus, free coffee 24/7, breakfast at the restaurant attached and welcome drinks every night. The only complaint i have would be the staff in the restaurant and the shop who try to rip you off, as for the hotel itself no complaints there!

Reviews.Title: “Traveling on a budget with no kids? Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Mom C
Reviews.Content: The rooms need serious upgrades. The shower had a broken handle, fell right off. It wasn't so clean. The towels were STAINED with brown stuff. The staff was unprofessional. The best thing was the parking (free), the location, the breakfast (clean area) and very good breakfast. But I don't recommend this hotel if you are traveling with children. It doesn't have a clean feel and it is NOT kid friendly. One guy at the front desk had a wrinkled shirt, a housekeeping lady was smoking a ciggarette on the sidewalk curb (entrance) while on her phone. They do a happy hour from 6-7 pm and the bar tender prepared a bunch of wine cups and beers before 6 and they were just siting there. We went for the soda and it was a lil flat. Just not the BEST place to stay. It was close to alot of eateries, gas station, food was on site, nice tv.. but that is IT. the sofa bed was stained :/

Reviews.Title: “Good enough to sleep - Forget the complimentary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lizzbeth
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and nice. There was a full kitchen to use. We basically just slept in the room; didn't use the pool, even though we went to see the pool; nothing special, a little dirty. The complimentary hot and cold breakfast was an absolute joke. Not much of a selection and definately not tasty. My daughter is picky eater and the poor thing starved. I myself am not a picky eater and will eat basically anything STARVED. If you want something to sleep in order to be close to Disney - This is the place; if you are looking for something more - Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “very clean beautifull place to stay”
Reviews.Author: della154976
Reviews.Content: this place was amazing and the service was excellent thay go above and beyond for you one call they are there in minutes . we loved it and will go back when we go to this area again close to disney parks excellent shuttle . we told our friens and family this is the best place to stay love the rooms and bedrooma and the service .

Reviews.Title: “Lodging for Guys Golf Trip”
Reviews.Author: Phuzzy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Royal Parc Suites for a golf vacation. The 2 bedroom suites were clean and functional for our 2 foursomes. Centrally located, with great golf and dining nearby in all directions. The pool was never crowded, and was just what was needed after a day on the links. A.M. breakfast is nothing special, and is usually too crowded. But the highlight of every nite is the Tiki Bar Happy Hour. Liz and Jen shine as the bartenders, keeping the place hopping with great music, great service, and great conversation. Will be returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: C0mac
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful six nights at the Royal Parc Suites. We were there to golf, and found the location to be very centralized. At the end of the day we would gather with other guests at Frenchman's Cove. There Tiki Bar right off the pool. Liz and Jen were not only friendly and interesting, they kept the Happy Hour crowd very happy, with their grace and speed. They are one of the main reasons that we came back for our third year. See you next year. PC

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Kenn47
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line: You can do better going elsewhere. We chose Royale Parc, recognizing other TripAdvisors seemed to have very bi-polar opinions. We hoped for the better; we got something in between. Arriving at 3:30pm, the desk clerk began the conversation, "Check-in doesn't start until 4pm. I'll see if something is clean." No "Welcome." No, "Glad you're here." She found us a room. Twenty minutes later, following room instructions in the room, we called the front desk asking for the wireless password to be told tersely, "You'll have to come down to the lobby." When I protested, she told me to be polite! Otherwise, the 3 night stay was adequate. The room was clean, attractive; the handicapped access shower was fine. The bed reasonably comfortable. The towels were threadbare at best and scarce. It wasn't that anything was bad (beyond the clerk's attitude). More, this very large place just felt worn-out, in need of a refurbishment. The chill on the stay took place at check-out. Again, no "How was your stay." No, "Thanks for staying with us." The check-out clerk was cordial but seemed baffled when we wanted to split the bill into two nights on one credit card, one night on another. When he messed it up, all he could say was that he could fix it, but it would take some time. His slow and inept execution of this simple request, led us to just leave. Again, no "Have a safe trip," or "Come again." The breakfast was ok, but the space woefully inadequate for the volume of people. When accosted to give my email to offer feedback, I eagerly agreed. You can guess what I'll say. In fairness, the other staff we encountered were courteous and helpful. A shame their first impression at the front desk was so poor. Management was simply not visible at any point of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: We did not plan on staying at this hotel when we made out our trip plans, but so glad that we found them and ended up staying with them. The front desk staff was amazing. The courtesy, smiles, friendliness, and helpfulness was terrific.We chose them after we had a horrific first day at the first hotel. They made us feel like our safety was number one unlike the hotel from hell. The pool area as nice and clean. The property was well maintained and kept up well. We had a problem with our refrigerator and they not only fixed it right away but alson reimbersed what food we had that went bad on us. Over all this was a five star rating for me and my family. Can't wait til next year so that we can get to go and stay with them again. Thank You for such a terrific stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families Visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: Inhumanimal
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Royal Parc Suites in Orlando/Kissimmee and we were very pleased with the accommodations. We had a two-room suite on the ground floor, right oustide the playground. The layout of the venue is great, as you can access the pool, restaurant, bar and playground from anywhere easily. They have a free 1 hour happy hour, free hot breakfast, and free shuttle to Disney. The staff are nice, and the pizza they serve was better than most we've had in Florida. (We're from Chicago area and used to good pies). Anyway, the only downfall is the empty hotels next door, which give a weird vibe. And, the place is a bit outdated, yet still very clean. Don't go here if you are expecting a 5 star luxury experience, but do go if you want a very affordable, clean and comfortable hotel. Great place and we will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Room for the Whole Family and Three Flat Screen TV'S”
Reviews.Author: KY_Road_Trippers
Reviews.Content: We were exhausted after 7 days at WDW and looking for a place to crash before the long drive home that was affordable and roomy enough for all 9 of us. Doing a search we found many condos but they all charged a hefty cleaning fee for a one-night stay. Then we happened on this hotel and reviews were good so we thought we would give it a try. It also cluded a free full breakfast, pool, playground, pizza restaurant and small kitchen. This is an older hotel that has been updated as suites. The rooms were large, 2 full beds in each bedroom were comfy, pull out sofa in living room, three flat screen TV's, two bathrooms and complete kitchen with two burner stove and two refrigerators. The unit comfortably accommodated our party of 4 adults and 5 children ranging in age from 3 to 16 who were somewhat weary from our 7 days at WDW and being cramped together in the small ALL-Star Sports Resort rooms for a week. WE NEEDED SPACE and more TV's. This was terrific and the price for our October 1 stay was truly a bargain. We stretched out, took a dip in the pool, watched three different TV channels at once and had a marvelous breakfast the next morning. There were many families as you can imagine and we did feel safe in the hotel even though the rooms opened to the inside pool area. Didn't try pizza restaurant but it smelled really good. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and kitchen was well stocked with classes, cups, utensils, coffee pot, etc. I recommend this hotel for large families and it is very near WDW and easy to get to WDW from this hotel. I think they even have a shuttle but I would drive if you came in a car.

Reviews.Title: “Price couldn't be beat”
Reviews.Author: TravelingiCandi
Reviews.Content: I have an extremely sensitive nose and I didn't smell what a lot of reviewers are smelling in the elevators (which I used plenty due to being on the fifth floor). The only issue we had with our room was a clogged bath tub drain which was fixed on our second morning very quickly by maintenance (I called around 9am and it was fixed by 9:20am). We had a great stay otherwise, and will definitely stay again on our next trip to Disney. It was close to every thing and there is a Flea Market on Irlo Bronson as well as a Ferris Wheel. A quick jump on International Drive and we were at the Premium Outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: stranger371
Reviews.Content: For the money I paid for a two bedroom suite, I cannot complain. It is a value for money hotel. The staff is excellent and well trained. I had to take one star because of the unreliable wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “What is that smell?”
Reviews.Author: boyd66
Reviews.Content: I am really torn about writing this review. The two things that REALLY turned me off on the place may not be management's fault. Those two things are the smell in the lobby (like rotting garbage) and the smell in our room (again, rotting garbage). The hotel is VERY close to Disney. There are many great accommodations like a hot breakfast and happy hour. And, like hubby states, it is two years older than when we first visited. But, the smell just knocks you over!! The room, besides the smell, is very clean and roomy. The breakfast is hot and good - even the corned beef hash!! The only negative to breakfast is the two people greeting you at the entrance. One wants your room number and the other wants to survey you on your stay. Why survey me if I use things like Facebook and Tripadvisor? And most importantly, please don't bother me before I eat breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Friendly Lodging”
Reviews.Author: liblaura
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights and I would stay there again. The room was large an clean, the pool was nice and the breakfast buffett was very good considering it was free. Though my husband was sad the days they had corned beef hash instead of bacon or sausage. But they had eggs every day (scrambled or hard boiled), either sausage, bacon or corned beef hash each day (again only one of those 3 each day), home fries, danish, cereal, instant grits and instant oatmeal, toast and either pancakes, french toast or waffles (the toaster kind of these) each day. So again pretty good choice for free. Plus coffee, milk or juice. We did not use the park transportaion so I cannot rate it but they have it. But make sure you call ahead for times so you can plan around the schedule if you want to use it. You can buy tickets to parks there at same price as park sells them or save a good deal of money if you want to go on a time share presentation. We are not fans of these presentations so we did not do this so I cannot tell you if it was worth it or not. Only issue would be the internet wireless service. It was painfully slow and unuseable at times. The only time it worked good was around 5am in morning when no one was on it. So if you need to work while on vacation or cannot live without wireless access this is not the place for you. It wasn't an issue to me as much since I was totally in vacation mode and could careless about updating my facebook or working.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Anney1
Reviews.Content: The Royal Parc Suites was more than adequate for our needs. 6 adults stayed in a very clean 2 bedroomed suite and had everything we needed. Lovely bed linen and plenty of towels. The staff were very friendly and helpful and there was enough choice at the included breakfast to satisfy all our requirements. We only stayed for 2 nights but would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations - reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Elaine B
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of spending a week at the Royal Parc Suites. The rooms were perfectly sized, with a small kitchenette to allow for cooking our own dinner. The price was right, and included the best breakfast (no charge) each morning, and a free cocktail hour every evening. The shuttles were provided for taking guests to disney, the pool and property were beautiful. Could not have asked for more!! Looking forward to going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Location? Yes. The rest of it? Meh.”
Reviews.Author: 253Native
Reviews.Content: September 2011 stayed six nights, seven days, traveling with a group. To keep it simple: Pros: Happy hour. Friendly security guard kept things cool, bartender worked her hiney off. Breakfast. Stick to the cereal, plain eggs, sausage patties, waffles & beverages. Pool. Pretty clean, nice size. Air conditioning. Front desk service. Internet rate. Location. Cons: Breakfast. Sketchy corned beef hash & other interesting offerings. Housekeeping. Knocked at 9, I said we'd be out by 11. Knocked again at 10. This happened three days in a row. Decor. Supposed to be reminiscent of the French Quarter, but it's more "tourist bedraggled." Overall maintenance: sheetrock repairs poorly done & ugly. Handicapped room had a terrible shower. We'll come here again because of the location & room size/options, but we'll have fairly low expectations of the property in general. Not bad but not awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Florida 2011”
Reviews.Author: ArnoldGermany
Reviews.Content: Not enough breakfast seating area; people had to take food up to their rooms. Plastic dishes might do, but these were as cheap as they come. Outside seating area, some sort of insects crawling all over the tables. Rather pay more than eat breakfast there again. Personal was very friendly, rooms and everything else was just as described.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeatherFromPa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on multiple occasions between 2007 and 2009. I put October 2010 because you cannot go back any further than that. Each time I stayed here I had a very good time. The rooms are spacious and very nice. I really enjoyed the bar at the pool. It was convenient and the free happy hour was nice. They also have a small playground which was nice for my son to play at when I brought him with me. The breakfast buffet was good and it was free. The hotel is located in a nice area within walking distance to Old Town and close to Celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Supster
Reviews.Content: We checked in quickly and easily, the reception staff were helpful and friendly. As soon as we walked in to our room we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was huge, a big lounge with tv, table and chairs and then a small kitchen area that was perfect for what we needed (even a dishwasher). Bathroom was clean and spacious. We had 2 double beds in our room (there was 2 of us - a couple) so had lots and lots of space. Another tv in the bedroom was handy. Our safe had no batteries but we let them know and they came and sorted it out within the hour! Our only problem here was the wifi connection was not very good, we were relying on Internet a lot to book next stages of our trip so was a bit of a pain. We did not use the pool as were out every day, and only had breakfast a couple of times as we had some food in the room. Breakfast was fine, a little simple but ok for us. We really were impressed with the hotel, especially after reading some of the reviews. We would happily stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!...”
Reviews.Author: Fatima R
Reviews.Content: My family and I love this Hotel, clean...very nice....confortable, great free breakfast!!....We enjoyed our vacation a lot!!!...

Reviews.Title: “Family Florida Fun 2011”
Reviews.Author: deebattle
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved our stay at the Royal Parc Suites Hotel. The rooms were very nice and cleaned. We loved the free breakfast every morning despite the long wait in line. and the free drinks every afternoon. We will be staying there again real soon. The Battle's Social Club Greenville, NC

Reviews.Title: “great family place”
Reviews.Author: floridafun11
Reviews.Content: our family ranged in ages 11 to 71. most things were just fine except the long wait in the breakfast line, poor wifi conection, need better shuttle bus schedule.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it very much, will be our Hotel from now on”
Reviews.Author: Patricia V
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel the only part I didn't like was the breakfast area, too small for the amount of people in the hotel. The suites are very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Action Items”
Reviews.Author: William R
Reviews.Content: 1 Business Center not properly functioning 2. Internet service is terrible 3. TV channel availability is not adequate. More sport channels are needed (ESPNU and Fox Sports Network 4. Religious channel needed(Word Network)

Reviews.Title: “For the price it is a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: skytravels123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before our Disney vacation in Dec. We had a family of 7 staying in the 2 bedroom suite and had plenty of room. Overall it was a really good experience, however I will go over all the details just to be fair. At check in I was slightly irritated when we checked in as the front desk attendant told us no 2 bedroom suites were available yet, which was not a problem, so we asked to store our luggage until our room became available so we could enjoy the pool and get something to eat. They do not store luggage..we actually saw a family sitting at the pool with all their luggage around them. They may want to consider adding that as an option. That was still not our problem..what happened next was. Another family checking in right behind us in a 2 bedroom suite checked right in. I was not very happy that one front desk agent had rooms available yet ours didn't..so I went up and asked why they had a room available and we didn't....she immediately gave us a room. I still can not figure that one out. Our only other bad experience was check out, we had a plane to catch and just wanted to turn our keys in. The front desk told us we could not just turn in our keys we had to officially check out, which meant getting in a line that went to the door. After waiting in line 20 minutes(our transfer service to the airport was very upset), we said something again and finally set our keys on the counter and walked out. We had no desire to miss our flight for poor customer service. That was the worst of our issues, which again was just inconvenient...some small annoyances were the transfers. It is true what other readers have said about the times being terrible. We woke up extra early for the seaworld shuttle, only to arrive at the park an hour before opening. We literally had to sit on the concrete outside of the turnstiles and wait for an hour. That seemed silly, we decided to pay for a shuttle for the ride back as the hotel shuttle came 4 hours before the park closed that day. That was the only shuttle we used, we had transfers to Universal and Downtown Disney. As for breakfast, we actually enjoyed it. It is exactly what you would expect for a complimentary breakfast and it is a BIG money saver. If you are expecting gourmet dining you should really consider what you are paying to stay here, you get a nice hot and cold breakfast buffet for the price, it can get quite full though so plan accordingly. OK, the room, we found it to be fantastic for the price. It is spacious, our room was clean upon entering and cleaned daily. The bedding is nice and our room looked exactly like the photos. If you are so picky that you don't like that there may be some scratches on your external door..well then maybe you should again consider staying at a 4 star and pay those prices. Of course there will be some wear to any resort you stay at, they can not refurbish them every 6 months. Our room was perfect though, honestly for the price it was far superior to what we were expecting. The pool was clean and our oldest son loved hanging in the hottub during the evenings. Wifi, is just as everyone says, spotty at best. They do have a business center that you can pay to use. It was fine for printing my sons boarding pass as he left our vacation early. Honestly, If you come expecting a concierge level resort, well of course you will be disappointed, if you come here expecting a resort based on what you are paying for it, well then I suspect you will be pleasantly surprised by this place. It is a fantastic value...and if it is any indication as to our real overall experience, we just booked a week here this upcoming March and will be bringing our sons girlfriend this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs Bedbugs Bedbugs!! Do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Woo Sook K
Reviews.Content: We arrived past midnight. Didn't really get to sleep there. In the early morning we noticed that we had some weird reddish bites. Thought they were mosquito bites. Couldn't fathom that they were anything else. After the second night we noticed we had a lot more bites than normal. Started suspecting and investigating the bed area. Found a bed bug near the pillow area. Contacted the front desk immediately. The supervisor came and upon further investigation found more bedbugs. We immediately decided to change hotels. Asked for our money back. They are telling us that they will only credit us for the two nights we did not sleep at the hotel. They are charging us for the nights we spent being bitten by bedbugs. DO NOT STAY THERE!!!! DIRTY, INFESTED, and HORRIBLE customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed myself, things were swell whenever I wasn't at the Royale Parc Suites hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Porsha W
Reviews.Content: First of all, the room smelt of mildew/musty odors (519). We didn't complain about it, I brougt some Frebreze with me. We went to the store to purchase the little stationary air fresher. Later on we discovered, that the beds look like children had made them. There were stains on the linens, they didn't fit the bed properly, one of the ladies found a sock under her bed. There were drinking glasses in the room that should have been removed, due to, a chip along the rim, a crack along the side, and the other was broken. The staff lied to us continuously, while given us lame excuses. It was one TERRIBLE experience. The staff wasn't very pleasant, only a few were hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR FAMILIES AND FRIENDS”
Reviews.Author: wendyagarrido
Reviews.Content: good service, cleaned room and organized, i was suprised when i saw the kitchen, was perfect for us, great, location, near most parks, the best was the pool but we can not stay too late, will be perfect keep pool open until midnight or so.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Leila C
Reviews.Content: To sum up this rating, I would say you get what you pay for. I stayed here in August 2009 and stayed here again in August 2011. I picked this hotel because I wanted to save money on breakfast and transportation. Transportation: I went on this vacation with my brother and both of us don't drive so I liked that they provided transportation. However there transportation isn't that great, especially for Universal and Seaworld. They picked us up from the hotel at 7:40 in the morning to take us to Universal and Seaworld, by the time we got there the park wasn't even open yet. You can assume how annoying this was because we had to wake up at like 6 to get ready and make this shuttle. Who wants to wake up at 6 in the morning on vacation. This also forced us to be at the park for like 12 hours. This is because they didn't pick us up to go back to the hotel until 7:40 PM.By the time we get back to the hotel it 8 so we can never make it to happy hour. I brought a ticket to go to Universal and Island of Adventure in the same day. My brother and I were so tired of rides by 3o clock and we didn't want to go on any rides at Island of Adventure. We end up going on a few rides at Island of Adventure and then walking around until it was time for the shuttle to pick us up. This isn't the same situation for Disney, I am not sure why but for Disney they have more times for pick up and drop off. When we went to Disney we were able to sleep later because the shuttle bus came later. At the end of the week we got tired of waiting for the shuttle so we figured out how to take the public bus back to the hotel. For example, you can take the 56 from Disney to go back to the hotel. In addition, you can take the 50 from Seaworld to go to Disney and take the 56 from Disney back to the hotel. However the bus only runs every 30 minutes. Breakfast: As some people have mentioned, they serve the same thing almost everyday, it always eggs (scrambled, hard boiled) with some kind of meat (sausage, bacon) and bread/pancakes/eggo waffles and some kind of pastry. The breakfast isn't bad just you will eat similar foods all the time. Hotel: The hotel room is really spacious. For two people I thought there was a lot of space. There is also two flat screen TVs, so you don't have to share the tv. One is in the living room and one is in the bed room. The hotel is close to a 7eleven, a supermarket and a gift shop.
