The first day we went to the supermarket to buy food to make dinner. However the pots they provide for us is really small so it was hard to cook. At the end of the week, we order room service and the chicken wings we ordered wasn't bad. Housekeeping was pretty good, they did a good job on cleaning the room. They even put the dishes in the dishwasher for us, however the dishwasher is horrible. The only thing that was really clean after it came out of the dishwasher was the cups. The pots, plates, forks and spoons still had little pieces of food stuck on them and I always had to clean them again before using it again. The internet sucks! I brought my laptop so that I can do some research on the theme park and other materials, however the internet kept cutting off. I would be on a website and the internet would cut off. I had to connect and reconnect like ten times. It was so annoying and at the end I just gave up. The hotel is a little loud and there is always people at the pool and they can be really loud. I don't mind the noise so much cause once you turn on the TV you cant really hear the noise. In addition, the staff is really nice and always there to help. I think this is a plus because they have wonderful customer service which I like. Overall, as I said before you get what you pay for. I would stay at this hotel again but I would find another way for transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kat4luv14
Reviews.Content: My family and I had stayed here on Aug 18 and checked out on the 20th. We were suppose to be here for eight days. We couldn't last another night or day for that matter. We get to the hotel (imagine my family and I are on vacation) we had to load our own luggage ( no bell service). Free breakfast was horrible. It was being served at a cafeteria. A hospital cafeteria looked so much better. The pictures are very deceiving. I requested an up-grade on our room. Which the 1st room they sent us to was not what I requested. ANd the fridge was yellow. it should be white. Then they moved us after an hour. We came from a long flight with stop overs from CA, we are tired. Couldn't relax during cocktail hour. Then our 2nd room we finely got the carpets were so dirty with some smell in the room as you walk in. There were patches on the wall where holes were. The manager even pointed them out to us as he showed us to the room. Free shuttle, was a waste. We were scheduled to go to the Walt Disney Parks during our vacation. The advertisement said to all walt disney parks. It's a lie. It goes to EPCOT and you yourself needs to fine another shuttle to get to the other parks. It was so upsetting. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: This was the most discusting hotel I have been to. The pictures aren't even close to what is really in this hotel. It's very dirty, smells like mold and we had bugs all over our air conditioner. Don't go here---what you see on the internet is NOT what you get. The rooms are gross and dirty. The smell alone was clogging up my husband, the smell of mold or midlew was awful. I believe the managment should be liable for dishonest advertising on the internet - the room was nothing like the picture.

Reviews.Title: “The right hotel for everyone in the family!”
Reviews.Author: peggy j
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived my entire family just loved this hotel. We were treated with so much kindness from the General Manager Mr. Frost to the front desk staff, housekeepers, maintenance staff and wonderful wait staff that we encountered while there. We were first invited to the tikki bar for a complimentary hour while our children enjoyed the beautiful tropical pool area. The suite we reserved had two seperate bed rooms and living room which was wonderful when small children needed sleep and the adults were still enjoying TV. The kids got such a kick out of having pizza from the pizza parlor downstairs hand delivered to their room and even the housekeeping staff made beautiful baskets from towels to house their toiletries that were spread everywhere when we left for our action packet day at nearby Disney. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Orlando, Florida area and hope to return ourselves one day.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable trip”
Reviews.Author: blabink
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and courteous. I had booked online through Quality's website. I discovered the price had dropped a few days later and called the hotel. They promptly adjusted my reservation to meet the currently published price. The room was very spacious (we liked the table and extra seating away from the bedroom) and housekeeping was great! We rarely saw them even though there were a few days that we enjoyed the pool and didn't leave the hotel until noon or 1. My only complaint here is that it looked like the bathroom floor hadn't been mopped for awhile. Other than that, the room was clean in all areas (very important to me). There were always plenty of towels. I was even surprised to find pool towels available in the evening (most hotels we've stayed at are out by early evening and you have to go hunting for some at the desk). The pool area is quite nice although we would have liked it if there had been an 18 and over swim maybe for the last hour from 10 to 11. While I love children (we have 2 although they're older), there were at least 2 nights we would have liked to swim but there were so many kids screaming (yes, screaming) and jumping in without regard to other guests that we (our son included) decided to skip pool time. I know this isn't the hotel's responsibility necessarily but wanted to warn others with older children or none at all. Breakfast was good (eggs, sausage or corned beef hash, danish or muffins, cereal, juices, oatmeal, toast, waffles...hot items alternated each day) but you have to time it right to avoid long lines. People were generally patient though and the staff was always very friendly and kept the food trays full. We weren't able to hear guests on either side of our room but the windows aren't very insulated in that we easily heard commotion in the parking lot and whenever kids went running and hollering past our room. Once again, this is a case of disrespect by other guests. Checkout was quick and courteous. All employees were very friendly and helpful. It was a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good”
Reviews.Author: Jomil0423
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, daughter and her boyfriend stayed at the hotel in November/December of 2010 and everything seemed to be fine. The pool was always crowded but that is to be expected. We did have some problems with finding seats in the morning as the crowds for breakfast were large but the food was relatively good, compared to other places that we have stayed in. The store at the hotel was definitely overpriced and I would suggest going to the 7-11 or even the drug store across the street. Happy hour was definitely a laugh though as there was no one there, music wasn't loud enough to hear and we couldn't hear ourselves think because of the kids in the pool playing. Parking was definitely a problem at this hotel but overall I think the hotel is a good value for the price and I loved the fact that we had a living room in addition to our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: cwaterfalls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royale Parc Suites for one week. The kids my husband and I feel in love with this place. We loved the set up of the rooms which made us feel like we were renting a condo. We had two separate bedrooms and two baths so my husband and I had plenty of privacy. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the managers happy hour which were included. Granted the selections weren't as extensive as the Embassy Suites which is generally our favorite family hotel.the pool and game room were great for the kids who stayed very busy duriour stay. We were close to shops outlets and a.d restaurants. And most importantly close to Disney World. We would definately stay here again the price of the rooms we more than reasonable compared for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “too many problems for it to be a vacation and unsafe”
Reviews.Author: nickey75570
Reviews.Content: The police were at the hotel twice during our stay for disturbances. The bathroom above ours overflowed through the ceiling fan. We came home to everything in it being soaked. The hotel was trimming palm trees which distiurbed the ants habitat. So the ants found a new home infesting our car. It took hours to spray, and clean it. The tree branches were also left in the parking lot. Which contributed to not having enough space to park. The coin machine for tokens to do laundry was out of service. So much for doing the laundry. Managment was not helpful and showed no responsibilty for any of these situations thoughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions are very important to impress, and this did not....”
Reviews.Author: foodfrenzy11
Reviews.Content: My family(4) stayed here while vacationing in Orlando and we brought our grandmother so we had five in a room. There was a pull out couch and two double beds. The pool with the tiki-bar had free beers,soda,and water during happy hour. The kids in the pool were rambunctious and annoying(not the place to stay if you want to relax by the pool.) The maids did not do a good job cleaning the bathroom was not vacuumed. For all the nights we stayed there was a Magic Kingdom map under the sink, the maids never moved it. We came back from the park at about 4:30 and the maid was still there!!! The employees were kind and when we asked for extra pillows they were there within minutes. Overall an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Greattt.....will come back”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is greattt....staff is friendly. The rooms are clean and everything is nice in place. One thing only, some of the maids doesnt speak english nor spanish. For teh rest...will recommend it to otherss!

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose but not what was advertised on website”
Reviews.Author: kmstorms
Reviews.Content: Positives: The hotel is very well located for all the parks we visited (Universal Studios, Disney Magic Kingdom, Disney Blizzard Beach). The hotel is next door to a 7-11, so we could very conveniently get drinks and fuel. There is a Publix grocery store very nearby (short drive, even shorter walk), so we got food there and ate dinner in our room, which helped our budget. Having a kitchen in our room helped make the stay more comfortable. The buffet breakfast was fine. The hotel gym looked very nice, and was hardly used. There are loads of restaurants very nearby so there is an abundant choice when eating out. Hotel parking was plentiful and there were even spaces in the shade (necessary for parking in the Florida summer). Criticisms: The hotel is older and is clearly worn in several places, which was not what I expected from the website. The walls are very thin and we could hear everything happening in the rooms around us and corridor outside our room. Although the hotel's website states they offer shuttles to the popular amusement parks (which was one of the reasons I chose this hotel), the schedule was limited and not practical (for example, one trip to Universal in the early morning and one returning in the evening; we had a child with us and we could not have withstood the heat for 12 hours) so we ended up driving ourselves to all the parks we visited (tip: if you stay at this hotel, budget for amusement park parking when planning the trip). The wireless network worked within the common areas of the hotel but only in the living room of our suite, so we were unable to use wifi in our bedrooms (which is not ideal when someone is sleeping in the living room). The hotel gift shop was very over priced, so we made the most of the nearby 7-11 for refreshments and the nearby giftshops for souvenirs. To anyone from outside the USA, where everyone is accustomed to carrying photo ID, please bring an official form of photo identification with you to this hotel. We found the check-in process difficult and rather stressful since we didn't have photo ID, and were told ID is required to use a credit card AND when you use cash for room payment (of all the places we visited and purchases made over three weeks in Florida, this hotel was the only place that requested photo ID to use our credit cards).

Reviews.Title: “huge rooms,older hotel in ok neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: travelin0101
Reviews.Content: was nice to have 2 rooms with kids, but we did not spend much time in the room. Very close to disney and a 7-11 is right in front of the hotel, be careful walking around at night, saw a bum passed out in the yard by the driveway when we came back from disney one night late, and another day decided to walk to amusement park about 2 blocks away and 2 different men stopped to ask if we needed a ride as we cut across parking lots next door, funny no cars were marked as "taxi" so no clue who they were...went to flea market across street and looked down an alley and saw a huge group of teenagers lurking. Hotel was clean and pretty quiet, had a big laundry room which was nice, breakfast was poor to say the least, food was ok, a lot of times were out of items and could never find anywhere to sit, one morning sat outside which was ok, but had trouble getting back in to get more drinks since door locked when we went out. Not sure we would stay here again, maybe a hotel that is better organized would be nicer with a better set up for breakfast. Never had time for the pool but it was always packed also so it must have been nice. Did like the huge rooms with the big fridge that was the best thing about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “SUCKS, THE WORST HOTEL ON EARTH”
Reviews.Author: ELABISPONVERDE
Reviews.Content: I have been taking vacations with my family for the last 10 years, I went to a different hotel every year, but this has to be the worst hotel in the United States, the first night everything was ok, just ok, the second night no towels, no shampoo, no conditioner, no nothing. I called the house keeper, no answer after 5 times calling, I tried the front desk but no answer, I went to the front desk but after 10 miserable minutes waiting, they told me that they were going to send someone, 20 minutes after they brought some stuff. the next day the swimming pool was really nasty, a group of guys took charge of the whole pool, jumping around, racing each other, pushing people out of the way, drinking, smoking and nobody to stop them, the management didn't care, 3rd and 4th day again no towels and no nothing, the breakfast was the most unhealthy and pure grease I ever tasted, my kids really hated it and they never want to go back again, bottom line The Wingate by Whydam in Lake George, Emmbasy Suites in Niagara Falls, or Majestic Elegance in Punta Cana were the Best Hotels, and they were Heavenly compared to this horrendous place...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and plan to be back in November of this year....”
Reviews.Author: kameon99
Reviews.Content: This was a very enjoyable trip. The Royale Parc Suites accomodations were excellent - so if you're in the Orlando/Kissimmee area - this would be the place to go. We had a group of about 45 family and friends and a herd of kids between the ages of 1 - 19 and everyone had a GREAT time.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at royale parc suites”
Reviews.Author: zoom8942
Reviews.Content: this is our second time staying at this hotel. We fit me and 3 of my kids, my parents, my brother, his wife and kids all in one suite!! free breakfast, and even though its not as expansive as it was 2 years ago it stilll far surpasses any breakfast I have ever had at a hotel. Our refridgerator wasnt working on arrival, but they promptly replaced it. they were quick to bring us extra towels. The pool area is nice, but it is extreemly noisy. I believe heard the hotel was full. Convenient to everything. Publix across the street, disney a couple miles universal and sea world 15 min drive.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for getting around”
Reviews.Author: LaCanadaDublin
Reviews.Content: We came here for our honeymoon, I rang the hotel beforehand and they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a better room with extras so already off to a good start. The staff were friendly and helpful, we actually forgot our cell phone charger and we happen to ask one of the staff did they have any spares and they did and no trouble in borrowing it. They advertise a breakfast buffet, it wasn’t actually to my taste but there was plenty of everything, we enjoyed the cinnamon rolls the best. Out of all the hotels that we were looking at I found that this hotel was ideal as they offered a complimentary shuttle bus to most of the parks to Disney and Universal which was really ideal. A tip for people staying at this hotel as we were only in Orlando for 10 days so we purchased our park tickets at the hotel, they offered that we could get it cheaper if we visited a local hotel nearby, complimentary lunch would be offered and transport to and fro to our desired destination, we went, it was holiday timeshares, bad mistake, we had no interest and it was a waste of our precious holiday time, and there's, to be honest, so please be wary of this if at all making enquires when at the hotel. The hotel has a very good website and it can be deceiving as it wasn’t as new and fresh as it looked on the photos, but at the end of the day it was very functional. Probably not the venue for a honeymoon though. Will return again as its ideal base for getting around to the different parks and is aimed at families.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again, even if it was free”
Reviews.Author: RGOLOBDRAKE
Reviews.Content: I regretted this hotel from the moment I walked in. We were told via the phone that we could check in early. Upon arrival, I waited in a long line, only to be told that they couldn't find my reservation. When they finally did find it (after an hour in line), he told me I couldn't check in until 4:00 (it was 2:30). When I told him that I had phoned ahead and that the person had told me I could checkk in early, he literally picked up a stack of papers and gave them a shake. "You see these? All these people are ahead of you," he told me, referring to the stack of papers. When I asked if there was no one else working there, he told me that he guessed they must all be on break and that he was the only one employed there who did any work. The first night, perched on the sidewalk outside my room, three unattended teenage girls played three diffferent music devices. At 1:00 a.m., I finally had to get out of bed and step outside and ask them to move away from our window. They had been there for at least two hours, as they were there when we arrived at 11:00 pm. The second night we were locked out of the building, and when I approached the front desk, I again encountered a long line and one employee. When I explained that we were locked out, he told me to get in line. The only other person working was someone in the kitchen, who did eventually help us. On our last day there, my children wanted to swim. Although the hotel boasts that it is non-smoking, they do not enforce the rules, and the pool area was filled with smokers. As I could not get timely help from staff, I asked the smokers to move to the designated smoking area away from the children. I was received quite rudely, and the situation escalated when one of the smokers instructed her children to throw water on me. Two boys wetted my shoes and my camera. I asked that the hotel get security because our interactions were getting physical, but my request went unanswered. As my children and I attempted to leave the pool area, one of the smoking patrons yelled, "Just get on outta here, you fat, ugly bi***!" in front of about 50 people, still puffing on her cigarette. Again, I went to the front desk and asked for help. I truly wondered if I was going to end up in jail if the situatiion became physical and I attempted to defend myself and my family. My children and I walked across the street to a souvenir shop, and when we returned, one of the women from the pool was on the sidewalk outside of our room, smoking a cigarette. Again, I asked for help from the front desk, and again, I had to manage the situation myself. Truthfully, it was very difficult to refrain from a physical altercation. I didn't want to get arrested during my vacation. While I understand that some of the problems I experienced were the behaviors of the patrons, I also believe that the staff hanled the situation unprofessionally and unsafely. When situations escalate to people throwing water on you and your belongings (my camera is ok, thank God), people yelling and screaming profanity at you, and people waiting for you outside your room, hotel staff need to put a stop to it, even if it means calling the sheriff's office. Not only did the staff not help me, but they mocked me when I asked for help. I have since tried to reconcile the situation, but the only thing I've been able to accomplish is the customer relations specialist offering me two free nights at the same hotel (to which I said, "No, thanks."). In my entire life, and I've been alive for 43 years, I've never had a more grueling hotel experience, and I've never seen such lax customer service people. I get better service at Motel 6. Let the fact that I turned down two free days speak for itself, and anyone who doesn't want to vacation with unattended teenagers playing loud music at 1:00 am and spend pool time in a cloud of smoke, beware! I regretted this decision from the first day I got there, and a week later, I'm still wishing I could do it over and choose a different hotel. It was supposed to have been my vacation! On a positive note, the breakfast was delicious and the beds and comforters quite soft!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: RNtravler
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say after reading some of the negative reviews on here, I almost changed my mind and canceled my reservation. However, I am VERY glad to say I did not. Yes, the hotel has a little wear and tear but it was definitely not run down or in a bad part of town. It is centrally located to many stores on the highly traveled 192 and a very easy 8-10 minute drive to Disney. My family and I had the pleasure of spending the night here after a long day at Disney World on July 22nd. We arrived to the Hotel at 8pm and were relaxing in our very clean and spacious room by 8:15pm. The Check in process was quick and the employees were friendly. We stayed in the two bedroom suites with 4 double beds. The beds were comfortable and the linens crisp and white, each bedroom had its own bathroom which were also found to be clean and roomy. My only complaint was the lack of available towels, but it only took one call to the front desk and 10 minutes later we were brought a stack of warm white towels and wash cloths. There was some noise to be heard from the swimming pool at night, but we did not find it overly disruptive or loud in our room while watching TV. This noise was not heard at all from our bedrooms. The air conditioning system works great and was a welcome relief after spending all day walking in the 100 degree heat. The morning breakfast buffet was a good variety of food and replenished frequently. I can see how they may be a lack of seating if you are eating early to leave for the parks, but we arrived downstairs around 8:50 and found seating for a family of 6 without difficulty, nor did we stand in a very long line for food. The pool area was nice although we didn't use it. Our check out process was quick and we will be staying here again our next visit to the Magic Kingdom!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS UNLESS U WANT THE "INTERNATIONAL FEEL"”
Reviews.Author: bruceol
Reviews.Content: From the minute I saw the hotel entrance, to the time I checked out. This is not the place to stay if you want nice accomadations. Check-in took 30 minutes. They only had 2 people working the desk for 10 families trying to check in. Screaming babies and irritated children, super small lobby, time share people ect. While waiting my turn, I went to the so called restaurant to get a drink. The woman behind the counter didn't speak English. After a 10 minute run around, I was told I could not by a beer until the outside bar opened at 5pm. I was directed to the 7-11 directly next door. The hotel location is at the corner of us 192 and International dr. A major intersection. While there are plenty of restaurants and stores with in walking distance, the surroundings are terrible. They supposedly had free transportation to Disney [they said 1 mile to disney-HA! try 7 miles to any drop off point] also Universal and seaworld, the mini buses had only a hand full of pick up times and only one hotel pick up time for universal [740am] The pool was small but kid friendly, however, it stayed open til 11pm. If you aren't bi-lingual, forget about trying to ask for quiet. The rooms have thin walls, and noisy neighbors. Under stocked drinking cups in the kitchen, mold in the bathroom, the hdtv's only got 2 hd channels and the pull out couch/bed had a matteras that had to be 30 years old. None of the coke machines I tried worked. The room doors open to a balcony walkway, that always had someone walking by your window. If you want the free breakfast buffet, bring your own tray. They don't supply them. Be prepared to stand in line with everyone at the hotel. Everyday they were always out of something. Ketchup, milk, napkins ect. My advice would be.....spend the extra cash and up-grade. If you are on a limited budget, fine stay here for that definite "international feel" if you get my drift.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this filthy place!”
Reviews.Author: Cemsah
Reviews.Content: Dirty, filthy place! Upon check-in, the floors were not vacuumed. Corners of the room were dirty and dusty. There was 1-inch thick dust on both air conditioner units. There was only one remote for two TVs; the remote didn't work. The bathtub drain was clogged up. We had the room booked for 8 days...we checked out after 1 night, which was not soon enough

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst experiences we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: GroupTravel1327
Reviews.Content: I reserved over 20 rooms at this hotel and our experience was horrible. At check in they said we still owed a balance, but the balance was taken care of a month prior to us arriving. The hotel keys did not have the room assignments on them even though a rooming list was provided prior to arrival. I was not able to get into my room until after 5pm due to housekeeping not having the room clean by check in time. The qualiy of the hotel is nothing like the pictures online. The hotel is dull and grimy. There is nothing Royal about the place. It is really a QUALITY INN. They did a very cheap renovation on the property and some of my party reported having to go through the door sideways because it would not open up all the way. Some reported dirty towels were left by housekeeping and request for additional bedding for sleeper sofa were never answered. One even reported seeing a roach in the room and the housekeeper was acting scared to kill it so she killed it.The food at Perky's Pizza/Cajun Corner was aweful. Several mornings my family ate at Krispy Kremes or Denny's across the street. This is our 5th year for our annual trips and we have never experienced anything like our experience at Royale Parc Suites. The staff was very nice, but it didn't make up for the quality of the place. This place really did not meet my expectations considering how vibrant the property looks online. We will never use another Choice Hotel property and we travel every year to different cities. I filed a formal complaint with the corporate office regarding the problems we had at check in/the quality of the hotel rooms and all we received was a letter of aplogy. We spent over $9,5000 on the rooms. The best part of the hotel was the bar and swimming pool areas. The kids were able to enjoy the pool while the adults were able to relax at the bar. If you are use to upscale hotel accomodations AVOID this hotel because you will be highly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Resort my Fanny”
Reviews.Author: badog153
Reviews.Content: Looks great in the pictures right? Well to bad you will pull up to a ghetto washed up building with a rude manger serving as your helpful guide to a dreadful vacation. I guess if you normally stay at a motel 6 this is considered a resort, but if you wanna keep your hub caps go somewhere else. Talk about classy...wait to you see the faded tacky clown leading you towards the dirty building. If you do decide to stay here just drive past all the wonderful hotels at the same price and take a left at the tacky american flag building. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis60
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, and many others who need at least a three star hotel for a family of five or more, this is the place to go. Clean and pleasant. I did have to wait longer then I expected to check in, but it was worth it. Not only was the suites spacious, it even served free breakfast, and provided a free shuttle bus to the parks. to all the staff thank you. The Browns

Reviews.Title: “NOT 1 MILE TO DISNEY LIKE THEY ADVERTISE”
Reviews.Author: dominguez650
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and spacious. Not in a good location. There is a hideous colorful building right in front of hotel which blocks view of the Hotel. DISNEY IS NOT 1 MILE FROM HOTEL. It is a far distance to even get there with shuttle (which they only have two time frames to catch shuttle 745 or 945 am, if you miss shuttle, $30 for taxi to Disney) last shuttle at 1130 back to hotel which means you cannot stay later hours at disney unless you get another taxi back. False advertisement is what really upset me. We got there at 5 pm to hotel and there were no shuttles to disney and if it were 1 mile to disney we could have walked, but i want to say its about 6 miles just to get to disney area. shuttles on holidays are cramped with people even standing on the aisle..... hot, hot, hot,......

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything they say.”
Reviews.Author: Rockhole
Reviews.Content: First of all regarding information about Disney World, the hotel states that the distance is one or two miles. Crock, the shuttle takes you to Epcot and it takes 15-20 minutes to get to Epcot on the shuttle. Once you arrive at Epcot, you have to walk about a quarter of a mile to the entrance and if you want to go the Magic Kingdom you have to ride the monorail to the main entrance to Magic Kingdom and then ride another monorail to finally get to M.K. This can take 20 to 40 minutes depending on the number of people riding. The shuttle is free as is stated but there are only five pick up times at the hotel beginning at 7:45 a.m. and ending at 5:15 p.m. The shuttle will bring you back from Epcot to the hotel starting at 6:00 p.m. and ending at 11:30 p.m. with a total of four returns. The hotel states that all furnishing are new. Well, our hide-a-bed had a broken spring sticking out the side and the mattress was so thin it was difficult to sleep because of the cross rail pressing into your body. On a positive note, the free breakfast was great. Cereal, eggs, meat, buns, pancakes, toast, juice, etc. No complaints. They also had apples and oranges plus on morning there were bananas. The pool was nice for kids and overall the hotel, room, and grounds were clean and attractive. I would recommend this as a place to stay but as I stated above, don't believe everything you read.

Reviews.Title: “Think about your vacation needs before you book rooms at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Axsdata
Reviews.Content: The price was right - $159 a night for a 2 room suite for 5 people that could have accommodated more. But the hotel was a little bit run down even though it recently had a face-lift. The main thing you need to know about this hotel is that it is quite large and is priced to accommodate large families or groups on a budget. And that it does. The day we arrived there was some sort of baseball thing going on and there were rooms filled with unchaperoned teenagers. We had to call the front desk about the ones next door who were making a big noise after 10. The front desk apparently called the coaches and the noise was stopped. The other noise factor is that the hotel rooms all face inward towards the pool area which is filled with rambunctious kids until well after 10. The pool area is fairly small and definitely not for adults who want a leisurely swim and a quiet drink by the pool. So if you have a big family that is there for the theme parks and are on a budget this might be an OK place. If you want peace and quiet and a more upscale experience, this is not for you. We were in Orlando to visit the Disney parks (5 adults) and I chose this hotel because of proximity to the parks. The website talks about a free shuttle to the parks, but there is an Orlando guide in the hotel lobby who immediately talked us out of the shuttle. This was because the shuttle only GOES to the parks in the morning and only RETURNS from the parks in the evening. He advised us to drive to Disney and park our car. Then we could return to our car and leave and come back if we needed a break (the Disney parking pass - $14 - lasts all day). Otherwise we would be stranded at Disney unless we wanted to take a cab. Our experience there was OK. We got a reasonable room and the beds were comfortable. The rooms were somewhat old but nothing objectionable. The free breakfast was not very good at all. The breakfast area was quite dark and very institutional feeling. The food was lowest common denominator canned stuff. They have a free beer and wine happy hour. The beer and wine were also of the lowest common denominator imaginable. But what can you expect for the price?

Reviews.Title: “children and adults loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mburk_11
Reviews.Content: Your hotel was great, no complaints at all. Rooms were clean and well taken care of, Breakfast buffet was excellent with lots of choices. Pool and towel service was number one also. The bartender's deserve a extra thank you!! The employees def need a pat on the back. Thank You all for making our visit a memorable one! FUTURE VISTORS TO YOUR HOTEL....STAY WITH ROYALE PARC SUITES!!! Sincerely, Peggy from PA

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gigi9968
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was very nice, rooms clean & beds very comfortable, we were disappointed with the horrible breakfast, leaky toilet, excessively frayed carpeting, virtually non-existent wi-fi, sporatic gift shop hours, & not very helpful 'concierge'. Be aware that the rooms are not automatically cleaned daily, you must request it. Was not impressed with the condition of the patio/swimming pool area. Was not an overall terrible stay, but I'm sure that we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved some of the services but could not get connected! Will never return!”
Reviews.Author: ccptas
Reviews.Content: We could not get internet. Even though they offer free Wii Fi you gets no connection. Then in the evening the young lady directed us to the business center. The business center had 3 computers but only 2 were working and there was never a line fewer than 5. We were scheduled to stay for a week during entire conference. But we checked out after one night. George and Ricardo tried so hard to keep us as guest but it was a no go. I had work that needed to be completed via internet. So I could not take the chance. But thanks George and Ricardo for providing this no connection place with great customer service. PS. Then there was the free breakfast and the unclean room at check in.... They served no name brand unsweetened cereal. And Cornbeef hash for the meat. What is that????? Stale muffins-YUCK! The room had unrecognizable items still on the floor and trash when I checked in..YUCK!! Oh I almost forgot about the Managers reception. I stood in line for 10 mins to only notice a women walk away with a 3oz dicsee cup of wine. Stop Playing! Maybe I am a hotel snobb but I do like clean rooms, recognizable meat for breakfast, and internet when you say you have it. And what kid eats unsweeted fake-O's for breakfast?

Reviews.Title: “We loved to stay there and we'll be back in the future.”
Reviews.Author: xavicito
Reviews.Content: Limarys was the person that clean our room. She is a very nice person and took care of us like a family member. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Provided What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: JohnN95
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay close to a convention center, and this hotel provided what we needed. The breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Took the bad with the good!”
Reviews.Author: nms114
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was very nice and the staff was friendly and helpful! We stayed on the fourth floor, which was nice to have a view of the pool when we walked outside of our door. Our group stayed in a two bedroom suite and found the beds and pillows to be very comfortable. The sheets appeared to be clean as well as the dressers, closets, toilet, and shower. The only downfall to this hotel was the lack of vacuuming (very dirty floors) and attention to detail when it came to dishes that were supplied to be clean (many weren't very clean and most plates had old wear and tear which caused them to look dirty & they were stained). It was nice to have a dishwasher in our suite. The exterior of the hotel could use a paint job and it appeared to be a little run down and not as appealing as the pictures. The outdoor pool was nice, but for the amount of people that stay at this hotel there weren't enough chairs for everyone. Free breakfast was amazing; hot waffles one day and french toast the next. Shuttle only left at ONE time during the day to go to disney or to shop; made it useless because the time was too conflicting with everything else going on. Took a long time to get something when we called the front desk for it. Waited over an hour for extra bedding (went to sleep without it) and the next night took over an hour to get dishwasher soap! If you're bringing your own computer don't expect the "high speed internet" to be fast.. took minutes to load a page and it only worked when I was near a window; even then it still would kick me off and not let me reconnect VERY frustrating! Walgreens, shopping, dining, as well as bargain price souvenir shops are all within walking distant; def a good perk if you didn't rent a car! Overall a decent hotel for the price, but it's nothing as fancy as the pictures appear to be and the corners of each room are filled with dust and gunk; esp the bathroom! I would suggest housekeeping doing a little better cleaning job!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for parks, very pleased overall!”
Reviews.Author: alinmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2-BR suite in late May. The suite was the perfect size for my family of 6 and was much larger than I anticipated it being beforehand. The desk staff was excellent, both when checking in and when I needed assistance with directions. The location is outstanding for traveling to the Disney or SeaWorld parks, close enough to Disney that you can bring the kids home for a nap in the middle of the day and go right back later. The drive to the Magic Kingdom entrance from the hotel was 7 minutes, that's from the hotel parking lot. I don't have any negatives, other than the wi-fi is somewhat lacking. Could not pick up a signal in the back bedroom, and had a dropped signal a couple times throughout the week. The breakfast buffet was good, not great (but with a Krispy Kreme two blocks away and a Dunkin Donuts across the street, it didn't really matter to us!). Overall I was very pleased, particularly considering the rate I paid - it's not a 5-star, but I didn't have any issues that would keep me from returning and with the friendliness of the entire staff, I would definitely return. I would recommend though if at all possible to get a room not on the first floor near the pool, as that can be noisy, particularly later at night. I was on the 4th floor and it was fine there.

Reviews.Title: “good points and bad points”
Reviews.Author: Teddysox
Reviews.Content: The good points abut this hotel is it is a close drive to WDW and it has the suites( two bedrooms and two bathrooms) which is handy with teenagers, it has a decent breakfast but it gets a bit boring after a week, it also has happy hour with free drinks which was fun. It is close to stores, supermarkets, and restaurants. The beds were comfy and the sheets were clean and they gave you lots of towels and soap etc. The bad points is the hotel is run down and needs way more maintenance, it is not the cleanest of hotels. The rooms needed a good vacuuming in the corners and edges, the paint on the walls and ceilings needed touching up and repairing, the fridge was had a broken shelf and door, the outside doors needed wiping everywhere and the floors outside needed to be swept and cleaned. The chairs in the eating area outside were horribly noisy and there were not enough chairs for everyone and that would be the same for the pool area not enough chairs. The shuttle is totally useless because of its schedule. Internet very slow. The drain in the bathroom was always backing up. The staff was very friendly and helpful but I would not stay here again because of the lack of maintenance in our room and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, will be back again, hopefully soon.”
Reviews.Author: WeScott6
Reviews.Content: Our suite was beautiful and clean. The hotel property was well maintained, family friends, and staff was very helpful and efficient. We look forward to our next visit to Orlando and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: clubsoda212
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and we enjoyed the hotel and all that it has to offer. The employees were very helpful and pleasant to deal with from every from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value despite some repairs needed.”
Reviews.Author: disneyluver7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. Our first impression was of the glass elevator (overlooking the pool area) that took us up to our 3rd floor room. It was a nice touch, although the air freshener made it smell like a department store restroom :). The room was suite was smaller than expected, but still plenty of room. One ironic issue was the lack of abundant hot water. An other review stated to be careful because of the scolding hot water. Well, neither bathroom got real hot at all. The repair man, who came right up after being called, stated that the hotel was only operated on 1 boiler due to the other breaking down. He managed to get the hot water in the main bathroom pretty hot, but not the other. While he was there, we reported that the TV in the guest bedroom was broken, and he immediately replaced it with another TV, which also was broken in a different way. I gave up on the issue because I really hadn't expected a TV in that bedroom, & we didn't watch it much any way (still had TVs in the living room & master bedroom). THe shuttle schedule had the shuttles not arriving at Disney until close to 10am and returning some days well before closing, which is unacceptable for our troops. Thus, we ended up not even utilizing the shuttle once. This was one major reason we chose this hotel, so that was a let down. The breakfasts were good. The meats alternated between corned beef hash, bacon, & sausage (mostly sausage) on the days we were there. That variety was a pleasant surprise, actually. Also alternated between pancakes & waffles. Always had plenty of scrampled eggs, but PROMPTLY shut down at 10am (fair enough, they always got SLAMMED!) It was better than most free hotel breakfasts I've been to. The happy hour was nice! That bartender was on the ball with whatever drinks we needed when we needed them. It was never overcorwded. The Wi-Fi was not accedible from most parts of our room. If I put the laptop right by the window by the door, I picked up a mediocre signal. I think it's meant for the pool area anyway. The busness center had 2 nice computers, which were busy. Some in my party ordered pizza & it was quite good. I'd order it again even if I didn't stay at this hotel :). If those pesky repair issues hadn't been there, & the they expanded the shuttle schedule to match Disney's schedule, I would have given this hotel a 10 out of 10 for everything. Overall, it was excellent for what we paid through the travel site that rhymes with cookit. Oh yeah, don't forget that "resort fee" when considering any hotel in this area. One reason we liked this hotel is because it was cheapest of all we had seen. P.S. Who CARES about the the hotel being right behind the 7-11?!? It actiually is a nice 7-11 (believe it or not), provides a nice landmark coming back from the parks, and it is close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great overall deal for Orlando parks stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sk8ter1916
Reviews.Content: great overall deal! i booked online at qualityinn.com. if you sign up for a free online account, you get a better price (but it's final and non-refundable). for 3 nights (sunday 5/15 - wednesday 5/18) i got a price of $67/night before taxes ($85/night after all taxes and fees). + this included free wi-fi internet in your room (just ask the front desk for the login/password) and this did work in my room! + also included free breakfast 7-10am every morning: hot food would be scrambled eggs (no egg whites) and switched between potatoes/ground beef hash, bacon, or sausage depending on the morning, then cereals, toast, waffles/pancakes/or french toast, coffee, juice, instant oatmeal packets. we took extra food for either dinner later or muffins to snack on thru-out the day no-problem. + finally included free shuttlebus service to disneyworld, seaworld, and universal orlando parks. right outside in their front parking lot *between the huge gift store bldg and the days inn) the hotel itself is a little hidden from the main road; just look for the 7-11 and the random huge gift store. the driving entrance is in between these 2. the overall look to the hotel and rooms are more dingy/grimy than the pictures online show it to be, but for the price and service, you can't beat it! our room (room 202) had a (we were a family of 3; i'm 27 y/o with both my parents of 60+ y/o): - living room with a couch, coffee table, flat-screen tv, closet - a dining table that snuggly fits 4 chairs - kitchen with sink/microwave/dishwasher/coffee maker/mugs and cups (i think they had other plates and utensils but i didn't check) - 1 bathroom with shower/tub, sink, toilet, toiletries, bath towels for 5-6 people - 1 bedroom with 2 double beds, closet, safe, flat-screen tv seaworld and UO only have 1 shuttle pick-up and drop-off per day; pick-up in the morning is at 7:40am and to return, UO (lane 81 - altho i didn't go to UO so this is from the schedule sheet i have) at 6:00pm and SW (green canopy, same as drop-off corner in the morning) at 6:15pm. disney shuttle to EPCOT from the hotel at 9:25am, 10:45am, 11:15am, 12:10pm, and 6:30pm. return from EPCOT (parking spot C23) at 7:15pm, 8:45pm, 10:00pm. **if Magic Kingdom is open until 11:00pm or later (usually in the summer time), there is one more pick-up AT the magic kingdom TTC (tickets and transportation center) at 11:30pm (parking spot 98). every worker will tell you that the shuttles leave at the designated times on-the-dot, but with the exception of the 10:00pm pick-up, we found that they were either around on-time or a few minutes late. **this schedule was good as of 5/01/2010, so note: they may update/change the schedule taxi from MCO airport to hotel: it's about a 30-min drive. Mears (the big cab company in Orlando) will charge about $60-70. we used Simon's Travel [tel. 407-673-8300] and got a one-way ride for $45 cash (before tip, we tipped about $7). driver was a younger middle-aged cuban guy, very nice. call to give him a few hours notice if you can tho. we chose to not get turn-down service every night, but the room does come with a safe for your valuables. but when we needed new towels/soap, they were sent up in literally 2 minutes! lots of local take-out places deliver right to your room. we did chinese once for dinner, it was fine. i think they charge 10% delivery fee (i'm from nyc where we don't have delivery fees) before tip. the hotel itself for dinner sells pizza, but we never ate/bought this. hotel has a pool, hottub, and tiki bar. we didn't have time to enjoy the pools, but my one pina colada at the tiki bar was $6.75 and tasted yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but noisy at nite”
Reviews.Author: barbara12557
Reviews.Content: Traveled with grown children, one 21 and the other 18. When we first arrived the a/c in one of the bedrooms was not working and had to wait for them to switch it out. The next morning the shower head was not working and one of the toilets kept wanting to back up and kept running. When we returned that evening the shower was fixed, but the toilet was not completely repaired. Still kept running. Otherwise no other problems except for the noise at the pool. All rooms face the pool, so there was no getting away from it. We ate breakfast the first morning, other than that we ate food from the 7 eleven next door, their breakfast sandwiches were so much tastier and so was the coffee. Great value but if you want a quieter place to stay, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the pictures!!!”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl730
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay in this hotel for 4 days and ended up leaving after the first night. The "suite" was dirty, and the plumbing rusty. There was no counter space in the bathroom to put anything (curling irons and hair dryer had to placed on top of the toilet). I was afraid to give my daughter a bath in the tub because of the lack of cleanliness. The promised "kitchen" was nothing but a small counter with a microwave and fridge and a hot plate and all were dirty and dusty. We left and found the Comfort Suites just down the street, which was far better and cleaner and even cheaper! Do not be fooled by the online photos. They also promised that we had a pool view room and even confirmed it when we arrived, however, when we got to our room we could hear all the pool noise, but couldn't see any party of it. Very Dissappointed in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A poor imitation of Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: 3KRAD
Reviews.Content: I travel for work regularly and have explored many different hotels when on vacation with my family over the past 15 years. I rarely give negative reviews but feel obligated in this case. This hotel was one of the worst we have visited. To be fair, I should disclose that we usually stay at 3 or 4 star hotels, so I am comparing Royal Parc Suites to hotels that typicaly cost $100 - $150 per night. We paid about $100 per night to stay at Royal Parc Suites - that is, we intended to. Instead we checked-out ASAP after night number one. In brief, Royal Parc Suites is a poor imitation of Embassy Suites (Hilton Hotel chain). I will list the most troublesome problems with this hotel: (1) dirty with in-room carpets filthy and discolored with repeated staining from who-knows-what, (2) unkempt and dilapidated walls with stains, scuffs, erosions nearly everywhere, especially in the rooms, (3) poorly maintained with malfunctioning mechanical and electronic devices, including the deadbolt on our exterior door, (4) bedding was so flimsy/over-used that my lower back ached in the morning from sleeping in a crevice, (4) narrow walkways and small common areas that make for bumping into other guests persistently, (5) no interior hallways (suite doors open to the outdoors), (6) located next to an obnoxious, purple-colored "souvenir shop" with bright parking lot lights, (7) no room service. Many other all-suite hotels in the Orlando area, including the Embassy, are the same price - stay at one of these instead. This place reminds me of one of the building facades at Universal Studies - where the appearance from a distance looks genuine and well-kept, but get a little closer and the truth is revealed. What was "not-so-bad?" The staff were generally not rude - to be sure, they weren't helpful, but at least they were not rude either. If you have to stay at this hotel, bring plenty of extra socks so your feet don't stick to the carpet in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great for School Groups - in spite of a some negatives...”
Reviews.Author: Bandtourplanner1
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for eight consecutive band tours. We were very pleased with the overall quality of room cleanliness, helpfulness of staff, and provided services. Our visit three years ago was our first under a change in management. The rooms had been updated, new paint, furnishings, etc. The breakfast menu had also been expanded. We were delighted with the improvements. This May, we again returned to our favorite hotel after a three year absence. The chaperones who had been on previous trips immediately noticed how the rooms had deteriorated since our last visit. It's time for a "face-lfit" once again. Chipped paint and an overall sense of lacking TLC seemed to pervade this hotel that has seen better days. However, the staff continues to be overwhelmingly helpful and friendly, and the breakfast buffet still offers a large selection of foods. Cafe hours have also been extended. Our group stayed for four nights. During this time, we did not experience consistent room cleaning, and my particular room experienced plumbing difficulties. In the past, we have given this hotel our heartiest thumbs-up, but I will be checking back personally to see if the quality of the rooms and overall cleanliness improves before I automatically sign a contract next spring. It still remains one of the most economical places for school groups, and the staff is very accomodating, but we'd like to see a higher level of care for the physical plant and individual rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good/Bad/Truth”
Reviews.Author: DColls0818
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here for a week.(total party of 9 spread over 3 suites) The rooms were fantastic & very clean. I loved the setup of the hotel! The pool area was perfect and super relaxing. Loved the free happy hour. The on-site pizza place was good too. Breakfast was OK-defintely good for free! Definitely make time to grab dinner at Logan's (steakhouse) across the street. SO wonderful. The hotel even gave us free appetizer vouchers! My issues were mainly these: -the shuttle service. Expect to be (probably illegally) crammed in at twice the capacity. Late too. -lack of towels and washcloths. The kicker is that you'd have 2 or 3 in the morning, but housekeeping would take them while you were out! -DON'T attempt to buy tickets in the hotel lobby! They will ask you to hand over your ID and basically hold you hostage by trying to force you into going to a timeshare presentation. -items left behind. Expect a hassle and you will NOT get your item back unless you pay for it. My item was a stuffed animal and it cost me $15 to have it returned. (And 2 weeks! Good luck if your child is anxious about it. I know it was our fault, but the hotel did not return it when they said they would. Just be honest, people) Overall-a great stay. The gift shop emporium in front of the hotel is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time”
Reviews.Author: tink105
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time At the Royale Parc ! We came in to spend time as a family , Because My spouse is station down in Fl and we live in TN . The kids love the room and the pool. The Breakfast was even nice. We had a room by the pool and I could not even hear the nosie from outside the room. The room are very big and nice too and if we had any question one of the staff was always willing to help out. For the price it was a great place to stay and Yes we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one time stay only”
Reviews.Author: shaw7
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website are definitely NOT what the hotel looks like when you arrive. The hotel definitely needs a make over. In our room, there was barely anything to cook with. A very small counter top stove, no oven. Our bedroom door barely opened when you needed to get changed, I thought one day we would be stuck in there. The breakfast was terrible, we were there for 8 nights, there was bacon one day and we didnt even get any. Either than that everyday was the same boring breakfast. It definitely is an "economy" hotel. The shuttles were only at scheduled times so if you were wanting to stay at SeaWorld or Universal Studios past 6 p.m. you are out of luck unless you want to take a taxi which costs approx $40.00 to Universal plus tax each way. The return times were terrible. One plus was the maid service, our room was always done up very good each day which was nice. The hotel staff were fine as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent. :-)”
Reviews.Author: Nikki51308
Reviews.Content: My family and i were very pleased with this Hotel, it is close to everything you could ever need on Vacation. Seaworld, Universal, Water parks,also great places to eat, everything is right there. The people at Royal Parc Suites are EXCELLENT, Ada in Housekeeping was the best. Anything i needed she was right there to make sure i got it . Thank you Ada. We will be back next year if not sonner and we hope to see everyone again, Thank you for a Great trip !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “dont be fooled by the photos, horrible location”
Reviews.Author: cheertravels
Reviews.Content: we arrived at this hotel and thought we must be at the wrong place because it looks nothing like the photos we saw on bookit.com. it was located literally behind a 7-eleven and on the other side was very seedy hotel. our kids were afraid to get out of the car! we went in to see if the inside was any better and it wasn't! the manager came out after we explained that it wasn't what we expected and wished to change hotels and we were told there was nothing they could do to help wouldnt even let us see a room. we left and drove around for three hours to find another hotel and had to pay cancellation fees and one nights deposit and an additional 400 to stay somewhere else. stay away from this hotel and bookit they are horrible!

Reviews.Title: “NOT BAD..”
Reviews.Author: fashionette
Reviews.Content: Was a little concerns about staying here because I'm very picky and the price was so reasonable. My daughter made all of our arrangements. I was surprised but for the cost it wasn't bad. They offered a very good free breakfast. The first day we went out before they served breakfast and found that what the hotel served was just as good as Denny's across the street which cost us $30.00& tip. The "maid could of done a better job of cleaning and dusting. The room was not vacuumed while we were there. One day she did not leave us towels nor washcloths and we had to go down to the main desk to request them. It took 2 calls but we finally got them - the person delivering them apologized and offered additional toilettries. The beds had new mattresses and felt clean and comfortable. The pool was great. However, we had to ask for the hot tub to be cleared of bugs. We were told they are love bugs that come a couple months throughout the year. These bugs were even at Universal Studio. They did have free drinks at the bar area from 6 pm-7pm each day. The bartender was not very friendly and they did not open on time at 3:00 p.m. the one day. We found some of the workers were friendly and nice while others basically didn't say anything. One thing that was a problem was taking the shuttle to the parks. Fighting to get seats. A couple times on the return trip the bus was overloaded with many people standing. But, it is free and the driver didn't want to leave people behind. There is only one shuttle there each day and one shuttle returning. Leaves hotel at 7:40 a.m. and comes back to hotel at 6:00 p.m.. That worked out for us. Being teens the boys spent most of their time in the pool while there. We do plan on going back in December but decided we will stay at one of the hotels inside the park. But, would go back to this hotel in the future. It is close to Old Town, good restaurants and places to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelinrn_11
Reviews.Content: Overall good value-close to Disney property with many amenities. The BIG SPOILER for us was 17 year old daughter left her purse with wallet in the room one day. (we had not warned her to not leave cash behind) Between the time we left in the morning to when we arrived back to the room that evening-she was missing exactly $40 in cash!!!!!!! This was reported to Alejandro that same evening. He essentially said it was our fault for not keeping things in the safe provided in the room. I explained the safe was locked and therefore unaccessible upon our arrival. he said the event would be reported to the manager Aaron(whom I never heard from) and that our locks would be interrogated. I had to follow up each day for the remainder of our trip to make sure this was being taken care of. Finally on our final night, Angel (an assistant manager, I believe) said the hotel was not "accepting responsibility" but that we would receive a resort fee credit for that day "to make amends." I asked if the lock was ever interrogated and was told it was but never whether or not someone had actually entered the room. That particular day the money went missing we had left the do not disturb sign in the door. Was very disappointed this was not take more seriously. The rooms could definitely have been cleaner, in serious need of some updating. Pool area was nice, complimentary happy hour was nice as were the bartenders, who worked their bums off for that hour. Much of this could have been overlooked if our complaint about the missing cash had been taken more seriously. Chris Belcher

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: jeannie10kids
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel have been staying here for over 12 years. There are a couple things that make me mad every year. When you get there at checkin there is never a room ready. When you have kids and drove from MI you want to get a room and get out of the car for awhile . But every year we have to wait at least a hour past checkin. The other is the maid service . They can be very rude about things. Plus very hard to talk to most do not speak english. It has a great pool area and play area for kids and nice breakfast for the family and the rooms are very big we always get 2 bedroom we have 10 kids and fits us all. Old town is always fun to go to and close to disney to. They also have a bar and for a hour in the evening beer and wine are free nice extra lol.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the price and close to all the fun!”
Reviews.Author: MurFam005
Reviews.Content: Reservations by phone was fast, friendly and accurate. The location is great - right across from Disney's entrance. There is a gift shop emporium for all your Disney souvenir needs right in front of the hotel and great prices and restaurants galore and a Publix supermarket right across the street! We had to park way in the back since the hotel was full which was the only inconvenience. But check in was swift and hassle-free. You may or may not find a cart to haul your stuff to the room though. The 2 bedroom was very big and comfortable - the beds and pillows were comfy too. The pool area had lotsa towels, was very clean and had enjoyable scenery. There is also a nice and clean swing and slide set where you can see your kids play right from the pool...the pool area had a kiddie pool and a hot tub - nice touch. Love this place because you can bring your own food and cook relatively easy meals in the two burner kitchenette with microwave. Breakfast was great every morning....long lines though but plenty of food. Just heat up the pancakes as they are cold. I would say the hotel is an older building that was refurbished and you can tell in the bathroom and the kitchenette that they did a remodeling job but some of the crevices show it's age. Overall would stay again with a large family that wanted to be smack in front of Disney, cook your own meals to save money and spend some fun in the Sun.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: nonna2
Reviews.Content: We were taking our grandson (4 years), on his very first trip to Magic Kingdom. It was important to us that we stay at a kid friendly, CLEAN hotel. While somewhat nervous as we typically stay at 4 star hotels, I booked a 2 bedroom suite here. It was PERFECT! Two perfect sized bedrooms with 2 bathrooms! The room was VERY clean! The mattresses (of course 1st thing we checked with bedbugs always a fear) were brand new. The pool area was lovely, perfect for kids and adults alike. Kudos to the bartenders on the evenings of 4/15 and 4/16...SOOOO NICE!!! Friendly, helpful and so sweet with my grandson! The same kudos to the man in the gift shop! The location was amazing, nothing you could think of that wasn't in the area. Free breakfast was ok...but plenty! Took us 5 minutes to get to Magic Kingdom...within 20 minutes after arriving back at the hotel after a tiring day...we were at the pool! If you are looking for romance, 4 star hotel treatment and amenities, this is not for you. But if you are looking to be somewhere that is CLEAN, FUN, ACCOMODATING & KID FRIENDLY...this is the place. I doubt you will be disappointed. We cannot wait to return! Already thinking of staying there for Sea World!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fun experience”
Reviews.Author: nanabijou
Reviews.Content: Mauricio, our 1st contact, was extremely helpful and explained everything in detail. He arranged whatever discounts we had coming. The pool and hot tub were great- especially the hot tub. It was "hot"- not just lukewarm and provided the proper instructions and warnings for everyones safety. The happy hour was just that- very convivial- the 2 ladies, Lizzie and Jennifer were like buzz saws looking after everyone and never missed a beat. Breakfast was plentiful and healthy. Location was excellent with respect to Disney (we didnt use the shuttle)- all other destinations were easy to get to and the computer room was helpful in printing out maps and directions for our excursions. All on all- worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: paulrn01
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, Excellent customer service, very accomodating. Friendly staff. My family and I were very impressed, for what we paid we definitley received our money's worth. We plan on booking another stay over the summer and then for our annual Christmas Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: gjw3176
Reviews.Content: Great location for Disney, You can buy tickets to anything in the front lobby, nice tikki bar next to the pool, resturant everywhere some that I never heard of or some I have but not in Mich. so much to do just in Kissimmee alone, Like shopping... & real good beakfast in the morning...& last but not least coffee in the lobby around the clock... you feel like its your own little private place,caus its in a triangle and it doors face toward the pool area... We stayed on the 4th floor, and the view was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great Pool Hours. Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: AllThingsJeep
Reviews.Content: Pros: -The price was decent -Two bedroom suite was very roomy -The pool / hot tub were open until 11 pm which was great. - The pool / hot tub were very clean when we were there -Nice business center with functional/fast internet and printer - Next door to convenience store and across street from supermarket and Walgreens/CVS -Plenty of parking -Laundry room was big and never had to wait for washer/dryer. Fairly priced -Kids liked the pizza served in the restaurant (very small selection) -Staff was very friendly to us Cons: Internet connection in room was poor (but great by the pool / bar area) We skipped the free breakfast because it was always mobbed Clean enough for us, but if you are fanatical, you will be disappointed On-site gift shop/store is super expensive I would come here again for the pool/hot tub/price and location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION TO VISIT DISNEY PARKS”
Reviews.Author: richarobx
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first week of April 2011, and enjoyd our stay. The room was spacious and clean. The breakfast buffet was better than most hotels. Very easy to drive to Disney as well as many restaurants in the area. The shuttle service we found to be unreliable. We were at the pick area 15 mins prior to the time, but the shuttle never showed up until the next scheduled pick up (45 mins later). Our return shuttle was also late leaving the park by 15 mins. So we drove the remainder of our stay, much easier. The HS internet was a little weak several times, they say its free but you pay a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good hotels great loctions”
Reviews.Author: Gosnail
Reviews.Content: Great hotel great locatin. Right next to 7- 11 and few minutes walk the the old twon and the fun spot, very nice location. The rooms are very large.We like the mardiGras stacho by the main enterance and in the lobby. It speaks it's character, Welcome guest..

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and good value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: 2crows
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. First time in 1993 and it still has a nice family friendly feel. Breakfast buffet is satisfying and coffee and tea available free all day long. Happy hour 6-7 and nice cozy outdoor bar. You can watch your children from any area around the pool. Staff are happy to meet your needs. Very good value for your dollar. Close to all parks and shopping. Don't pay any attention to negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: headanne
Reviews.Content: I'm am here with my husband 2 children 15 and 3 and mother and father. We are in a 1 bed room suite plenty of room for all of us 2 dbl beds and pull out couch but if we were to come again would def.get a 2 bed room because the pull out couch is very uncomfotable! The pool is very nice and clean as well as the hot tub! We are a 5 min walk from old town and plenty of resturants and shopping 7-11 is on the grounds and suggest going there for anything you need because the hotel store is pricey.the breakfast isn't bad and so far has changed every day...eggs bacon...saus...cornedbeef hash...pancakes...waffles..french toast...muffins...pastries....fruit....toast....coffee and juice best part is its free so really can't complain!! The bartenders are so friendly and helpful as well they do have a free happy hr. Including beer and wine but I haven't made it yet sure its great :-) the whole staff has been great since we got here so not sure what some people were complaining about if you do have an issue or need anything they do their best to help! Haavent used the shuttles because we have a car but do know they don't run very often so I suggest renting a car or or using public transportation.It is alittle noisey between people at the pool and kids slamming doors but that is expected I think and doesn't bother me at all vacation is all about fun and I could careless if the pool was open all nite I say have fun....live and let live and kids will be kids if your the type of person that is botherd by kids running around then don't come to a hotel by Disney!!! So would I stay here again.....Absolutly.some people pay hundrands od dollars on a hotel and spend very little time in it I think that is silly as long as it is clean and this hotel is then what more do you really need? Hope this was helpful and have fun oh yea very close to all the parks and very easy to get to from here!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: mrgenki
Reviews.Content: The Good: - First off, having a nice, clean, heated pool with plenty of lawn chairs and open until 10 was nice. Secondly, the complementary morning buffet service, although not particularly special--scrambled eggs, flat sausages, danishes, muffins, hot and cold cereals, toast, etc--was warm and filling. And lastly, being just a 2-minute walk from Walgreens to get supplies was convenient as well. Oh, and as an afterthought, you may want to try their Pesky Pizza. For $11.99 a pie, they weren't that bad. The Bad: - The Quality Inn offers a lot of complimentary services. The only thing is, they are not always what they appear. Their so-called High Speed Wireless Internet service, for instance, was terrible. The signal was not only weak, but kept cutting out. Their complimentary beer, wine and soft drink service that is offered nightly is from 6-7pm only. And, their free shuttle service to the Walt Disney World Theme parks, only runs after the parks open, and will only take you to EPCOT. The fact that they claim to be 1 hour from the Walt Disney World Resort means nothing. On a map, it may be a mile, but you can't get their by foot. It's more like 4 miles by car. The Ugly: - The one thing that upset me the most was the fact that I was told that their Disney park shuttle services left at 7:40am. This was a blatant lie. They will take you to Universal and Sea World at that time, but not to Disney. They in fact, will not leave until 9:30 at the earliest. On the way, of course, they will stop at two or three different hotels to pick up other passengers. The good thing is their shuttle service starts at Royale Parc, so you can be assured of getting a seat. The bad thing is you'll feel like you're riding in a giant sardine can for 30 minutes. By the time you get to EPCOT it will be close to 10:15. And, by the time you find a Disney bus to take you to another park, it could be as late as 11. Believe me, if you want to have a good time at Disney, getting to any of their theme parks before they open--preferably between 8:15-8:30--is a must. The fact that Royale Parc can not get you there by that time, but prefers to mislead you into thinking you will, would irk most pat To add injury to insult, their taxi service is highly unreliable. If you plan on going to the parks early by taxi, I would recommend that you think better of using Platinum. They will be very late or not show at all. It happened to me 3 times and I've witnessed it happen to many others. County Taxi Service will take you to the parks for $18, but like any service you have to negotiate and confirm the price before getting into the taxi. --- On the whole, Royale Parc Suites Hotel wasn't as bad as I made it out to be. They just need to make several relatively simple changes to increase their overall quality: 1) Offer free shuttle service that will get you to EPCOT by 8am; 2) Put their shuttle service schedule, complete with times and destinations, on their website so as not to mislead their patrons; 3) Find a taxi service that is not only reliable, but offers flat rates to the parks and airports; 4) Upgrade their WiFi Internet service; and 5) Let patrons know that the complimentary beer, wine, and soft drink service at night only runs from 6-7 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience, but favorable overall.”
Reviews.Author: vince66226
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the day before checking into Disney and the night after checking out of Disney. The first check-in (Sunday) was longer than it needed to be as we waited 10 minutes to be sold park tickets we already had. We explained that we already had park tickets and the clerk was a bit rude in explaining that only the ticket merchant would provide the parking pass. As it was very busy, the clerk reluctantly gave us our parking pass without the need for marketing tickets to us. The first two bedroom suite we had was a good location on the ground floor and the teens enjoyed the pool. The rooms were clean and tidy, but some sort of odd smell was present. A remote was not programmed to control the TV in the second bedroom. Breakfast was outstanding with the kids very happy to enjoy seconds on the good food. The second check-in process (Friday) was very easy and Alejuandro was extraordinarily professional in welcoming us back. The hotel should have more like him, based upon our earlier experience. We had a two bedroom suite on the fifth floor and it seemed better than the first in nearly all ways. The room air conditioners are a bit noisy as they cycle on and off. Sound insulation otherwise seems to be good as we did not hear very much of our neighbors on either stay. The breakfast food was different than the first stay as the kids enjoyed french toast instead of corned beef hash. Compared to Disney resort, a very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “BAIT AND SWITCH stay away from this deal”
Reviews.Author: mully1234
Reviews.Content: Our spring break hotel expeirance was horrible here, this is nothing like the picture in website our descriptions. Rooms were old and dirty maid cleaned with bleach made room unbearable, buffet breakfast had bugs in and around food. surrounding hotel was vacant and rundown, to top it off someone was breaking in to cars and stealing electronics. Never go back !!!!!!!!! When we spoke with Mgmt. they told us to bad.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: MissLiddy
Reviews.Content: My group consisted of 4 adults and 2 children. We stayed at one of their two bedroom two bathroom suites. First the positive, the rooms were very clean and in immaculate condition. We had flat screen televisions, a full kitchennete, a small living/dining room with sofa bed and a small dinner table. The beds were very comfortable, and there was plenty of closet space. Check-in was pretty easy. We were checked in by the general manager and he was not overly friendly, but neither rude nor dismissive. There is a mid-size pool in the courtyard, which our group didn't get a chance to enjoy, but other groups seemed to. Room service did a great job in our room. The only negatives I would say is that the wastebaskets are very small and with a kitchen you definetely need a bigger wastebasket. We arrived on the eve of the Daytona 500 and Kissimee was packed as were the hotel's surrounding streets/venues, and this was a little crazy and hectic. The free buffet breakfast was not very tasty in my opionion and I would skip most of their breakfast offerings except for the fruit and coffee. But again others seemed to enjoy it. Overall a good experience, I would recommend it to everyone. Will definetely be back.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE STAFF AT FRONT DESK-Not treated with Disney attitude”
Reviews.Author: Familyman23089
Reviews.Content: I was very exctied to stay there as there advertisement stated shuttles to disney free. Wek=llm if you count a shuttle to Seaworld at 7am adn the next one at 4pm that was inconvienent. we had to payh $40 each way, may as well stayed on Disney property with the amount of money we spent on shuttles.
