When a young femaile guest asked the front desk for public bus schedule they were not helpful in giving me the schedule, the girl at the front desk ignored me while staying on the phone and the male manager was so rude and heard under his breath he called the guest a B*&^&. and threw her out although she stated she didnt stay there and she was able to go in the back doors for the rest of her stay. Poor family with a young son. They free breakfast wasw cold eggs, cereal and toast, nothing to write home about. The free happy hour the bartender was miserable as she thought you were bothering her and she was mad if you didnt tip her ON a good note, the beds were comfy and it was a place to keep a roof on your head..

Reviews.Title: “Royal Parc Suites Adequate for Needs During Short Stay in FLA”
Reviews.Author: sillygirl49
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in March '11 in 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. Didn't use the kitchen except for the fridge so can't really comment on that. The rooms, while updated according to information on internet, were somewhat drab in appearance, but the beds quite comfortable, especially for someone with back problems, like myself. Bathrooms clean with plenty of towels & washcloths. Problem was I was on ground floor across from outside bar area and the music went on and on all night, til I called at about 12:30 am and complained, which was immediately attended to and the music was turned down. My daughter, in the back bedroom, didn't hear it, so it depends where you are in the suite. The breakfast was decent for being included in the reasonable price~I had no problem finding something, but again, only there for 3 mornings. Coffee available in lobby all the time. Internet included in daily supplemental fee, never had a problem accessing it. I think some people who complained about that don't know what they're doing. Overall, a good value, but definitely not "swanky" as my kid put it...PS-my only complaint upon checkout was the last night, before bedtime, I attempted to put my aching body in a hot shower....cold as ice. Had to wait til morning and tried again, it was warm, not hot, but doable. Was told everyone on the ground floors had a problem. Oh well, I was checking out...

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, a great place to return to again...soon”
Reviews.Author: Brendams1966
Reviews.Content: We (Me, wife, 4 & 7yr daughters + wife's sister, her husband and 7, 7 & 9yr daughters + my 75 year old father) visited May, 2009 for 11 nights in 1 of the 2 bedroom poolside suites. Even with 10 of us in there it was still quite comfortable. We used the free shuttle most days, pool and hot tub all days, free buffet breakfast and all-day-coffee every day, managers open bar some days (when back early enough from the attractions). The staff was always helpful and the food and grounds / pool were always top-notch. The games room was a bit musty smelling (but expected near a pool, especially since it was carpeted). We still enjoyed it though. When we left there, we knew we would be back someday. We are going again in a few weeks (March/April 2011). This time there are 26 of us (friends and family, half kids 6-11 yrs old) staying there (in several suites) for 14 nights. I know my friends and neighbors will enjoy it since they have entrusted me to make the arrangements for this trip. I would highly recommend Royale Parc Suites to anyone (obviously, if you read the above). If you are looking for amenities at a reasonable price, this is it. Looking forward to another great time in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..will definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: TamaraRN
Reviews.Content: Great locations. walking distance to old town, restaurants and entertainment. Less than 15 minutes away from disney. Excellent breakfast buffet, nice pool(clean) and entertaining happy hour by the pool. Dislikes- internet never worked, staff was accommodating but didn't smile which made you feel unwelcomed. Also, shuttle did not transport wheelchairs. we took the public transportation(linx) GREAT SERVICE!! runs every half an hour to main transfer lot to disney parks and reasonable. under 9 yo free, 9 yo-$1, seniors $1 and for us adults $2 each way. BUT I would like to add. My granddaughter left her book bag at the hotel.When we got back to maryland, I gave them a call and they obtained my info to have it mailed back(my expense of course)...Again, no personality on the phone(very flat affect). If they smiled more often and had a cheerful tone to all of their voices it would be rated a 10 out of 10 place to stay. I give them a 7 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “We'll certainly come back here!”
Reviews.Author: blackink51
Reviews.Content: We were a little skeptical about staying here from reading some of the other reviews, which vary quite a bit, but decided we would find out for ourselves how good the quality was. I'm glad we did. The room was a true suite which was great for me, an early riser, and made sleeping in for my wife much easier. We met Carmen Cohen who is the Guest Relations Manager and official pool chair counter (lol). She was a delight to chat with at pool side and she was truly interested in listening to our small concerns we had-the hot tub seemed a bit too hot and the heated pool seemed a bit cool at times, mainly in the mornings until the sun would shine and help warm it up. Other than those two things, our stay here was really great. Fantastic staff, like Betty in the Cajun Quarters during breakfast. She's more than happy to help wipe a table or clean up any small messes that were made. If you try to clean it yourself, she says you'll hurt her feelings! There's lots of children here, they cater to families as well as to couples or single travelers. We found the noise level was very minimal from our third floor suite.The front desk lobby service personnel were very helpful if we had any questions or concerns. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and look forward to staying here again in the future. Of course, 80 degree temperatures with lots of sun in the third week of February certainly helped make our stay more comfortable. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, clean and close to all major attractions.”
Reviews.Author: MKEQ
Reviews.Content: I first found this hotel thru an internet search and booked our stay. Then I saw that it was somewhat poorly reviewed here on Trip Advisor and I got a little nervous. But we stuck with it and are glad we did. If you are looking for a luxurious place to stay in Orlando, this is not the place. However, if you are looking for an economical, clean place to stay that is close to WDW, Universal and Orlando, this is it. Free hot breakfast each morning made getting up and out the door a breeze. The pools were clean and we enjoyed them almost every day. Having the 2 bedrooms gave everyone plenty of space and the 2 bathrooms were nice also - especially in the morning when getting ready for the day. Three computers for easy printing of return flight boarding passes. Laundry (~6 each washers and driers). Easy drives to the major parks, plenty of places to eat nearby, other entertainment and shopping nearby. Walgreens and Publix (grocery store) right across the street. Overall, great value and a great place to sleep after spending all day away.

Reviews.Title: “Great new additions to breakfast and activities.”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastFl027
Reviews.Content: Happy hour, hot breakfast, movies for children at night and the location to Old Town and Didney make this a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: tosborne81
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here...pay the extra money and stay somewhere else!! The photos this hotel has posted are not at all what it is in real life. This hotel needs an upgrade and you can smell the oldness. The rooms a super small- we stayed in a two bedroom suite- there were 5 adults and 3 small kids and an infant- not nearly enough room. The breakfast is convientent but it is the same every morning. The beds are very uncomfortable. Not at all what I expected when I found it online. The pictures are definitely photo shopped and are not at all what it is really like.

Reviews.Title: “Locked out and charged full night rate after emergency on morning of checkout!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: busydeb7
Reviews.Content: DON'T STAY HERE..Noisy from other rooms. The two bedroom suite was tidy in appearance but filthy the more we looked around. Dirty floors, counters and carpeting. We arrived late first night so we had to wait until the a.m. to complain about the URINE SMELL in bathrooms and kitchen area. The first attempt to clean failed and they never were able to rid the rooms of the urine smell, we complained to front desk but they did nothing. The fridge froze our food! The beds were so uncomfortable and old, we hardly slept one full night of our 6 night stay. Urgh. The water was not hot for the shower, so forget taking a nice hot bath. The POOL WAS NOT HEATED and the jacuzzi too small for the size of the hotel. THE WORST PART IS WE HAD AN EMERGENCY OCCUR the morning of our checkout date with a child and they CHARGED US A FULL NIGHT RATE AFTER LOCKING US OUT as we didn't make the 11 a.m. checkout. They would not listen and no refund, no compassion. We did make our flight and all is well, but will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bossfan19
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at this hotel 8 times in the last 3 years, the rooms are clean and big, the value is great and the staff is second to none!!

Reviews.Title: “FIND ANOTHER PLACE”
Reviews.Author: piperwings
Reviews.Content: 4 of us checked in to the hotel after calling from the road for directions - even the gps was confused! the clerk was very friendly & helpful. Our 2 bedroom suite, had full size beds (we thought they were queen), was very dark and dingy. The kitchenette area was small but workable. We read many reviews pertaining to this hotel and it looks nothing like the pictures. The breakfast was ok & free. Parking on site is free. Shuttle service to the parks is a joke. They offer one shuttle and it leaves at 7:40am and drops you at Epcot. We wanted to shuttle to Islands of Adventure, The Wizarding World of Harry Potter and avoid having to pay $15 parking fees - that didn’t work. The weather was too cold to use or review the pool area. The noise in the room was my biggest complaint. I am a light sleeper and you could hear adjacent rooms turning their water off & on and doors slamming all night. Very noisy place. It’s convenient to Disney but not close to Universal at all. Saying all of this - I wished I had paid more money for a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !!”
Reviews.Author: jackiegc
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location.. The suite was comfortable & very Warm, It was cold in Kissimmee(Dec 2010). The breakfast was adequate, though not 5 star. You are across the street from Ponderosa buffet. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: DonneneB
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with our families stay at this hotel, the suite we had was 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and the living area had a sofa sleeper. I wasn't expecting to have a dishwasher and a stove, but we did have both along with the micro wave and a refrigerator. the staff was excellent and handled the 2 minor issues I had in a timely manner. (we used the heat because it was chilly during our visit and when we turned 1 unit on the smoke alarm went off due to it not being used often, and one shower head needed to be tightened) The breakfast buffet wasn't IHOP, but it was filling and pretty good. The hours were good as well from 7-10 so you didn't have to get up extra early for breakfast. The location was great within 15-30 min drive to where ever we wanted to go. Only 1 shutle for universal studios,but several to Epcot . What I didn't like was there were no clocks anywhere in the suite and It would have been nice to have an indoor pool as I stated it was a little chilly out. Also the beds could have been a little bigger, there were only 5 of us so it was comfortable enough with all in our own bed, but if we had to share it would have been a little cramped on the full size. The sofa sleeper could use a new mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches found in room! Otherwise good enough stay.”
Reviews.Author: Dulku
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of the great rate but I would not stay here again. This is a good enough hotel if all you are doing is sleeping here. Hot breakfast includes scrambled eggs and sausages everyday (decent breakfast). Stayed in 2 bedroom suite, found cockroaches in sink and kitchen area the first morning. Was offered 25% off for only the first night, manager was not sympathetic and acted as if this was normal. We were moved to another room and stayed the remaining 4 nights. Shower was leaking in the second room. Customer service was non-existent. This is not a 3 star hotel I would say 2 star max. Wifi worked in the first room but not in the second room. Did not use shuttle service, drove to Universal and Disney world (not that far).

Reviews.Title: “magic”
Reviews.Author: maureen m
Reviews.Content: well i think just a few words will say it all, been home in uk 1 week, looking at flights, to go back. REALLY MISS YOU GUYS> it just gets better every time we visit. now been going back for 6 yrs somtimes twice a year. Florida is just NOT about theme parks. cant understand why people pay the earth to go tenerife, Can chill out in kissimmee, better than any european holiday. all visiters are great fun. everyone who goes to this hotel are great people, we have just spent 31 days here and it was so relaxing, fun, and everyone who returns back are treated as family. Just a BIG wee message for the GM Mr Frost, we are all waiting for your email, to tell us the POOL is HEATED during the day. not just at night when every one should be in bed not swimming. Day time is for POOL fun. YOU promised us a warm pool on our next visit, so just waiting for your reply. Then we WILL be back. Many thanks to you ALL for a wonderfull, visit. So any moans on tripAdvisor about this Hotel, be warned, We will get in touch, and put you to rights. Only the most PROFESIONAL moaners can say anything bad about this HOTEL and the STAFF, IT truley was a MAGICAL holiday, and not one visit to a theme park.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but then again not the worst either”
Reviews.Author: Dthunder
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice...Overall not that bad! The rooms are abit out dated but hey we've all been there before...If you want the Hilton, then STAY AT THE HILTON!!! Yeah the breakfast could use alil bit more but it's hot and it's FREE! The pool side is decent but the way I see it, I'm not exactly training for the Olympics either...The happy hour FREE drinks is alright but again, I'm not there to look for a bottle of 40 year old scotch am I !! Best thing about this place is location...Old Town is a 2min walk away and 7/11 is right out infront..Right across the street is a couple of flea markets aswell..Kids 12 and under will have a blast here the adults will also have fun if they head over to Old Town for their night life! Would stay here again and recommend to friends and family also...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Allin220
Reviews.Content: The experience we had in this hotel was fantastic! Great comfort / Great value We chose to stay in the 2 Bedroom Poolside Suite, which was extremely comforatable and convenient for everything! Our poolside suite led directly to the pool, and was within seconds of the complimentary breakfast which was an excellent money saver throughout our vacation. I would strongly recommend this hotel, and hope to stay here again in 2011! Thank you Royal Parc Suites!

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: tmalBayCity
Reviews.Content: The]Royal Parc is a very nice and very clean hotel/motel, it has everything you want and need on the property,and if not you are walking distance to also any style food and drink you would like. The hotel has super big tooms with 2 tvs in each, very comfortable beds with fancy pillows and a seperatre bedroom in each unit. every mornig they have a very tasty breakfast and every evening a Beer and wine happy hour( 6 to 7 ) included,when I return this will be my first choice because it it very affordable

Reviews.Title: “Best Quality-Best Service-Best Price all at the same Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: precious90
Reviews.Content: This is really a great place to stay at! No unpleasant surprise upon arrival - Huge spacious clean rooms - very friendly and helpful employees - beautiful pool - great safe location - free complete breakfast - Unbeatable pricing - My choice from now on

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay on holidays - Looking forward to be back”
Reviews.Author: cr9000
Reviews.Content: Talking about room service it was kind and efficient, as well as front desk personnel - billing and additional days fares were all ok . Breakfast service is an opportunity to improve. Rooms are one of its strengths, not luxurious but clean, nicely decorated, very confortable with room for all of us (we stayed with our two kids). Location is good, has a gas station and 24-7 across the parking and places to dinner across Intl.Drive. Best: confortable rooms / value for money To improve: breakfast (a bit basic) / aisles decoration

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: PhiloftheTropics
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early November. The taxi driver had trouble finding it which wasn't a good sign. We arrived late at night around 11 pm and the reception area was deserted. After about 10 minutes or so someone did come to the counter, very unfriendly and unwelcoming, especially after travelling for 30 hours from Australia. Once we left reception to find our room we were amazed at just how dirty and run down the place was. The elevators were filthy and stunk. The room was large, not very clean and everything looked a bit sad. The cupboards in the kitchenette looked like some cheap secondhand junk. No kettle which is annoying if you want a cup of tea. The free breakfast was OK for free but you wouldn't want to pay for it. Depending on which park in Disneyworld you want to go it's not all that close and the free shuttle only goes to Epcot so you then have to wait around and catch a free disney shuttle to the other parks. If we had known this we would have got a Taxi rather than wasting an hour to get to Animal Kingdom. The general area the hotel is in isn't very nice but you get what you pay for. Next time, we'll pay the extra and stay in the downtown disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Parc suites-Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: vagabond2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 14 nights...these are the pros and cons Pros: --Budget friendly hotel --close the attractions(10-15 mins drive/shuttle) --well connected to the food courts Cons: --Pathetic/Horrible internet/Wi-fi connection --Extremely poor customer service --No free paper as advertised.. -Odd shuttle timings..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HonestMomOf3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days in the 5th floor, 2 bedroom suite. We also were joined by 2 other families who I know share similar thoughts as we do. Our room size was great, towels and beds were changed every day and the 3 sinks were wiped out. However in those 10 days our tub, bathroom floor or carpets were not vaccumed at all nor were the tables countertops or furniture wiped of dust or food spots. Our room was one of the newly renovated rooms but in those few years that they have been renovated, the walls were marked with splashes of food and stains already. In the bedroom that did not have the onsuite, there was a terrible urine smell that was embedded in the front corner of the room after 2 signs and telling the supervisor, they did come and clean that spot with a water vaccuum. But the smell was still there. In regards to the ammenities. The wii-fi, pool area was great. Never saw a free newspaper unless we were suppose to pick that up in the lobby. Room safe was never used by us, but we still have to pay the $2/day for their insurance purposes. The happy hour are very inconveniently timed from 6-7pm. as the first free shuttle returning from Disney world is at 7:15pm, so you would never be back for that unless you took a taxi (which was about $20). Another disappointment were the shuttle times that they offered. The first shuttle of the day was at 9:25 a.m. The next shuttle that came wasn't until 10:45. The shuttle took you to Epcot under 10 minutes, however if you were planning to go to the other theme parks, you would need to take a boat, monorail or another bus to get there from Epcot. there were times where we didn't even get to our destination until 10:30-11:00. So we did take a taxi a couple of mornings to get the fast passes for Soaring and Toy Mania (as those were usually gone by 11am) But with younger kids, it was so nice those mornings to get there early when the park opened. There were 3 return shuttles: 7:15, 8:45 and 10pm. By day 5, we envied those people whose hotel shuttles took you straight back to your hotel or straight to Animal Kingdom, Hollywood studios, etc. Breakfast were OK but very boring. The 3 cold cereals they had were generic. The butter for the toast was whipped spread, only jellies for toast. The same danishes, scrambled eggs and sausages every day. Oranges and apples were readily available. But with small kids: they only seemed to enjoy the toast, eggs on a few mornings and apples. They were longing for waffles or pancakes, yogurt and kid friendly cereal. So we did end up buying cereals and ate those is our room, we also cooked in our room one morning and made pancakes. Kitchen utentils were minimal like a pot, a pan, dishes, cups, plates and a corkscrew. No extras like a flipper. We borrowed from our friends' room which had a flipper. Room supplies were inconsistent: some days we would get dishwasher detergent, coffee packs, shampoos, replenished and then other days we would have to go to the desk to get dish washer soap or borrow from our friends's rooms again. So in the long run, we should have gone for a more expensive hotel as we ended up paying the same as a higher star hotel: for taxisand breakfast foods. As well as the feeling that your room was dirty and smelled did not make our stay as pleasant as it could have been. This is not a 3 and a half star place, I would rate it a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel doesn't live up to description or follow through with ammentities”
Reviews.Author: sportair
Reviews.Content: Although the location is good for Disney world, & restaurants aplenty, the sales pitch on the hotel description & list of ammentities didn't live up to all that was written, Free Internet access is terrible & didn't match their own "sign on sheet", Free newspaper daily...didn't exist, Breakfast buffet had cold scrambled eggs & cold undercooked sausage patties. The surrounding area is of old rundown vacant hotels/motels.

Reviews.Title: “This is our 3rd time staying here, we love it!”
Reviews.Author: purplehaze1943
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time here and we are still very pleased with everything. The staff, Melissa in particular, is outstanding, They are all pleasant and can't do enough for you. The rooms are spotless. Pool and hot tub are crystal clear and just the right temp. There is not one thing that is less than top knotch! Thanks and keep up the good work, we'll see you again in April!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “5 minutes tops to disney!!”
Reviews.Author: purpleskier1163
Reviews.Content: I found this Suite hotel through "bookit.com". They offered a discounted rate for this place on the dates i was going. The pluses are as follows, crazy close to disney, you have some space rather than everybody staying in one room , beds were very comfortable. Free breakfast, free happy hour beer and wine. The down side was that the picture on the web site looked better than the actual rooms are, the breakfast never changes so we got tired of it after a few days...sausage, scrambled eggs, danish, cereal, and toast period. I did overall think it was a good deal but would have been dissapointed if i paid the web site prices. The pool was nice and cleaned daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mtnk1973
Reviews.Content: Our suite consisted of a huge room with sleeping arrangements for 10 people; 2 bathrooms; Living room; Eating area; and Kitchen with plates, cups, utensils... The hotel supplied guests with a Free breakfast each morning. There were eggs, sausage, toast, fruit, danishes, hot & cold cereal, juice, coffee. Each evening, there was also a "manager's reception" with Free soft drinks, beer, and wine. The hotel's location was ideal in that it was less than 10 minutes to any of the Disney Parks. It was close enough to walk to a grocery store, restaurants galore, and even Old Town, where the children were able to ride carnival type rides. Great Value... Perfect Location...

Reviews.Title: “HONEST REVIEW - A GREAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: karkulture
Reviews.Content: I've read various reviews on the Royal Parc and have to ask were some of these people staying at the same place we did? Yes there is a 7-11 near the hotel.. is this a problem.. Absolutely not and in fact can be useful!, Is it dirty, damp, smelly, bedbugs.. Of Course NOT!! Its perfectly clean and well maintained, The staff are extra extra helpfull and we never had to ask for the room to be cleaned once.. It just happened.. The towels were changed exactly as we asked them to be and not all every day in an effort to be enviromentally friendly.. The location is great.. Yes you need a car to get around but for those who complained that its too & you need a car.. try staying anywhere but disney properties!! The pool is perefectly well kept and very very clean as is the pool furniture.. Daily free breakfast and daily free happy hour at the bar.. I have stayed all over the world and can only wonder what the people who left bad reviews of this place want.. I cant think of a better place to stay for the price in Kissimmee..

Reviews.Title: “A Gem! Doesn't deserve some of the negative reviews it has received.”
Reviews.Author: NurseAnn
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two teenage sons and one of their friends from October 18 through October 25th. I was extremely pleased with the accomodations, the staff, the location...everything was what I had hoped for and more. The two bedroom suite was spacious. The bedding was just like my bed at home. I appreciated the breakfast in the morning. Is it what I would cook at home; no, but I didn't think it would be. The eggs were commercial eggs, but so what. Add a little bit of hot sauce to the egss and they were quite tasty. I have noticed that some reviews mentioned the same foods every morning for breakfast. Let me tell you, I have the same foods every morning at home. I believe the buffett was superb for a large hotel, feeding many mouths within a short time. We could pick from eggs, cold or hot cereal, sausage, danish, cinnamon swirls (to die for!!!). toast, fresh fruit, two kinds of juice, milk and very tasty coffee. The rooms were very clean. Some areas were slightly worn in the carpet, but so what...it was clean. The pool was clean and not too crowded. The staff are awesome, always there to please and serve. As far as being 1.5 hours from Disney and the outlets. That individual better get a map. It took us 10 minutes to get to Disney and about the same amount of time to get to the outlets. We were so pleased with the hotel that we will be back next year. Keep up the good work Royale Parc Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Far and I mean far from Disney and Outlets if you don't have a car”
Reviews.Author: Green-eyed-77
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel is clean and basic. Grocery store across the street Cons: Far from everything if you do not have a car 1.5 hour bus ride with three transfers to Outlets. The hotel staff makes a cut on calling for a taxi, so that means any time you ask how to get somewhere, the answer is always…”the only way is by taxi” Which is owned by the hotel. The Hotel staff does not know anything about buses. The hotel staff is really not helpful. The location is about a 20 min shuttle ride to Epcot. The free shuttle is only 4 times a day each way. 4 times in the AM to Epcot, and four times back in the evening. $20 taxi ride if you miss the shuttle. Breakfast consists of: powder mixed with water eggs, micorwaved meat, and some bread and Danishes. The stove in the room is really bad and does not heat well. My advice, pay a little more and get a hotel something on International Drive

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but it needs to improve on guest services”
Reviews.Author: Jgomez65
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedrooms suite. There were 4 adults and 4 children (these suites hold up to 10 people) We had a late check in and it was bad. After a long day at the parks, all you want to do is get to your room as quickly as possible so you can rest, but once you check in, they make you go to another desk in order to get your parking permit and a property map. The reason? Simply because on this second desk there is a salesperson (no associated with the hotel) trying to sell you park tickets and timeshare sales presentations before giving you your parking permit. Sometimes there was another line for this desk made up of people waiting for their permits and others inquiring about the tickets. Luckily the hotel manager was the one who did the check in and I told him I wasn’t too happy about having to go to another place and get in line so someone would try to sell me something I wasn’t interested in. He agreed to give me the parking permit right there and pulled out a permit right in front of me, so obviously the other desk was just a scheme to hear a sales pitch. When we got to the room, my cousin who came with us called me over to show me one of the bathrooms. The shower was full of hairs and there were also some hairs on the floor. A clear sign that whoever cleaned the room did a terrible job. It was late, so we decided not to say anything and get ready for bed. During preparation to go to bed, we realized there weren’t enough pillows or bed sheets. We picked two rooms with two beds on each room and a sleeping sofa. We were short of two pillows and 1 bed sheet. I immediately called front desk and I was told there had ran out of both, pillows and bed sheets. According to them, the hotel was full and they didn’t have any more of those items. Honestly this is the first time I’ve been in a hotel where they had run out of pillows and bed sheets. To be fair to them, I mentioned this issue the following morning during checkout and they took $20 off my bill. Their free breakfast was good, and the hotel is right next to Old Town, so it is in the middle of Kissimmee. Other than the incident with the dirty bathroom, the property was fairly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of amenities packed into one hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieP101010
Reviews.Content: What better way to celebrate our honeymoon than to go to Walt Disney World and stay at Royale Parc! As soon as we walked in the room, we found a cake on the dining table with faux flower petals sprinkled around it and cider chilling in an ice bucket. Then found more flower petals laid out in the shape of a heart on our beds as well as a gift basket and chocolate covered-strawberries! My folks had contacted Carmen Cohen and pre-arranged this great honeymoon surprise for us. Royale Parc really went above and beyond to make our stay special. The free hot breakfast was great and we took advantage of the free shuttles to the Disney parks and Universal Studios parks. They also had a pizza and hot wings restaurant inside the hotel which was great. The hotel is a minute walk to 7-11 and a 3 minute walk to a 24-hour Walgreens or a BBQ restaurant across the street. Can’t wait to come back for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room, for a GREAT price”
Reviews.Author: t_la1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends for 8 nights and we all enjoyed our time. We had a 2 bedroom apartment with 4 double beds and a tv in each room which was really convenient. The rooms were a little dated and a strong smell of cigarette smoke lingered for a few days upon arrival. Over the weekends there was alot of noise due to the amount of people partying in their rooms, which was a little irritating. The bathrooms were clean but could do with an update. The kitchen facilities were handy to have but we had an issue with the fridge, which was quickly fixed by housekeeping. House keeping did a good job of maintaining the room as amenities were always supplied and beds were always made. The location was great with a 7/11 next door and a supermarket across the road. There is a huge selection of restaurants within walking distance so dinner is never a problem. The free breakfast was a great extra. There isn't much of a selection but we still ate there every morning. We found the free shuttle service to be the best way to travel to the parks. The times suited us and gave you long enough to enjoy the parks. If we wanted to go anywhere else we would rely on Louis who's town car service was great. Overall it was a great place to stay with plenty of space. The rate was great and the complimentary breakfast and shuttles were a great added extra.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: lrw401
Reviews.Content: Our 7 night stay started out decent. Rooms were large and clean. Beautiful pool area. Great free happy hour. Good security. Right next to Old Town, not really a plus. 192 runs one way, so always had to make a U-turn in order to get on interstate. Breakfast was exactly the same all 7 days! No variety whatsoever, although they advertise that it changes. It doesn't! No waffles or pancakes or bacon! Just scrambled eggs, sausage patties, toast, danish or cinnamon swirls, apples, oranges, oatmeal packets, cold cereal, milk, juice and coffee. Although its FREE, it got real old quick. Business Center is NOT free. Have to pay for computer & printer use. Our problem was with billing. BEWARE. Billed us completely different from original reservation. Told me the 800 number changed it, which was totally untrue! After I pulled up email confirmation on my laptop which was taken into the back office because the manager would not even come out to help, they refunded the difference. Although, I did not even notice the $2.50 + tax nightly safe charge until I got home and sat down to figure out my bill, which was supposed to be disclosed at checkin and not refunded. Put in complaint with ChoiceHotels Customer Service. All I received directly from the hotel was an email apology. Very frustrating & inconvenient. Thankfully we didn't miss our flights! We will NOT being staying at this hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacobycoby46
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite, room 524 to be exact.We took the glass elevator up to the fifth floor which overlooked the pool area. The elevator was not very clean. First thing I did upon entering the room was to check for bedbugs. Thankfully, there were none. Then I started to make up the sofa bed. There were some food remnants when I removed the cushions. The bed was not already made but the sheets and blanket were in the livingroom closet. The bed was comfortable. The two bedrooms looked like the pictures on the website. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms could have been cleaner but they were far from disgusting. The shower, sink and toilet all worked fine. There was plenty of hot water. There was air conditioning in each bedroom plus the living area which is a huge plus since each person could control the temperature in his or her own sleeping area. We did not use the kitchen area much. One complaint about the bedrooms was that there was only one alarm clock for all three sleeping areas. Also one bedroom did not have a television. The maid did not replenish our shampoo over the four night stay, so we had to get some from the front desk. Also, the maid took the sofa bed sheets but did not leave any clean sheets in their place. The front desk had some sent up within a half hour. The breakfast was scrambled eggs, sausage patties, danish and little cinnamon rolls. There was hot and cold cereal and white bread only to make toast. There were red delicious apples and oranges. There was coffee and orange and apple juice. This was fine the first two days but we needed a break on the third day. There was a Dunkin Donuts across the street and many restaurants in the area. We did not use the pool area but it looked nice. We also did not use the shuttle bus but we received the schedule. They drop everyone off at Epcot and from there you are required to use Disney transportation to get you to whichever park you are going to. Also, I noticed that the first shuttle didn't leave the hotel until 9:20, and the parks open at 9:00, so if you want to beat the crowds, this probably isn't the transportation you want to choose. We could not connect to the internet on our mac book and we did not ask for assistance. We used the business center to print our boarding passes and copies cost .75 each. We also received an unwanted wakeup call at 5:15am. on our last day there. All we basically did was sleep, shower and eat breakfast and for that, this hotel was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “I did not like it”
Reviews.Author: littlelou1012
Reviews.Content: It was not that great. The pictures on the internet look better than it actually looked. It did not have an oven just 2 eyes on the stove top and a small refrigerator. One pot and fry pan, no drinking glasses actually all it had was a few plates and cups and forks and spoons. The carpet is worn bad places on the walls. The beds did not comforters on them a piece of cloth about 3 ft wide on the bottom of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here and will definately come back for a 3rd”
Reviews.Author: themaldonados
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to the Royale Parc Suites. The first was great.... no problems (stayed in May 2009) This time (May 2010) was just as good. My only complaint and I mean ONLY one was that the water had a terrible smell and taste to it. At first I thought it was the hotel and then I realized that it was everywhere. Even in the Disney parks. I suppose we're just used to our water at home. The problem was easily solved by using bottled water! Everything else about the vacation was perfectly fine. I agree that it isn't a 5 star hotel with room service etc, etc. but for the price you pay, it is definately more than we expected. We were booked to stay 8 nights and on the 6th day our 14 month old son got extremely ill. We waited the day hoping he'd improve but he didn't so we decided to check out and begin the 24 hour drive home. I went to the front desk at 11:30 PM and explained that we were leaving and why. They refunded me the extra 2 nights!! I didn't even ask them to, I was totally shocked. We are in the process of planning our next vacation (May 2011) and will definately stay here again! I must add though that I don't understand why so many people are giving such bad reviews?? I don't get it. Even the breakfast was fine. It wasn't gourmet and it was pretty much the same breakfast daily but seriously?? It's free!! We did do a disney character breakfast one day and it cost us (group of 7) $260.00! One other day we went to IHOP and it cost us $54.00! The free breakfast was nice on 4 of our 6 mornings :)

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler0102
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks. The breakfast is NOT what they describe on their website. Each and every day, the served the same two pasteries. Only two days out of the two weeks they had sausages. They NEVER had English Muffins, Yogurt or Granola...NEVER! Coffee was only served in the morning and not all day as advertised. How can they fasely advertise this!?! Rooms were not cleaned well and housekeeping only made beds/changed towels. Noises went on all night and there was no security whatsoever. People were partying in the pool right outside our room until 4:00am....the pool is suppose to close at 11pm but NO ONE reinforces quite time. Plumbing was also a problem. Toilets won't flush and after calling, they came out but never resolved the problem. So we struggled to flush the toilets for two weeks (but mostly used restrooms out of our hotel.) I just have to warn you that this is not a good place for children due to partying guests encouraged by the management, poor cleaning and terrible buffet. By the way, buffet breakfast is a steal accross the street at the Sizzling Grill...it only costs 3.99 per person and they have TONS of selection and good food. I don't know where the manager is referring to when he/she says outside breakfast buffet costs $13.99 (maybe a character breakfast?). Get a better motel and eat at any of the extensive local buffets....pay the difference.

Reviews.Title: “perfect budget hotel A+++”
Reviews.Author: dudeldue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our Orlando vacation. This was our 4th hotel and by far the BEST. It was close to everything, we made several friends,the bartender was awesome and we will be staying here for the entire stay next time. It was clean, great security, comfortable rooms and beds. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The only thing I can say was lacking, and it was the entire LBV/Kissimee area hotels, was the lack of knowledge and willingness to find out when they did not know the local transit system! We stayed on the Universal end last time and they went the extra mile in this department. I assume it was because of the distance from the attractions. Sure it was easy to drive to Disney but the parking adds up when you can take the local bus for under $2. That is speaking as a single parent with one child, maybe not as easy and inexpensive with a family of 4 or more.

Reviews.Title: “It's an ok hotel, comfy beds, nothing fancy. please read for important advice.”
Reviews.Author: kelly5481
Reviews.Content: Hi, Firstly I must get this important info in for your benifit. Please DO NOT go on any time share presentations for the offer of cheap tickets! Yes you save about $50 dollars on your tickets (£30) but it wastes a whole morning/afternnon of your vacation. The sales people lick your butt all the time they think you might buy a time share and when you say no, they become bullying you and then get a real negative attitude. It is very stressful. The time shares are also not what they seem. We went to mystic dunes and orange lake resort country club. Unless you want a stressful experince and 10 years debt, plus rising maintenance fees (which they will deny) and to have to visit the same place every year, please take my advice and don't go! They time share destinations do look lovely, but you can stay there anyway without signing a contract!!! Now for the hotel. Me and my husband have stayed here twice. Sept 2009 & 2010. It is not as good as it was last year and would'nt stay there again. It's ok and it's comfortable. It's got all you need. The bed's are very comfortable. The kitchen only has an electric hob and microwave. No kettle! Last year we had a toaster, but not this year. The coffee machine in the reception used to also be there all day/night, now it's only in the mornings.The bathrooms are tiny but ok. Really cheap loo roll though!!! We had two problems on this stay, our door would'nt lock and the carpet door bar was broken and sharp, which my husband cut his foot on. We conplained about this and they did sort both issues out immediately, but no one actually said sorry. It's not a fantastic hotel but it's not a bad hotel either. I'd give it 6/10. Cocoa beach is 2 hr drive though which is the only thing missing local to this hotel. It's great to get to parks though. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “33 minutes in and out. A picture is worth a 1,000 words. But looks can be deceiving!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationsmilestoday
Reviews.Content: Our plane landed at 9:20 p.m. We drove to the Royal Parc Suites and looked forward to the beautiful hotel pictured on its website. When we pulled up to the lobby, which incidentally is tucked behind a 7 Eleven, the hotel appeared dirty, bushes overgrown and generally unkept. The windows looked as though they had never been cleaned. I assured my daughter that it would look better in the daylight. However, once inside the lobby, it looked worse. We noticed the furniture was very outdated and busting at the seams, quite rickety. The man behind the desk was cheerful enough. He gave us our room key and we proceeded upstairs. The elevator carpet looked like it belonged in a garage. It was heavily soiled and had rips and tears everywhere. As we reluctantly entered our room, our spirits became more and more deflated. What should have been an exciting time, became the beginning of a nightmare. The beds were thrown together and appeared quite untidy. The carpets were frayed everywhere throughout the room and its overall appearance was very dirty. We didn't touch a thing and quickly stepped back outside and glanced down at the pool. My grown daughter said "mom even the pool chairs are slashed." Need I say more. When I returned to the lobby the receptionist was on the phone with a hotel guest, reassuring her that if there were bed bugs in her room, she must have brought them there. We immediately requested a refund, and was granted one. However, we were left out on the street, frantically searching for a place to say at midnight. Although, I might add, we were relieved to be out. We spent an additional $1,000 for 6 nights at a hotel that delivered what every family deserves, an enjoyable vacation. In fact, they proudly showed us their facilities prior to check in and then gave us warm cookies and a clean place to lay our heads for the week. The pictures on the Royale Parc sight are not accurate. In fact, they are a lie. Enough said.....we tried to warn you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Dawn823
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel. There was 3 adults and 2 children and we got the the 2 bedroom suite. It was just enough room and it was great that the there was 2 rooms. The pool and jacuzzi was great too. The breakfast i just wished it had the same variety every day. Some days they had more than others. The transportation to and from the parks was not long at all. Definatly would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price”
Reviews.Author: flangypan
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Fair enough on the first couple of nights it was noisy but I am a very light sleeper and no one else in the family heard a thing. The shuttles to and from the parks were great, the drivers were always punctual and well presented and curteous.The universal and seaworld shuttle did come at 7.40 am and yes that is early but if your going to the parks you want to get there early. there were 4 shuttles going to disney at 9.25, 10.45,11.15, and 12.10and 3 coming back at 7.15, 8.45, and 10pm. the hotel also runs a shuttle to lake buena vista factory outlets that run a few times a day.the hotel was a bit dated but it was vey clean. breakfast was fine if a bit monotonous but at the end of the day it was FREE!! We did have a slight problem with our door so make sure you slam your door and check that its locked before you leave. Managers reception was great free beer and wine and soft drinks for the kids. Big shout out to Angel who was very helpful after I had an accident. ( I will send you a christmas card) and to Jennifer who worked behind the bar. the location of the hotel was excellent, right next to lots of restaurants and gift shops. They also have Perky's pizza in the hotel which charged $19.99 for to huge pizzas this was great if we needed to have a cheap night. All in all we loved this hotel and will be booking up for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from the website and reviews”
Reviews.Author: MomFromPa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay in Florida. We selected the Quality Suites for our last two nights in Orlando based on the value we felt was represented in most of the reviews we read. We also use the Entertainment Book as we travel and this hotel was represented as one of their Preferred Hotels, so we thought it would be a great experience. We were not in the room often as we were enjoying the Disney Parks both days; however, the breakfast was nothing like we had read about. There were no waffles, no bacon, no sausage - there were some scrambled eggs that were watery and not very appealing. In fact, one morning I took them back to our kitchenette and refried them with some "extras" added in. We did not consider this to be the "hot breakfast" that was represented. The room was clean, but definitely needs to be updated. The location was good, as well as the happy hour from 6 to 7 each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Honda599
Reviews.Content: Check out their website-very large rooms. Living area with flat screen TV, small kitchen and separate bedroom with another flat screen TV, the biggest room I have ever stayed in. Large in room safe for storing valuables while your out and about. 5 floors square building design with inner courtyard containing swimming pool, jacuzzi, poolside bar with free drinks between 6-7, game room and full breakfast served daily. Close to Old Town with rides, stores and events happening throughout the week. I didn't take advantage but they have shuttle service to Disney parks and Universals. The only problem we had - door did not automatically lock after closing which could have been a problem. Had to fiddle with lock to make it work, suggest you check door before leaving. Accommodation very nice and priced very reasonable. Good for larger groups and more that enough for my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BUDGET! Not 3 star. Only good thing was location”
Reviews.Author: PaulWhiting
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this so called 3 star venue late in the evening with 2 very tired children. That was the only reason I stayed. I emailed our booking agent that night about the standard of the property requesting a call ASAP looking to move. I was really annoyed at the quality as this is nothing like the pictures. They must have cleaned those rooms especially for the website as our room was not like what we were sold. The carpets are damaged stained and falling apart. the doors have been badly repaired with filler, the Aircon is noisy , we a FAMILY OF 4 had 3 knives and 9 spoons in the kitchen draw. there is no OVEN or toaster in a suite? the bath tub had mold around it. The showers are not good at all, The safe was from the 60's. As for the free breakfast, im not suprised its free, it was rubbish! greesy soggy sausages and scrambled egg thats it for hot. and various pastry's. various cereals. watery friut juices and toast! we went out and bought our breakfast! I have relayed my thoughts to the hotel who have offered me a 50% on ONE night. I dont think that is yet a figure I am happy with!! We used an online booking company who to be far contacted us quickly and have now tried to help us get some refund.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel and even worst service.”
Reviews.Author: sharondiaz
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again...It was GROSS. The front desk was not in the least helpful, and the picture that you see on the internet is fake. It is all lies. It is a dump, the place was smelly and moldy and the you have to ask for someone to clean your room. I will never, stay there if my life depended on it. I hated every single minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was great for are needs.”
Reviews.Author: chris82_10
Reviews.Content: i was worried when i read the bad reviews,but when i arrived the 1st day i enjoyed the hotel,but beware of flyers from pizza places.I had orderd from one it took 3 hours for delivery..The shuttle was great but the only time they pick you up from the parks are at 7:15 pm,so if you plan to take the shuttle back be prepaired to stay for a long,long day..We took the taxi back it run around 20.00.The free complamentry brekfest was ok(the eggs were powderd ) not very good...

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: beachbum_number1
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at Royal Parc suites. Stayed in 2005, and just returned Aug 24/2010. Location is great - close to tons of restaraunts, publix, target and gift shops just down the road. Getting around was easy with our rental car and the help of a GPS. Wish the pool was larger. It was so full of little kids from morning to late night, we barely got a chance to use it. (It would be nice if it were open to adults unitl midnight). Free happy hour drinks and buffet breakfast was great. Bartender was very friendly! Rooms - comfortable beds, nice pillows, spacious, but a few issues. When we arrived, there was a pile of crushed potato chips on the floor in the corner of the room (not what I would expect in a newly cleaned hotel room). The next day I left a note (and a nice tip) for the maid asking for the room to be completely vacumed. The chips stayed there for the next 2 days, until she finally saw them and cleaned up the mess! The fridge was missing a leg. Because of this, It was unstable and our drinks fell out and broke on the floor. Left a note for the maid but the fridge never got fixed. (We ended up putting a folded up towel under it to even it out.) Also the bathroom door wouldn't close completely. We would stay here again despite the few issues with the room. I'd suggest paying the extra for a main floor poolside room as this is very convenient when you are coming and going. Rooms appear to have been rennovated since we stayed here last - they looked great. I felt leaving a note about the room problems should have been sufficient. I guess next time we will have to contact the front desk instead of leaving notes for the maid.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Onthgo074
Reviews.Content: My family planned a trip to Disney to celebrate my mothers birthday the second week in August. It was my husband and I with our children ages 14, 12 and 5 along with my mother. We stayed poolside which was perfect because we could walk out our door and right to the tiki bar for happy hour. Thanks to Jennifer the bartender you were great. The room was the perfect size for all of us. We didn't cook the whole time were were there, so the kithen was fine. Having two bathrooms was great also. Check in was quick. Everyone was helpful. Breakfast saved us lots of money. The shuttle was a huge bonus. I can not say anything bad about this place. I planned this trip a year ago and my only worry was if the hotel would be ok. It was, and we will stay hear again on our next trip to Disney. Also make time to go to Old Town next door. It is short walk (across a parking lot) and your there. My teenage boys loved it. Thanks to Royale Parc for making a the memory of our first trip to Disney a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel helped to make our vacation the best ever”
Reviews.Author: myronna2000
Reviews.Content: easy to get to, close to Disney only about 10 Minutes, breakfast very good also had a happy hour that helped start my vacation off right. pool was great for the kids and us old kids too. rooms were clean and we slepted very well in the beds. the price was right for all of us. can't say any thing bad about our time at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcalvin
Reviews.Content: I would call this Hotel a Diamond in the ruff. Great price,Close to Disney and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Location”
Reviews.Author: Happy-SC-vacationer
Reviews.Content: We were exceptionally pleased with this hotel. The friendliness and helpfulness of the employees far exceeded anyone's expectations. The suites were very clean and well furnished with all needs. The beds were comfortable. We elected to not have our suite serviced each day in order to save sheets and allow the cleaning crew to be able to have a more pleasant day. They were extremely helpful with towel replacement and paper product supplies. The sofa bed in the living room became jammed while closing it one morning. A call to the desk brought a prompt response. It was determined by the employee that the unit needed to be replaced and within an hour, we had a new bed mechanism in the sofa and all was well. He even suggested that we get double mattress pads for the new mattress in order to make it more comfortable to sleep. The breakfast in the morning was excellent. There was not lack of food and all was tasty. We did not venture forth for the cocktail hour but were impressed that there was one. The cleanliness of the entire complex impressed us. The courtyard area was beautiful and well maintained. We used the laundry facilities and they were well kept and convenient. All in all, there was no part of our experience that we found to have anything lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TxTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Good for the value. Nice & spacious rooms but furniture kinda dated. The shower/tub water backs up but quickly drained. Good breakfast with outdoor seating. Nice & friendly staff. Pool was crowded though. But even with a lot of families and kids, the rooms were quiet. Overall a nice relaxing stay but needs improvement in room cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again !!!”
Reviews.Author: sagagne
Reviews.Content: This place had friendly service , all the staff was very nice . The breakfast that they put out is top quality and abundance in food. We had a pool side room , which was very close to the pool and on the bottom floor . It was nice that it stayed open till 11 pm so we could come back from a busy day and relax in the pool . We didn't take advantage of the shuttle services because the times just didn't fit us. If you want to be close to everything this is the place . Had a great Publix across the street and tons of places to eat . The rooms were bigger than expected and the staff made up the beds and gave us fresh towels daily .It did get noisy a few times but we were on the ground floor and it was near the elevator . Thanks for a great week...

Reviews.Title: “Not a great deal”
Reviews.Author: dmboyd901
Reviews.Content: Although it is the South and bugs are expected the response from the hotel was - "sorry we can't get an exterminator out here right away so sorry." No concessions were made. When you find a roach-like bug in your room you really have to take extended precautions when you get home to ensure you don't infest your home. Also, the sinks and tubs didn't not drain well at all. The pool was nice but crowded. The hotel definitely needs an makeover. Very outdated. And don't be fooled by the transportation to the parks - once a day - that's it. And the free continental breakfast left a lot to be desired. The kitchen workers I thought were rude. They would just walk in front of guests vs letting them go first and just budge in line to fill stuff without even saying excuse me.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Negative On a great Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: gszpylman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little run down. The pool area, elevators and walkways are dirty. The rooms are clean and spacious but in need of upgrades. The pool is overcrowded and very loud from open to close. The internet pictures are deceptive, and I would not recommend this Hotel to someone looking for a four star or better. This Hotel is a three star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More...”
Reviews.Author: ky_traveler2010
Reviews.Content: The suite was spacious. Two bedrooms, two bath, living area, kitchen area. Nice pool with managers reception. The breakfast is 2 out of a 5. Waffles are soggy. Bacon is not crisp. Eggs are runny. It is not much. But I guess at least it is included in the room price. There was no hot water for a shower/bath from 5:00 - 6:30 each morning 7/6/10 - 7/11/10. Upon checkout the front desk responded we could have easily fixed that. The elevators didn't work properly. They would skip the floor and the light would go off. You would have to press the button three or four more times. The air conditioner in the front room did not work right two days we were there. They tried fixing this. The toilet in the master suite ran at times. Pay the extra and stay at Disney or Universal. No frills and charge for all the extras (business center, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “WARNING !!! Don't fall for the internet picture of this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheCastleEstate
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware!!! I requested a two bedroom "suite" all the testimonials & reviews I believe were by hotel management/owners! When we arrived (&actually found the place tucked behind the 7-11) I knew right away we had been tricked. The hotel picture on the internet is nothing what the place really looks like !!!! It isnt "grand" it isnt "clean" or "spotless". I wondered WHAT they did with all the "Million-dollar renovations" when we saw the place!!! What a joke! The room had two bedrms/two baths but everything was "shabby". The carpets were literally worn to pieces & fraying at every entrance way. One of the Bedrm air condtioners didnt work, the refrigerator didnt work & the microwave didnt work! The only truly wonderful thing I can say about the place is that the "maintenance guy " (Bill - i think?) was johnny-on-th-spot. He immediately brought us a new air unit & a new refrigerator ! We were grateful for that and we only had to hit the reset button for the microwave. I also requested a smoking room on line & when we got there the whole place is non-smoking. The pool was okay but always seemed to have a "film" to it...or cloudy water. So dont be fooled by what this place seems like through the pictures..im glad i only spent $900 to stay for a week because I definitely got what i payed for & even less !!!

Reviews.Title: “Young and old alike, we had wonderful time!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmarnold89
Reviews.Content: We traveled with children ages 2mons, 1, 6, 12, 19, 21, 23, 26. We had NO problems. The rooms were very clean, we were able to let the children have there freedom in the rooms. The dining area was always well stocked for breakfast, no matter the time early bird or for late sleepers. The pool area was always clean and well maintained. We also enjoyed the cabanna house! We could sit at the bistro tables and watch the children enjoy the pool. There was alway security around, not so they seemed to be watching you. But there for you just in case. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. We give this hotel 10 thumbs up!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous family friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KarenTToronto
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. I do not understand what anyone would complain about. The hotel was exceptional and very nice for what you pay. The location is 10 minutes drive to Disney. They offer a free shuttle but it stops at many other hotels and can take up to 1 hour to get to the park. We drove and paid the $14 per day which offers in and out privledges. We would drive back to the hotel for lunch and go back after an afternoon swim and some relaxing. The hotel suites are spacious and clean. Each room overlooks the pool area which was gorgeous. The rooms and pool were a very pleasant surprise as we were not expecting it to be as nice. Beds were super comfy. Breakfast was fabulous. Eggs, bacon , sausages, waffles.... In front of the hotel is a large discount gift store that sells everything they have at the Disney parks for 1/3rd of the cost. Purchase your souveniers there. Only negative comment is there is a time share counter in the front lobby. They will pose as selling discounted park tickets and then when you chose a package they tell you that you need to attend a presentation. This was disappointing. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Pain Suites”
Reviews.Author: Buzzman88
Reviews.Content: OK, maybe the title is a bit too harsh, but I simply cannot recommend this hotel to most people. In this trip, we stayed in 7 different hotels in FL (from Residence Inn to Westin) and I have to say that this hotel is by far the worst one out of all of them. Let me talk about the pluses first: 1. The staff - all of the staff we had interactions with was helpful and very nice. They genuinely wanted to make sure that you had a great stay. 2. The hot breakfast - it's free and plenty. They serve basically the same stuff every day, but it's pretty good. Make sure you get there by 8 am to avoid long lines. 3. The free drinks - I don't drink, but this can be a big plus for drinkers out there. 4. Location - close to many restaurants and stores (like Walgreens and 7-11) and only about 12 minute drive to Magic Kingdom. Now about the bad: 1. Filthy - one of the bathrooms we had was simply filthy. We didn't even dare to look under the sink. I'd like to think that we're a pretty hardy travelers, but this place made all of us want to wear our flip-flops at all time. And yeah, the bathroom fan wasn't working either. 2. Wi-fi is bad - it was very frustrating to get any connections at all from the room. I called the front desk and asked how many routers they had and he replied "two". Yikes! I'm an IT professional; adding routers shouldn't cost that much. I had to go to the hallway to get any connection (a whopping 1 Mbps). In order to get a more reliable connection, you'll need to be either in the lobby or near the pool. Even that, sometimes my connection didn't respond too well. 3. Laundry facilities - the laundry machine doesn't clean too good and the dryer doesn't dry - not good. 4. Dishwasher - the one time we used a dishwasher, it leaked water (about a cupful, not too much), but still not a good sign. 5. Poor bedding - the beds are too hard to my liking and the sofa bed is horribly thin - not recommended for adults unless they are less than 100 lbs. We booked this hotel thinking that we had a good deal, but after staying there, I don't know I could say that anymore. Right now, I'm staying at a Hyatt near airport for 60% less than what we paid at Royale Parc; granted the location is far from Disney and they only offer continental breakfast, not hot breakfast. But the rooms are night-and-day; it's much cleaner and modernized here at Hyatt. I truly believe that Choice hotel is trying to improve this hotel, but to me is not nearly enough. The staff was great in making sure you have a good stay and that's a big plus. I'm a Choice hotel rewards member and disappointed in the condition of this property; I'm writing an email to Choice hotel customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Displeased”
Reviews.Author: NOQuality021
Reviews.Content: I had real high expectations upon arrival to this hotel. Reality set in quickly when, to my surprise, this hotel was not the hotel that was advertised online. I was very disappointed. My first impulse was to ask for a refund, but my family and I decided to give them a try. I should have listened to my conscience, In the words of Jimmy the Cricket ," Let your conscience be your guide." I recommend that future guest do your research before you spend your money here. The room layout doesn't match what's advertised. If you are not fond of exterior rooms I don't recommend this hotel for you. As for poolside rooms, ALL THE ROOMS ARE POOLSIDE. Don't let them charge you extra for a poolside room. After reading the reviews of some the other guest after sending actual time there i think that those reviews done in favor of this motel are all done by the staff and or management. As for the concierge they are just hustleman and woman who are trying to sell you a timeshare for another and better hotel. I had to buy back wrap heating pads for my back because the bed was like sleeping in the wilderness on a mountain on jagged rock not comfortable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Gross + Grosser”
Reviews.Author: ajmanzi
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday April 16, 2010, the first day of April Vacation. Luckily, we were checked in rather quickly. We went to the room but then we had to talk to the concierge for 1 1/2 hours. T his lady did not stop talking. The location was OK, but there were other hotels that were better, cheaper and closer to Disney. The picture makes it look like a very nice, getaway. Its not. It is located next to a year-round carnival, and behind an UGLY t-shirt store/gift shop. It was hard to find because it was behind the building. I slept on the sofa bed, and I could feel the springs in my side. The pillows were also dirty. The bathroom fan did not work so every time we took a shower, the wallpaper peeled a little more. There was gum on the balcony floors, and more than 10 pieces at that. The pool was the best part. It was large and located outdoors in the center. The hotel was not what it looked like, I will never stay again. Oh, and the breakfast was gross. There was hair in my eggs and t he eggs were like the bottom of my shoe.

Reviews.Title: “good value, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MAP12
Reviews.Content: I would have ranked this hotel higher, but the person that I thought was the concierge (because that's what the sign said) was really a salesman for time-share. I asked for a map and information about different dinner type shows in the area. I was given a map and information about one of the dinner shows, which I could get a really good deal on if I would listen to a time-share pitch. When I wasn't interested the fellow wasn't interested in giving me information on anything else. The room was nice, pool area good, breakfast above average, location OK, plenty of parking. I would stay here again, but would get my info somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “We did our homework and QSRPS is the best value suite closest to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: lzk2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our weekend at QSRPS. Thank you for serving a breakfast buffet, and having coffee available 24/7. Traveling with kids can be tricky(temper tantrums, etc.). Being surrounded by families helped us feel comfortable and at ease. Having a separate bedroom is always a plus! We even got to take advantage of the poolside bar. Thank you, Koenig-Ft.Lauderdale

Reviews.Title: “Third Time's Still a Charm”
Reviews.Author: KayGee62
Reviews.Content: My extended family stayed in room 522 on June 17-21, 2010. This is our 3rd stay at this hotel, and for what we paid, we definitely got our money's worth! I'm a Choice Rewards member, and I was also able to get a reduced rate through my husband's employer, which really dropped the closer we got to the date (it pays to check the website and change your reservation to get the best rates!). The hotel was going through renovations when we were last there, and it appears they have done some extensive upgrades - flat screen TV's in most rooms and the cool top stove tops, and the refrigerator worked well -- even the freezer froze our bottled water quite wonderfully! Anyhow, we stayed in a 10 person, 2 bedroom suite with a kitchenette - had all we needed except for an oven, but we were out most evenings and didn't cook! The breakfast was a vast improvement from the last time we were here 4 years ago - there were scrambled eggs every day as well as either bacon or sausage every other day! We did have to ask for extra pillows, towels, and washcloths that first night, but they were brought to us quickly with no delay. Also, a broken faucet in the kitchen was fixed that next day. The pool was just as lovely as I remembered it. Every morning, I would see a guy cleaning the pool and the surrounding area, and the water was clean - not dirty as some other reviewer wrote! And all the elevators (there are 4 total) seemed to work just fine, thanks. The only thing that disappointed was the Manager's Reception is only one hour instead of 2 now. And the internet service was spotty. But those things are minor compared to the pleasant stay we experienced. And being a Choice Privileges Reward member, I was allowed the privilege of late check out. We stayed until almost 1pm so we could avoid rush hour returning to metro Atlanta. All in all, I enjoyed my stay, and I would definitely be back! If you are looking for a high class resort, this is not that type of facility, but it is great for families with a mix ot teens and small kids. We had a great time and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: DSCAshburn
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 6 pm. The pictures DO NOT adequately show the location of the hotel behind the big, ugly $5 tee-shirt store that looks run down. The hotel right next door looked deserted and run down also. We checked in with the hopes it would improve. We arrived during "free all you can drink beer and wine hour", complete mistake. We went up to our 5th floor 1 bedroom suite. It was clean and basic, we didn't have any extra blankets for the pull-out bed, pillows or more than one roll of toilet paper. The pullout bed was nothing but coils and cloth, had the worst nights sleep ever. The breakfast line was so long it wrapped around to the lobby, about a 30 min wait. We decided to get breakfast items at the grocery store. To wrap it up this is not as advertised and we ended up only staying 2 nights as the crowd this hotel attracted was NOT acceptable. We typically stay in moderate hotels and are on a budget. We are a regular family of 6 with 4 kids. We will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: bscott12
Reviews.Content: Started out that we had a nongauranteed room. Room was held until 6pm. Got stuck in rush hour traffic in Orlando. Called hotel at 5:50pm to tell them we were on on way, and would be about 10 minutes late. We were told that it did not matter, our reservation would be cancelled at 6pm if we were not there unless it was held with a credit card. Against my inner feelings, I provided the hotel with my debit card number to hold the room an extra 10 minutes. Upon arrival we found that the "resort" pictured on the internet was nothing like what we found. The hotel is nestled between other sleezy motels and run down commercial buildings right adjacent to Old Town. We decided to give the hotel a chance since the room was now guaranteed. We waited over twenty minutes to check in because two people were ahead of us. We checked in and got a room on the third floor. They advertise poolside rooms for an extra charge. Well guess what! All rooms are pool side. The pool looked disgusting. We went to one of only two elevators that serve the hotel. We waited 8 minutes and the elevator still had not arrived. We then decided to utilize the stairs, all twelve of us to include 8 kids under 12. We toted all of our luggage and coolers up three flights of stairs. When we arrived at our "suite", we found it to b very dated and dark. We unpacked and decided to go out for dinner and then to old town. We went to place some valuables in the safe (which the "resort" charges $2.50 a night to use) and found that it was locked shut. We had to call and wait 15 minutes for maintenance to arrive to unlock the safe. That posed a question: How safe is the safe if some maintenance guy can unlock it in 30 seconds with an electrical device? We then went out for the night, returning about 10:30pm. We started getting all of the kids bathed. We found that there were 4 towels with 12 occupants in the room. There was no soap and no washclothes. The hotel had placed hand towels in the bathrooms to be used as washclothes. We called the front desk for more towels, washclothes and soap. Ten minutes later, a not so pleasant houseman arrived with 4 towels. He left. We then called the front desk and again requested washclothes and soap. The same houseman arrived about 10 minutes later with two bars of soap and 4 washclothes (again we had 12 people). We decided to make do. We then found that one of the towels the houseman brought us was soiled. It had something on it that appeared to be either dried blood or motor oil. Still trying to make the best of our stay, we put that towel to the side and was going to share the remaining 7 towels. We then found what appeared to be pubic hair in the bath tub in the "master suite". After cleaning someone else's hair from the tub, the kids got their showers. We then started turning the beds down so we could get the kids to bed. We found food crumbs on the sheets of one of the beds. Food crumbs? Yes food crumbs! The sheets were dirty! We also pulled out the couch bed and found old M&M candies on the bed. A pipe in the bathroom also was leaking under the sink, puddling water all over the floor. We called the front desk, and asked to have a manager meet us at the room. We learned that with a "resort" that size, there was no manager on duty. We informed the front desk staff that we were checking out. It was 11:30pm. We packed all of our luggage and gather 8 very tired kids. We checked out, and I insured that no charges would be made on my debit card. I was provided a receipt that stated I had no charges. I was told the hold placed on my card for $290.00 would be released at the close of the day. It is now three days later and the hold is still on my account. We have been trying to work with the bank and the hotel to release the hold because it is holding money on my account. I have just learned that the hotel debited $290.00 from my account WITHOUT my authorization! I am filing a complaint with Choice Hotels, and possibly going to have to take legal action against the hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE! THE WEBSITE IS DECEPTIVE, THE HOTEL STAFF IS NOT HELPFUL AND IT IS NOT WORTH THE HASSLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!!”
Reviews.Author: ged630
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with a family of 5 with kids ranging from 15 to 2. This hotel was a great value and was in a great location. It was nice to be within walking distance to Old Town and many eating establishments. There is a 7 Eleven basically in the parking lot so we didn't have to go far for snacks. Pool was small but nice. Breakfast was good and another way to same some money. We had a GREAT vacation and Royale Parc was part of what made it great!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: momma22
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay at Royale Parc Suites and were VERY pleased with our accomodations! I had read several reviews on this hotel that were not good at all, and even posted once asking if I had made a mistake booking here. I am so glad that I did not change our reservation! We arrived at the hotel earlier than check in time on Memorial Day. We stopped by hoping that a room might be ready, but expecting to have to wait for 4 p.m. (the check in time listed). They did have a room ready and we were allowed to check in at 2:30 p.m. We had a two bedroom/two bathroom suite on third floor. Our suite was AWESOME! It was extremely clean and, we felt, very roomy! One bedroom had a king bed and the other had two double beds. All beds were very comfortable. The did have smaller pillows on them, but we each just used two instead of one.
