Both bedrooms were away from the poolside, so when we went to bed, the pool noise didn't bother us at all. The bathrooms were smaller, but they were fine for us. Our two teenagers shared one bathroom and my husband and I shared the other. We got along just fine and I didn't hear any fighting about space from my teenagers! ;) The breakfast was exactly what they tell you it is: scrambled eggs, boiled eggs (we did think these tasted funny - not sure why, but we just didn't eat them after that!), sausage or bacon (varied by day), small cinnamon rolls, danishes, waffles, seveal dry cereals, fruit choices, oatmeal, english muffins, toast, yogurt, juices, and coffee (the coffee in the lobby is better!). We stayed 8 nights, and while it would be nice to have things switched up a little more, there is enough there to change your breakfast choices each morning. We found it to be just fine and it filled us up - - note that one of our children is a 15 year old boy! We had great service during our stay. We found everyone on staff to be very friendly, accomodating, polite, and efficient. Our first morning there we had no hot water. When I called down we found out that a boiler had gone out. Those things happen and we survived the cold showers. By afternoon I still found the water to be lukewarm at best. When I called down again, they sent a maintainence right up to the room. He was very nice and joked around about spending his day getting us hot water! He explained how they had had to replace things and promised I would have hot water the next morning, which was all I was worried about. He was very nice, patient, and had a sense of humor about his crazy day! I also had to get extra towels, etc. during our stay and they were brought up promptly and with a smile. The pool area was quite busy while we were there, but I guess we expect that when it is hot outside, and when a large number of people are traveling with children. Our kids got into the pool a couple of times, but the crowds did discourage them. I think if you time it right, you could get in with fewer people, but we were going pretty hard at parks so that was difficult for us. The elevators have been mentioned - - they were warm while we were there and they do have an odor to them. I guess we didn't stress too much about it - - they are outdoor elevators and used by lots of people in a high humidity location. What do you expect?? They appeared to be cleaned each morning and there was a note in the elevator explaining that the hotel realized the air situation in the elevator and was working on fixing the problem. All in all, we had a great stay here. We slept well, the air conditioning worked, the accomodations were better than we expected for the price, we had a free breakfast each morning, and our room was clean. We will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway spot”
Reviews.Author: disgyal4u2nv
Reviews.Content: Great central location. Many food choices close by as well as shops and fun. A recommended stay for any first timers or anyone looking for a good rate hotel. This was a last minute decision between me and my girlfriends to get away for the weekend for some R&R. Best decision we made was staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ChibiRoy
Reviews.Content: This Hotel "is what it is" a inexpensive hotel close to disney with many valueable perks. Free breakfast, large clean rooms, kitchenette, pool etc. No, it's not spotless, but you do get what you pay for. Our stay was cheaper than staying in a Disney Value resort and the room was nearly 3 times the size with a kitchenette. You get what you pay for and you can definatly do worse than Royale. Overall I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful - Every Single Visit”
Reviews.Author: NGomez417
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Royale Parc Suites for over 5 years. The staff are all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are clean and large (which is very important when you travel with family). The hot breakfast is free and tasty. Carmen, the event coordinator, has helped us many times by caring for all of the details to make our trips a success. This has included reservations and decorating our rooms for different events like our kid's birthdays. She is very helpful and a pleasure to work with. When we are working with her, we travel worry free. Thank you for all of the great service and we look forward to coming back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at....”
Reviews.Author: jennlorino
Reviews.Content: We have a family of 9 and decided to stay off Disney grounds to save some money for an already very expensive trip. I read many reviews that said this was a great place to stay. Needless to say, we were extremely disappointed. First of all, the hotel rooms are not very clean. They are MUCH smaller than they look in the pictures. Our first night there, I had to cal the front desk for hand towels and face rags. The second day, there was not ANY toilet paper in our rooms. The next 4 nights, I had to call the front desk for bath towels....as there were NONE in our room. One night, after the front desk not even answering the phone, I had to walk down from the 4th floor (because there were times that the elevator would take more than 10 minutes to arrive) and ask the front desk to hand me towels. As I am sure most can understand, after 10 hours of walking around Disney parks and finally getting back to the hotel, everyone is very ready to take a shower and relax. The bed sheets were not changed the entire week we were there, they just made the beds. We had planned on taking the shuttle from the hotel to the parks, but ended up having to just drive and park ourselves because the shuttle does not come and go very often at all...and it only goes to Epcot. With such a large family, I planned on washing clothes at least once while we were there. After a very long and exhausting day and after having to track down and wait for towels for our room, I ventured out with a large garbage bag full of dirty clothes. The laundry room is on the 2nd floor. Half of the washing machines were not working and the washers and dryers only take "tokens" instead of quarters. Of course, the token machine next to the washing machines was out of order, so I had to walk downstairs to the game room by the pool to get tokens. 8 tokens per cycle ($2.00) so I got enough tokens for 2 loads of clothes to wash and dry. Then I discovered that it actually takes 2 cycles in the dryer for your clothes to completely dry....so I walked again downstairs for more tokens. Very, very frustrating experience. The pool was filthy...3 of my kids broke out in a rash after getting out of the pool and they all said that the water was disgusting. The hot tub was so hot that I could barely put my feet in (and I love hot baths and showers). We never did get connected to the free wireless network at the hotel because the strength was so low. Even standing in the hotel lobby, I could not connect on my laptop or on an ipod touch. I can honestly say that this is the very first time I have ever reviewed anything online, but I wish I had known before deciding to stay here exactly what we were getting into. We will not travel back to Disney unless we have enough in our budget to stay on grounds.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed right from the beginning!”
Reviews.Author: justgettingbetter
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed to see the wonderful pool/bar area while on the way to our rooms. We were visiting from all parts of the country as a small family reunion, all female and varied ages. We stayed in the largest suite and were pleased with the size of the rooms. The 20-somethings spent a lot of time by the pool. The breakfasts were good. Quick access to Disney and walking distance to restaurants. The only thing that needs to be upgraded a bit is the sleep sofa which was not very comfortable. Will return someday with the guys!

Reviews.Title: “So there is a such thing as Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: slysam10
Reviews.Content: My family and I were recently in Florida we started in Miami, which was a nightmare and later ended up in Orlando. I wanted to take my wife and 10yr old daughter to Disney World. What a difference in customer service between these two towns. There must be something in the water in Orlando because they actually value your business and have good manners here. We checked in we were greeted with a smile, they even remembered that I stayed here before, we asked for directions we were… hold on wait for it…. Actually given directions to the area we wanted to go to (with a smile) Quality Suites saved my vacation. No one thought there cell phone conversation was more important than me, or anything. I had one problem while I was there and it was fixed with in ten minutes. I’ll be back here for sure. Management should be sent to Miami to show them how its done.

Reviews.Title: “comming home to our family”
Reviews.Author: maureen m
Reviews.Content: Well, we have booked another stay, this is like home. A comfort blanket. unbeatable value, unbeatable staff. No where in orlando area can beat this place. AND HAPPPPPY HOUR to boot. Right on Old Town. dont need a car.transport to anywhere, Most important a safe place for familys. We have traveled the world,but always come back to this place.For 5yrs now. absolutley unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: mikeh117
Reviews.Content: my family and I stayed here on may 15th to the 21st this hotel is in a very convenient location the room was comfortable large great for my family of four our kids were happy with the pool and there was a 7-11 right next door a grocery store across the street and alot of restaurants nearby i dont think you could get a hotel in a better location central to everything close to disney and universal studios i would also like to say the breakfast thats free is great to all those reviewers that complain about the FREE breakfast go ahead and buy your own breakfast elsewhere more for the people that appreciate it.i would definitely return and just might one day our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: kwilson228
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 22 month old daughter. We had requested a crib for her to sleep in and it was promptly sent up to our room. Nice furnishings, great little kitchenette with dishwasher, microwave, two burner stove. Bed was great and lots of pillows. Breakfast had eggs, sausage, waffles, toast, fruit, yogurt and pastries. Easy access to highway and International Drive. Had a great time. Only downside was outside corridors..noise from the pool sometimes bothered the little one during her nap or early bedtime.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as it looks in the picture”
Reviews.Author: Melinda44
Reviews.Content: Our experience was different than the other reviewers. We arrived early and were told that our room was pre-assigned and would not be ready until 4:00. I booked a King Suite so I don't know why our room was pre-assigned at all. Turns out the room was not ready before 4:45 and when we got there, housekeeping was not even nearly finished cleaning our room - she was just getting started. Our lovely view faced the back of the sign over the front door which made our room VERY dark, 24 hours a day. The pool is open until 11:00 pm so the music and pool activity can be heard right up until then. We were there in May, so a quiet time - the pool fills up very fast and there are not enough chairs around the pool The breakfast was gross. Only white milk, no chocolate milk and the "juice" selection did not contain any juice at all, just sugary fruit flavored drinks, You would think in Florida they would at least serve Florida Orange Juice. Diet yogurt (not kid friendly), one fruit selection, soggy waffles because they make them so far ahead and then cover them in a tray until they are soggy and precooked sausage patties that are refried to heat them up. This is what they call breakfast meat. My kid ate cherry danishes all week and I had to buy chocolate milk and real juice from the 7-11 that most of the other guests have a view of. The room is very outdated and the bathroom very small. The bed was comfortable, the sofabed, not so much. Spend the extra few bucks and stay anywhere else. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families on a budget”
Reviews.Author: daddypat3
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel. I have a family of 5; 3 being small children. Our kids loved the pool area, so much they almost forgot about Disney. They had a nice breakfast in the morning times. The staff in the breakfast area were great! My oldest child has food allergies, and they were able to bring out the boxes of the food to make sure nothing contained peanuts; that was great customer service in my book. The one thing that needed some attention was the WIFI access. It was very spotty certain days, but I was able to go to the lobby and finish up some business when I was unable to get online in my room. Other than that we had a great time at this place, the staff made our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel very clean pleasant staff comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: ventura10
Reviews.Content: we stayed at quality royal parc suites kissimee for 5 days may 2010 after experiencing two other below standard hotels this hotel was spotless, rooms cleaned daily we stayed in a one bedroom suite which had two double beds and one bed settee two 32" tvs one in living room which also had a nice sized settee ( which could be made into a bed ) the size was ideal for about 4 people (comfortable) the kitchen area had a cooker microwave sink and dishwasher the pool area was clean with a pool bar pool and hot tub . free drinks availible at bar between 18.00 and 19.00 pm daily a free hot breakfast ! and free tea and coffee in lobby all day . The location was fantastic to walk in to old town on a evening for a drink (no driving) also if you dare to cross the road there is plenty locally (shops , food, pizza hut , kfc , and a chinese (but chinese was cold ) we have travelled to florida 10 times we have stayed in condos villas and hotels but found the royal parc suites ideally located and value for money even though you could stay next door for less money the beds were horrendous and not very clean this is deffinately the best in this area

Reviews.Title: “Nice people always win me over”
Reviews.Author: limer99
Reviews.Content: My family and I were recently in Florida we started in Miami, which was a nightmare and later ended up in Orlando. I wanted to take my wife and 10yr old daughter to Disney World. What a difference in customer service between these two towns. There must be something in the water in Orlando because they actually value your business and have good manners here. We checked in we were greeted with a smile, they even remembered that I stayed here before, we asked for directions we were… hold on wait for it…. Actually given directions to the area we wanted to go to (with a smile) Quality Suites saved my vacation. No one thought there cell phone conversation was more important than me, or anything. I had one problem while I was there and it was fixed with in ten minutes. I’ll be back here for sure. Management should be sent to Miami to show them how its done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Royal Parc”
Reviews.Author: Loucee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very satisfied with our stay at Royal Parc Suites. Because of a cancelled appointment we got there a couple hours before official check in time. We did not expect to go to our room, but werepleased when the desk staff started our paperwork and let us spend some time at the pool, which offered a place to change into swimsuits, comfy lounge chairs etc. The pool area was very clean, but the pool IS smaller than it looks in photos. (no problem for us, but if you were there at a peak travel time I am sure you would find the pool area crowded at times) Our suite was very spacious, and clean. Beds were very comfortable, and the place was very quiet. From the hotel you can walk to many restaurants, nice to not have to take the car out! All staff we spoke to was friendly, and helpful. The free breakfast buffet is just fine. We were only there for one night, but if you stayed longer, you could certainly "mix and match" and have different things for breakfast each day. We had breakfast early, and at that time of morning everything was plentiful, fresh, and hot, and there was plenty of seating. Although we did not use the kitchen facilities, we checked them out, and they were fine. We were sorry we were only at Royal Parc for one night. We plan to go back again, and would not hesitate to suggest this to anyone looking for a longer stay in the area. The only thing that I think is not quite as it was "suggested" on the website is, this is not really a "couples hotel". To me it is more of a family place. I would not go there for a romantic getaway, but again, the month of May is slow, so it worked out fine for us. A very nice hotel and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Jalayne68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was GREAT! It was everything that was advertised! We enjoyed the pool (My 2 year old loved the kiddie pool!) We loved the free drinks! We had a problem with our microwave and it was fixed within 20 minutes! The rooms were cleaned every day (that included the filling and running of our dishwasher ) and LOTS of clean towels were always left ! The only problem we had was the internet..there was only one place in the room that we could access it! But for the price we paid the service, free breakfast and staff were GREAT! We would stay there again! My kids didn't want to leave! A couple of tips...eat breakfast early as 8am-9am it gets really crowded! Make sure to ask the staff for any help that you need! They are great and work hard to make you happy!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, Clean, Would go back”
Reviews.Author: atkinsonCumbria
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week and had a lovely time. Royale Parc Suites was great for us. Only made use of the happy hour twice, wine and beer were fine as was soda for kids. Everything was clean, lots of towels for by the pool. Hot tub was really really hot, too hot for us, pool was not very warm but did not bother the kids. Location was great for oldtown, we went there a couple of nights, got a nice local feeling to it. Shuttle service was fine when you got used to it. We would book again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful stay...”
Reviews.Author: GodAlways
Reviews.Content: There were several reasons our stay@The Royale Parc Suites was a beautiful one. There were a few kinks in the beginning, however, the staff was very professional & expeditious in resolving all matters. I immediately sent an email to Ms. Cohen, Guest Relations Coordinator to thank her for her role in making our stay an enjoyable one. The email in part is as follows... I want to thank you so much for making our stay at The Royale Parc Suites an enjoyable one. Your staff truly helped to make our stay one that was memorable. Angel (Front Desk) deserves an extra pat on the back/hug/commendation/thank you for his efforts. Angel was just that--an angel. He smoothed out the initial kinks , showing complete understanding for us as guests of the hotel. He did everything in his power to make things right and he succeeded. He was friendly and professional. He extended himself and let us know that we could call on and count on him no matter the reason or the amount of times. He was genuinely concerned about our satisfaction. Please let him know how much my husband and I appreciated his help and appreciate him. If you are not his direct supervisor, please also make that person aware of Angel's success in pleasing the hotel's guests. Other staff members who are worthy of being commended are Holiver (Housekeeping), Carlos (Maintenance) and Susie (Housekeeping). Carlos has such a warm spirit! He was SOOOO refreshing! Meeting him and getting the opportunity to interact with him was a blessing. Please give him an extra pat on the back/hug/commendation for his being such a warm and friendly person. Please let him know that my husband and I enjoyed meeting him. Our interaction was brief but it meant so much. Holiver was humble and professional. He made sure he put forth his best efforts until things were "just right." The hotel ammenities were great! I loved that there was more than 1 pool. My babies are beginners so having the "Kiddie Pool" was just right. I hate cold water so the warm jacuzzi was great. My husband enjoyed the big pool. Providing breakfast was also great! Despite wanting 2 sleep in, it was wonderful being able to get up & mingle w/other guests in the restaurant & the outdoor cafe. Allowing 3.5 hours for breakfast really gives ample time for everyone to have the opportunity to enjoy a free breakfast. The free breakfast really helps out not only for the on-site convenience, but it helps for our budget. The kitchnette is also great for the budget. I didn't realize dishes/pots and pans would be provided! I cooked for my family several nights. We utilized the laundry room. We LOVED the fact that you have an on site fitness room. We had fun utilizing that as well. I again have to thank you for added that "something extra" to help make things better. U certainly gave us a warm welcome. I thank you for all your email interaction with me prior to our trip in an effort to insure that everything was to our satisfaction before we made it there. My husband has bragged to his coworkers about the excellent, friendly service we received. Once things were made right, we hated having to leave! Overall we had an excellent stay. We look forward to returning! Have an awesomely beautiful day, Carmen. Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: palance69
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel online and didnt have much expectations of it being that we just wanted to have a place to stay that was close to the theme parks and that offered free transportation. Upon checking into the hotel I realized that I couldnt of made a better decision than to stay here. The hotel has a New Orleans/Mardi Gras theme, and who doesnt like Mardi Gras! The person who checked up in was very efficient and warm, smiled throught the entire check in process. In addition every other staff member we encountered during our stay always greeted us with a smile. The lobby was a bit crowded so I can tell it must be a busy place. I had a ground floor suite that i can just walk out and the pool area was within a few steps; along with a bar which had FREE DRINKS!!! The room was spacious and we didnt feel cramped or over crowded what so ever. I can tell that they did some renovations to the rooms, but you can still see the age in the overall property. The beds were comfortable and they had ample amount of linens. They had a free breakfast every morning so it allowed my party to save a little bit of cash. The breakfast area tends to be crowed at certain times but over all the food was good. They offered free shuttle to Disney throughout the morning and one in the evening. The shuttle get full very quickly so we had to make sure we where at the stop at least 20 minutes early. All in all we enjoyed the stay at this hotel, we will keep this place in mind for our future visits to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND STAFF”
Reviews.Author: MrsJaxson
Reviews.Content: My Family and I visited this hotel for the first time and it was a great experience. The Hotel staff were very inviting. The rooms were beautiful and clean. The breakfast was great and the hotel overall is awesome. I would highly recommend everyone to stay here. I will definitely stay here again. The hotel is very close to the Disney parks as well. We stayed in a beautiful two bedroom two bath. We had to change rooms because the first was wheelchair accessible and we didn't have a wheelchair. I made the call and Carlos advise me that they can move me and my Family with no problems. We went to the park and when we return, our bags were in the next room as Carlos stated they would do. I left a note to ask them to move the baby milk out of the fridge and that was done as well. They even move my baby's Disney balloon aaawww. I was so happy. I would like to take this time to thank the hotel staff and management for a wonderful experience at this hotel. The Jackson Family

Reviews.Title: “Had a geat time”
Reviews.Author: sally889
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here at the Royale Parc Suites and wishes i could stay the rest of the week. We found this hotel because it was close to different venues which we were atteneding while in kissimmee. They have free local calls so it made it easy to call around to my family who were also staying in the area and othe hotels. The staff were very friendly and always tened to all of our requests. Couldnt ask for anything else. the suites are more like appartment becauseof the space and amenities they offered. I will be back to kissimmee during the summer time and I will not stay anywhere else but here.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney A+, Nice Amenities A+, Housekeeping F, Rooms C-”
Reviews.Author: verispicey
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was ok. The front desk staff and concierge desk were very nice and helpful. The foyer was very clean and updated. Wonderful 24 hour coffee bar serving the best in coffee choices however around 10:00 pm the coffee would be empty. Breakfast was included in the price of our stay and overall it was nice. Breakfast was always ready and hot. There are a lot of choices so you don't have to eat the same thing everyday. The orange juice was terrible it tasted like tang not what you would expect when staying in Florida. The location to Disney is fabulous, very close, probably less that 10-15 min. away from hotel. There is a complimentary happy hour every evening. My husband did get a beer a couple of nights but we were at the Disney parks everday until around 10:00 pm. and the happy hour was from 6 to 7 pm.. The pool looked very clean but we never had time to use it. We did use the hot tub and it was clean. Very spacious rooms. Now for the not so good. The hotel is older. It appears while updating most of the money was put on the pool, front desk and breakfast area. All three areas are beautiful. The actual room that you will be staying in is not so wonderful. First of all it is updated with new furnishings, mirrors, carpet and fixtures. But it is just a cosmetic update. The interior doors do not close due to being old and having coat after coat of paint on them. Although the bathrooms have had a few cosmetic updates they are very small, dingy and still appear old . The fans in the bathrooms need replaced. The mattresses are fine for small children but very small and uncomfortable for two adults and we are not large adults. I slept horribly and my parents slept separately in the guest bedroom because of the mattresses. The air conditioners are as old as the building. We all had sinus problems before leaving after a 7 day stay. The guest bedroom air conditioner did not work. It blew out air but it was not cold. We did let the front desk know and maintenance did look at it quickly. It did not get fixed on our stay, but we were ok with that. The kitchen does not have an oven and only two cooking pans. Housekeeping is the worst. Our beds were made a couple of times. We had to ask and wait for towels and washcloths, not very fun after staying at Disney all day. Nothing was cleaned or wiped down. Ran out of toilet tissue a couple of times. No vaccuming. Parking is terrible, very small spaces. I have a new dent in the door of my vehicle. Despite the room conditions and parking we still had a great time at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Quality is more than quality when you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: otocasio18
Reviews.Content: The Quality Suites Royale Parc Suites, located right next to Old Town Kissimme, it is a wonderful hotel. It was a pleasure staying at Quality Royale Parc Suites where the attention provided by the employees was excellent as well as the cleanliness of the suites. I felt at home or even better cause of the quality that was found not just at the suites but as well as with it sorround, the service provided by the employees, the security and it location. Definetly, I will choose it again and again and will recommend it to family, friends and relatives. Thanks Quality Suites Royale Parc Suites for being there for me, my family and friends and for make us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible experience; though I could have done it cheaper!”
Reviews.Author: screwedbydaysinn
Reviews.Content: The suite that I stayed in was recently renovated and fabulous. Hotel is beautiful. They offer shuttle to and from major hot spots, but only one trip there at 7 AM and back at 6 PM for Seaworld. Otherwise, the shuttles are $25 to 30 each way. There is us stop across the street and you can pay $2 to go anywhere; though you may need to hop on a few buses; this is very easy! I paid $33 for shuttle from airport only to find that I could have taken the bus. The breakfast is free and choices were just fine. Those who might complain are just trying to pretend that they are high society. Happy hour is as they say, but not worth running back for when there are so many things to do. Loster Feast Buffet down the street is $37 and they offer you one lobster after another; 12 between the two of us and so much to choose. Dont go near the Full House Buffet; disgusting! Get coupon codes for discounts on just about everything. The hotel had an even better price for Seaworld than the Seaworld site; $42 a person. Ibooked on Travelocity and piad $272 for 3 nights and airfare from Pennsylvania; all taxes included. I booked it a week before the trip. Beautiful fitness room, pool was packed up to around 11 PM; then adults only from what I experienced. The Outlets are a waste of time; hal f off the marked up prices. Order the Visit Orlando brochure to save $10 off Maui Luau.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay for Vacations”
Reviews.Author: rbledgar
Reviews.Content: My stay in Quality Suites Royale Parc Suites was an excellent place to stay for vacations. All the amenities offered were excellent. The pool was well kept clean. The yacuzi was excellent. The hours for happy hours were excellent, good service and very nice people behind the counter serving. It was a pleasure and gratifying our stay. My first choice to stay in a hotel in Kissimmee is Quality Suites Royale Parc Suites because of the good and nice attention towards myself. I definitely recommend your hotel and was an excellent experience staying in the facilities. I am proudly to recommend and accept your efforts in during a good job with your clients. Please let your employees know that all of them did a great job in serving us and their kindness were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: esms60
Reviews.Content: stayed here many many times great place,friendly people,alawys ready to do for you.nothing is to much to ask. Its live being away with family and friends. allways a safe place to stay,everything close by

Reviews.Title: “Value Vacay”
Reviews.Author: livinglife22
Reviews.Content: Easy to book, easy to stay and easy to leave. Great experience checking in and out, very convenient. Also very friendly staff at front desk. Free breakfast was cool, so was happy hour. Nice kitchen area in the 2 bedroom suites as well. I truly have no complaints as the suite was clean, and the hotel was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Money....but don't go in with expectations too high”
Reviews.Author: taylorplayer
Reviews.Content: Writing this from our room at the Quality Suites on the last day of our week long stay. After 6 days here, I've figured out a couple of observations I wanted to share with prospective guests: 1. Beds are comfortable, rooms are clean, if a bit tired. With a destination as busy as this, wear and tear is an issue at just about every hotel in the area. 2. In-room DVD player is great for rainy nights: plus there's a Red Box at the 7-11 right in front of the hotel: convenient 3. The free breakfast is marginal at best and gets REALLY crowded by 9am. We skipped it and hit Denny's instead (hint: the Denny's and Ihop nearest the hotel are MOBBED, keep heading east on 192, past Vineland, there's a brand new Denny's on the left, no crowd, super clean and nice staff). 4. The pool and hot tub are overrun with kids, so if you're thinking about quiet time at night in the hot tub with your spouse, well, you can just put that out of your mind right now. 5. Old Town is within walking distance, what a blast. Best to go on Saturday night for the cruise night with 300+ pre-1975 cars cruising right down the middle of Old Town. 6. There's a Publix supermarket right across the street so getting groceries is easy, although we made limited use of the "kitchen"...as it were. 7. Get a room on a lower floor or get ready to hoof it: the elevators are the slowest on the planet. 8. The wi-fi connection is a bit pokey, but we were able to check out a couple of shows on Hulu without any trouble... All in all, a great, spacious value for around $120 a night, so go for it.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: macmill
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly adequate. Room was clean on arrival but clearly the decor needs to be updated, brown walls make the rooms look dingy and dark. Doors had warped in our 2 bed suite which made them difficult to open and shut. Staff prompt helpful and polite, but we had to ask for our room to be cleaned. Breakfast ok but nothing special but it was free. Happy hour at the bar was fun and the kids enjoyed the pool. It was quite noisey at night. It certainly isnt as bad a hotel as others have stated. Reasonably priced for a 2 bed suite.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of Home”
Reviews.Author: gredbird72
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice place to stay with our 2 teenagers, everyone had plenty of room to be comfortable because the rooms were really spacious and the kitchen in the room helped up save money on out to eat expenses and really let us enjoy doing many things that Kissimmee and Orlando had to offer travelers. The hotel staff was very helpful with all the questions and needs that our family had, and even helped us with directions back to the hotel when we got very lost on the Walt Disney Resort after a long day of park hopping. There are so many things to do near this hotel, and there were a day or two that we just hung out at the pool and walked around the areas near the hotel to do some on foot exploring, and the nightly happy hour was nice for some adult time while the teens were swimming in the pool. Next time we come to Florida we will definitely be staying at this hotel again, and i would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: robinjason
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. Our room was very comfortable and big. The beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was ok. I didn't like the fact that we had to eat with plastic cutlery and plates. For eco reasons, it creates a lot of garbage and in this day and age, the hotel should be trying to reduce that. Not enough tables for us to sit at for some mornings and we had to take our food up to our room to eat. On the mornings of day 3 and day 5, we only had luke-warm water to take a shower. The lady at the info desk in the lobby was rude and tried to get us to go to time-share seminars. She was very pushy and annoying. If the manager of this hotel is reading this, please end this practice, its a huge turn-off. At the end of the day, it was a nice hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable family suites on a very commercialized boulevard”
Reviews.Author: Judarell
Reviews.Content: Pros: very clean, very comfortable, free beer and wine happy hour, good service, nice outdoor area for families and children, only 1 or 2 miles from Disney's maingate. Cons: lousy breakfast (though free), thin walls, heavy doors which slammed loudly, DIRTY elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Two words-Happy Hour”
Reviews.Author: MrWiggles954
Reviews.Content: If you have a couple of friends and looking for food, fun and sun; then this is all you need. The free beer and wine was just the icing on the cake. I don't know where the other bad reviews came from because I hardly found any problems with the room service or a/c units. I set aside a day of my vacation to spend some time in the hotel and it added to my experience. Funny story, I left my pj's on the bed and the room a mess, when I got back the bed was made up and the pj's top and bottom was actually where I left it on a new made up bed. The breakfast was free and lots of it, I can't compliance because I can't cook or wake up early to go out for it. It’s an eco-friendly hotel with a save-a-towel program and remotes to the a/c so you could turn it off as you leave the room. The pool is pretty much always open 24/7 so you could go for a swim without have a bunch of kids playing Marco-polo around you. The hot tub was not a time machine but it worked really well. Smoking wasn't a problem either because you could smoke in the patio area and not in front of my a/c vent. To sum it up, I had a blast and I will see you again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for giving us one less thing to worry about on our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: adsmiley32
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royale Parc Suites for 7 nights with my 5 yr old and 14 yr old; and would absolutely stay there again! They made check in and out quick and painless. Everything from restaraunts, grocery stores, pharmacies, to park tickets were easily accessible. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. The pool, gym, breakfast area, common areas, and rooms are kept clean and maintained. The only thing I would recommend are a few more later shuttle times, due to some of the parks being open later on some nights. But overall, a fantastic vacation and would highly recommend this location. :)

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: upstateNYMarzie
Reviews.Content: Were 2 children and 5 adults in our party. Our grandson is handicapped so we asked for 1st floor poolside room so he would not have to walk long ways. Had room 113 right next to entry way from parking lot and right at pool gate. We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was very large. The beds were comfortable. Our maid even ran the dishwasher which we have never had before. The service was EXCELLENT. Our needs were met within 10minutes of calling the front desk. The breakfast was included and was both hot & cold and fresh. Happy hour was included as well and we did partake one evening. Distance to Disney was farther than anticipated, however, no more than 15 minutes and we were at the parking lot. The pool was nicely decorated and had ample furniture. I had read some of the negative reviews before we left and I just dont know what people expect. This is an excellent place to stay, and if you figure breakfast for 7 people would be around $70. per day and happy hour probably another $30 we just about stayed for free. If in the area we will be back and would not even look at another hotel. Only negative but not life threatening was wish there had been a television in each bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied Teacher of a group of 164 People from South Carolina”
Reviews.Author: teamqueen
Reviews.Content: This is around my 10th year staying at Quality Suites Royale Parc Suites with my fifth grade classes while visiting Disney World. The staff has always been child friendly and very accomodating. The rooms are spacious and meet our needs. The group sales representatives are always helpful and a delight to work with. I appreciate their efficient coorespondence with me during reservation time. I have never encountered a problem at this hotel. There was a mistake this time on my part that caused a glitch in the rooms needing rekeyed. It was late when we arrived back to our hotel, but the desk attendant responded quickly to our problem and rekeyed one key per room. We didn't need any other keys as we were checking out the next morning to return home. We definitely will return here next year and the next as long as our district allows out of town field trips. My students had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “Just the Place you have been looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Jetson101
Reviews.Content: Hi All, Your Canadian friends here eh! We stayed here last year for a short time and loved it so much we returned for an extra week this year. You will want to meet the staff, from Front Desk to Maintenance, Alajandro, Angel, Carmen, Carlos and Nathan as they are the best, as the Staff are as important to your stay as the facilities are. The Hotel grounds are well groomed, the rooms are excellent and very clean and the free daily hot breakfast (all you can eat) provides value that you will not find in many Hotels. Although the evening Managers free drink special for Beer and Wine really completes a great day by relaxing around the pool and enjoying the remainder of the day with the setting sun. The location makes getting around to all the Parks, and Old Town very convenient and if you wish, you may purchase all your tickets in the lobby. We have pre-booked for next year (2011) and look forward to another Quality Stay at the Royale Parc Suites. This is a Hotel that you should not overlook for you next Florida vacation. Pat and Jeff , Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “160 unhappy guest”
Reviews.Author: Soubelle
Reviews.Content: This was a school trip with approx 160 in the group. The school had used this hotel several years for this outing with no problems. This time things were different. We checked in Wednesday and paid for two nights, on Thursday (our 2nd night) we arrived back at the hotel at 11 PM in pouring rain, only to find that we ALL were locked out of our rooms. We had to go thru the lobby and courtyard in the rain to get to the elevators to access our rooms. All 160 tired, wet, aggravated people had to go back to the lobby (in the rain) to find housekeeping thought we had checked out - all our luggage and clothing was left in the room, so rather than checking this out, the hotel just locked us out. No notes on door about this confusion. The person working the desk said security would have to take us to our rooms, needless to say this did not make us happy and finally they gave us 1 key for each room. When we finally got to our rooms, we found that dirty linens were taken and no clean linens were left, it took guest services 20-30 minutes to get clean linens. Everyone was very unhappy and this could have been avoided if someone paid attention to the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for its price and excellent location for Disney World”
Reviews.Author: SilvestreLima
Reviews.Content: We reserved through the Internet, and were very satisfied with our two bedroom suite. It was large and very comfortable. The location, just a few miles from Disney World, was also excellent. The fact that the price included breakfast was a great plus, specially because we were with our small grandchildren. We will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: 13softball
Reviews.Content: The washer flooded next to my room and I had to wade through water to get to my room. I did not complain but no one working on it said anything. One young man said let him know if it ran into my room and they would get me a fan! I travel a lot and this was the first time I saw a charge for the business room. The free internet did not work in my room or most of the girls' rooms. They did complain but nothing was done.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: themaldonados
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Parc Suites last May (2009) for 5 nights. We drove 24 hours from Toronto, Ontario so were pretty happy to find that the check in was quick and efficient. When we got to our room we were just as happy to see the state of the room. It was spacious and very clean. There were 7 of us which included my husband, myself, two teenage daughters, grandma (age 82) , our 4 year old and our 7 week old son. We had requested a crib for the baby and it was there within minutes. Traveling with an infant, we had to have a fridge because of the baby bottles. It didn't seem to be working properly so we called the front desk and someone came up to look at it within the hour. It was fixed on the spot. The pool was great..... nice when you come home after a long day at the parks. The breakfast was simple but always good. The choices were altered slightly everyday. I have read some of the bad reviews on here and am not sure why they found the experience so bad. We are going back there in 5 weeks and can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “The website photos are nicer than the hotel”
Reviews.Author: dleah66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quality Suites Royale Parc Suites for 8 nights in a two bedroom suite. The rooms were not very clean, and the kitchenette was old and the countertops were burned. The little bar fridge froze everything and our complaints went unanswered the entire trip. We had to ask for towels and soap, but when we did, we were given a very generous amount of towels and soap each day. The breakfast was okay, but the selection never altered, so after a few days, we just went out, for some variety. The shuttle times to the Disney parks were limited, so we ended up taking a car most days and paid for parking. The pool had animal droppings in it, and many people smoked on just outside of their rooms. The beds were firm, and we all slept well. Overall, I would recommend the hotel, if you were not spending much time there, as the location to Disney was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjakoby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 6 children. I have to say the hotel staff what GREAT!! They were so helpful with helping us navigate our way around. The shuttle service to the theme park was awesome, because it helped us save money on having to rent a car. It was too cold for us to visit the pool, but it looked very relaxing. Our rooms were very nice and roomy, and the carpets were clean. Having a kitchenette in the room also helped us not spend money on going out to eat. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone with kids. THANK YOU for making our vacation one the kids will remember!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: beakerbek
Reviews.Content: We live in FL but wanted to get away for a short weekend trip. We decided to stay at the Royale Parc because it was close to the theme parks. We were greeted as we walked in, then again when we were at the counter. The room we stayed in was great. There was plenty of room for my husband, myself and our daughter without feeling crowded. The best part was that there was a small kitchen in the room. So we were able to save money by picking up sandwich meats at the grocery store and making our own food. I would recommend this hotel to someone with a family that wants to stay close to the theme parks but not right on top of them.

Reviews.Title: “surprised”
Reviews.Author: Harley05NewMexico
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice grounds and conveinently located. Well worth the price Best of the choice hotels so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: wakee08
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly surprised by the service I received from the reservation agent and other staff members. All my questions were answered and the staff was very accessible. It was truly a comfortable place to stay. Easy to navigate the hotel and surrounding area. I would definately recommend this hotel! =)

Reviews.Title: “Best value and accomidations for families of all sizes.”
Reviews.Author: pizza22
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd year in a row staying at this resort. We are a family of five, with three children 7,6,4. This resort has everything you need. We always get a 2 bedroom pool-side room. The kids get their own bedroom and we get ours. It is convient when the children go to bed we can still stay up and enjoy the living room and not have to worry about waking up the children. The breakfast buffet is great. We would eat every morning then take the free transportation to the disney parks. There is also a food store across the street from the resort. We would buy food for the room and pack sandwiches to take with us to the park. We saved alot of money doing this. Having a room poolside is awesome you step out of your room and the pool is right there. The open bar from 6-7 everynight was also a nice treat. I recommended this hotel to everyone. Bottom line from a mom, Food is great, beds and so comfortable, rooms are clean, and service is awesome! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us...”
Reviews.Author: almost3am
Reviews.Content: Know what you are going to before coming to this hotel. We found it to be a pretty decent hotel, although not "new" or "renovated". We stayed here for 7 nights right after Christmas, but beyond New Years, and we maxed out the number of allowed guests in our suite. Overall, everything was functional and was clean, although parts showed its age. It was about what I was expecting going in, so we were fine with it—a family hotel at a pretty good price. Here are a few comments: -Included breakfast was pretty good (eggs, meats, cereal, oatmeal, toast, english muffins, etc) -1 hour happy hour with free beer, although the only choice was Bud/Bud Lt, which I guess is a negative (I would rather have a Miller Lite) -Free shuttle to Epcot was timely, although we needed to stand in the aisles a few times. This was likely due to the time of year we went. -A couple of decent restaurants are walking distance to the hotel -A Publix & 7-11 are walking distance to the hotel -Kitchenette was functional and stocked with plates/pots/silverware/cups--I made spaghetti one night, Mac & Cheese another, and beans & rice another night. -Maid service was fine -A service miss: One night we ran out of towels, so I went to the desk to get more, but they were out. They told me someone would come by with more towels, but didn’t. I then called in the morning and they came by promptly with more towels. -One concierge was quite good and helpful, while another one was just trying to sell me on a time share. She (the second) actually gave very little insightful info, but fortunately I had spoken to the other concierge before…he was knowledgeable about the area. -If you ask for a cab, the hotel takes a cut of what the charge to the driver is (downpayment—like $5). We figured this out after one trip and then got the name of our taxi driver and called him directly after that. It was cheaper, and when he couldn’t get us he would call a taxi-driving friend to pick us up. One note, if you take a taxi to a Disney park, Disney charges the taxi ~ $14 to enter, which you end up paying in the taxi fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the family!!!”
Reviews.Author: sjgarcia30253
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family while visiting Disney. I am usually a picky traveler and am usually not totally satisfied but this hotel left me suprised! I usually travel with lysol and clorox to clean the room before my stay and my room was spotless!!! the layout is very comfortable especially since we have 4 kids. This is the perfect place for long or short stays. The happy hour was great I could watch the kids in the pool from the bar, The breakfast was also great. The staff was very friendly. I couldnt ask for anything more. Clean, Great, comfortable, close to attractions...I will be staying there from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: rexflorida
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted to get away for the weekend. Reading the reviews we were not impressed, but after we arrived we made our our judgment. The hotel was great! We were very pleased with the service the entire time at the hotel. We are planning and would definitly say at this location again! Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Old Town Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodBeachcondo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem hidden away in Old Town. As soon as you drive up to the hotel you are pleasantly surprised by the outward appearance. Once inside you are greeted by a friendly staff with a smoothe check in process. The hotel is secure with card access needed for entry. It has a great pool area. Rooms are clean and well kept. There are plenty of places to eat withing walking distance as well as shops and amusements.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, safe, friendly, great breakfast and lovely pool area”
Reviews.Author: RockinPamela
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the 2nd time last month. I have tried to get booked in on another occasion as well, but it was fully booked so dont delay making your booking! We love the fact that everything is secure and the quadrangle has the pool, playground and bar area in the middle. The hot tub is very hot and the pool was slightly heated so that took the edge of the fact that is was unusually cold for February! The breakfast can be a bit hectic with long queues at peak times, but everyone was chilled and polite and no-one jumped the queue. We were rewarded with fresh waffles, either bacon and sausages and boiled or scrambled eggs - make your own toast or muffins, cereals, danishes, juice, tea coffee........ What more could you want in the morning and it's all included in the room rate. Everything goes quiet in the quadrangle from about 11pm - even from the bar area -and we had no trouble with noise at all during our stay. The floors in the rooms are carpeted so this helps. The rooms are lovely, very spacious and well provided for with lovely 32” plasma TV's. Our phone broke whilst we were there and it was fixed within 20 minutes so there you go! If you want to stay here either as a couple, a family, or with friends, you would be hard pushed to find somewhere better, so close to Disney and the fabulous 50’s style Old Town at Kissimmee. Don’t miss the vintage car show every Saturday night. The Old Town, bars and restaurants are within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. I'll be back just as soon as I can afford it!!

Reviews.Title: “Big room on a budget. But zero service.”
Reviews.Author: 6yearanniversary
Reviews.Content: If you want a bigger room for a cheap price then yes this is the place. But we just went Feb 2010 and there were many shortcomings. Here is a list: 1. Housekeeping was very poor. No new toiletries, we used the same bar soap every day. All they did was replace our towels and make our beds. They left the garbage (coffee cups) as is ! Paper everywhere even on the floor. They did not even replace our toilet paper when we checked-in, we had to do that ourselves. 2. Toiletries there are 3, a one-time use of shampoo, lotion and soap. Of which they do not replace. 3. The refrigerator kept freezing our milk. There is no oven just a stove top. 4. Dishes there are 6 plates, 4 bowls, 6 cups, 4 glasses and some utensils. 5. Concierge sold us on going to a 2 - hour timeshare presentation on another hotel property, in return we get 50% off tickets to Magic Kingdom and Hollywood studios. The tour actually takes up 5 hours of your day! When you say NO to the timeshare they treat you like you have committed a crime! If you are short on time do not go to the timeshare tour. If you want the discount, yes you will save about $150.00 on tickets. Benefits: 1. You get breakfast every morning. 2. The room is bigger than your average room. 3. There are 2 flat screen TV's with about 20 channels to surf. 4. Shuttles are free, but very few timings. 5. There is a grocery store across the street, and a gift shop to get discounted disney souvenirs. This was not a 4 star, definitely a 3 star. Many couples with kids there. When we went it was off season and still it was at over 90% occupancy. Also, they do not let you check in until 4pm. This is annoying when you have a child who is tired of traveling. I really was disappointed in the service, but was satisfied with the size of the room. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this place to EVERYONE!!!”
Reviews.Author: jokar1v3ra
Reviews.Content: my husband and I drove down to kissimmee for a relaxing vacation. We chose this hotel because it was right in between everywhere we planned to visit; so location is GREAT. We absolutely loved the hotel. The staff was pleasant, check-in was very quick and smooth, the rooms were clean, the FREE drinks during happy hour was a big bonus, and the breakfast was good. I especially liked the Logan's accross the street, it was a good place to eat. My overall satisfaction from 1(l;east) - 10(most) was definitely a 10!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the spacious room, friendly staff and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: warren2k
Reviews.Content: The service was very professional. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was very spacious. It felt like being in an apartment, as opposed to a hotel. We took advantage of the breakfast and pool, which my daughter enjoyed a lot. The hotel was conveniently located close to Disney World and Pleasure Island. Also, there are many good restaurants to eat at close by (and a good steakhouse right across the street). I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and have recommended it to my family, who have had enjoyable experiences there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Carmen, Liz and Jen make the place great!!”
Reviews.Author: swede1963
Reviews.Content: The Bartenders and the Quality Assurance Team Leader make the place great! Carmen Cohen not only remembers everyone name, but also everyone in our groups nickname! The Bartenders make the place, we enjoy it year after year. Only wish Florida Weather lived up to the Sunshine state name. If you like the cold and rain, go in February!!

Reviews.Title: “This was my second stay and it just keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: micah2
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel I had wonderful time, but the second time was even better because the service increased from what I already perceived as good to great. The food was a real treat and a cash saver. The hotel also upgraded to flat screen televisions and the pool area was quite extravagant. Not one time did I have to call for room service because everything I needed was in our more than spacious room. It truly was a great experience and I am looking forward to coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: mbenjamin8282
Reviews.Content: Overall my experience at this hotel was excellent. The front desk staff was extremely accomodating and friendly. The rooms were well kept. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was very helpful with all of our needs. Breakfast provided great convenience and got our day started in a positive direction. Houskeeping was extremely helpful in meeting all of our needs as well. They constantly asked if we needed anything. One the best hotels that I've ever stayed in and was definitely the best hotel in the Orlando area in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “what a menorable vaction”
Reviews.Author: lilmama386
Reviews.Content: loved the service and the cleaniness of the room, it was to cold to enjoy the pool but my kids loved playing on the playground and the arcade. the beds where so comfortable its was like sleeping on air and the breakfast was great and a great way to save money. loved the area with all the wonderful places to shop. we had so much fun. cant wait until we return next year.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Smileygirlie123
Reviews.Content: I had an 8 day stay at this hotel and this is probably one of the most delightful hotels to stay in. Check in was easy, the room was clean and cute. Its nice having the kitchenette to take home leftovers to store in the fridge and heat up later. I really love the decor of the hotel, I would love to use some of their ideas for my apartment. The service here has been great. We haven't taken advantage of the manager's hour for the free soda/wine/beer but it is a nice touch. Breakfast is so-so but it is free so you really can't complain. The pool is very pretty and so far all of the staff has been extremely friendly. I don't think the jesters in the lobby are creepy like others have stated - they are adorable. Overall there is no wonder why this hotel is a Disney Good Neighbor hotel. We've had a very pleasant stay. I would definitely come back to this hotel again and I plan on suggesting it to family and friends. My only complaint is that the music from the pool seems to be on at all times. You can hear it when sitting in the living room but since the bedrooms are in the back you don't really here the music in there. Be warned the internet is a bit spotty at times but we've called up the front desk and asked them to reset it and it speeds it up a little. The location is great for Disney travelers. You're within minutes from the park, Old town is next door and there are a lot of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location, safe and clean!”
Reviews.Author: kittycat1974
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and maintained and overall we felt secure in the facility. I travelled with my boyfriend and my 3 children (9, 15, 18). Having the complimentary hot breakfast was a nice feature, however I feel they could have changed it up every other day, but overall if you are travelling with a family it is a good deal, easily saves a family of 5 like us approximately $40 or more a day alone. It provided us a good start to our LONG days at the parks. The hotel staff were helpful and approachable - thanks Quality Royale Parc Suites!

Reviews.Title: “OK but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Murrell89
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights in January, 2010. Everything was OK, but we expected more for the price; you can get same quality for much lower price in the immediate area. Part of the problem was that we did NOT need the small kitchenette ... a room with small refrig and microwave at $49 to $59 would have been adequate .. SO DON'T PAY FOR FACILITIES THAT YOU DON'T NEED. We used the shuttle to Universal 2 days vs. $15/day to park there = good, but available at many lower priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Average 2-3 star Hotel Renovated Multi-level Motel Property”
Reviews.Author: AriannaFlorida
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for (3) nights from December 25-28, 2009. The reason I selected this property was to have a 2 bedroom suite. Our total cost was $540. Upon check-in the lobby was attractive enough. Clerk gave us a complimentary upgrade from a standard suite to a "deluxe suite". Our room was located on the far side of the outdoor pool (5th floor). The "suite" was an immediate let down. It was painted in dark mustard colors and the ceilings were low in some spaces and higher in others. In looking at the beautiful bedding shown on the web site pictures; one has the impression that this is a lovely 4-5 star hotel. It is not. It is a renovated 5 story huge motel. In saying this, the room was adequate, the beds were very comfortable, the staff were wonderful and friendly! Happy hour was a good deal and the breakfast buffet an excellent value. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and a visit to Old Town is also alot of fun. I might stay at this propery again in the future but with the correct expectations now.

Reviews.Title: “We spent just one night, but we were all IMPRESSED!”
Reviews.Author: cynnii
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with with 5 adults and 1 teenage on a recent trip to Orlando. We could not check into our time share condo until Sunday, so we spent Saturday night at this hotel. We were very impressed with the size and condition of the room. There were 3 beds, a pull out couch, along with kitchen/living area, dining area, and 2 bathrooms. We had a ground floor room with a 20 second walk to the beautiful pool/hot tub area. While the pool was very chilly, the hot tub was perfect. Also, for the adults in our group, there is a cool outdoor bar area with plenty of seating and a nice gal behind the bar. The FREE breakfast on Sunday morning was great! Eggs, bacon, cereals, pastry's, juice, coffee, etc. We were able to sit outside on a great little patio. The only concern I had was that when my mother went to check-in, they attempted to sell her a time share condo. It was a little irritating, considering we already have one, and it's like every where you go in Florida someone is trying to convince you to COME SEE their great new condos. That was very frustrating. However, the hotel was great, staff seemed nice, need key to access outside doors to hotel, pool area was clean and tropical, and breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jbrost
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend one night at the hotel and were very pleased from the initial contact at the front desk to the check out. The property is very nice and was very clean both the grounds and out room. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. I will stay again next time in Kissimmee, FL....

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the florida sun”
Reviews.Author: Hthomas365
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Royale Parc suites was wonderful, we had an easy check in and all the staff were more than friendly and very helpful, the room was very spacious and gave our family more than enough room to spread out in the 2 room suite we stayed in, the rooms even had flat screen TVs which the kids were happy about but even more so the kids were excited about being able to go swimming in the heated pool, which was a nice site along with the bar and all the seating. We enjoyed our vacation here and it was close to all the attractions we came to see and it was close enough for us to even take a trip to the beach even though the water was to cold to go into! I see us coming back again hopefully during summer months.

Reviews.Title: “6th Visit and we'll keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royale Parc for 8 nights, from Jan 14-22. We had a2 bedroom suite, which is very roomy and has the advantage of a kitchenette where you can cook meals and save from eating at restaurants every day. The staff at this hotel is really a plus. When we arrived our fridge was not working. I called the front desk and it didn't take more than 10 minutes to solve the problem. Front desk people are very friendly and willing to help in anyway they can. I thank especially Magaly, she is adorable. I was never bothered by concierge to attend timeshare sales. We have annual passes to Disney, so once told they never pushed anything or were rude because we declined tickets to the parks. Breakfast is way more than you'd expect. Hot and cold items, everything always fresh . I only missed the waffles they used to have in the past, but that wasns't an issue at all. Our room, 326, faced the parking lot and was just across their laundry. If you are a sensitive sleeper , ask for a room at the rear end of the hotel, they are the quietest. We were never bothered by the noise from the pool. The only suggestion I have would be to limit smoke to the bar area and not the pool. I suffer from ashtma and sometimes had to leave premises due to the smell from cigarettes and cigars. Saw people smoking by the kiddie pool, which in no means is healthy to little ones. Our room was a bit outdated, but we did not bother asking for a change as we would be spending little time at the hotel. But they do have renovated rooms, is this is an issue, ask for one! Housekeeping did a great job, even though we did not request it every day. There was always plenty of towels and toiletries. Location is really a plus at this hotel. There is a 7 Eleven right by the hotel, a Publix supermaket, Dunkin Donuts, Logan's restaurant right accross the street, and if you are driving to the Disney Parks you'll be there in less than 10 minutes. Easy access to I4 also gets you everywhere else quickly. In overall tihs hotel is a great value for families and I would higly reccomend it. Thanks everyone at Royale Parc for another great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you are going to Disney”
Reviews.Author: longislandbeachgoer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a total of 4 adults. Plenty of room, comfy beds and a nice living/dining space. Would be great for a family of 4 to up to 8 people. We liked the very reasonable price and the location right near Disney. We didn't use the pool but it looked very nice and was certainly well heated judging by the number of children using it on a cool 60 degree evening! It was perfect for our needs since we would be in the parks all day and just there in the evening and to sleep. I would definitely go back again due to the value and space. I have stayed on site at Disney a few times and actuallly found this to be roomier, cheaper and only a short drive to the park (no big deal if you do not intend to take a break to return to your hotel during the course of the day at the park).

Reviews.Title: “better than the last time”
Reviews.Author: samsapopingmom
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time, 1st was ok but the rest of the group liked a hotel down the road instead. This time we got a remodeled room on the 2nd floor. It was great. Room was perfect for traveling with a child in a wheelchair. Breakfast was good, happy hour was great. Frontdesk was very nice and friendly when I had to call them because the internet was down. Only problem was the water was very very hot which could be dangerous with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel lives up to it's rating.”
Reviews.Author: jewels1973
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my mother and my 3 young children. Positives: The room was great for us as the two separate bedrooms and bathrooms and pull-out couch allowed us all our privacy and we each had a bed; the city bus ($5 per trip for all 5 of us) has a stop just across the road; there are several restaurants (including Denny's), gift shops, a grocery store (Publix) and a drug store within minutes; the hot tub and playground were great for us; the manager's reception and breakfast saved us a bit of money; the outdoor bar was nice and the female bartender was lovely. Negatives: The pull-out couch wasn't terribly comfortable; the bathroom plumbing wasn't in great shape (the shower faucet was loose), although it was working; there was no TV in one of the bedrooms; there was no phone cord in one of the bedrooms and the phone didn't work in there anyway even with the phone cord from the living room; the pool was quite cold despite supposedly being heated; the breakfast was monotonous although there was some variety (cereal, apples, fruit, coffee, english muffins, danishes, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, and sausages everyday -- sometimes yogurt and oranges); only some (as opposed to all) of the staff that I talked to were helpful and friendly; the shuttle times did not work for us at all (7:40 am to Universal and Seaworld, 11:40 am to Disney Parks except Epcot which was more reasonable); and we were only able to attend the manager's reception twice as it was so early (6-7pm) and we hadn't come back from the parks yet. All that being said, however, I would probably stay here again, this time knowing what to expect, simply due to the convenience of the location and the room suitability.

Reviews.Title: “Ughhhh!!! Yuck! Yuck! Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: tevetv
Reviews.Content: This place is disgustingly filthy. The grounds were full of trash, the doors smeared with greasy horrible prints, the whole place was a sorry excuse of a hotel, and certainly in no way have the word quality attached. The renovations are some slip-shod sloppy mess with no attention to detail. The first room was gross and I wouldn't let the little one stay there. The second room was slightly better but not by much. The crud on the switch - plates was enough to make you vomit. The towel linens were thread bare and I nearly lost my mind when a washcloth was caked with hard dried egg yolk. Absolutely no attention to detail. It is NOTHING like the pictures on the website. The breakfast is made up of the worst kind of cheap foods, Thank goodness for yogurt and oranges. The thing that was equally bothersome was the riff-raff at the hotel. Everyone deserves a vacation - but I was approached countless times, heard stories about employment status, prescription drugs they were taking, hoots and hollers from the pool area even though it was 26 degrees, and the hotel blasts music about 12 hours a day. We stayed in our room and went to the theme parks - period. Never again - it is the same money as a Disney property. The staff at the hotel was very nice, very polite and cordial, it was the property that was really unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and service”
Reviews.Author: Visitantegrande
Reviews.Content: We visited for a weekend and were pleasantly surprized. Although the weather was unseasonable our stay was good.the hotel looked like it has been updated and the staff made up in service for what was lacking in appearance. It was close to the parks and plenty of places to eat. Old town being down the street was a plus. We didn't use the shuttle bus but I know we could've. Our suite had a flat screen tv in it and pullout couch which was perfect for the kids. If we needed anything the staff was there with a smile. i would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: marymoo24
Reviews.Content: We've been to Orlando a few times now, and this trip was a last-minute thing. We just wanted to get away for a bit, but not spend a lot of money doing it. The kids really wanted to go back to Disney, so we ended up choosing this hotel because the price was right. Before going, the mixed reviews had me a little worried, but we were all pleasantly surprised upon arriving. We ended up coming here based on what we had read in "The Unofficial Guide to Disney", which rated this hotel as very good. This is not a 5-star hotel, so if that's what you're expecting, don't come here. They also don't pretend to be one. If, however, you want good, but cheap quality, and space, this is the place to be. Yes, the elevators need a bit of work. Who cares? Yes, the hotel itself needs some upkeep. Who cares? Yes, the jesters in the lobby are a little freaky. And yes, the location of the hotel (behind a gas station and hoaky gift shop) leaves something to be desired. Who cares? What mattered to us was that the service was there, it was clean, it was close to amenities and Disney, and it was safe. I give this hotel a rating of four and five for all these things. We had a 2-bdrm, 2-bath suite, and it was wonderful to have the space, with two kids along who like to squabble. Most of the time, when we weren't at a park, they were holed up in one bdrm or another, or at the pool, which was great. The suite was a bit smaller than I had thought, but it was still big enough, and a lifesaver at times. It was also very clean, with cleaning service doing a good job. There could have been some improvement in the kitchen clean-up, but all in all, good enough. The pool area was not that bad in terms of noise. If you wanted to sleep, you would go into your bedroom and close the door, and you would not hear a thing. I got very ill during our trip, and spent the last half in the hotel room, and I don't remember hearing anything. The only thing I didn't appreciate at this hotel was the "concierge". I don't like being taken for a fool. And because I had read the hotel reviews before going, I knew exactly what was going to happen, and they tried to get us to go to a timeshare meeting, but we politely declined. I could tell they were not happy about that, and for that, I was not pleased. This was not a concierge. It was a glorified salesperson. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. The food was freshly made, delicious, and varied, with both hot and cold items, really good coffee and juices, and fruit. We looked forward to it everyday, especially our kids. And it was wonderful to have access to this for some of our early mornings when we were heading out to the Park. It made a big difference in our days. Other than the "concierge" (and a hairdryer not working, and the internet being a bit sketchy), it was a great place to stay while in town. If you're expecting a classy joint, don't go here. If, however, you just want a safe and clean place to stay while visiting, this hotel is more than adequate for any and all your needs. I would stay here again if we come back to Orlando (which I hope we do).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharonrehr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in August '09 and am going back in February '10. During my August visit I was at the park all day so was unable to use alot of the features of the hotel. I plan on staying at the hotel for a few days extra on my next visit, just to hang out by the pool and pool bar. The breakfast was pretty good for the price (free). They have eggs, sausage links, cereal, waffles, apples, bananas, yogurt, etc. I really don't have anything bad to say about this place. Well just wanted to say that this place is awesome for the price and I hope you enjoy your vacation where ever you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and location”
Reviews.Author: MJSaskCanada
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after many hours of web surfing. The two bedroom, two bathroom suite was a real bonus for the four adults in our group. The suite looked just like the photos on their web site. It was only a few minutes to the Disney Parks, and we had two great restaurants, a Walgreens, Publix and 7-11 within a five minute walk. The breakfast was good for what is was meant to be, but we usually ate at nearby breakfast buffets when going to Disney Parks, (as they had limited food choices there). The beer was cold at the Frenchman's Cove, and the bartenders were friendly. The pool was clean and warm. I can't comment on staff, as we never really needed anything during our stay. Maid service was excellent, check in and out went smooth. My only negative would be that the pillows on the beds were pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value!”
Reviews.Author: lerrilynn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks. excellent value. Kid friendly atmosphere. Staff were awesome: any issues we had were dealt with quickly. 2 bedroom suite was clean and well decorated. We were in room 414 with a lovely view of the pool. Free shuttle was a bonus except it only had one drop off pick up time for our destinations Universal and Seaworld...made the days long (10 hrs)! Breakfast was good but VERY busy. Bring your own tray though as none are provided....makes getting breakfast for four very chaotic....juggling food and drinks etc.This hotel gets really crazy on the week-ends and very loud at the pool area until around 11 pm. We just shut the door to the bedroom and slept well . Would highly reccommend this hotel for its great atmosphere and budget friendly perks. FLEXIPASS from undercover tourist...AWESOME DEAL 5 parks for $219....can't beat that!!!! BEST THING: my boys 4 and 6 got to meet thier Heroes at Universal`s Island of Adventure...made the trip for them talking to Spiderman and Captian America!
