Beacause we went in Dec NO LINE-UPS ! just make sure to bring warm clothes as well as summer attire we got weather from one extreme to another.

Reviews.Title: “great price & location BUT!”
Reviews.Author: kaced
Reviews.Content: location Fab free shuttle to from major parks Fab size of room great as it is a suite, however hotel is getting very old & needs a complete refurb, floors & walls look grubby & our toilet was coverd in the maids hair! reception area nice but be wary of the concierge as they try & force time shares on you ( they get straight off your 8 hr flights when ur really tried) would recommed purely for location for old town kissimmee & easy access to major parks, but reccommed with caution. free breakfast is scramble eggs, sausage patties & toast

Reviews.Title: “Great place good price”
Reviews.Author: NENAER
Reviews.Content: Chekin around 5pm quick an easy. Loved our room spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was ok!! You get tired after 2 days of eating there but it was free!!! Pool was clean and hot tub was nice after walking all day in dysney. Hotel close to restaurants and dysney. Great I will stay here, but eat breakfast elsewhere. Book this VAC thru bookit.com

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: BillyboyBoston
Reviews.Content: I would consider my stay to be "comfortable and convenient" and it's proximity to the parks and restaurants was a big plus. I would certainly stay there again if they add a little more variety for breakfast. I stayed for seven days in November-2009 and the only issue I had was with the breakfast (repetitive after seven days). I originally selected this hotel because of the breakfast buffet and the idea of not having to dine out. Although, there was bananas, oranges, yogurt and cereal and oatmeal-the hot items (scrambled eggs, sausage, hard boiled eggs) and danishes, toast, english muffins and cinamon rolls were the same for the whole stay. Pancakes, bacon, muffins, bagels w/cream cheese and omelette's would have made a big difference during those seven days; especially for the kids. We decided to try IHOP and Denny's for the last four days. I chose the hotel solely for the breakfast and the comments from management on October 20th as follows: Management response from royalparcmgmt, Hotel Management (Management representative) Oct 20, 2009 The management of the Quality Suites Royale Parc Suites would like to thank reviewer mandella914 for her positive comments about the hotel’s attractive suite pricing and the spaciousness of our two bedroom suites. The Royale Parc Suites offers both hot and cold items on its extensive complimentary breakfast buffet. Daily selections include scrambled eggs, sausage links, white and wheat toast, yogurts, bagels or english muffins, cold cereals, oatmeal with granola, raisins and brown sugar toppings, muffins, danish pastries, fresh whole fruit, Minute Maid fruit juices and drinks, regular and decaf coffees, teas, and milk. This breakfast is served daily from 6:30AM to 10:00AM with seating in the charming indoor Cajun Quarters restaurant and adjacent Sidewalk Café outdoor gazebo. A comparable buffet breakfast at other Orlando resorts would cost $13.95 per person plus tax and gratuity, so it offers families a great savings on your overall vacation costs. Although, I agree on the cost of eating out, they just need to add a little variety for breakfast...just a little tweak! Other than that, everything was great! Sincerely

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: kat016
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel not expecting much per the other reviews., LET ME TELL YOU I HAD THE SUITE ROOM 200, I would stay at this hotel again. THE room was very clean and we had everything we needed if you wanted to eat in the room. there was a walkway to the gas station next door if you wanted to p/u anything ..THERE was a great pool bar ,THE COMP BREAKFAST WAS AWESOME.A nice walk to old town which during halloween weekend nobody bothered us US . THE STAFF WAS ALSO VERY GREAT AND VERY HELPFUL WHEN YOU HAD any QUESTIONS.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marpauar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, all the staff was friendly and helpfull, specially Magaly and Melissa from the front desk . Was pretty clean, good breakfast, the pool was open until late and is located pretty close to all the parks, we take the shuttle and it was a good service. It was really worth it! i recommed it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with no Frills”
Reviews.Author: dantesmom06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated a 3 star hotel and it is truly 3 star. The rooms are average, the area is average. If you are looking for a 4 or 5 star hotel, this is not the place for you. It is a family friendly hotel with continental breakfast and a pool. The rooms are large and include a "full kitchen." However, there is no oven (to make pizza and cookies).

Reviews.Title: “A great place to take a group. Quality and Value”
Reviews.Author: Weekender10165
Reviews.Content: We recently had a classmates mini-reunion at this hotel & we were pleased with the staff, the employees, and the hotel. We had no problem that wasn't immediately taken care of and this is our 2nd annual stay as a big group at the Royale Park Quality Suites. The size of the rooms, the ambiance, the comfortable beds, the seperate bedrooms and bathrooms in the 2 bedroom suite was very accomodating and the room rate was most affordable. We were so impressed we plan to go back with our families in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Year Having Our 'mini' High School Reunion Here!”
Reviews.Author: tuggers
Reviews.Content: Some of us arrived on Thursday the 8th and some on the 9th. Most stayed till the 13th. Melissa Izzery who handled our reservations was great and made sure that we all had rooms in a block so that we could pop-in to visit others in our group. Melissa also made the arrangements to have a room set up for our welcome cocktail party complete with a TV, DVD player and had the air turned down for us as it was a very hot evening. The rooms were big. We had a two bedroom, two bath unit for about a hundred dollars that was great. It had a living room with TV, a table seating 4 for eating or games plus a bar and two stools at the kitchen. Everything was clean and neat with lots of towels in the bathrooms. The pool area is large, well landscaped with plenty of chairs and a hot tub. You get pool towels in the pool area, so you don't have to give up the ones in your bathroom. The pool bar serves a happy hour from 6 PM to 7 PM. Wine, beer and soft drinks are available at no charge.. Very pleasant bartender while we were there, A free breakfast is served 6 to 10 AM. Coffee, tea, cereal, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, pastry, toast, English muffins and either fruit or yogurt. Enough to get you and your family up and moving. With the economy they have made a few cut backs, like most businesses. The most noticeable being cutting an hour off the happy hour and using smaller glasses for the wine. Even with these changes it's still a great deal and a wonderful place to stay for a group.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accomodations for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: InTheIndustry528
Reviews.Content: This hotel really surprised me. I was extremely pleased with the room. It was very large, had a living room with a large closet, little dining room, kitchen, and bedroom with a full closet. Tons of space! I was most impressed with the cleaniness of the room. It looks as though it was barely used. The very very best part were the beds, they were so comfortable. A few tips: Don't rely to much on the free breakfast, it fills your belly but not that great, but for it being free it works. Elevators were a little scary, but they did have a note stating they are going under renovation, no big deal its only 5 stories high. Great value for the money. I am staying there again in 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Animal House, don't waste your hard earned money.”
Reviews.Author: notacleanfreak
Reviews.Content: If you like snot filled walls and bug infested, moldy bathrooms, then this is the place for you. The exterior door(that looked like it had been forcibly opened at one piont) led to a littered courtyard surrounding a ridiculously crowded, nasty pool and hot tub. Buffet was like chow line in prison. Non smoking room smelled like a tavern. One stained bath towel to share among two adults and two children. We booked for 5 nights and hightailed it out of there after 1 creepy night. The person at the front desk was almost embarassed and it was obvious that we weren't the only ones who thought this place was a pig sty. It's best to steer clear of Kissimmee altogether. Lake Buena Vista is much nicer. We ended up at a Marriott Residence Inn and it was like the Ritz compared to this dump. If money is a problem, research a condo. Especially if you travel off peak.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: TATINEE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my son's first birthday trip to Disney. Our party included my husband and I, our three children (1, 11, 13) and my mother. This was our first experience at an off site hotel; we normally stay at Port Orleans Riverside. Since our budget didn't allow for a Disney property, we were pleased to find a reasonable price at this hotel,, which is very close to Disney property. I thought I had reserved a one bedroom suite, so you can imagine our surprise to walk into a two bedroom. It was wonderful! There was a separate living room area, followed by the bathroom and kitchenette. The two bedrooms were just after that. More than enough room for everyone in our party. Each morning there was a free deluxe continental breakfast with both hot and cold items, which we took advantage of. Each evening, there was a manager's reception with free drinks, but we weren't around for that. The location is great - there are many gift shops and restaurants within walking distance, including Old Town. We didn't have problems with anything... every aspect of our stay here was wonderful and we will not hesitate to return and to recommend the hotel to others. It was definitely worth staying off property to be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: duchess86
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 21 nights at this hotel Overall it was very good. The location is excellent for Disney - 10/15mins on the Lynx bus from 2mins outside the hotel. The bus takes you to to Transportation and Ticket Centre at the Magic Kingdom and from there you can get a bus to the main places of interest. 2mins walk from Old town - the shuttle bus to Bush Gardens will pick you up there daily 5mins walk from Publix supermarket (only because you have to cross the road) Getting to Universal is a bit more of a challange aprox 1 1/2 hours to get there if your taking lynx buses. We didnt use the shuttle buses as the times were random and the one day we did want to use them we were told the bus had gone and that we had the wrong times. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, it was comfortable and spacious. I cant fault the housekeeping, the place was kept clean, the beds were made everyday and lots of clean towels were provided - they even put on our dishwasher everyday! Breakfast was dispointing boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, sausages, toast and muffins were the only hot options and after 3 days of this we had our own breakfast in the room. Using the internet was expensive .25 /min but when the computers werent working the reception staff allowed me to use their computer. The pool area is nice and we had no issues with bottles or any sort of rubbish being left at the pool. The bar area was good and the bar staff were friendly but it was quite often closed when we returned from our day out. Would return to this hotel again but would concider renting a car though its not neccessary.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad...but you wont catch me here again.”
Reviews.Author: NeverAHilton
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 11am on my 30th birthday, 9/18, and was quickly moved from my king suite to a double queen to accomodate my early chech in request. We had been driving through the night and took what we could get. Check in was very smooth, front desk clerks very friendly and professional. However, the concierge was trying to sell us on some sort of time share for another property as we left the lobby. This got annoying quick, and caused us to not come back to the lobby for the rest of our stay simply to avoid having this guy push the time share on us. He was very pushy, like a used car salesman. I use to work for Choice Hotels (Quality Suites) and I have no idea where this property got Royal Parc from...this is certainly a Quality Suites and thats it. The room was very comfortable and in good working order. The bathroom could use some work. The large plasma TVs were great. The loud noise from the party at the pool until the wee hours of the morning was a bit annoying. It did not feel safe having all those drunks hanging out there with their children. I would never bring my children to stay there thats for certain. At one point we saw an altercation taking place between two teenagers sitting in the hot tub. We just shut the door and went to bed. Its nice that the bedroom is on the outside of the building away from the pool so you actually dont have to listen to the noise out there. We slept soundly, and left early to catch a cruise to the caribbean. It was just ok, and I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Very middle of the road accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Destin2go
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a middle class hotel, this is the place. The good thing I can say about this place, is that they were able to upgrade us to a 2 bedroom suite upon our arrival. If you are a swimmer, don't count on being able to do it in the pool. There is football going on, drinking, etc. with open bottles of unsupervised alcohol on the sidelines. The kiddle pool is too smal for toddlers and the larger pool is too busy to accoomodate them. You are never able to connect to connect your laptop to their server and the only choice is to pay .25 per minute to use theirs. As a business person, this was a definite setback. The room could use some paining as well as the elevator. The grounds are kept up and the staff is personalble. If you use the breakfast buffet, make sure to get there early, as items run out and condiments such as butter, etc are not refilled. If you are vacationing to the area's sights, then this is an okay place to lay your head at night. Just don't expect the hype they give you in their adverstisement.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was at home...”
Reviews.Author: nmuhammad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came across this hotel while planning a trip months in advance, I saw what i liked and decieded to book right away it was such a good deal with air fare and hotel together i couldn't pass it up. Now the first part of our trip we stayed at the fabulous Westgate Vacation Villa very nice place. The second part of our trip we stayed here at the Royale Parc Suites which is not to far from the other place. When we first pulled up I looked around and said to myself its alright not that bad but it could be worst. We then proceeded to check in early which we already knew cheeck inn time wasn't until 4pm but why not try anyway. Our room wasn't ready but the nice gentlemen (Rick) informed us that it will be ready soon and we can go and utilize what ever they have to offer which was great. Not to long after he called our name and we went to our room to my surprise the room was beautiful not what I expected by look at the reviews after I booked the trip lol. I looked at my husband and said comparing this room to where we just came from Royale Parc has the new flat screen Tvs in both the bedroom and the living room which we didnt have at the other place. dining area which was at the other place. full kitchen which we didnt have at the other place and much more here at the Royal Parc Suites they also offer free breakfast buffet form 6:00am to 10:30am and free happy hour poolside from 6:00pm to 7:00pm so you never had to buy breakfast and you had free drinks if you like. O and free WiFi which the other place wanted you to pay for...

Reviews.Title: “I Loved My Stay at Royal Parc Suite”
Reviews.Author: loveorlando_9
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed in room 404 from Aug 29th to Sept 6th 2009 I don't believe that there is anything to criticize about it, I enjoyed my stay, I don't understand why people criticize, If its a trip with Kids, You leave in the Morning and return late nite, My Kids loved the pool, jacuzzi, the breakfast, Me and my husband and my sister loved the place, everything was convenient, from Grocery stores to Lynx buses running pretty late nites, We will be back each time we come Florida and would also recommend friends.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie-223
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located to most of our activities and entertainment as well as restaurants. Upon entering the two bedroom suite, I noticed that there were no flowers or plants anywhere in the suite, as seen online at various travel websites, as well as Royale Parc’s website. The bed was so close to the closet in the master bedroom that we had to squeeze by the bed to access the closet. The second bedroom was perfect. Also, another shocker was that there were no wash cloths, or bath mats in either bathroom. The bathtub was so slippery, that we had to place a towel in the tub to avoid slipping when taking a shower. Several of the towels had so much lint that lint was all over my clothes. The suite was small and needed upgrades/renovations. Nothing in our suite looked new to me. Their website says 224 Newly Designed, Upscale One and Two Large Bedroom Suites. The exterior looked much better than the interior. I will never stay at this hotel again. The daily hot/cold buffet breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: ocalag8tor
Reviews.Content: This motel had no hot water. My wife flushed the toilet and the handle fell off. When they replaced the handle they left the old one on the kitchen counter. My son found a woman's fake fingernail in the couch. We were left with (2) large towels for a family of four. The carpet was dirty. The elevator was 100 degrees and the glass overlooking the pool area had a large crack in it. This is a Quality Inn that they are trying to pass off as a "Royal" Hotel. When we arrived in our room the smell of bug spray was disgusting. My wife and sons itched for 2 days after leaving and were covered in bited. Don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: GREYSEN
Reviews.Content: Dont let the pics fool you it is not at all what it looks like. We made reservations and were so excited about our summer vacation to disney. I kept telling people about the great looking hotel suite we had booked. That all changed once we arrived, it was a very shady looking dirty hotel. I didn't want to even stay the night but we agree we would stay the nice since it was late and if we still feel uneasy the next moring we would leave which we did. The front desk staff was not pleasant to deal with at all. It was obvious they don't care they know people will stay there because of the cost. once you get there you have already booked . Dont get that far we went to a much nicer, clean , friendly hotel and the whole family was happy. Our one night stay there, the room was dirty, 1 bath towel and 2 hand towels in the room for 4 people, there was food in the floor of the kitchen . we didn't even bring our bags in I worried all night about bed bugs it was a miserable one night. Dont make this mistake just go elsewhere from the start.

Reviews.Title: “Royale Parc Suites”
Reviews.Author: hydrangea38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royale Parc Suites in Kissimmee - near Disney. Their website is VERY misleading. I find it ironic that every person shown in their ad is white....when we were there, 95% of the guests were black or mexican. I am not prejudiced - just stating a fact. The room was disgustingly dirty - I have pictures to prove it. I will try to post them with my review. Food splattered on the kitchen walls and ceiling. Crud around (and in) the toilet, and BED BUGS!!! We had to throw away both of our daughter's favorite stuffed animals - they were covered in bed bugs. We had bites and actually SAW the bugs...that's how bad they were. Our room had the tiniest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel (one-bedroom suite with 2 double beds). I couldn't stand in the bathroom with my 4 year old...that's how small it was. Our room was in a corner - behind the elevator shaft - absolutely no light whatsoever. Even with the curtains opened...we had to have lights on to see anything. We requested toilet paper and towels TWICE - nobody ever came. When we requested washcloths, we were told they were completely out. How can that be - at a hotel?? We found 2 dead cockroaches on the kitchen floor - by the baseboards. Disgusting. And lastly - there are no smoking rules....and it seemed like everybody who was a guest was a smoker. Every time we tried to eat breakfast at the outdoor tables, somebody was blowing smoke in our faces. Not good when your child has asthma. Cigarette butts all over the pool area too - and garbage all over the pool. Obviously, nobody cleans...I wonder how much bacteria was in the water. I would NEVER recommend this hotel. I would rather pay double and stay somewhere clean - and not have to do my laundry twice in boiling water when I got home. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not 5 star, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: kimdWi
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel only for the location. It was a nice area to be able to walk to some favorites like Flippers and Another Italian place we enjoyed, forgot the name already. We found a gem of a Mexican restaurant right in the same area. We were accommodated by a suite that had two separate rooms, one with a king bed and another with 2 queens. I slept fine. More than adequate room to store luggage and clothing. The living area was good with a table and another seating area. The kitchen area was small but served the purpose. The two bathrooms was great! What sold me on the hotels was the nightly happy hour. Having traveled I was really liking going up to the outside bar for some friendly conversation and a cheap drink. We met some really great people there and spent a few nights hanging there too. We never heard the sounds from our room, which was on the 1st floor located not far from the pool. I was traveling with a special needs child and I didn't have any complaints. The breakfast was a seller too. I was happy to see fruit and didn’t tire of the free breakfast and never had a problem with the lines. They went fast. We had no problems with anyone being obnoxious like I had heard. The pool area was ok. We used it only once. The hot tub was fun for evening with a cocktail. Everything nicely accessible. We had no trouble parking out rental as I had heard. I was traveling the first few days with just me and my daughter so my 1st trip to Florida, I was disoriented from the airport. I called the hotel and they guided me in. Also my daughter got sick one night and threw up all over the bed. It was soaked with yuck and we called and they came and changed everything and made up our room really nice. We left the poor maid some extra cash for the trouble. The front desk could not change my traveler’s checks. They never seemed to have money there. When looking for directions they were helpful, and we didn’t but any tickets from them. Coming back from the parks was nice to have a pace for adults to hang out at the little bar and the tenders were great. Overall for the price it was a deal. But last spring, there were so many deals. The hotel is a little older but still ok for the money. Not quite what I am used to, but the other amenities made up for it. I liked the local for getting away from Disney! And only a few minutes drive to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Really interesting stay”
Reviews.Author: CDeus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mainly because of the pictures on the hotel website. At check-in, we were informed that we had been upgraded to the same 1br suite w/ a few add'l amenities. Our suite was very nice, clean, and interior design was well done. The ste was smaller than we expected, but larger than an avrg room. I never saw anything remotely similiar to the "projects" as stated in a review. I was not impressed with the wireless internet srvc in the lobby only and inoperable elevator on the 5th flr. The manager, Angel, checked us in and he was excellent and breakfast was an added bonus. It can be noisy, with the pool area in the center. But, you can't really hear the noise when you enter the bedroom (esp. w/ a TV). Overall, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel, but a great value.”
Reviews.Author: S0sie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite for a week in July. It was very spacious for our 6 person family. The beds were comfortable. We didn't use the sofa bed, so I can't comment it. The rooms were clean. The elevators and the public areas are not very clean, but they are outside, so it's harder to keep them clean than a completely indoor hotel. The breakfast was so-so. My kids loved the pool. You are not getting luxury accomodations, but it is definitely a great value. We were going to WDW daily, and the hotel was very conveniently located (only a couple of miles from the WDW complex). There is a grocery store across the street and lots of places to eat on 192.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the pictures.”
Reviews.Author: USA4eva
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel on line, most reviews were good and the pictures very impressive. Check-in fine, went to check the room, the elevator was in a disgusting state, the cobwebs were thick and you could hardly see through the windows, this disappointed me as I feel the public areas should be as clean as the rooms. The room was OK, but because we had teenagers of both sex we needed to use the pull-out sofa bed. This was in a stained condition and every spring could be felt by just putting your hand on it gently, it would have been very uncomfortable to sleep on. We went back to reception they were very sorry and offered a deluxe suite for the same price. I checked the room out to find the sofa bed exactly the same, in fact unless you want the dvd and toaster and large coffee maker it is not worth the extra money as it was exactly the same as the first room. Also if the the sofa bed has to be used it takes up the whole of the living space. I went back to reception and they told me the sofa beds were the same in all the suites, so offered me to cancel my booking with no charge. I was very disappointed as I had hoped the suites would have been as special as the pictures on the web site, I can't see how any adult could possibly sleep on such an uncomfortable surface. The suite would probably be ok if you dont need the pullout sofa. But for the money there are other places nearby. I would not recommed this hotel to a large family specifically for reasons stated.

Reviews.Title: “Totally deceiving pictures on their website!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cvinson
Reviews.Content: Pictures of the rooms on the website are totally deceiving. The layouts shown are not accurate. The rooms are unclean and appear to be very old with cracks in the walls, broke tile, broke bathroom fixtures, unclean appliances, smaller rooms than advertised, funny smells coming from the air conditioning units, electrical outlets that are hanging out of the wall, and slow creaking elevators that you have to share with the cleaning staff and their huge carts. The hotel is not located on the main street (192). It is located behind and surrounded by what I can only describe as the worst side of the projects. You do get a free breakfast however....served on a paper plate with a plastic fork and you'll be lucky if you can find a seat at one of the only 10 tables the hotel has available. This is by far this worst hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SharonH43
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the advice of friends who had previously stayed here. Check-in was very good, the receptionist was very helpful. However, was a little disappointed in the rooms, we were on the ground floor and you see outside under the closed front door, the sockets in the kitchen area didn't work, neither did the fridge and there were hairs in the bathroom. Other than this the bedrooms and bed were very comfortable. The breakfast was okay, scrambled eggs and sausages with a selection of danish cakes and breads. The pool area looked great (we just didn't have the time to use it) and there was a bar beside it. The hotel was in a good location as we could walk to restaurants and shops in the evening and it was only a few minutes from disney. So many hotels in area, would probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Got what I was Promised”
Reviews.Author: twinkleFlorida
Reviews.Content: I was a little unsure about staying here at first after reading these reviews, so i called up the hotel and wanted to inquire more about the hotel and it's services. I spoke to Maurice at the front desk and he reassured me that I would have a wonderful stay at the hotel. I did mention some of my concerns with having small kids on trip, but again he reassured me that I will love my stay . At check in I did meet Maurice , He was so courteous and professional and got me checked in quickly, We know how important that is with small kids. The rooms are kept clean unlike some of the reviews i did see. I did have a situation where house keeping was needed to clean a mess as soon possible but I guess they are not in until a certain time according to the front desk person that morning. It worked out anyways because we were leaving for the park and it was all cleaned up upon our return. Lastly, I had a situation where one of my sons forgot his sneakers in the room and Ricky at the Front Desk made the process of having them shipped to me much easier than some of the other employees I spoke to there including a Supervisor in the housekeeping Dept. He really had good customer service including verbalizing that he valued my business.. It really made me feel good as a guest .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacations”
Reviews.Author: avilamonica35
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, the staff was very friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the breakfast buffet excellent. The pool was clean and warm, we enjoyed our vacation in this Hotel. There were many attractions close nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: kmd2173
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel June11-15,2009. There were 3 families in all. The rooms were very clean and well stocked. The customer service was very nice. All of the kids ( ages 5-14) had a blast at the pool and arcade room. The happy hour was pleasant. Breakfast was good.. but we had sausage everyday except Sunday. I would definitly stay again:-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will most definately stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Smiley47
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and got a 1 bedroom suite. It was very roomy and clean. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet ... it was perferct ... lot's of choices. We enjoyed the pool. The kids had a blast and made a lot of friends. We also would walk over in the evenings to Old Town and the enjoyed playing games and riding rides. Not a bad drive to area parks. We chose to go to Seaworld and Universal which are also very close. Lots of places to eat and shops within walking distance of the hotel. Hotel staff were friendly and courteous. I really enjoyed the coffee bar also. I can't wait to plan our next Florida vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just as adverstised”
Reviews.Author: florida0927
Reviews.Content: After wondering the internet my sister-in-law found this perfect hotel for my our first trip to disney, and i can say that it is just as it's posted on the internet. The room was spacious and the staff and people was friendly as friendly could be. The only thing that i would change is the fact that the restuarant doesn't serve lunch or dinner, but you are close to everything. Overall would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: scubamoritz
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a nice "hot" breakfast buffet. Pictures on the internet are a little deceiving but we may have had a different room "set-up" since we were on a corner. We called maintanance about our faulty room A/C which they replaced the second day with a new unit. There was some confusion with our reservation but the staff resolved it with not much trouble. Good value for the money. We did not take advantage of the Disney shuttle service as the departure and pick-up times were too few & we were traveling with small children. Would recommend to families who need two bed two bath units on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Bait & Switch - BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: cochranj74
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in spite of warnings from other travelers on this site, as well as others. We chose to do so because of the "space," as we were traveling with two small kids and grandma. We also liked the price, we paid about $1050 total for 8 nights. Well, we were very disappointed. The suite was NOT AT ALL as pictured on the site. It was very small and not laid out well at all. There is a floorplan shown on the main website. Beware - not the one you'll get! We questioned the front desk about this after we checked in, and they told us there was "only one of those in the complex." Wha?! The updates are very shoddy (painted rings around the ceiling to look like crown molding) and the place was absolutely filthy. The bathroom floors looked like they had never been mopped and there were little black bugs in the bathrooms. Also, there was lots of mildew around the tubs and showers that looked like it had been caulked over quite a few times instead of cleaned. We complained about this and someone came up and "cleaned," but it looked exactly the same when they were finished. GASP! The linens smelled musty and sour. Asked for fresh ones, again, same thing. I just don't think this hotel staff knows how to keep a space sanitary. I wouldn't let my kids walk around without socks on. Consequently, I was washing a lot of nasty, dingy socks when we got home. The breakfast buffet was okay, but the dining room was so small and cramped, only about 40 people can fit in there comfortably. Save yourself the headache and go someplace else. We sure wish we would have.

Reviews.Title: “A Major Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: auntiebeanie
Reviews.Content: My family of 9 (3 adults, 6 kids) found the hotel in a travel guide. It looked nice enough, was affordable, big enough for everyone, and I trust the Choice Hotels brand, so we gave it a try. When I booked my hotel in the fall of '08, it was around $1500. By the time I finished changing my reservation in April, it was down to $950, so I was excited. When we arrived, the man at the desk was very helpful, as was the concierge. I was impressed with the size of the bedrooms and the comfortable beds upon arrival. When we returned from dinner the first night is when the trouble started. For a hotel that advertises room for 10 adults, you'd think they'd have enough towels. We had about five bath towels in the entire suite, and no washcloths! Seriously! We had to call the front desk several times, and the little weasel who finally brought them had an attitude as if it was our fault housekeeping didn't leave any. We also had to ask him to bring sheets for the sofa bed since it didn't have any, more pillows, and a blanket for the sofa bed that took about two days and a change of staff to receive! The kitchen floor was not clean, nor was one of the tubs. I don't doubt that housekeeping came everyday as our beds were made and the dishes were washed, but she didn't do the best of jobs! The laundry rooms was a disgrace! It was full of lint and a mysterious brown smear on the wall. The washers took $2 in tokens and the dryer an additional dollar, and they didn't even work good. The breakfast was bland. Bland eggs, bland sausage, no bacon, cold pastries. There weren't nearly enough chairs for the crowd. This was one of the worst aspects of the stay because the convenience of not preparing breakfast is what made us choose this hotel over a vacation home. We ended up going to the Publix market across the street and buying microwavable breakfast foods at incredibly low prices. The hotel sales Disney tickets, but at the gate price and it takes forever. And they stop after like 8 PM. No one told us that the night before. The Universal tickets sound like a better deal, but only if you're willing to listen to a timeshare pitch at another hotel. It's easier to go to Orlando's Convention and Visitor's Bureau and get tickets at a real discount. I must clarify that most of the problems occurred with the night staff. The day staff at the desk and the housekeeping staff all seemed to be friendly. They did address problems promptly. And the concierge with the blonde hair on the night shift was great. She was very helpful. I've stayed in fine hotels and mediocre hotels across the country, so I know I'm not being picky. I didn't expect five-star quality, but this was ridiculous. The customer service was about 99% of the problem. Perhaps if people would have been more willing to address the issues, I would have given the hotel a better review. It has potential because it's large, affordable, and incredibly close to Disney. They've almost got it, but not quite. If you choose to stay here, just take this into consideration. Don't be blindsided like we were.

Reviews.Title: “5th and LAST stay at this place”
Reviews.Author: GMJ555
Reviews.Content: This was the 5th time staying at this hotel and it will be the last. We chose it for the location and it is a nice hotel considering some of the others near it. For some reason in the past couple times, the customer service has really gone downhill. We stayed here in January and was given a price over the phone of $99. Great. Then called back in March because we were going again but this time the customer service rep was rude and gave us a price of $129 and accused us of making up that we had stayed there in January and paid only $99. He then ended up looking up our past stay and did in fact see we did pay only $99. Didn't matter, he still said there was only a few rooms left and the price was $129. So my husband booked the room over the phone with his credit card. Well, me and the kids were to be at the hotel hours before my husband would arrive so he gave me his credit card for check in. I get to the hotel at 3:00 pm to check in and the girl at the desk finds the reservation on the computer and then asks for the credit card it was under and my ID. I give it to her and she says..."do you have your husbands ID?" I said "Of course not". Well, then that was it! She says well I can't go to the room until he gets there. I say he won't be there until 9:00 pm and I have three kids waiting in the car. Why does he need to be here!? She says because he has to verify information. I say I can verify anything she needs to know, after all it is my husband, we have the same last name, live in the same household, etc. AND the reservation has already been made by him on the phone the day before with THAT credit card. She asks if I have a credit card she can use and I say only my checking/debit but I don't want to run it and be charged. She then goes on to explain how a credit card is different from a debit card which I cut her off since I don't need my time wasted with a useless explanation like that. She then says..."Well, what do you want to do?" I say "Check into the room!!" She continues to repeat that she needs information verified but will not let me verify it, so I say fine call my husband. She calls him and asks him our address, phone number, his name AGAIN, and then his driver license number. She hangs up and gives me my room key. So just a warning to others, if you plan on checking into this hotel regardless if you have already made a reservation on the phone or online AND paid for it, you will not be able to check in without the driver license number of the person who made and paid for the room. And apparently it doesn't matter how much info you can verify or how many times you have stayed there. This is the first time I have had a problem using my own husbands credit card or checking into a hotel where a reservation has already been made and paid for. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with plenty of room!”
Reviews.Author: tunesjs
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are very spacious and have many amenities. The suites surround the pool area which is beautiful. The pool bar is also very nice. The breakfast buffet is great with many choices for everyone. I stayed there twice and would definitely stay again. Very close to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: griswold5
Reviews.Content: I spent a ton of time checking the place out! First time in Orlando - kind of bewildered by endless choices. Online pictures and information made this place look fantastic! Upon checkin, we thought maybe we had gone to the wrong place. Did not look quite like the pictures! My main huge complaint was that the hotel apparently simply did not put much emphasis on cleanliness! Yikes! The elevator almost made me want to run away. Room condition was not very clean at all. Food crumbs found on furniture, garbage left underneath furniture. Unpleasant smell. The bathroom was the worst for me. I do not wish to see my own pubic hairs scattered throughout the bathroom, let alone someone elses! Observed the same hairs in the bathroom upon arrival and all throughout the week! Yuck! I wore flip flops the entire week, only leaving them at the bedside! Kitchenette may have been convenient, but after other cleanliness issues, there was no way I was cooking anything there! Please do NOT fall for the "DW ticket savings to their "sister resort" We fell for it, always being ones to try to save $$. We were told it would be 2 hours tops! Ha! Actually 4 hours! Waisted half a day listening to VERY pushy people trying to sell into their timeshares. It was quite depressing to see that beautiful place then returning to our own hotel. I love to save money, but frankly I doubt a person saves much money in the longrun! Don't fall for it. Not worth it! Breakfast, yes lots of choices, but some of them rather disgusting. But, it was free. Also, seeing staff people working in the breakfast area with long hair (not put up at all) grossed me out also. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful. Shuttle service, once we got the hang of it (Be early = they dont wait 1 minute past advertised departure!), was very much appreciated. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, if you make it across the busy road without meeting your death! I guess it is affordable, and if you are not picky about cleanliness, it is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Great Service, Fun Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: dianalynn57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family ranging in ages from 51 to 10 years old. We all had a great time and really liked the hotel. We got an unbelievable rate and we appreciated the nightly happy hour and free breakfasts. The suites were nice.Everything, including the carpeting, was clean. We loved the beds! They were so comfortable. The kitchen area was a plus. The bathrooms were small, but manageable because there were 2 of them. The other rooms in the suite were a nice size. We really liked the atrium and pool area and the design of the hotel. The hotel had a fun atmosphere and the other people staying there all seemed friendly. The housekeeping staff was efficient and on the ball whenever we asked for anything. I was worried that the hotel might be noisy at night, but it wasn't. Our bedroom was right next to the balcony and we had no problem with noise. This is a great place to stay for a family get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Experience - A long read, but my pain is your gain!”
Reviews.Author: jasoninsatx
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, mother and I we were headed to Disney World so I originally booked a 6 night stay at the Royal Parc Suites starting March 7th-12th, 2009. The room was a 2-bedroom suite w/1 king size bed in one of the rooms and 2 beds in the other room, a kitchen, small dining room and a living room. Upon arriving in the early evening of our first night stay, I was informed by the front desk personnel that our room was unavailable due to a toilet that had flooded and saturated the carpet of the entire room. I had traveled by car all day and was a little annoyed to know they had known about this issue all day, but failed to contact me “because they didn’t want to lose my business”. The employee behind the desk offered me a 20.00 discount per night if I would change to a 2 small beds per room suite, and advised me that I would be saving 120.00 dollars for the duration of my stay, as if that was supposed to give me an overwhelming pleasing feeling to jump on the deal. I agreed to stay in the “other room” for one night, but upon my request for the original room was told by the desk personnel that I could be moved to the original room style I reserved starting on the 2nd night of my stay. I was fine with that, but that’s when the real nightmare began. After a 13 hour day at Magic Kingdom my family and I were ready for a hot shower and good night’s rest. We didn’t get back to the hotel until 11:00PM, so we didn’t get to sleep until about midnight. At about 4:30AM our rooms phone rings and an individual identifying himself by name and says he’s working “the front desk and states we have an emergency.” He goes on to tell my wife that “Your room has a gas leak, the fire department is on their way, I am contacting all the rooms on your floor, you need to stay calm and follow my instructions. “ Before he said anything else she wakes me up and hands me the phone. The phone falls off the night stand and accidently hangs up on the desk as she hands it to me. Within about 10 seconds (and before I can clear my eyes enough to call him) he calls back and says, “Sir, I need to you stay on the line with me and follow my instructions so I can make sure you are safe and then I need to call the next room.” He stated, “The first thing I need you to do is wake your family members and put them in the bathroom. Also ensure they place a towel under the door to ensure they no more gas flows into that room.” I did as he asked and then got back on the phone. He then told me that I needed to ventilate the room to the parking lot side of the hotel because the leak was coming from the hotel side. At that point he told me I would need to get a chair from the dining area and break a window in the bedroom to help ventilate the room. Now remember, it 4:30AM and I’ve only been asleep for about 4 hours when all this is happening. I go to the living room, grab a chair and do as he says. After breaking the window I told him it was done and he could continue onto the next room cause I thought I was finished with his instructions so I hung up the phone. He called me right back again and said, “Sir, please stay on the line, I need to make sure you are following my instructions.” He then told me to go to the living room and break the window there. I asked him why I should break the window on the side facing the inside of the building if that’s the area that the gas is coming from? He again instructed me to break the window, and then I asked “why don’t I just open the door because it’s facing the same side of the room?” He said not to open the door and insisted I break the window at once because he needed to call the next room. I opened the blinds to the window and in the courtyard I saw 2 county deputies walking without any protective masks or any equipment that would indicate a gas leak. I flagged down the officers by knocking on the glass and got them to come to my room while I still had the desk on the line. One of the officers came in and I handed him the phone. The “front desk” talked to the officer for about a minute before the officer interrupted him and explained that the individual on the phone was not who he claimed he was. The officer had just come from the front desk and he was that there. At that time, the individual on the phone hung up. The officer stated that a guest in another room had also broken a window. Apparently the individual calling was someone who was familiar with the hotel, knew which rooms had kitchens, knew what to tell the front desk employee to allow him to be connected to multiple rooms at 4:30AM, and was familiar with hotel procedures when dealing with an emergency situation. The office also said it has to have been a former disgruntle employee. At this point I was furious that I had been in the hotel for 2 nights, and had issues both nights. I wasn’t going to let the rest of my vacation be ruined by the hotel and their staff, so I decided to check out. We gathered our belongings and I went down to talk to the manager when he arrived at 7. The other individual that had broken a window had accepted a move to another room, but I refused to stay there another night. At that point the manager said, “”then you’re going to have to pay for that window.” I said I wasn’t paying for the window because it was their front desk that was allowing those repeated calls to come through to my room and work his way down the hall. “ I also told him that “if he wanted my money for the window it would have to go through my attorney.” I told his he should be happy enough that I’m paying for a service I didn’t receive, 2 nights of rest in his hotel.” The manager’s name tag said “Ricardo”, but when I asked for his name he handed me a card that didn’t have it, but the name of another person, Cedrick Thomas. When I asked him to write his name on the back of the card he simply scribbled “Ricky”. I then asked him if his name was “Ricky, Ricardo, or if it was Ricky Ricardo because what his tag said and what he wrote were to different things.” He then stated his name was “Ricky Ricardo”. I asked him if all the employees had their last names on their tags because I wanted to make sure I had his name correct. He then pointed at a sign on the wall that verified his name wasn’t Ricky Ricardo, but in fact, Ricardo Robles. I asked him why he gave me a fake name and he did not respond. When I asked him to give me the room number of the guest that had moved from 206 so I could get his information for my complaint he would not, “because I didn’t know the guests last name.” I had met the man only a couple hours earlier when we were both standing at the front desk with the county sheriffs, but he knew why I wanted it and at that point was “playing the game.” I then requested the police report numbers and those were provided. We called the Royal Plaza hotel in Downtown Disney and they had heard it all before from customers coming from the Royal Parc Suites. They were kind enough to allow us to check-in early that morning and we had a great experience there for the 4 nights left of our vacation. I ended up paying over 300 dollars for the 2 nights I was in the room, but that was all (as of right now). I re-injured my right rotator cuff that I have been getting cortisone shots for and have been taking anti-inflammatory for. I didn’t want to ruin my family’s vacation by spending a day at the hospital, so I put up with the pain and iced my shoulder regularly. I now have an appointment scheduled with my orthopedic doctor back home in San Antonio. The Royal Parc Suites just outside of Disney World is a place I would never recommend to anyone on the face of this earth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: parin3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Royale Parc and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I was a bit apprehensive, based on some of the reviews read prior to booking the hotel, but needn't have been at all! Our room featured a king bed suite (bedroom, kitchen, bath, and living room area). All the rooms were extremely clean and contemporary, the WiFi worked without a hitch, and the daily cleaning staff was personable and efficient. The location was perfect for our vacation needs, i.e., college baseball tournaments, sightseeing, and Disney. We will definitely keep Royale Parc Suites as our vacation home-away-from-home when we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: draksky3
Reviews.Content: The signage is terrible. The only thing seen easily is the Quality Suite sign. Unfortunatly there are about 5 on that road and it hard to find the right one without a noticable indication of which one they are.When I arrived the front desk reception was great. But when we got into the room the first thing I did was walk to the seven eleven, bought cleaning supplies and clean the suite. It is very noticable the cleaning staff do not pay attention to detail. It only took a little scrubbing to remove the stains on the counters. They need to keep an eye on the base of toilets and corners of the floors. Also, the carpet was so dirty I couldn't let my kids walk around with out shoes or slippers on. I think they should have at least spot cleaned the bigger stains. When the cleaning staff did come in while we were out, they still did little more than make a bed. I would still have to clean the sinks, toilets and bathtubs. I finally told the forget it I will do it myself so it was done right. They really may want to keep the concret on the property cleaned regularly at all levels.This alone give the first impression of uncleanlyness. The laundry was handy but filthy and unkept. Should make the signs on the dryers more obvious for what money slots are for what dryer. I had no problem, but several times people put tokens in only to find the dryer not running then I would have to explain they put them into the wrong one. Trying to sleep at night was not good. They constantly had people running around making all kinds of noise by scremming , yelling, music and such sometime well after 2 am. I call and complained and was told they had spoken to certain parties and it would get better.........never did. They told me a security guard patrols at midnight but I never saw one and nothing changed. It is hard when there are childeren who go to bed around ten. They should have quiet policy in place for families with young kids. Maybe keeping it down after 11 pm until 8 am. The breakfast "buffet" was hectic and disorganized. They need at least two or three updated toasters that they can keep clean. The line was forever backed up with people trying to cook their own things. the one they had was old,with only two slots and always drty. Basically, the layout need to be adjusted slightly to make it a flow friendly. The pool was freezing the entire time we were there. It would be hard to convince me and others I spoke with it was heated in any way. The hot tub was much hotter than the 104 they claimed. When I used a digital thermomitor( I got one to prove to someone it was hotter and not safe to be in too long) it read around 107. There were several of us out there from many different rooms who all agreed. Though there were disappointments the price was good for what we had. It was the right size and the beds were very comfortable. It was close to a lot of businesses we used regularly like Ihop, Mc DOnalds and so on. The parks were just a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: suzq808
Reviews.Content: This is our 7th trip to Orlando. Our first time staying off Disney property. The suite is clean and spacious, breakfast very good, staff pleasant. Exceptional value. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location, rooms clean, service excellent”
Reviews.Author: kegs605
Reviews.Content: i think it has an ex cellent location, the free drinks at the bar was great, if you dont want to wait for the shuttle to come back to pick you up at 8, take the link city bus from the park no 55,56, goes right past the hotel.old town was great right next store.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place !”
Reviews.Author: meomeomy
Reviews.Content: We had the worst time trying to find the place. As one review had said it didn't have a sign that said Royale Parc out front but rather a Quality something or other. We arrived a little early and was allowed to check in early..thank God because we had just drove 19 hours straight to get there. Check in was quick. When we got to our room we immediately noticed there was no shower head in the shower but was quickly resolved..like within 10 minutes. We got the 1 bdrm suite for 2 adults and 4 kids, there was plenty of room for all of us. Me and the husband slept on the pull out sofa bed, was decently comfortable. Room was clean. Coffee bar was really nice, pool and courtyard was clean and beautiful. Plenty of staff all around. The pool was heated but not heated warm enough for me, my kids enjoyed it though. The hot tub was great. Breakfast was OK...it's free, can't complain too much. Housekeeping was good. Our lady didn't speak English but there was someone there to translate our needs. They were all really nice and got everything we needed quickly. My only complaint was the shuttle service to Disney...also free so can't say too much. The problem was their pick up and drop off times. Was something like 8am, 10am and 11am but to get back to the hotel the earliest pick up time from the park was 8pm. The first day we ended up taking a taxi back which cost us $22. So the next day we just drove and parking was $13. The parking fee is good for all the parks if you have park hopper tickets like we had. They also go to other hotels and pick up guests so they cram the busses as much as possible, a lot of people had to stand in the isles. All in all I loved the place and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent - well kept - pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ctcomanchepilot
Reviews.Content: The silly per room charge for "In Room Safe Insurance Fee" is simply added profit to the hotel. When I asked to see the insurance policy it was taken right off my bill - no questions asked - so - ASK. There is no reason to add $2.50 to your room charge because they want to collect more money from you. Just so no to these blatant ripoffs. The good: No 'resort fee'. Clean rooms. Decent enough accomodations. Clean and tidy public areas. Breakfast is ok; and as expected for this type of establishment. The Happy 'hour' is truly one hour. Free beer [Bud/Bud light] and box wine for the hour. The hot tub was hot - a GREAT perk after a long day on your fee. Pool was clean. Rooms have coffee makers, mugs, microwave, a small fridge and even smaller freezer area, dishwasher and basic pots/pans/utensils. Beds are firm and decent. Overall: A great value. The Bad: internet access - free - and you get what you pay for. Constant dropoffs, weak signals. Blankets are thin and essentially worthless and you need three of them to stay warm at night. Pillows are all very very soft feather - and they do not have anything else. There is no signage: the only sign is the large green Quality Suites sign - you do not see the name of the hotel anywhere until AFTER you turn off the street between a gas station on the right and an ubiquitous Orlando style T-shirt and junk store on the left. I can imagine many people never found the place and are still wandering Irlo Bronson looking for it. Location is tough - tucked next to the freeway. You learned to use the light at the nearby street and use the parking lot of hte Days Inn next door to turn on the road to the parks. Once you learn that secret, it becomes easy to get in and out. I think the cross street is Hudson.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised... and Relieved”
Reviews.Author: MsMJP
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Monday evening, Feb 2 and checked out on Wed morning, the 4th. The prominent signage out front advertises Quality Suites, NOT Royal Parc Suites, and because I did not make the reservation, I did not know to look for Quality Suites. We drove by the property a couple of times looking for "Royal Parc Suites"- in a late evening downpour, nonetheless- but got to the right place after a quick phone call. We thought, "Quality Inn- oh no!" We were nervous when we entered the lobby- it was nice, but huge, oddly-out-of-place life-size jesters stood guard in the lobby, a slightly creepy fellow offered us coupons and a map (and asked waaaay too many personal questions), and the clerk on duty that evening was not too pleasant, but we were exhausted and went up to the room. The courtyard and pool area was very nice, and had the "bar" situated there. The elevator could definitely use some work- it was raggedy inside, and we thought it was an indication of what was to come. We had a 2BR suite, and breathed a collective sigh of relief to see a clean, spacious room with everything in order. One bathroom had only one washcloth, but the next day there were several fresh ones with fresh towels, plus shampoo and soap. The kitchenette had burners, microwave, and mini fridge, plus a counter with seating and a dining table. Happy hour was cool- complimentary beer, wine, and soda- and the other guests and the bartender were really nice. Breakfast was totally impressive- plenty of scrambled eggs, saus links, muffins, bread for toasting, french toast, fresh fruit, cereals, danish, beverages- you get the idea. Note for Internet users- the hotel advertises wireless, but my laptop could not even get connected in my bedroom because the signal was too weak. Another guest mentioned the same issue. The channels were limited, but the flat screen TVs were great. The local pizza place bombarded us with flyers- between Mon and Wed, we received at least 9 menu flyers in the door! Overall our stay was pleasant, and we will definitely consider that property for a stay in April, as the price was fair for the space and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Disgrace !!!!”
Reviews.Author: drinxx
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and have not had problems in the past. However, this trip was inexcusable. I drove 4 hours and arrived at about midnight. I got up to my room and found the floor in the kitchenette area was very sticky. There were also no shampoos in the bathroom. Only a single bar of face soap. My guess is that the maid did not restock them from the last guest.....or clean the room well for that matter. So I called the front desk and they gave me a different room. So I got to the 2nd room. the 2nd room had multiple issues as well..... The towels in the bathroom were obviously not restocked since the last guest. There were several bath towels, two hand towels, and no facecloths at all. There was also a hand towel already hanging on the towel rack which was all disheveled as it had obviously been used.... While laying a shirt out on one of the beds, I noticed MANY hairs on the pillow cases and the sheets. Upon closer inspection, there were hairs all through the bed. I checked the other bed and found the same thing. The beds... While impeccably made, still had the sheets on them from the previous guests. There is no way they had been washed because many of the hairs were loosly laying there. Very disgusting!!!! So I called the 800 number form the 2nd room to complain and to see if they could find me a room in another one of their hotels nearby. The rep came back on and told me that the hotel refused to refund my money for the first hotel because I had already checked in. I hadn't even been there a half an hour or opened my bag yet. So basically they tell me that they are keeping my money even though I was put into two different disgusting hotel rooms.... As if it's MY FAULT!!! I find this to be inexcusable. As I said... I have stayed there in the past, but they will NEVER see my face again. In fact, I'm taking my 40+ nights per year worth of hotel stays to another chain. I am insulted that I have been so loyal to the ChoiceHotels brand for so many years only to be treated like this. As another reviewer wrote.... "This hotel is ghetto!". I recommed staying at the Comfort Suites which is literally within walking distance, right around the corner, It is so much nicer and cleaner. They also have a much nicer continental breakfast, and are actually cheaper. It's hard to believe that it is also a ChoiceHotel brand hotel. Whatever you do.... Do not stay at the Royal Park Suites Hotel..... There is NOTHING Royal about it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay near Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Jamaicacrazy85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed @ this hotel from Jan. 12-16th 2009, for a short getaway to visit Universal Studios. We had a one bedroom suite which included two flat screen TV's, full kitchen (small fridge, dishwasher, kitchenware, stove top stove w/ 2 burners). The room was clean, spacey and very convenient! The breakfast was FREE and included eggs, sausage/bacon, bagels, toast, fruit, yogurt, pastries, cereal (hot/cold), and a variety of drinks. The pool was clean, as the jacuzzi and kids pool. Every night from 6pm-7pm there is FREE happy hour which included unlimited beer, wine and soda. The bar tenders were great and would re-fill you without even asking! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. About 15 minutes from Universal. I would recomment getting a rental car, shuttle isn' the best from what I hear, and the prices of a rental are about equivilant of a taxi to and from the airport. BE AWARE of the discount theme park tickets. Although you save a large amount of money, you must attend a TWO hour tour of a local resort. If saving your money is your thing this may work for you, but in our opinion we wanted to save TWO hours of our day! good luck at this hotel, again I would HIGHLY recommend it to older couples, golfers, kids, and couples! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: t-lop
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 7 nights at this hotel. We had a 2 BR suite and found it to be neat, clean and efficient. If you have read Travelinggran's review, I would agree with it 100%. No issues with staff, the buffet, the pool, the room, etc... very good value for the rates paid. It was fine for us and our 6 and 3 year old girls. Good location for getting to the Disney Parks (we rented a car) or any where in Central FLA. There's a grocery store, a 7-11, plus lots of restaurant choices! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “roayle parc suites - a great family location”
Reviews.Author: travellinggran
Reviews.Content: My family and I (group of 6- 4 adults, 2 children) stayed at this hotel Oct. 10 - 17th. We had a wonderful time and thought the location was great. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the 5th floor - the rooms were large with ample closet space. It was very clean when we arrived and was well cleaned every day. The kitchenette area is compact but has everything you might need to prepare a light meal. The pool area was kept tidy and cleaned every morning, with plenty of towels supplied at least twice a day.There could have been more seating but on our last day they did get a shipment of new chairs and were busy setting these out. As with any facility with a pool there were busy times and slow times - you just have to take it as it is! The breakfast was very good, with a great selection- the same every day but it is up to you to vary your choices. It was kept hot and re- stocked and the staff was very polite. The seating inside is limited but there are tables outside in the bar area. The children made use of the arcade area and although it is not large it is a diversion for the "tweens" age group and was kept tidy - there was also a small playground area for younger children. The shuttle to the parks arrived on time and was very handy - my group did not hire a car so made full use of this. The local bus service is also excellent for access to shopping and Disney parks. We usually got the shuttle to Disney but then came back on the local bus service as it has service to the area twice every hour. We took a taxi to and from the Orlando airport - this was a great way to go - just show up at the taxi stand and you are on your way - no waiting for the shuttle to the rental office and the long line-up to get your car. The only problem we saw was with other holidaymakers - a few children were not well-behaved and some families were a bit loud around the pool - but this has to be expected -everybody is trying to enjoy themselves and the hotel is not at fault in that area. Usually this occurred in the evening when everyone returned from the parks - during the day the pool area was usually very quiet and you would almost have the pool to yourself. All six of us thought it was a great place to stay and I would highly reccommend it if you want a hotel handy to Disney, restaurants and a bit of shopping (ie. Wal-Mart, Target)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: homeschoolscool
Reviews.Content: My mom went through a travel agent and was able to get our room for an awesome deal. Keeping in mind that we went in late October, which is the off season and I'm sure that the state of the economy might have had something to do with our good rate. I've stayed in 4 star hotels that weren't as nice as this. This was a very family friendly hotel, free breakfast buffet that was outstanding (waffles/bagels/eggs--real eggs/ cereal/juices/gourmet coffee) . We loved our suite, which had a bedroom w/two double beds, large flat screen tv and phone, living room w/pullout queen bed & flat screen tv. The hotel was very clean and recently remodeled. Plenty of towels, very comfy beds and pillows AND the hotel staff was friendly. The hot tub/heated pool/arcade/playground are in a courtyard to the center of the hotel square. There are laundry facilities, bring quarters! Walgreen's just across the street will get you just about anything you need to take care of food/laundry needs--we had a kitchenette that came in handy. My 12yo son really enjoyed the pool and hot tub...the arcade was nice and allowed him to meet other tweens his age from Canada, New Jersey, all over....lots of families were staying here. There's a great buffet place just across the street from Old town--we ate for a great price and the food was wonderful! The only "con" was that the shuttle service was not convenient...especially if you want to come back to rest w/little ones or have lunch and return to the park. The shuttle only come at 7:30, 9:40 and 12:00 to take you and only return at 8PM, 10PM and 11:00. This shuttle goes around to all area hotels and then drops off at Disney's central transportation center. From that point you take the ferry or monorail to M.Kingdom or hop a bus to the other Disney parks, which can prove challenging if you have strollers and/or multiple family members running across the parking lot! (overall, I think it would be worth it to have a rental car if you have your whole family w/kids on this trip). 1st class accommodations, and would return to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Family”
Reviews.Author: flarasim
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five. (Kids are 4,7,8) I needed an inexpensive place to stay with a kitchenette and 2 bedrooms, near Magic Kingdom. I had low expectations but was pleasantly surprised. This was a good value. It is not the Ritz, but it was clean. It had a kitchen complete with stove top, dishwasher, fridge, microwave, and all the fixings. It had two nicely decorated bedrooms with 2 queen beds in each, and two full baths. I know RT 192 can be a little honky-tonk, with Gift Shops, Discount Ticket booths, etc. but it also has the conveniences- restaurants, grocery stores, and more. Excellent location near RT 4 and RT 417, around the corner from Disney. Every evening there was a Manager's Reception (Happy Hour) with beer and wine by the bar. Every morning there was a hot and cold breakfast buffet with toast, fruit, waffles, cereal, oatmeal, eggs, meat (sausage), danish, muffins, and more. We also had WiFi high-speed internet in our room. The only complaint- the outdoor "heated" pool was ice cold. We were there Nov 19-22, 08. My kids were very upset, as was I. I was given a discount (the $2.50/per day in-room safe fee) and told the engineer would look into it. I think their heater was too slow to warm the pool, or broken. At any rate, the temp. was low 60s during the day, upper 30s at night, so the pool was an important feature for us that we could not use. We paid $89/night Wed,Thur, $119/night Fri- still an excellent deal for 2 bedrooms. No additional "service fees", or parking fees, or WiFi fees, or extra child fees, etc- just the in-room safe fee of $2.50/night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sellicks
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel but became nervous after reading some of the reviews. We did not have to worry the hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was cleaned daily and there were plenty of fresh towels. We had a 2 bed 2 bath deluxe suite on the top floor. The pool and area was clean and was good for a swim in the evening. There was many resturants within walking distance. The best one being right across the road called Logans Roadhouse. Old town was just a 5 minute walk away. The location was good. There was a free shuttle that went to Disney a few times a day, so you could vary the times you could come & go. There was only one early bus to Universal, would be great if there had been more. We found a reliable and good value cab company (we found the hotel cabs expensive) Try Julie's Transport give them a call on [--] (call from your room local calls are free). The pool area had towels down there and a very warm hot tub the pool area had not very many deck chairs but there wasnt very many people there if you go in the evenings. The pool was very clean and was cleaned daily. The bar beside the pool had a happy hour from six to seven, free wine, beer and soft drinks. The breakfast was good with a variety of cooked and cold. Tea & coffee was free all day in the lobby. Overall we found the hotel very nice. The only thing that marred our holiday was that my sons PSP & games were stolen from our room,(forgot oneday to put it in the safe). We reported it to the hotel manager and are waiting for the insurance company to contact us. DONT leave anything valuable out in the room. I was shocked that the staff would steal from the guests!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in the Heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: Corey87
Reviews.Content: CHECK IN-We got there 5 hours before check in because of an early flight and they let us check in with no hassle. That was nice because we had our first day scheduled for Disney that day and we didn't have to mess with that when we got back. LOCATION-We were literally within 10 minutes of all 4 Disney parks. It might not be the mile that the web site says but it is still very close and easy to get to all of the parks. We never took the shuttle because it did not even take off until one and a half hours after the park was open. With shortened seasonal hours anyways, we did not want to give up that much time at the parks just to save $12 parking charge. There were MANY restaurants nearby and my favorite restaurant of all time GIORDANO'S pizza is just a 10 minute drive up the same road as the hotel. There is also a wonderful, huge, cheesy gift shop literally 50 feet from the hotel where we got lots of good cheesy souvenirs. Also, a convenience store is located right next to the hotel as well for snacks and beer. ROOM-Our room was very large with a kitchenette. We were surprised to see a stove even though we never used it. There was even a dishwasher, mini fridge, and microwave which we did use. We bought a hundred dollars worth of groceries when we got there and used the microwave a lot. There is a grocery store really close by. The bedroom had a closing door so people in the living room could stay up if someone else wanted to go to bed. Both rooms had very nice flat panel televisions. Overall, the room was fairly clean. POOL AREA AND GAME ROOM-The pool area was very nice but pretty crowded. Really enjoyed drinking some post Disney beers in the hot tub. We used the pool and hot tub almost every day when we got back from Disney because it was open until 11 p.m. It was very loud down there and at the bar like I read in some reviews but that didn't bother us. The game room was decent sized and I had fun with my kids in there. BREAKFAST-The free breakfast was decent but we were getting tired of the same thing by the end of the trip (scrambled eggs, sausage links, bagels some days, cereal, sweet rolls). There was not much variation from day to day. Also, it was VERY crowded every day and it was hard to get a table some days even outside. For the price, this place can not be beat. Our room was huge and very close to Disney parks, Olde Towne (which we could see but never made it to), and many restaurants and shops. We have no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted and more!!”
Reviews.Author: kmm808
Reviews.Content: It was a little hard to find as their sign says Quality Suites and there are trees in front blocking the sign from the highway. We checked in at evening time and the front desk was cordial but not overly friendly. They did upgrade us to a 2 bedroom suite, and it was great! The room was very spacious and our kids had one room, and we had a bedroom, and 2 bathrooms! There was a small kitchen area and a nice living room. The best thing for me was there was FREE wireless internet access, as I still needed to access for work and school. The evening reception was great, and it is the perfect place for hard-working middle class people. The other guests were all friendly, we met a lot of nice people at the bar, which stayed open as long as there were customers (law requires closure at 2 a.m.) The kids played in the pool until 11 p.m. There's also a 7-11 steps away and we were able to buy beer, snacks, hot foods, at all hours of the night and keep it in our icebox which saved us a bunch. The breakfast was a GREAT moneysaver for us, There were eggs, sausages, waffles, toast, yogurt, cereals, juices, fruits, toast, bagels, a very large selection ALL INCLUDED!! It never ran out when we were there, and was never very crowded. The location is very convenient, of course in Orlando, you need a car, everything is so far apart. But, we were 5 minutes away from Old Town which is 2 streets of bars, live music, car shows on Friday and Saturday, and also connected to FunSpot which is a mini amusement park and we spent 4 hours riding go-carts. It was great to be able to walk back to our hotel and take a rest and go back! Across the street is a Harley Davidson shop, Chinese buffet, souvenier shop is right next door. For food, there are tons of delivered items, Wendy's is in walking distance, KFC, Chick Fil A, and Red Lobster, and Joe's CrabShack are all within walking distance. Wal Mart was a little hard to find. Disney World, Universal, Sea World and International Drive are all within 10 minutes drive, or you can use their free shuttle. I will definitely go back whenever we go to Florida. We stayed at this hotel for 11 days, and it became like home! No timeshare pushing here, just fun!
