We had a great deal from hotels.com at only $89 per night and $100 back for staying over 10 days plus a $50 gas card! One note, if you are well-to-do, this is not the place for you. Kids run up and down the hallways until midnight, there is loud music from the bar, and people are yelling and splashing in the pool until it closes at 11 p.m. But if you want FUN, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Toonces76
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to Disney with a young child, and we chose this hotel for its proximity to Disney, the shuttles, the suite layout, and the free amenities. Everything was exactly as promoted on the website. We opted not to take the shuttle because it only left once per day and the timing was inconvenient to us. This would probably have been true for any non-disney resort, as to our particular circumstances with a very young child. However, this place was an amazing value for the money. The place was clean, feather duvets, good sized kitchen, too. it was in the middle of renovations but we didn't have a problem with noise or anything. The staff was super-friendly and accommodating. I think we are coming back in January because of our positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jackfish88
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the Royal Parc Suites from October 2-11. The room was clean kids had a great time in the pool. Staff was friendly. Rented a car so did not use the free transportation to Disney World. It is about a 10min drive to the parks. There is a 7/11 right next door. Across the street is a grocery store and pharmacy. Quite a few restaurants to choose from (although I do not recommed the Sizzling Grill). Breakfast was the same every morning so we did take a break every second morning and went out. We were very pleased with out stay.

Reviews.Title: “not perfect, but worked out good for 3 people.”
Reviews.Author: reentselite
Reviews.Content: the rom was a 2 bedroom suite, then a kitchenette with 2 burners, a dishwasher, fridge and microwave. Dining room area was a small table, 4 chairs and a hanging lamp. Living area only had 1 couch. wish it had a arm chair or something. our room had 3 air conditioners, 2 died in the 3 nights we were there. 1 commited suicide altogether, and the other pked water all over the floor. rooms looked recently remodeled, and they were very clean. Both bedrooms had a LOT of room in them. but only 1 of the bedrooms had a TV in it. (go figure the biggest bedroom is the one without the TV) would come back, we were on the 5th floor, on the corner, so it was nice and quiet. Management of hotel: we were in room 508. fix those AC units!

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Parc Royale”
Reviews.Author: cdiana2
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Parc Royale Suites with my grandchild, my friend from Brazil and her two children. We had a wonderful time! The people were great, the rooms were very nice and clean, pool wonderful, very quiet, palm tree setting gorgeous, close to Disney. However, we had a difficult time finding the hotel because we were looking for Parc Royale instead of Quality Suites. Just look for Quality Suites road sign. There is no Parc Royale sign visible from 192. This is not by any means a luxury hotel and I've stayed in far nicer hotels but for families with children, this is ideal. The pool fence has a safety lock. The kids can play in the game room while adults have free drinks by pool. Really great, relaxing place. People who complain are too fussy and will always find something to gripe about. Relax and have a great time with these wonderful hard-working folks. Breakfast is great. Free coffee in lobby a real boost. Didn't take shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “** Hotel Is Not Bad **”
Reviews.Author: London2012HereIcome
Reviews.Content: Stayed Labor Day Weekend. This Hotel was not bad at all. I booked this on Sams Club Travel and was going to change once I read the reviews. HOWEVER, I decided to go on ahead and stay since it was only one day. This hotel is not bad as everyone say it is and trust me I know hotels. I had my heart set on staying at Embassy Suites. However, after my Labor Day cruise decided to save some money. When you look at this hotel from the street you might say Oh my God, but you have to have an opened mind. This hotel offers free breakfast, happy hour, shuttle, grocery store (across the street), shopping plaza (access the street), funplex (next door), Disney Up the street, and various options. How can you complain? I stayed with 4 grown women 30 and over coming off Carnival Cruise. 1. Staff accommodated us well got in room early. 2. Plenty of space in room to sit, eat, sleep, 3. Happy hour was nice and was able to meet great people from all over the world, 4. Pool was nice but full of kids, 5. Hotel room was clean, but elevator was old, 6. Nice computer room but don't use debit card for computer time not secure, 7. Publix across the street so that was an excellent convenience, 8. Old town next door with rides, shops, restaurants, the largest go cart track and karaoke, 9. Karaoke till 3 am with people from NC, Ireland, Netherlands, and Florida (just people we met at happy hour), 10. Check out was easy and painless no worries. Yes I would stay here again on a fun vacation, but on a relaxing one of course I would stay at nice resort. Just remember everyone’s experience will be different regardless what it is.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IwonaL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Parc suites from Sept 20-27. After reading some of the reviews I was beginning to think that we made the wrong choice but once I got there I was very happy with my selection. First, the hotel provides a free breakfast. It’s not the best but it’s not the worst, I have been to plenty of buffets that had worse. Point here is you will never go hungry, there is something there for everyone, eggs, sausages, cereal, and bagels. toast, fruits, yogurt. The rooms were clean but will admit that that the bathrooms require a little renovation. Again, I travel a lot with my job and stayed in hundreds of hotels and can tell you I have been at Hiltons that looked worse then this. Every night the hotel has free drinks at the bar from five to seven and although we did not take advantage of it, plenty of guests did. I though it was a great idea. The pool was big and clean and the kids loved it. The lobby is nice and clean and the staff is more the helpful. There is plenty of security in the hotel. Aside from maybe renovating the rooms a little I have no complaints about the hotel. Some of the reviews are scary but I think its all about expectation. If you want a Hilton, this is not for you, but if you are okay with a Holiday inn or Best Western, this hotel is great. The location is also great, dozens of restaurants within walking distance, grocery stores, and gift stores as well.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: ChickFlorida
Reviews.Content: Me and 3 friends stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Since we were gonna go to Disney, we checked out at the concierge their deals. There was a very nice deal for the 4 days, however, he had to have breakfast in another hotel (kind a promotion thing). So, our hotel picked us up and dropped us off at the hotel that we were supposed to have the breakfast and tour around the property. When we got there, they said was already full. The option they gave to us was wait 4 more hours and do everything. We decided not to. We came back to our hotel and explained the situation, they just said nothing could be done, and they couldn't give our money back. I personally called the corporation at least 10 times, they never did anything! Anyways, we lost over U$200, even though we got to the breakfast on time, they didn't give our money back. I said to the concierge guy "I'm not coming back to this hotel" he said "I don't care!" I've never felt so disrespected in my life as a paying costumer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Balanced review great value for money”
Reviews.Author: twintownChepstow
Reviews.Content: september 2008 update:-granite worktops not in suites for us or guests we spoke to. hotel clean and well maintained, Safe and quiet hotel situated within walking distance of Old Town just off 192. We choose hotel due to location to Disney and free comp breakfast/free drinks between 5 and 7pm. Had 1 bedroom suite which was clean and functional,had 2 lcd tv's,fridge,small kitchen,bath with shower and comfortable beds. Overall well cleaned and maintained hotel,although external walkways,these were overlooking pool rather than typical outside external to building. Room changed immediately on arrival due to soaking carpet due to air con leak. though on here patrick from BOOKIT says extensive breakfast over 100 items,we found like other guests we spoke to that there were only 2 hot items,sausages and scrammbled egg and although bread and waffles could be toasted this in my opinion a continental breakfast with the exception of eggs and sausages. All day coffee bar was usually not HOT but luke warm as they were thermos flasks rather than coffee machine. You could make tea and coffee in room if you wished so not too bad. They were constantly cleaning and keeping hotel well maintained,so nice to see. the poolside bar tender 'Jennifer' was the best staff member at the hotel,friendly, welcoming and attentive and made for a lovely stay and great value for money. the concierges were helpful even if they always tried to get you to go on vacation (timeshare) style tours every time you asked them for tickets to any park,some did not even have the courage to tell you about the tour when offering discounted price!! didn't like that! With that said this is not a 5 star hotel and for what we paid we got good value for money a great bar tender,didn't put on too much weight eating free breakfast(you really do get bored of that,so all guests we spoke to agreed.)and with the pentagon shape and good security,we would say we had great value for money for what we paid,and looking at some of the neighbouring hotels,this was the nicest and well located too. Whilst I have read other reviews,and we had a few issues needing resolving,this was done immediately with no fuss,and the security comments I find unbelievable as during our stay the security patrols were all night long and highly visable. Yes we arrived labour day weekend and it was busy and as this is an affordable hotel you will always get a mix of good, bad, loud and quiet,but unless you pay for 5 star exclusitivity,you should find the hotel and securty are more than capable of handling the roudy guests which we must say were certainly not there on the 1st week of September. We enjoyed our stay at Royale parc suites and with some of the other comments we would not have booked,and to be fair this was better than most 3 star hotels in orlando we have stayed in,and we would go back just for the friendly bar tender (jennifer)who made for many enjoyable nights around the poolside bar meeting people from all over the world,having fun and laughter and resting our tired feet! Don't be put off if you have problems they are dealt with and we and everyone we talked to liked the hotel,if not laughed at the hot breakfast items after sampling them for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be shut down!”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveler1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a chance to stay at the Royal Parc Suites on US 192. Is it on US 192 or is it on some side street off US 192? It's on the side street off US 192 and if you miss it while looking for the place, keep driving, your money elsewhere will probably be well spent at another one of the hotels on the strip. Hell, the Old Town Suites down the road or some other hotel on 192 that was selling rooms for $24.99/night would've been better than this place. My parents had made the reservation as they were spending two weeks in the Disney area. The only PRO to this place that it was close to the Disney entrance (US 192 route). That was cool, but outside of that, let me start nit-picking every detail about this hotel. First off - I read the other reviews about this place and it looks the manager of this property said there was security that patrols the hotel? There is? Where? The place could potentially be a hotbed for criminal activity as people are free to come and go through the side entrance that's kept open at night which accesses the pool courtyard and five floors of hotel rooms where the purpritator could get access to ANY room. Second - the room had a musty odor in them. I'm not sure if it's because someone had used the restroom in the hotel room, but it smelled like the room hadn't been cleaned for weeks and before the room was sold to my parents, housekeeping came in and surface cleaned it (dusted the shelves, straightened out things, etc.) Third - The beds were very small. My wife and I aren't skinny people, but we're not fat, either. We couldn't exactly sleep in the same bed together, at least comfortably. As of this writing, we came home early because now we're looking forward to sleeping in our bed tonight. My parents wound up sleeping on the bed that folded out of the couch. According to my mother, she had to get extra blankets to cushion the bed padding so that the folding bed hinges wouldn't stick in her back. How nice, huh? Fourth - You want a hot shower? That's funny. You'll be better off taking a lukewarm shower and enjoying it rather than getting maintenance up there to figure out what the heck is going on with the hot water. Fifth - The free breakfast buffet. No wonder they're giving it away for free. No one in their right mind would pay for such crap! You might as well go to the Golden Corral Buffet Restaurant down the street. You'll get a better breakfast in there! The eggs were runny, the sausage was rather chewy, the juice from the juice dispenser was "cool" at best and usually when I stay in a hotel that has a free breakfast buffet, there's real dishes on a plate warmer next to the buffet line and not styrofoam plates with plastic forks, spoons, knives. Sometimes free is good, but in this case, shell out the money and get a real breakfast elsewhere. Really, I didn't feel safe at all at that hotel and left. While my parents are enjoying it up there (which I'm shocked because my parents have better taste in judgement when booking a hotel in Orlando), my wife and I packed up and came home early. Next week, we're staying at Embassy Suites. If you're reading this review and it sounds like this is the room/hotel you want to stay here - be my guest. I'll let you know how we're enjoying a nicer hotel elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: AHoeter
Reviews.Content: Just returned to Cincinnati from our stay at the Royale Parc Suites in Orlando, near Walt Disney World. This hotel was nice! The room we stayed in had not one, but two LG Plasma televisions, a kitchenette complete with pots, pans, plates, utensils, and glasses. The room was spacious, never heard any noise late at night, and I enjoyed the free drinks at the poolside bar from 5-7pm. There are some things that I do think could use some improvement. The elevator (green) was very rickety. When we got on it at the 3rd floor, the elevator shook very badly and felt like it was going to break down at any minute. Also, the housekeeping staff acted like they were rushing us out of our room when they came daily. I'm on vacation- don't rush me. Other than that, this was a very nice hotel and I would highly consider the Royale Parc Suites on our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mstravelerArkansas
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel, I searched the internet for a nice clean hotel to stay at during our family vacations, I saw this hotel, I saw the pictures on their profile and booked it. But when we got there it was nothing like i had expected it to be!!! The hallways don't even have carpet in them. The elevators were stinky, nasty looking, The whole hotel stinked like a public restroom, the room was ok but it wasn't as clean as it was supposed to. The restroom was smelly, it still had hair on the tub belongin to the people that had been there before. The game room that was supposed to be a nice arcade for the kids to play in was nothing but a little room with 2 or 3 machines. I took pictures and I hope this helps everyone considering to stay in that hotel think about it twice! I didn't stay in the hotel of course and for the same price they were charging me I found a really nice hotel that was closer to the atrraction parks, because this "Royal" hotel is not as close to them as they say.

Reviews.Title: “Very Affordable & Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tysnsmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying 5 nights from August 12, 2008 to August 17, 2008 at the Royale Parc Suites. We were a family of 6, with my son and his wife, and my daughter and her husband. We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was awesome. Very clean, more than enough room and the beds were very comfortable. We were on the 5th floor and had a wonderful time. The staff is very helpful and courteous. The area was clean, the pool and hot tub were nice and the breakfast was good. Only complaint I would have is that the pool didn't have enough chairs around. For several of the days we were there a guys baseball team was also staying and we had no problems with noise or wild partying. Elevator is a bit slow, but take the steps. Location is great. You have to try Logan's Steakhouse across the street. Awesome food and atmosphere. Coffee available all day and night, and Old Town being close by was also nice. I read a lot of the reviews prior to going and felt a little hesitant about several of the comments, but we loved it. No problem with getting extra towels or anything we needed. This is a very nice and clean hotel and if we go back to the area we would stay again. jcullum Elkton, MD

Reviews.Title: “UGH!...please read before staying here”
Reviews.Author: houstoncheetah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 30-August 3 and I must say it was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. We had complaints EVERY DAY we were there! We arrived on a Wednesday evening to teenagers running and yelling around the property. We overlooked it then since we were so excited about going to Disney the next day and, well, kids will be kids. The next night (Thursday) was different since those same teens were now throwing soap bars and coffee mugs at each other while running and yelling around our floor. At 11:30p I called the front desk 3 TIMES to report this...no answer. I decided that after spending 11 hours at Disney, I wanted to sleep, so I WALKED down to the lobby and told the guy at the front desk what was going on. He said he "would take care of it." An hour later (12:30a) "the teens" were still running around AND NOW playing the drums on the railing, bouncing balls, and riding skateboards. Again, I called the front desk and I was told that he would take care of it himself. By 1:30a nothing, still, had been done about this problem. When I called the front desk to complain AGAIN and ask where the parents of these MINORS were, I got the annoyed response of: "Uh, I'm working on that." I was under the impression that this establishment had 24 Hour security...I only saw him 1 time during our stay. By 2a, I gave up. Who needs sleep anyway, right? Friday night was quiet (since "the teens" checked out that morning). However, we returned from our second day at Disney to a hotel room that had been moderately cleaned by housekeeping. One of the two bathrooms had not been touched! Toilet paper and towels had NOT been replaced!!!! Cleaning one bathroom must have been easier and saved more time. Saturday was a disaster. Again, we did not have enough towels to accommodate us, coffee was not replaced, and there was a fresh stain of what looked like menstrual blood on a bed that 2 kids were sleeping on. We called the front desk, AGAIN, to ask for more towels and a fresh set of bed linens. An hour and a half later, we had facial tissues delivered to our room. ??? A new set of teens had arrived that afternoon and once again we were awakened by yelling. However, this time, there was arguing, cursing and threats between "the teens" and another guest (no one with our group). I called the front desk to report this disturbance and man who answered the phone blew me off and seemed very annoyed. I don't think security ever went to check it out b/c "the teens" were still outside yelling. Here's the kicker...when checking out, we told the girl at the front desk about our complaints, and all we got was "Oh, Sorry. I guess we just have a bunch of teenagers running around." NOT GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE if you ask me. All in all,if you like rest and sleep after long days, spend a little bit extra and stay somewhere else...Sanity is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Total Getto”
Reviews.Author: claudianj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Royal Parc Suites. This is total getto. People all nite at the pool. If you have a big group and will need the sofa bed you will not fall asleep from all the noise coming from the people every nite we got back there were over 40 people out till after 1 am. The floors are wet and slippery and no signs,levators are dirty. The bed sheets were only changed once in 6 nites and the kitchen sink dishes were never cleaned. The breakfast is the same every day. If you are going to the parks all day and use the hotel to shower and sleep is ok. Also if you are renting a car and getting back late good luck finding a near spot because trust me it will not happen. You get what you pay for the price. The only 2 good things is the beds are comfy and location you are 10 minutes from the Disney parks.... Good Luck!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Many more positives than negatives”
Reviews.Author: libertybell
Reviews.Content: Tried to make this detailed, so excuse the length. The positives far outweighed the negatives, but some issues at the hotel should be addressed by management; In general; Nice pool area, although all the kids complained of too much chlorine (better too much than not enough in my opinion though). Quite crowded, but the noise was not an issue for us as we were on the top floor and it was a fun “kids” atmosphere, rather than a rowdy crowd. Decent small gym with all new equipment (no fee). Computer/business center that charges by the minute for the computer use or by the page for printing. We used it only to book and print some boarding passes at the airline so it was worth while. Probably not worth the cost for anything else. The hotel advertises free wifi, but we didn't bring a computer with us, so can't comment on that The room has been about 75% renovated with new furniture (very comfortable beds), carpeting, linens, paint, partially updated baths, etc. Our room looked very much like the hotel site photos which was a relief after seeing some of the other reviews here that stated they didn’t. The room had 3 separate a/c units which appeared new and worked great and it was nice to be able to adjust each to fit the peoples needs/wants in each room. The kitchen was not totally updated, but everything worked fine and was clean. We stayed in a top floor suite with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, living area and kitchenette with cabinets, sink, stove (no oven), microwave, dishwasher and nearly full sized fridge. It was stocked with all necessary utensils, dishes and pots & pans, coffee pot, toaster, blender, etc. (although we used paper and plastic most of the time out of preference). Both bedrooms had 2 queen beds and the living room had a pull out sleeper sofa (very comfortable and private for the 5 of us). The master had a private bathroom and the 'common bath' was adjacent to the living area and the kitchenette. Two rooms (master BR & LR) had a new LCD flat panel TV and the 2nd bedroom had an older standard TV. All worked well except the channels were very limited with the majority being news and/or local. They had Showtime which is no ones favorite and there is no other premium channel or "pay per view movies" as most hotels have these days as options. There was a VHS/DVD player in the living room, but the hotel doesn't offer movies for rent which seemed odd? So bring your own unless you want to go to the bother of joining a local video store (we didn't). There are free sodas, beer and wine at the pool every day from 5pm to 7pm which was nice. We went on 3-4 occasions and the service was fast and friendly The free breakfast buffet is nicer than most area hotels with muffins, bagels, pastries, breads, cereals, fruit, juice/coffee/tea, and hot waffles, sausage & scrambled eggs. Very crowded between 8:30-10, but nearly empty earlier when I usually went around 6:30am. There is also a free coffee/tea station in the lobby all day. There is a small gift / snack shop in the lobby. Prices aren’t very good and the products aren’t very fresh. I pointed out several snack items to the clerk that the expiration date had expired on (several months ago in some instances). Would recommend you avoid this place and walk the few hundred feet to the 7-11 store in front of the hotel as we did for “snacks & drinks” if so desired. Better selection, cheaper and fresher. Positives: * Good location near I-4 and 192 about 15 minutes from Disney (when factoring in the traffic, etc). There is no left turn when exiting onto 192 though, so go through the Days Inn parking lot next door when exiting so that you can use the traffic light and avoid trying to make a u-turn on 192 when going towards Disney, etc. * Good overall value for a family needing a suite rather than a “room” * Updated and comfortable with good free breakfast buffet * Good pool area and amenities for a family * Many restaurants and stores in the immediate area. Several within walking distance * Good parking unless you return late at night when you may have to use the overflow lot behind the hotel * The web site is pretty accurate with the description, which isn’t always the case * Free shuttle was on time and convenient for getting to Disney, did not use it for the return trip to the hotel as we had a car for pick-up at our leisure * Lots of closet space and they even have shelves as well as hangers and rods Negatives: * Housekeeping was below par and much too late in the day. I believe they need to hire more housekeepers as many days things weren’t cleaned properly and/or items were not replenished ‘no clean towels one day’, no soaps and shampoos left another day (but they are cleaning ‘apartments’, rather than hotel rooms, so more time or help is probably needed). And they need to adjust their cleaning schedule. In our 10 day stay, our room was never cleaned before 3:30pm except for one day and on 3-4 occasions wasn’t done until 5pm. This is fine if your at the parks until late at night as you’ll never know the difference, but on the other days it’s quite annoying. In essence, we never had a clean room except at night which is unacceptable. We contacted housekeeping and the front desk to see if possibly they could even alternate days so our room wasn’t one of the last ones cleaned every day, but were basically shrugged off and told that the maids finished at 5pm. End of conversation. The maid (who only spoke Spanish, but so did one of us) informed us that the “check out rooms” received priority and had to be done 1st and then they did the other guest rooms. I’ve never stayed at a hotel with such late cleaning times every day? * As other posters have noted, the elevators are very slow, hot and need cleaning * As already mentioned, better quality control is needed at the snack/gift shop as many items were found to be past their expiration dates. There is no excuse for that. * Put a stop to all the people shoving fliers for bogus pizza restaurants under your door every evening (although there are signs stating same is prohibited, we saw the security guard on more than one occasion just watching the people do it, rather than telling them to stop)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leylita
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 adults and 2 small children. We stayed in the double suite and it was fantastic. We had room to spread and the closets were big. We had enough towels for everyone. Housekeeping was prompt and everything was clean. The pool was fantastic! Very well kept and clean, beautiful. The free happy hour was a nice touch, my uncle enjoyed it and did not miss it. We stayed for 7 nights! Fantastic! The breakfast was plentiful and they were on top of it. They did not run out of anything, and everything was fresh. Front desk was friendly. The hotel guests could be loud ... i.e. teenagers, but, they would be loud anywhere! So, if you want complete peace and quiet this is not the place for you. We were not bothered by things being loud until 11 PM. Sometimes we were coming back from Disney after the fireworks and would not make it in until 11:30 PM anyway. The beds were comfortable and the kitchenette was nice. Overall the best place we have stayed in Florida!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: glittergrl71
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just like the pictures were on the website. The rooms were nice and clean. The pool was nice. Noise didnt keep us up at night. the only thing that did was alot of people coming in and out of their rooms until really late. The breakfast was good, it saved us ALOT of money as we are a family of 5. We didnt use the shuttle to the parks since we had a rental car. The hotel is close to a grocery store and alot of restaurants. Old Towne was kinda fun to walk to in the evening. They have alot of cute shops. Check in and out was fast and easy. The only thing that could have been better was that the elevators werent clean and were very hot. We had a two bedroom suite and it was very nice and big! We would go back to this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Believe The Pics Online”
Reviews.Author: lavender925
Reviews.Content: The pool should have a open and close period. People were loud until after 11PM. Fitness center is not monitored, children were playing on the equipment in the evening, therefore we could not use it. MANY unattended wild under 18 year old all over the place, sitting in hallways, stairwells,etc. Felt like I was walking into an apt complex in the city. The pics online were very decieving, makes it look like a quiet, remote hotel. This is in the MIDDLE of OLD TOWN!!!! Right on the strip! The breakfast left a little to be desired. It's basic eggs, sausgae, bland cereal, juice, toast bagels, some fruit and yogurt. It's ok. They say it's open until 10:30, but they clean up at about 10:00! If it's open until 10:30, they should start cleaning up at the earliest 10:25! My room was DEFINITELY said to be an upgraded 2 bedr suite. The gave me the traditional with no TV in the 2nd bedroom, no flat screen TV's, NO DVD, and a MINI fridge! When I said I want the room you describe online, they wanted to charge an extra $20 p/day. That was RIDICULOUS! I did not, and got upgraded. The other room was better, but there was filth under the fridge when I opened it. I just cleaned that myself. The railings left you hand black when you ran them across while walking. The elevators are horrid. The pool, this should be cleaned and ph balanced alot more. The jacuzzi, lets just say one night I saw no less than 10 people in it, and I didn't see anyone putting chlorine and balancing the whole time. I was NOT getting in that! It was OK for a last minute emergency, but I will stick to my Bonnett Creek, or skip my vacation next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Royale parc suites!”
Reviews.Author: callie67
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 2 night stay at the Royale Parc Suites and we really enjoyed it! The breakfast was plentiful and we usually had a place to sit. My kids loved the pool! It was so nice to have some palm trees by the pool to give us some shade from the hot Florida sun. We never had a chance to try the Managers reception so I can't comment on that. We got a 2 bedroom suite for all 6 of us and everyone had plenty of space to stretch out. We had plenty of towels and the housekeeping did a great job. We didn't notice any of the pool noise, but we were up until midnight most nights. We had just come from a 4 night stay at the Old Key West resort on Disney property before we extended our vacation at the Royale Parc Suites and we really thought this hotel was very high quality. It's not up to Disney quality, but it also isn't anywhere near Disney prices! I would highly recommend this hotel for the budget conscious family.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: susselsprout
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that the hotel staff genuinely tries to cater to the traveler, but I wouldn't go so far as to say the RPS is a fantastic place to stay. It's okay. It's an older property that appears to have been updated, but you can't cover everything with a fresh coat of paint and new carpeting. I stayed in a two-bedroom suite, and one of the two bathrooms smelled strongly of urine, which was yucky. Also, the exterior "B" elevator, which was glass and faced the sun, was not air conditioned (actually, it was pretty warm in there) and sort of stunk, too. Every time I got on it, I thought how it would totally suck if I got stuck in that elevator. Although everyone was very friendly, I personally wouldn't come back. Just didn't thrill me.

Reviews.Title: “best Memorial Day vacation”
Reviews.Author: milfam4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our much anticipated trip to Orlando. We stayed at the Royale Parc Suites for 4 nights. I was very nervous after reading some of the reviews on here, but was pleasantly satisfied with our stay. We are a military family of 4. Two adults and 2 small children. We were supposed to stay in Disney at the Shades of Green in June, but had to cancel due to my husband's work schedule. Next, we booked a room at the All Movies resort, but after reading their reviews, we were disappointed with the room size and lack of amenities (no breakfast, no fridge, etc). We stumbled upon a deal at the Royale Parc Suites for about $80/night and decided to take a chance. I would like to address most of the concerns point by point: #1 Annoying check in. Unfortunately, we did find this to be the case. We avoided the front desk during our stay for fear of having to deal with this again. My advice is this, once you have received your room key, you will be directed to the concierge desk for your "welcome packet". Unless you still need to buy your park tickets, avoid this desk! They will try to talk you into a free breakfast at their new resort and a tour. Now, if this is your type of thing, by all means, go for it! My husband had 4 days leave, and we are already strapped for family time, so it was not for us. We like our privacy when on vacation. #2 Cleanliness. We had no problems here. Our room didn't have the fancy granite or anything, but it was clean. The maids did a good job everyday keeping it clean. I also saw someone cleaning the pool everyday. One day we came back from the parks just as happy hour was ending and were disgusted to find vomit all over the stairs. My husband called the front desk and it was cleaned up immediately. #3 Comfort. My husband and I had a one bedroom suite. It was ample. My children slept in the living room on the most comfortable sofa bed ever. I loved the duvets and pillows. My husband and I had a large bedroom with 2 double beds all to ourselves. #4 Accessibility. I agree, the hotel could be hard to find if you are looking for the Royale Parc Suites. We almost drove past because the sign reads "Quality Suites". Fortunately, I saw the 7-11 the other reviewers mentioned, and we were fine. You have access to the 7-11 from the hotel parking lot, and we found ourselves using this often. With 2 little kids, we always seem to need something, and it was nice to just walk to the convenience store. #5 Happy hour, I really can't say anything about this one. I wish the free drinks had been from 8-10 but I realize that's not really happy hour. We were never back from the parks early enough to take advantage. #6 Breakfast. It is what it is. I'm health conscious and I had wheat toast, scrambled eggs and a lowfat yogurt every morning. Better grain breads, and more fresh fruit would have been nice, but you get what you pay for. My husband and kids were happy. They are much easier to please when it comes to food. I'm the snob, so I recognize it as my problem. The food was sufficient (and most importantly: included in the price!) #7 Access to the parks. We took the shuttle to sea world the first day, and would have stayed later if we had drove. I've never been big on having to stick to someone else's schedule. That's why I don't take cruises. I also found it annoying that we drove right past Seaworld and dropped off at Universal studios first. But on the return trip, being picked up 2nd was to our advantage. Driving to the Disney parks worked out best for us, and it was easy to get there, and easy to get back. We didn't know what to expect on a holiday weekend, but we never experienced parking problems or traffic. The shuttle times were difficult to make. The first was at 0730 (it was too difficult to get my kids up and fed and dressed by then. We were too tired from the night before). The 2nd was at 0945 which we felt was too late. We were usually ready to hit the road around 0830-0900. For the most part we were satisfied with our stay. We have been all over the world and have stayed in 1-5 star hotels and I think we knew what to expect. The room was decent, not fancy. The amenities were the same. The location was ugly, but convenient. We had a horrible view of the gas station from our bedroom window, but learned to appreciate that 7-11 by the time we left. Once you are in the courtyard, you forget about the ugly location. The pool area was nice enough, but again, nothing fancy. There are tons of restaurants in the area, but we spent most of our time at the parks, so we never had a chance to check them out. I was excited to see Dunkin donuts and starbucks across the street, but the coffee in the hotel lobby was excellent, so I never needed to go anywhere else. We were frustrated one night when we returned late and couldn't find a parking spot. We finally found overflow parking, and it sucked carrying two sleeping kids to the hotel from there, but we lived. It would be nice if they gave you a parking pass or numbered the spaces to correspond with the rooms to control how many parking spaces people are using. We had one car and shouldn't have needed to park in the overflow. We didn't bother complaining to the management though, and didn't have a problem again. Another complaint was the lack of a DVD player in the living room. Again, we avoided the front desk, so we didn't complain. We just used our portable. Our location right across from the 3rd floor elevator was a little noisy at times, but not too bad. Just at about 11 pm when the pool closed, and then it was quite through the night. We only had neighbors on one side, and we never heard them. I think we will try staying at a Disney resort next time for the convenience, but I would consider this hotel as a back up choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near everything in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDeeDee
Reviews.Content: Our extended family of 6 (Grandpa, Grandma, daughter, son in law, 2 boys ages 4 and 1) stayed 5 nights here in May 2008. I scoured the reviews on this hotel as there were many differing opinions. Honestly we all loved this hotel! We did not go to Disney this year, but it is no more than 10 minutes away. We went to Universal Studios (15 minutes away) and Sea World (10 minutes away) along with the new Sea World Aquatica. It was a pleasure to return to our hotel after long days being tourists and walking into our spacious cool rooms and then hitting the pool. Our 2 bedroom suite was larger than expected! The frontroom has a comfortable couch (pull out sleeper) with coffee table. The kitchen table is near with 4 chairs. There is a breakfast bar next to it with a couple of high stools. The kitchen was nice and stocked with the plates, glasses, silverware, pots, etc. that you would need. It is a small refrigerator and a 2 burner stove which is ample. Plenty of room to walk around in the kitchen. The main bedroom is quite large (accommodated the crib nicely) and has 2 beds with a connecting bathroom which has a tub. The second bedroom is also large (at the end of the kitchen) and also has 2 beds. The beds are really comfortable and each has feather pillows also comfy. The second bathroom is off the kitchen and has a shower. If you need any additional towels, shampoo, etc. and phone and request it, it is brought up quickly! Other reviewers have complained of noises heard in the rooms next door. Honestly one night we did hear noise, but called the front desk, and they immediately came up and everything got quiet next door. All the rooms (5 floors) overlook the courtyard which is landscaped very nicely. The pool is larger than expected and very refreshing (not cold, but nice!). There is a small baby pool that has water fountains in it, and also there is a hot tub that is nice. You can take as many towels as you want right in the pool area. The whole pool area is fenced off, with a small playground right outside it. There is a game room next to it also. The 5 to 7pm happy hour is just what is advertised. It is also outside of the fence, but right next to the pool. They offer soda, tap beer and wine. Each time one of us went us we ordered 2 or 3 drinks and gave a $1 tip. The morning breakfast is nice, especially that it is included in the price. The choices minimally change each morning (bagels one day, english muffins the next and different fruit also). They always have scrambled eggs, sausage links, bacon, toast, waffles, danish, juice and coffee. Hey, it's free so anyone that complains is crazy! There is alot of shopping down Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy along with many restaurants. However right across the street is Logan's Roadhouse. I would definitely recommend it! They have peanuts in the shell on the tables and bring you fresh hot bread pretty quick. The prices are very good with a nice selection of food. Behind that is a good, large grocery store also. I would highly recommend this hotel based on the ammenities, and price. Our whole family loved this place and we know we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Florida Holiday Yet!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loulou7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks excellent stay at Royale Parc. Do NOT listen to the negative reviews of this hotel!! We have stayed in Orlando 6 times now and this Hotel is the best we have stayed in by far (and surprising the lowest rated!). The only complaint we have is that we had to leave to come home. The suites are just as per the pictures on the website, very roomy, cool and with excellent facilities. Having a full sized fridge, dishwasher etc really helped. Having a separate bedroom, overlooking the back of the hotel, along with lovely linen, meant we got a full undisturbed sleep every night. From what I hear we didn’t have a fully renovated room, but this doesn’t change how impressed we were by the facilities we got. We found that all the staff went far and beyond our expectations from reception, kitchen, housekeeping, maintenance to the management. The girls behind the bar are brill and deserve gold stars for their Customer Service going far and beyond what I would image is their job descriptions (is it really their job to organise extra pool towels at 10.00 at night???), and how on earth do they remember what everyone drinks? we only had to order once during the whole 2 weeks! Breakfast was always fresh and plentiful and if you do want a different choice every day I suggest you go to Denny’s or the other restaurants nearby and pay their prices – really what more can you expect for a complimentary breakfast! I am still amazed at how they make that amount of fresh scrambled eggs in one go. We usually stay on International Drive but after our experience here we will never go back there again. Everything that you could need is on the doorstep, 5 mins from Disney, 2 minutes from Walgreens, Publix and really good restaurants (Logans is really good!), and 1 hotel away from Old Town Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kind5150
Reviews.Content: The Royal Parc Suites overall was a good place to stay. The suites were clean, fresh towels were delivered every day, and the bathroom was clean which made our stay very pleasant. Room service cleaned every day and also washed the occasional dish, that was left, out which was very much appreciated. The beds were comfy with excellent pillows ( I almost took one home…) and the A/C worked wonderfully! If your purpose for staying at the Royal Parc Suites is to visit Disney World than the location is great. It is only 5 minutes from DW and within walking distance to many eating establishments (mostly low priced buffets). We were never awake early enough to visit the breakfast bar nor did we ever get down to the restaurant so I have no opinion on either. The only issues we had during our stay was one evening our toilet became plugged, but one call to the front desk and help was there in under 3 minutes. Also, the size of the room was great, but the bathroom was pretty small. It was a tight fit for 2 adults to be in the bathroom at the same time and me and my wife are not big people. Not a big deal, but just so you know. Unfortunately, the walls were pretty thin. There were a few occasions we could hear our neighbors “enjoying” their vacation which became quite old and it was easy to hear children running around upstairs (we were on the 4th floor). Not major issues but there it is. Besides that, it was a great place. Lastly, if you are looking for a Resort environment, you may be disappointed. The open courtyard is cool, it has a bar, playground, pool and hot tub. It does gives the place a nice feel, but in the end you still know that you are at a hotel. Overall is a good place to stay and I think you get a lot for your money. If you could afford more and expect a lot, you should stay at a resort but if you just want a place to rest your head after a long day than this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Royale Parc Suites Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Mom13045
Reviews.Content: Our entire experience with this property was great!! My daughter and I checked in on at 7:30pm on April 15th for a 7 night stay in a one bedroom suite. Check-in was speedy and professional, they had my “late checkout” noted for 2:00pm (I am a choice hotels rewards member). There were an abundance of luggage carts available outside the hotel; not just 1 or 2. I had some trouble maneuvering my cart so the security guard in the lobby helped us with the cart and even helped us bring our luggage and groceries into the room. There is a PUBLIX and Walgreen's across the street. The gift shop also carries emergency items. At no time did the concierge pressure us into a timeshare presentation. I think it’s because I was traveling alone so I didn’t “qualify” – this was a good thing. The room was really nice. Clean, fresh and new. They had folded towels to resemble swans and placed one on each bed. There was also a ducky dish towel w/dish-washing detergent for the dishwasher in the kitchen. The closet space was more than I had seen available at other properties. The property has added closet organizers; which was a nice touch. The bathroom was spotless with plenty of towels, soap, shampoo and lotion. I have no complaints about the water pressure or amount of hot water, it was always good. We did have a clogged drain in the shower but maintenance fixed it within 10 minutes of calling the front desk. There are privacy curtains in the living room and bedrooms, they are kind of hidden behind the actual drapes; my daughter found them before I did. Bedding is all new and very comfortable. There are 3 very cushy pillows on each bed and the sheets were changed as requested every other day (I have allergies). We had an RCA flat screen in the bedroom and a Visio flat panel TV in the living room. We only had breakfast one day (couldn’t pull ourselves out of the comfy beds early enough) but it was good with a nice selection. The café area was new and clean. We were on the 1st floor. Every morning I saw the maintenance crew clean the pool, bar and café area. The landscaping was very nice too. The pool was large and they always had clean towels for us to use. These are large towels 2 covered the lounge chairs. The bar was nice and open until midnight. They offered bud-bud-light and wine for free at their happy hour. I was a little disappointed, when we stayed at the Quality Suites and Hawthorne Suites on Canada Ave, they also offered bar poor (mixed drinks). Mixed drinks are a little pricey ($6.00 ea.). I can’t drink bud but this seams to be the “norm” in Orlando, it’s everywhere!! The bartenders were very nice and speedy with your order. They have a smoothie machine for daiquiris’ etc. which my daughter liked. We used the hotel taxi service to get to/from Universal and while all taxis are pricey in Orlando it was typical price. They were right on-time and offered a small discount for a round trip. The hotel shuttles were luxury buses, very nice. Tip – they don’t take you to the individual parks, only the Magic Kingdom transportation center – you will need to plan accordingly. The latest trip back is 10:45pm. We had a wonderful stay. We will go back when we return to Orlando unless I find some amazing deal somewhere else. The area was OK; we are used to International drive. My daughter missed her Fridays. I have no complaints about this property; we had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Royale Parc Suites!”
Reviews.Author: spencernurse88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation in Orlando. We stayed at Royale Parc Suites in Kissimmee. Let me tell you- this is THE best place we ever stayed for vacation as a family! We arrived on Saturday around 7:30. Check in was quick and easy. We did get asked (well, begged) by the concierge to sign up for a Condo tour in exchange for $70 cash; however, we stayed firm with our "No thank yous" and was left alone for the rest of the trip. Our room was a two bedroom suite on the bottom floor in room 123. We could walk out to the pool from our front door. We couldn't complain about the pool noise late at night, because we allowed our teens to stay out at the pool until closing at 11pm most nights. After all, they are on vacation, too! You can only hear outside noises from the living room, not the bedroooms, Each bedroom had two very comfortable beds, dresser, large closet, lots of room. The master bedrom also had flat screened TV, an in-room safe, and a bathroom. There was another bathroom off of the living room. The kitchen is fully equipped with appliances, ccokwear, dishes, fridge, stove, dishwasher, and dishwashing soap. The living room has a pull out couch, flatscreen tv and a table with 4 chairs. There are also two barstools at the kitchen counter. Nice heating/airconditioning set up with separate controls in each bedroom and living room. The staff was awesome! The maid even washed our dishes. They only change sheets every 3 days. Not really a big deal since you are the only one sleeping in them! The pool is heated, which came in handy since the weather was colder than average (60-70s) Hot tub nice. Also noticed kiddie pool. The poolside towels were plenty. I've never seen anyone keep so many fresh towels stocked! Arcade near pool, as is the bar, and an outside eating area. The poolside bar was very tropical with friendly bartenders. We just loved Jenifer but both were great. We took advantage of the free beer, wine, soda at managers cocktail between 5-7pm. Never had to wait long before we got a refill. Often there was another one sitting there for you before you even asked! Breakfast was good and plentiful. coffee,tea, juices, milk, muffins, danishes, cinnamon rolls. english muffins, bagels, toast, waffles, scrambeld eggs, sausage. No complaints from us! All in all, we definately will be returning to Florida adn will stay o where else but Royale Parc Suites in Kissimmee!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel237
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Royal Parc was fabulous!!! After reading some of the comments on trip advisor I was a little unsure of this hotel, but was I ever wrong! Everything about this hotel was great!!! We travel at least six times a year and always stay in 4 or 5 star hotels. The Royal Parc Suites is one of the best we have stayed at. You must consider everything when choosing a hotel and this one has everything! Check-in was fast and courteous, tickets were available in the lobby at the lowest prices. No waiting in line when you arrived at the parks! Breakfast every morning was hot and plentiful! ( not your usual muffin and juice, but eggs, sausage, bagels, cereal, fruit, and more.) What a great way to save money for other things.. Grounds and pool area were very nice, pool bar, clean towels, playground for kids all first class. Nice gift shop in lobby if you forgot anything. The suites were the best! Large rooms, very clean, comfortable beds, everything you need. The staff at this hotel went out of their way to make you feel like you were the most important guest in the hotel. My family had a wonderful time in Florida and a lot of the credit goes to Royal Parc Suites for making this such a wonderful vacation!! We will be back soon and will always stay at the Royal Parc Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Listen to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: lindagsjsn
Reviews.Content: Should've listened to the reviews. Pool was filthy and small. Hot tub was filthy. Pool area was disgusting. Very small area for a hotel. Do not get a ground floor, as there are parking lots all around and you have cars parked right outside your bedroom window. Breakfast was nasty. Too many guests for such a small area. You do not get a free local paper and there is no free internet. No towels at the pool and in the morning, I'm glad we used our towels over again. Very Very noisey hotel. Rooms are smaller than they look on the site. Bathroom floor had all kinds of filth on it. We checked out early. The only good was that you are across the street from a lot of restaurants and right by the interstates. Beds are awesome and so is the airconditioning. They charge you a $15.00 fee for what I don't know, I know one is for the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: AtlanticCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for approximately 9 nights in February. I just read some reviews since I have stayed it appears to me some rooms are renovated, partially renovated or not renovated. Our 1st room was on the 2nd floor. It was facing the entrance and very noisy. This room did not have flat screen tv's but fine. This room had new A/C and seemed to be clean. The fridge did not work. We requested to be moved due to the noise. The 2nd room was quiet on the 3rd floor. We did not use the sofa bed but I can see that it would be noisy from the pool area. The fridge was moldy. It had black mould on the seals and it had been there for a while. I would not call this room clean. The corners and areas around the walls are very dirty and the tiles in the kitchen and bathroom need to be cleaned. We consistently had to request toiletries such as toilet paper. The A/C in our 2nd room was old and moldy. We didn't even turn on the unit in the bedroom it was so dirty. Several times our bed was not made and the sheets were changed once in our 9 day stay that I know of. The pool area is nice. The hot tub is to hot. The free drinks were great. The breakfast is ok. The location is good. The shuttle to and from Disney was good. There is also linx bus stops within walking distance. We did complain on our last night and received the usually if we don't know we can't fix it. I still had to ask to have toilet paper. We did get a good rate on our room but would not have been happy if I had paid what they want for the rooms. I would definitely expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Royal parc suites-quality suites~ NOT GOOD!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: socalcat
Reviews.Content: just returned from an 8 day family trip to Orlando. We stayed the last 2 nights at the Royal parc inn. We were not impressed at all!!! From the website the photos due justice, the rooms look clean and lush-newly decorated. I was told that they recently spent over 1 million in renovations!!! Not to sure where that money went!!! Hotel was run down, elevator smelled like cig smoke and had dirty q-tips in window. Upon entering room it had an odor, as the night went on it smelled more like cigerette smoke. i felt like I was in Vegas. the room was a smoke free room so not to sure why it had that smell. There was hair in the microwave and the room was surface cleaned but not cleaned under furniture and in cracks of bathroom. Furniture was newer but cabinets, closets, etc were old and busted up. It also was not located in the best of areas. the pool was so cloady you could not see the bottom! The online price was $200 a night but I got a AAA rate of $125 a night. Not worth it. Spend a little more and stay at the Nick hotel or a Disney resort. We live in So Cal and take many small trips a year as well as 2 to 3 big trips a year. This was probably one of the worst hotels that we have stayed at. I was dissapointed. The hotel website does the place justice. Belive me, it does not look like the pictures!!! The room rate included a bfast buffet. Which was hyped up to be a great hot bfast with fresh waffles. Well, save your $ for McDonalds.... It offered coffee, watered down juice, toaster waffles, yogurt, stale pasteries & powdered eggs. GROSS! With all the competition out there, you would think that it would have been a little better. If you are looking for a low budget, quick place to rest your head then this might be okay, but it is not a place to stay if you are looking to relax & enjoy on your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “nice 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanneCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We come from europe and stayed at parc royale for 1 week. When we first arrived, I was a little affraid of the clientele- the guest are ALL kind of types- I guess because of the good rates and maybe your spring break. BUT our 1 bedroom suite was very nice, we stayed at the 1. floor. Do not stay at the lowest floor- you can get directly out to the pool area- BUT there is no sun. The bathroom is very small, the sofa bed is ok. There were not flatscreen, but we did not care. The front desk is smiling and nice. The breakfast is ok. The cafe is VERY small-the plates and cups, knifes etc is made og plastic. The sortiment is ok, wafles, muffins, apples, marmelade, toasted bread. The Coffee is very good and you can get free coffee ALL day. The pool is nice and people are talking with eachother- especially in the hottub ! The poolbar has happy hour- and all the guest gathers to have free drink (wine-beer-soda) The place is very "down to earth" its clean, and a nice 3 star quality. If you are taking trips from this adress- it has a VERY good location- near everything, including a big mall- but are you planning to spoil yourself in beautiful pool and restaurant surrondings go someplace else. For family with children-going to the parcs this is nice. The bus to disney does not go often- rent a car and go yourself- then you dont have to rush after the clock.

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: steidl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights over the Easter weekend. After reading the previous negative reviews it makes me wonder if we just got lucky? Our group of 24 (14 adults, 10 kids) stayed in 6 suites. No one complained. I can't speak for their rooms but our 2 bedroom suite was nice. Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning our room daily. Okay, so the towels aren't plush but there were plenty of them. The "master" bedroom faces the pool and has a TV but could be a bit noisy. The other bedroom faced the parking lot and was quieter but didn't have a TV. We didn't miss it as there was a tv in the living room. The beds were comfortable with lots of pillows. The bathrooms were clean (no mold that I saw) and the toiletries replaced daily. The free breakfast was a bit crowded, and you do get tired of it after the first two days, but it wasn't half bad --eggs, sausage, cereal, waffles, juice. The free happy hour was enjoyed by all and a nice perk. Bartenders offered great service. The free internet was great and a very strong signal. There was a security presence at the hotel which is typical for an Orlando hotel on a busy "strip mall" road. The hotel charges $2.50 per day for the in-room safe whether you use it or not. Makes me wonder why the person who put their credit card in the drawer didn't use it? The staff was pleasant and professional. Yes, there were lots of kids there including ours -- but what do expect for an all-suite hotel in Orlando? They do go to bed you know. There are many restaurants within walking distance. If you like steak, try Logan's Roadhouse across the street. Good food at reasonable prices. We actually went twice. If you're looking for luxury then stay in a Disney property for twice the price. If you want a clean, comfortable place to stay in Orlando close to the parks and I-4 and with a few extra perks this place can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good,Bad and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: mac0621
Reviews.Content: Here is a hotel that has some good, some bad and some ugly. We stayed for 4 nites March 22 to March 26. First the good. They accommodated our request for a suite on the top floor. All suites face the pool and bar area. Lower floors get more noise. Happy hour from 5pm to 7pm with free wine, beer and soda. The bartenders were very nice. The breakfast were scrambled eggs, sausages, waffles etc. After 2 days you're ready to try something else. The rooms are advertised as being newly remodeled. It didn't look remodeled to me. Peeling paint on the closet doors, a sun film on the window was peeling. paint splatter very noticeable on the bathroom floors ( Hey housekeeping, some hot water and a mop will get that off) They offer free wireless if you bring your own computer. Use their computers and they charge you .20 per minute and .75 per page if you want to print something. Now the ugly part. Unsupervised kids were running around the balconies till after 11pm. Some guests threatened to call the cops. My wife committed a mental mistake by leaving a credit card in our top drawer. You guessed it, 5 hours later when we returned the credit card was gone. There are plenty of hotels in Orlando, you can do better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Mold Infested!!!”
Reviews.Author: ahicks
Reviews.Content: Before you start reading my review here is a little background on me. My family has traveled a lot sometimes staying in really expensive nice places and other times staying in cheap decent places. I have NEVER written a bad review about any hotel before, actually I have never written a hotel review before, but I feel the need to write and warn people. So ahead of the review I do apologize for the length but I feel you need to know everything that we experienced before you make the decision to stay here. Also, before I get into the review I have worked at a hotel before and it was a older one. I know that sometimes things go wrong and the cleaning staff can't get everything. I know how hard our cleaning crew worked and I know how hard our head housekeeper worked to check every single room everyday to give it approval of a good cleaning job. Still even then things got reported. I understand all of these things and appreciate the hard work housekeepers put in everyday. Which makes this review that much more disappointing for me to write. My family and a family friend decided to take a vacation in Orlando over my brothers Spring Break. Unfortunately we only had a weeks notice to make the hotel reservations and we needed a 2-bedroom Suite. I came across this place and the pictures made it look amazing. I thought what a wonderful place but I don't put much stock in photos so I came here and a few other places to check reviews. Like always some were bad and some were great. You always take a gamble with a hotel with several bad reviews that you may end up in the same situation as one of them. We arrived on Saturday with plans to stay a full week. The exterior of the building is really cool and looks nice and even the lobby is very welcoming. The courtyard with the pool, bar, playground, and arcade is very well kept as well. BUT that all stopped when we got to the room. The awe of the place ended as soon as we opened the door. The room was much smaller then the pictures would lead you to believe. It only had 2 TV's and I'm talking about TV's that the late 90's just called about and they want them back. The remote for the living room TV only had volume and channel control with no number buttons. It was very possibly the most pathetic remote I have ever seen but we thought we could live with those small issues. I called the front desk to ask about the 2 TV's and they said that the room was only supposed to have 2 TV's. What 21st century hotel doesn't provide a TV in every room? But again we were willing to just let it go. Then things got worse...much worse. Trying to put some of our stuff away we were looking in the cabinets to see what we might need to buy and what kind of plates and stuff they provided. One of the plates had a mold colony growing on it that I'm sure a scientist would have had a field day with but for a guest in a hotel it was beyond nasty. We immediately took every cup, utensil, bowl, and plate out and put them immediately in the dishwasher. Then we found out the toilet in the master bedroom took about 10-15 minutes to refill with water so it could be used again. I called the front desk for the second time to report the toilet issue. One bright side is they did send someone very quickly. He was at our door in minutes and had the problem fixed in under 10 minutes. It wasn't ideal but we thought we could live with it. But still things just kept getting worse. We went out for a bit to look around and came back to the room to start settling down for the night. I went to take a shower and the water nozzle in the 2nd bathroom was so lose you could move it from side to side and the shower mate had mold all over it and the shower bottom was a bit slimy feeling. I didn't want to put my shampoo or anything in that shower it was just nasty. When I got out of the shower the floor was sticky to the touch but I though it was because I was wet. Once I got dried off I talked to my family and they realized that the kitchen (if you can call it that) floor was also very sticky. We planned to just report it all to the front desk in the morning given how many times I had already called. Because I've worked in hotels, I didn't want to be trouble for them. Then we realized the bedroom door to the 2nd bedroom was so warped it wouldn't even shut all the way. My mom and I both have asthma and we realized that the door jam at the base of both bathroom doors were black and cracking with mold growing which was just gross. That was it, at that point we could no longer just let the issues go. Several of us got online and started looking for places to get us out of this science experiment we were staying in. We found an amazing place that was 3 times as big almost like a small apartment and CHEAPER then this god awful place. The only thing currently keeping me from wishing TripAdvisor allowed a 0 rating is the staff. I called at 1:30 am and laid down our lists of what was wrong. I asked what it would take to get out of the full reservation and he asked if I was looking for compensation or to change our checkout day to the following morning. I told him we just wanted out so he said he would change our reservation. Always being a bit weary I called back in the morning and he hadn't made the change but the woman I talked to was very nice and made the adjustment immediately. Myself and a couple others went out to the parks for the day and let the rest of our party deal with checking out and checking into the new place. Upon elaborating on the multiple issues they gave us an additional 25% discount for the night we suffered through. Things happen I get it. This was a busy weekend so maybe the cleaning crew just did a quick job. But they should have someone checking behind them to make sure the room is acceptable for human use. That room needs to have a serious bleaching and disinfecting before anyone is allowed back in it. My hope is that is what they did after we left but in all reality I know some poor sap looking for a room available ended up stuck in that room. To you, I wish you and your families health the best of luck. Some of you may have okay stays here but don't expect to see results of that "multi-million dollar renovation" they say they just completed. I could see signs of an attempt at renovating but it fell very short. I do have to praise the staff or the hotels policy though for letting us out of the week we had reserved. That was the ONLY good thing I can really think to point out to you. I do recommend a place called "Runaway Beach Club" because at least the week we registered it was cheaper then Royale Parc and just look it up online and you'll see that it is SO worth it to bypass this place and go straight to where we ended up. It's not but a couple of minutes down the road in the same area. Doesn't have a continental breakfast but it has everything else including 2 pools, a basketball court (with basketballs), a very nice gym, an awesome lake, and the rooms better known as condos/apartments are extraordinary for the price especially since we are here at Easter and paying less then $200 a night. I'll be posting a very positive review for them once we checkout. Everyone has to make their own decision and take their own gamble on a place like the Royale Parc. For some this might be exactly what you want and you're okay with issues. But if any of what I said above worried you then save yourself the headache and disgust and find some other place to stay. Good travels and good luck finding a place to stay because Orlando is a great city with a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “surprised at these negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: miechy
Reviews.Content: Wow, I am so surprised to hear some of the things on the negative reviews. This is the first occasion I've felt the need to review, because it was very good. I agree about the breakfast, but that seems to be indicative of Florida! Everything is fried and unhealthy~. Anyway, Scramble those eggs and much of the problem is solved. I would have like to see some Peanut butter, bananas and whole wheat offered. Room was fine. Flat Tv in bedrm not LR. Kitchen & bath clean. reserve yourself a 5th floor room where the noise is lessened. The pool and bar can be noisy. Also, if you are thinking of using the pull out as someone's bed during your stay, reconsider. It is uncomfy and much to loud to sleep well there. Even to sit on the couch for any period of time is uncomfy. AC worked great. Shuttle was prompt, reception and concierge was helpful. I reserved a portacrib ahead of time and mentioned it at check in but was it not there. I called when I got to my room and they immediately brought it, then I requested the CD alarm clock which was missing and also got that. Cleaning crew was fine though they only came once during my stay which I expected. Hello, the in-room safe fee is clearly marked. Don't complain if you don't read the fine print! Open bar: great time! We have a young one so we weren't partying much but it was quick and easy to get a drink (beer & wine) and the atmosphere was fun. don't buy anything from the gift store in the resort as there is serious price-gouging. We stocked up at Walgreens and Publix which is a HUGE plus to this place if traveling with kids or a large group. Big savings. 2 mile walk gets you to Ruby Tuesdays and several other chains that had more healthy fare than Bennigans & Dennys' across the street. Buy the Disney 1 day pass at Disney. If buying multiday, buy at resort for a discount. Beds were so comfortable. Storage was ample (we had a 1 bed with 2 doubles) though the furniure is cheap! We had a great expereince with other tourists and the staff. Very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Mixalot27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in late January 08. For what we payed we were more than satisfied with the hotel. We had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite. Both of the 2 bedrooms were huge and clean. The living area was also decent size and clean also. The carpet had been redone and was fine. The couch was a little bit hard and not that comfortable. The tile in the kitchen and bathroom are in need of replacement or fixing. All in all the room was fine though, nothing fancy but adequate for our needs and what we paid. The breakfast was fine, lots of choices. A lot of it isn't the healthiest but they had cereals, oatmeal, oranges, apples, yogurt, etc if you wanted healthier stuff. They also had some excellent pastries, including cinnamon rolls, and blueberry muffins which were so soft and fresh. We also didn't care for the boiled eggs, they were very hard and rubbery. I think the problem is that they should keep them in their shells and put them in cold water instead of hot after boiling. Everything else was fine though. And if you want a heartier breakfast, Ponderosa is right accross the street and has a $3.99 breakfast buffet which is pretty decent. We ate breakfast 5 of the 7 days we were at the hotel and found it adequate for us. The pool area and grounds of this hotel are nice and well maintained. The only negative are the elevators seem to take forever sometimes. The pool temperature was nice during the days but chilly at night. The hot tub was nice and warm. The fitness room and computer room were good and never busy. This hotel is in an excellent location. It never took us more than 10 mins to drive to any of the Disney Parks. 7-11 is right beside. Right across the street is Walgreens, Pondorosa, and many other restaurants. There is also KFC, Mcdonalds, etc just down the street. A short drive (5mins) down 192 and you get to target, Walmart, Nike clearance, etc. The Florida mall which is huge is about a 15min drive away. Old Town is right next door and is a fun place to spend a night or two itself. I didn't do any of the rides but it was cool watching the free entertainment like an Elvis impersonator one night. They also have really cheap, cold, draft beer there. I would definitely stay here again. For the price that I paid, it was comfortable, clean, safe, and an excellent location. The staff were friendly and did a good job. The breakfast was a nice added bonus. Its not a fancy place or anything but I would say its a pretty good budget friendly hotel, which is what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our choice of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: reviewhot
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was great...near Old Town shopping and go karts and inexpensive souvigner shopping. The beds and rooms were clean and nice. the only thing I noticed was the bathrooms could use some updating....ie: peeling chalk and chipped floor tile. Otherwise happy with price, location, view, pool, complimentary beverages and friendiness of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Eden7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a vacation to Orlando, and stayed 14 nights at Royale Parc/Quality Suites...we were very pleased with our stay here....the location of the hotel is great...close to shopping, Disney World, Publix grocery store across street if you wish to buy food for your room, drugstores, restaurants, flea markets. gift shops, and a couple of miles down road... Walmart, and Target stores also, with food shopping. A lot has been said about the breakfast buffet.. I'll tell you what it consists of and you decide for yourself ... waffles, bread you toast yourself, 2 flavours of yogurt, bagels/cream cheese one day and english muffins the next, alternating back and forth, granola, brown sugar, raisins, canned and fresh fruit(apples and oranges) , hard boiled eggs, danish pastries, coffee, tea and juices(the orange was excellent). cereals(cheerios and rice krispies), also packages of instant oatmeal, and small sweet rolls...outside the doors of the breakfast cafe there is also a coffee bar which has 2 types of coffee..a strong brew and a milder one, which we preferred to the coffee served in the cafe, and tea as well...it's avail. 24 hours a day, and always full, which I thought was great.....there is a free shuttle to Disney and Universal...we did not use the service, but it seemed to run about 4 times a day, and stopped just outside the lobby doors..the concierge service, while friendly enough, did not always seem to have answers at hand, but they tried..check in/out was fine...the happy hour..free beer and wine, soft drinks from 5-7p.m. was very enjoyable..nice to have after a long day out..almost like a party to come home to, before heading out for the evening..adults have drink and kids play in pool(which is right next to the bar..seperated by a wrought iron fence enclosure), one bartender on duty, but very, very quick, and pleasant.....we were 2 adults and one child, so we had a one bedroom suite, and that worked just great...the beds were extremely comfortable, great duvets and pillows, plenty of towels at poolside and in the room, lots of parking close to hotel for those who have rented cars, also restaurants, shopping and activites within walking distance...some right next door..Old Town, 7-Eleven, Gift Shop..the staff seemed friendly, and helpful..although no one has yet mentioned it there is a decent gym on the premises...the equipment is new and it's usually empty..clean towels and a water cooler..treadmills, recumbent bike, elliptical machine, ab crunch machine, leg press, etc...(No free weights)..a good place to work off a few calories if you're so inclined..also a business centre next door....I found the clientele to be quite varied..people travelling alone, couples , families with children, groups of men on golfing trips, groups of students..people from all over the U.S., Canada and Europe...the cleaning staff kept things tidy, not necessarily scrubbed every day...the appliances were not new..our fridge(a small bar fridge) had a freezer compartment that was completely warped, and so could not even fit a small container of icecream in it)..that was disappointing, but certainly not worth moving rooms for..lots of storange room in closets and dressers..tvs in each room, although not flat screen as advertised, nicely landscaped grounds...my only complaint is of noise by the pool at night..(the pool is open until 11p.m.) and all rooms open onto the pool, so if parents let their children get overly noisy, you'll hear it if you are in the room closest to the entrance to your suite..in the back bedroom we could not hear the noise...this is not a high end
