luxury hotel, but it is an attractive, good, clean comfortable hotel, with all the amenities you need for a decent family vacation to Disney and other attractions, at a reasonable price, with lots of inclusions, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Okay" - but wouldn't stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: tow1
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked in to the Westgate Vacation Villas but after reading horror story reviews on this website we changed our booking to the Royale Park Suites on Hwy 192. We stayed there for 10 nights with our 9 month old daughter. The first night after arriving in Orlando International and having queued for hours to get through Border Control and pick up hire car etc - we eventually arrived at the hotel around 10:00pm. I had received communication via email prior to our visit that we had been upgraded to a "Deluxe" suite on the 5th floor. When we arrived however we were told that there were no Deluxe rooms available and that we had a standard room on the 3rd floor. Although not ideal - as we could not unpack that night - we reluctantly agreed that we would move the next night to a Deluxe room. When we arrived in our room - there was no cot for our daughter - something I had specifically arranged in advance of our visit. After 2 telephone calls to reception and well over 40 mins wait the cot eventually arrived. They guy hung around for a tip but he sure wasn't getting one that night! The cot in any case was old and creaky and had a thin cheap mattress - wrapped in a full size bed sheet - luckily we had bought some of our own bedding!. When we moved rooms the next day - they again forgot to move the cot along with our luggage - again many phone calls and a long wait before it turned up. Speed of response isn't exactly a priority at this hotel! With regard to the rooms - we failed to understand why the "Deluxe" suites were so called. We had a more comfortable (King Size) bed in the normal room - having 2 double beds in the Deluxe - which were too small and uncomfortable also! The fixtures and furnishings have been upgraded in the rooms - but the renovations were superficial. The kitchen and bathroom areas were old and shabby. Kitchen worktops were stained and marked and we had trouble opening the dishwasher every day. Towards the final days of our stay - we were disturbed by loud drilling and banging noise around 11:00 am when our daughter was having her nap! I phoned up reception to find out what was going on and was informed that there were builders replacing tiles in the room next to us - and that they would be finished soon. They were still at it when we left a few hours later! I had been told that renovations were complete but obviously this is not the case. As mentioned in other reviews – the cleaning staff leave a lot to be desired. It was pot luck every day whether we would get new toilet paper, dishwashing powder, creamer etc left for us. There was a thick layer of dust under the TV’s for the entire duration of our stay. That brings me to my other complaint! The website advertised that there were flat screen TV’s in both bedroom and living room – no such luck! The TV’s were bog standard, cheap and old! Breakfast was also below par. I know it was free but they could at least make an effort to have something cooked and something healthy. All there was every day were high carb pastries, waffles and muffins! I would have preferred to pay less for the hotel and use the money to go over the road for a $3.99 all you can eat breakfast at one of the diners on Hwy 192 – as least they had some variety there. To cap it all – when we checked out we were charged $2.50 per day for use of the in-room safe! We argued that we hadn’t even used the safe – but were told it was policy to charge everyone for the use of it. Pure daylight robbery!

Reviews.Title: “Failed Expectations.... Must read before booking...”
Reviews.Author: bestreviewer
Reviews.Content: Qaulity Suites Maingate East( i.e. Royale Parc Suites) was touted by many on tripadvisor as being very clean, wonderful breakfast, wonderful free happy hour, etc... First, the positive.... The customer service was excellent. We had requested a top floor when booking online and received it upon arrival without asking. The front desk accomodated an invoicing request with no questions asked. Positives cont... As the other reviews suggest, there have been some upgrades. Not as extensive or thourough as one might expect. For example... New furniture, new mirrors, new carpet, new paint, new front entry doors, new tub surround paneling, new bedding, and new drapes. No upgrades were given to the tv, water fixtures, countertops, cabinets, dishwasher, sinks, moldings, caulking, toilets, shower heads/faucets, tile, or interior doors. This leads me to the negatives, which unfortunately if your a picky clean freak like me will take the remainder of this review to explain. First off, the caulking throughout the entire bathroom tub surround, toilet surround, sink surround had mold all over it. (Nasty) The tile on the floor was old, had paint splatters and was cracked in some spots. The bathroom door frames nearest the shower had black mold spores all over it. The cieling fan was extremely inefficient and filthy with dust and debris. The Towels that were delivered were appropriate size for my two year old, but not for the average male or female. (You will go through the towels with this in mind) Do you like stained bath towels? I certainly do not, but Quality Inn maingate East seems to think it's OK to provide stained bath towels to there guests. Hair ladened towels also seem to be the new trend at Qulaity Inn Maingate East. For new carpet, they sure do not maintain it. My white socks were black by the end of the night. The mini fridge was wobbly and filth around the handle. This handle on the fridge had a crust on it that a college dorm room mini fridge wouldnt develop in 2 semesters worth of parties. The windows in the bedrooms were filthy, rusting, and peeling. The wall around the windows was painted but you could tell there was bubbling(water damage that was painted over). They still do not have flat panel tv screens in the rooms, like there website touts(coming soon I guess). The dust and filth under the TV's suggest that it had no been cleaned since the inception of the new furniture within the rooms. The Toilet brush must have been broken, because underneath the rim of the toilet (not that I routinely look, but something caught my eye) there was build up not worth descirbing that had built up to a disgusting level. As one might guess, the cleaning staff is probably overworked and underpaid and under appreciated, becuase their mentality for clean is quick, and superficial. (The running theme here is- You get what you pay for). Now, on to the continental breakfast area and choices given for your morning pick me up. As one review suggested and I will have to plagairise due to the accuracy of it, "1) The continental breakfast was sub-par. Now, I have never been one to criticize a free breakfast, but this was by far the worst I have ever encountered. Anything involving a huge vat of boiled eggs and a huge vat of canned peaches...draw your own conclusions. Basically carb-laden and impossible to eat healthy." The area around the breakfast selections were infested with some kind of little insect. The web site and management will tell you that there will be a breakfast buffet with eggs and pancakes, basically the works as part of the upgrade to the hotel. They have some real polishing to do before this will ever take effect. The free " Happy Hour," was over run and understaffed. If you were the only person there you might have gotten two drinks, but because they advertise this as being free, like anything else, people will come. Note: to Quality Suites Maingate East, "Properly Staff your happy hour/ Bar." Also, there was a stench of stale beer within the confines of this bar. Very unsatisfying and hard to relax with a smell like this. The Free Wi-Fi was under repair and after reading previous reviews, sounds like a constant problem for the staff. We had intermittent connections at best. Nothing replaces a hard line connection, maybe the next time they do their so called renovations they can hard wire the rooms. On that thought, the outlets in the rooms were barely attached to the wall. The outlets were worn out and in need of repair and cleaning to say the least. As part of a renovation, you would think attention would be paid to details like this. They would be a good candidate for a "Flip this Hotel" show similar to the "Flip this House" show already a hit on TV. The hotel was cleaned up superficially, renovated minimally, and the shortcuts were obvious. I do not recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One Word - BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: Winue
Reviews.Content: We had booked a one week trip to this hotel. We were there for two nights, and on the second morning, found 2 BEDBUGS in our 2 year olds bed. We know these were BEDBUGS as we work in a field where we need to deal with them, and confirmed it online. We kept the 2 BEDBUGS in ziplock bags as proof to management. I went down at approx. 7:30am, and found the customer service rep. When I showed him the bags he was disgusted, and did not want to even touch the bags. He only offered us THAT night for free. We made it clear that we had wanted BOTH nights for free, as we would have SLEPT WITH THE BEDBUGS the other night, just didn't find them then. This rep. said we had to wait until 9am when management arrived. We went back to our room and started packing, shaking out all out belongings, although knowing how BEDBUGS travel through vents, etc, that we were very likely to take them with us hidden somewhere in our belongings. We called the DISNEYWORLD RESORT, and told them the issue, and they found us a room. At 9am, I went back to the lobby to meet the Manager, Melissa. The rep. had told her that I was coming, and she was aware of the situation. She had assummed that I had just wanted to check out, and said that the other staff had given us the last night for free. I explained that our entire visit of the 2 nights should be free. Manager Melissa stood there and argued that she couldn't give two nights free. As I continued to explain that JUST BECAUSE WE DIDN'T FIND THEM THE FIRST NIGHT, THEY WOULD STILL HAVE BEEN IN THE ROOM WITH MY 2 YEAR OLD. Manager Melissa stood there silent staring at me, waiting for me to accept the one night free, and PAY FOR THE FIRST NIGHT FOR BUNKING WITH THE BEDBUGS. Manager Melissa stated that she wanted to have the BEDBUGS in the BAG. I HAD TO THREATEN TO TURN AROUND, SHOW THE LIVE BEDBUGS TO ALL THE PEOPLE IN THE LOBBY AND IN THE FREE BREAKFAST ROOM. All I wanted was a total of zero on my total. She grudgingly did this as long as I gave her the bags with the BEDBUGS. I provided this to her, and shared my HEALTH AND SAFETY CONCERNS to others while leaving the building. Sure, the place looks nice, but we would suggest doing some research on BEDBUGS before going. They bite, and the have a long life. They spread like crazy, and they are a HEALTH AND SAFETY CONCERN. After, we stayed at the Coronado Springs Resort at DisneyWorld, and would stay onsite again. AN ADDED WARNING, WE WERE TOLD AFTERWARDS THAT ANYTHING ON THE HWY 192 IS SHADY.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: sharon4122
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the best we ever stayed at and we stayed at alot of hotels. We are a family of 7 and traveled to Florida for a 6 night vacation. Our room was a good sized 2 bedroom/2bath suite. It was clean, newly remodeled and all beds and the sofa(bed) was new too. The service was excellent. We had only one complaint and that was the refrigerator did not keep things cold unless turned up all the way, the freezer area never froze anything. This is an excellent hotel and I highly recommended for singles, couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Here's a THOROUGH review!!...”
Reviews.Author: drumline13
Reviews.Content: *(If you find my review helpful, please let me know by clicking on the “Was this review helpful? Yes | No” link at the bottom of this review. This will encourage me to write more reviews!) My wife and I, both in our early 30s with no children, stayed at Royale Parc Suites in Kissimmee, FL (yes, this is the same hotel as Quality Suites Maingate East; the name has been changed slightly), from Jan 4th - 13th, 2008. I will attempt to make this review as thorough as possible with the hope that it will help you understand how much we liked this place! I believe you should know our travel history before reading my review, as this will help put this review into perspective. My wife and I have been fortunate enough to be able to do a large amount of domestic traveling, and we have stayed at inexpensive hotels (Econolodge, La Quinta), mid-range Bed and Breakfasts, and higher priced hotels, such as a beautiful $400/night V-Suite at TheHotel at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas (due to a free upgrade)! So, I think it's safe to say we've experienced all types of accomodations! With our background in mind, I'll first list all of the complaints that we had with Royale Parc Suites over 9 nights: 1. Our fridge was a little wobbly. Ok, that's it for the complaint list. Now on to the good stuff... As of the time I am writing this review, this hotel is ranked #24 of hotels in Kissimmee (on Trip Advisor). This hotel will go UP this list fast... We had originally planned to stay at #9 on this list, Comfort Suites Maingate (due to a great past experience), but we found a ridiculously good price for Royale Parc Suites, and after reading multiple good reviews online, we decided to give it a try. Our overall experience at Royale Parc Suites was GREAT! We checked in after midnight on Friday, Jan 4th, and the front desk staff was awesome. The guy who helped me actually said: "I see you have requested a king bed suite, and we have one available for you." This was a surprise, as usually this type of request goes unnoticed at hotels…and we usually have to re-request this verbally when we arrive! Our room was a 1-bedroom King Bed Suite. The room was very large, approximately 600 sq. ft., and very nicely decorated, CLEAN, and NEW (due to a recent multi-million dollar renovation)! We had a separate living room with a couch (pulls out to a bed), T.V., table with 4 chairs, air conditioner, and closet. There was also a kitchen area (off of the bathroom) with a small fridge (which actually froze one of my drinks before we turned it down!), microwave, burner, dishwasher, coffee maker (w/ coffee), plates, utensils, dish detergent, etc. Our bathroom was actually very large, and there was enough room for the 2 of us to get ready at the same time. And, as a bonus, the shower rod is one of those "curved" ones, so it gives you a little extra room in the shower! The bathroom had soap, shampoo, lotion, etc., a hair dryer and towel rack, and plenty of towels (at least 4 or so sets each day)! We never had any problems with hot water, flushing the toilet, etc. The bathroom was extremely clean! Our bedroom was also very large! Our king bed was VERY comfortable, and it came with 4 pillows (+ 4 more hidden in the bedroom closet)! The bedroom also had an air conditioner, T.V., good-size closet, safe, iron, and ironing board. Practically everything in the room was new (with the exception of the kitchen appliances), including the furniture, couch, carpet, and paint. The room was VERY clean....no bugs, no dirt, no stains, etc. We were VERY pleased with all aspects of the room!! Housekeeping was great! We left our room for the day as early as 9am or as late as 2pm, and our room was always cleaned by the time we got back! On to the rest of the hotel... Complimentary continental breakfast is offered from 6am-10am every day in the cafe located off the lobby. Breakfast consists (each day) of coffee, juice (orange, apple, etc.), oatmeal with granola and brown sugar toppings, 2 types of cereals (i.e. Cheerios or Rice Krispies), a combination of 2 out of these 3: danish/muffin/mini cinnamon roll; hard boiled eggs, bagels, waffles, yogurt, and either a fruit, such as apples, or a fruit-cup-like mix. There was seating available inside and outside, and I also saw some people taking food back to their rooms. We made sure to enjoy this breakfast each day! Since we ate so much breakfast, we visted the hotel gym often! The gym has 2 treadmills, a cross country machine, a stationary bike, and 5 weight machines: bench press, ab cruncher, and 3 leg machines. All machines are NEW, with not even a scratch on any of the seats/cushions! There is also a water cooler and clean towels, and 2 thermostats so people like me can make the room as cold as possible! The pool area and landscaping were very beautiful and clean. The pool, bar, hot tub, kiddie pool, jungle gym thing, and game room (with air hockey, pinball, and video games) are all located in the courtyard (the hotel is 5-sided with the courtyard in the middle). There are a ton of lounge chairs, and we never had a problem finding a seat. The pools open early in the morning and close promptly at 11pm each night. Every night, from 5-7pm, the hotel has a "happy hour" outside at the bar, and wine, beer, and soda are free (yes, FREE!, but please be nice and leave a tip for the bartender)! I'm not sure what type of beer was on tap, but they offered 3 types of "Sutter Home" wine: Chardonay, White Zinfandel, and a red (I believe Merlot). The location of Royale Parc Suites is great! It is located on 192 (W. Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway) in Kissimmee, FL, and it is about 2 miles from World Drive (which is the "driveway" to Disney World). Our total one-way driving time to the furthest of the 4 Disney Parks, Magic Kingdom, was probably about 10-12 minutes from the hotel to the Magic Kingdom parking lot. There is a 24-hour 7-11 (with gas station) in front of the hotel, and there are a ton of places to eat (from McDonald's to Arabian Knights) and shop in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. We also accidentally discovered the Orlando Premium Outlets that were less than 15 minutes away, so if you get sick of all the Orlando "gift shops", then a visit to the outlets may help! The hotel is approximately 20-25 minutes from the Orlando airport. Also, within walking distance of the hotel (just walk out of the Royale Parc Suites, through the neighboring hotel's parking lot, and you are there) is a place called "Old Town", which is basically a carnival/fair atmosphere (but free to explore), with a few rides, games, a bunch of shops, a couple night clubs, and a few places to eat. It’s a cool “family fun” place, but it’s also a little weird, as it contains shops that sell knives/swords/smoking equipment ("for tobacco use only", according to the sign!), tattoo parlors, and simulated electrocutions. Yes, you read that last part correctly. If you bring a dollar, you’ll understand. Anyway, to sum up my review of Royale Parc Suites, it is a great newly-renovated family-friendly hotel that is worth a visit (most groups seemed to be families with children)! The hotel is very clean (we even saw housekeeping dusting the outside windows of each room, which is something that is often overlooked at other hotels) and we always felt very safe. We’ve read reviews where people complained about the stairwells being a little dirty, but besides the natural “dirt” that is bound to build up on an outside stairwell, the only “dirt” we saw was those left by smokers (there is a no-smoking policy inside the rooms) as many seem to have a problem with discarding their cigarettes correctly….i.e. throwing them in the trash (however, housekeeping did a great job of sweeping up). Our 1 bedroom suite was very large, and while it was perfect for the 2 of us, it would also be perfect for a family of 4 or 5! And, if you have an even larger family, then one of their 2 bedroom / 2 bath suites may be perfect for you! (As a side note, the hotel charges an additional $2.50 + $.18 tax per night to cover insurance for the safe in the room.) If you are planning a family trip to Walt Disney World, then my wife and I highly recommend a stay at Royale Parc Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Don1111
Reviews.Content: Great Surprise. Friendly atmosphere, good buffet, nice pool. Tip: don't stay at the back section of the hotel, there is a laundry business that is loud.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: skatermom1
Reviews.Content: After reading previous negative reviews, we were quite nervous about our stay at this hotel. We usually stay on Disney property, however, there were no rooms available. I am VERY PICKY about hotels and have NO complaints about the newly renovated Quality Suites. The room was spacious, nicely decorated and VERY CLEAN. There were an ample amount of towels in the large bathroom. We had one small problem with a leaky bathroom ceiling overnight and a safe that was left locked by the previous occupant. Both were completely taken care of within an hour of calling the front desk. We took advantage of the free breakfast every morning. While we wished there would have been more protein and fresh fruit (mushy red apples) it was adequate for our family. It had previously been mentioned bagels only once a week - we stayed five nights and had bagels offered four of the five. The coffee is great (available 24 hours a day in lobby as well as breakfast). Because of the small window of time, we did not participate in the free happy hour. One downside - it seemed as though we were the only non-smokers staying there. While the rooms are non-smoking, you are bombarded with smoke at the pool. I suffer from asthma and it would be nice to see a non-smoking area at the pool for us to enjoy (we had to move three times to avoid the smoke). Also, they are not very good about pool towels being available. When we got to the pool and noticed there were no towels ( we had exhausted the supply in our room for showers) it took two hours for someone to bring any out after we notified the front desk. As these towels were not warm from the dryer, you know it wasn't a high priority to get them out to the pool. With that said, we highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are large and very clean and we really enjoyed all it had to offer. It's a great deal and will be visiting again in April!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time here.”
Reviews.Author: pennsylvanian2007
Reviews.Content: We just really would like to compliment the staff at the Quality Suites. We arrived very late on December 20th, feeling rather concerned about the time of our arrival. Everything went smoothly. Our suite was ready, the paperwork was in order, the Christmas gifts which we had sent by UPS were waiting at the desk. We were very pleased with the condition of our suite and with the general atmosphere in the hotel. Everyone was warm, helpful and friendly. There were many children staying there from all over the world. Our grandchildren enjoyed swimming in the pool and playing at the playground and arcade. They made friends with several other boys and had fun every evening with them. Our family really enjoyed 5 days at Disney, several visits to Old Towne, some shopping, and many fine restaurants in the immediate area. The boys had a ball at Joe's Crab Shack and would have been happy eating there every evening. We will come back to the Quality Suites in the future. We left feeling rested, relaxed and satisfied that we had made the right choice of hotels. It was a pleasure spending Christmas in the Quality Suites!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: p_lavena
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12/16/07 thru 12/20/07. The hotel was far above what we expected. After reading the reviews I had mixed feelings about our reservation but decided to give it a try anyway. So glad we did. We had a 2 bedroom suite, all new furniture, carpet, bedding. The appliances in the kitchen were not new but far from unusable. Our only complaint with the appliances was the refrigerator was just "cool" but we found if we kept sodas in the freezer they were good and cold. The bedrooms were spacious as were the bathrooms and housekeeping did an outstanding job of cleaning EVERY DAY. We were an extended family consisting of four adults, two children (6 and 9), and two teenagers (17, 18) and everybody was content with plenty to do. We only ate breakfast once or twice but everybody found something they liked and unlike other reviews we had plenty of space to sit and plenty of food every time we went. We did not use the shuttle so can't comment on this but we were told where and when to catch it if we elected to use it. The heated pool was clean and the teenagers loved it, although the rest of us were a little too tired after a day at the parks. We did enjoy Old Towne on the evening of our arrival which was the "old cars" day and all of the guys thought this was one of the best parts of our trip! I did laundry a few times and had no complaints with this either. The elevators and stairs were not as immaculate as the rooms but there is a lot of traffic here every day and you have to understand this is outside, who can't live with that? I saw the security guard making rounds several times at night and felt very safe doing laundry at night by myself. This was far and above the best place we have stayed in Kissimmee (total of 5 times) and have already told family and friends this is the place to stay when they go in the Summer. We will definitely return. No problems with check in, actually arrived one day early and was given our suite without hesitancy. When approached by travel agent in lobby, he asked if we had our tickets yet and when I told him we did he never mentioned a time share or anything else. Very nice, even recommended Logans Steakhouse across the street for dinner and gave us a couple of vouchers for free appetizers. All of the staff was very helpful and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. Thank you all for such a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: smithfamilyMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews after booking the room. I was a bit concerned. We booked the 2 bedroom suites (for six of us- my husband, 3 boys (21, 16, and 12) and 1 girl (11). The room was very clean! Of course there was some wear and tear. We landed in Orlando at 11:10, as soon as we picked up the rental car I contacted the hotel to see if we could check in early. One of our rooms were ready (my sister-in-law and nephew had booked the one bedroom suite) and we could check in. The desk clerk was wonderful. We clearly didn't pay attention to her directions and ended up at the motel next door. We called back to the hotel and she met us at the lobby and led us to our room! After unpacking we went back to the lobby to purchase tickets. The agent only asked us once (our entire stay) to sit in on a timeshare event. He was very helpful. We only had less than a two night stay (12/18-20) and we were off on a cruise. We canceled our plans to visit Universal Studios on the first day and opt for Gatorland. We enjoyed ourselves. That night the kids visited the arcade and weight room (we parents felt it was too cold to swim). The breakfast was good (enough to tie you over until lunch). We were off to Disney-MGM studios. That night we had a couple of drinks at the pool bar. We wished we had more time to spend at the hotel. Hotel is near all sorts of restaurants. We visited Old Town and shopped at the strip malls and flea markets. Will be staying here again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: dolphin67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Qualite Suites for ten days in the beginning if December. I arrived very late, the staff was friendly and helpful at checkin and I received a room overlooking the hotel entrance on the second floor. There were some kind of problem with the keycards that unlocks the door but one of the security guards on the property helped out real quick. The impression: Room, very big, I had booked a suite with one bedroom but the room seemed big to fit a family of five - six at least. The kitchen seemed a bit old, but "renewed", equipped with the bare necessities, ok but nothing fancy.. Bedroom nicely furnished, the beds were really great.. Bathroom: Problems with the water, tried to take a shower in the afternoon, all I got was (really) cold water. The toilet flushing seemed to work only once every thirty minutes. I did not report it since I was travelling alone but these kind of problems are really annoying normally. The wireless internet is really not what you expect on a modern hotel today, the connections timed out all the time. I tried to use it to communicate with my family at home. I reported the problems to the frontdesk but they did not seem to know much about this. I was only informed that there were problems "now and then" that they were aware of. This needs to be taken care of.. also the fact that you have to re-logon every ten minutes is something we remember from the 90's The hotel is being renovated, I was not disturbed by any noises at all. The pool area and the Tiki-bar is very well kept. The elevators look a bit worn, maybe because of the ongoing renovations. Several of the vending machines in the hotel did not work and took my quarters returning nothing. I did not bother asking for a refund but this is also something for the management to attend. I have written down the things that I remember now as things that need to be improved. The hotel is very nice and all in all it was a pleasant stay. I would return, hopefully the things that I noticed this time will be taken care of in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Not as pleasant as you'd expect from reviews and pictures”
Reviews.Author: golas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Paid about twice what you would pay for other hotels in the area and expected some benefits in return- which did not come true. First of all, if you like breakfast to be somewhat like survival training, this is your place. You fight for the food on a sticky floor while kids are hurtling orange juice and chairs at you. Selection is limited- we could not determine what about it was supposed to be "deluxe". The hot and cold part only came true after you toasted the stuff three times. Therefore, toasting obviously takes forever. Bagles were only available on one day, the other days only sweet stuff like muffins and danish. A lot of families with 4 and more kids stay here so be prepared for noise and not enough seating. Two mornings we ate seated on pool chairs, balancing the food on our knees. Room service was okay- downside is the room will not be vacuumed daily (therefore, also the floors aren't being cleaned) if you stay 3 nights or more. I don't quite get the logic, but hey. We could live without new shampoo samples, too, would have been nicer to have them, though. If you want new bags for the ice bucket, you have to figure out a way on how to get them. If you do, tell us how you did it, we would be amazed. We had a kitchen (which is nice) without cutlery (which is stupid). On our fist night, we tried to get Soda out of one of the vending machines. One did not work right and when it finally spit out a bottle of Coke, it was absolutely stale. The machine one floor below was jammed with coins so you could only use bills. When we mentioned it to the front desk, they did not really respond- it took them more than 12 hours to put up signs that the machines were out of order- does not reall solve the problem, either. Neither were we offered a refund for the undrinkable bottle. Thank heaven for 7-11 which is right next to the hotel- they sell decent Coke. Be careful, as well, 2,50 per day is charged for the safe, whether you use it or not. Only nice part is the open bar from 5-7pm every night. However, it does not make up for all the other little disappointments. Maye to you this sounds as if we're difficult travellers, but we really are not picky. The night before, we stayed at a Tampa hotel that cost only 1/4 of the quality suites and were happier with it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JoyFoo
Reviews.Content: My Family of 8 stayed in this hotel from 25 Nov 2007 to 2 Dec 2007. We booked a 2-bedroom suite. The hotel management impresses me so much that I would do myself a disservice if I did not write this review. At the point when I was considering booking this hotel, I wrote in to them to ask about the conditions of the rooms, having read all the bad reviews. To my surprise, I got a reply immediately from the various department, the Sales and Marketing, Housekeeping, Front Desk. Everyone was so keen and reassuring. We were promised a newly re-furbished room with good view of the Courtyard and that was exactly what we have got. Check-in - Checking-in was quick and hassle free. General - The suite was clean and tidy. The carpet was newly laid and clean. The sofa in the living area was also new. During our 7-day stay, we did not experience any noise or disturbances due to the renovations. Location - Just 1 mile away from Walt Disney World (WDW). Perfect for us as we spent 7 of our 7days there at WDW. BedRooms - Both bed rooms are spacious. Beds were firm and very comfortable for 4 person in each room. Kitchenette - Fully equipped with Fridge, Dish washer, coffee-maker, cooking utensils, cutlery, dishes, cups, plates and even dishwashing liquid! Useful for us as our children needed supper and we could prepare night snacks for them. Bathrooms - One is attached to one of the bedroom, the other is a common bathroom. Both bathrooms has more than enough towels for all of us. The hairdryer was perfect for us. The toiletries include Shampoo, conditioner, lotion and bar soap. This has saved us a lot of luggage space. Pools - We did not use the pool at all during our stay there. We did had our happy hour drink once. It was great !! Transportation - We did not rent a Car in Orlando, so we needed to commute by the free shuttle provided by the hotel to and from WDW. However, there is no return shuttle in the afternoon. It would have been nice if there is a return shuttle in the afternoon, say around 1, 2 or 3pm. During my stay there, the earliest return trip from WDW was 7pm. Fortunately, there is a Lynx 56 that goes to and fro WDW, running at half an hour interval. The bus stops were along the main road just outside the hotel, about 5 minutes stroll away. Breakfast - Adequate for us. There were bagels, bread with butter, jam, philly cheese, Danish Pastry, hard boiled Eggs, Yogurt, Waffles with maple syrup, Oat, juices, cereal with milk, coffee and tea, fruits such as oranges and apples. What more can you ask for ? I would like to thank Ms Diana, Mr John, Mr Thomas, Mr Aaron and your team at Royale Parc Suites for making our stay there so pleasant and memorable. I will definitely return if I were to visit Orlando again. It was defintely great value for money and you can't go wrong with this gem in Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal--but don't plan on a shower before 6:30 a.m.!”
Reviews.Author: OurFirstDisneyTrip
Reviews.Content: Nothing cushy--but the rooms were spacious and clean. Carpet seemed to be recently replaced, but the sofa in the main room was hard as a rock. The mattresses were nice & firm & our entire family slept very well. We had plenty of elbow room & the kitchenette was great for stocking food for finicky kids! Breakfast was adequate--a little better than "Continental" but not really substantive enough to fuel you until lunch at the park. (We bought some sausage at the Publix grocery to heat up in our room as a supplement!) Our only complaint was that it was impossible for an early-riser to get hot water! All five mornings that we stayed, we could not get any hot water before 6:15-6:30 a.m. Despite numerous complaints to the front desk (by us and our parents who were also staying in a nearby room on the same floor), we could get no resolution. They either insisted that there was no such problem, or that the pipes were simply cold (aren't we in FLORIDA?). So just remember that in order to rise & shine for the Magic Kingdom, the "magic" time is 6:30 a.m. and not before! All in all, a good deal. If we return to Disney, we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hote,l bad check in, lousy wireless service.”
Reviews.Author: ljsflorida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is real nice for a Quality, the rooms are huge, the beds comfortable, all in all the hotel is a good place to stay. The only problems were that the check in is at 4 PM I got there at 3:30 and they would not let me check in, there were other angry people already waiting in the lobby to check in are were not allowed to check in until 4 PM, that to me is wrong because it was a weekday and the place was not full so housekeeping had to have rooms available before 4 PM, the other problem was the wireless, it kept kicking me off every 10 minutes then I would have to sign back on with a user name and password, I travel for bussiness and need a good wireless conection not one that keeps kicking me off, all in all I problary wont stay again because of the problems, but if you dont need wireless or if you dont mind checking in after 4 PM then this place is great,.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Value”
Reviews.Author: LAURA4006
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights 11/2-11/9. The rooms were GREAT very clean and plenty of room. The beds were very comfy. They are doing renovations and once they are done I think this will be a great place. I here January they will be done. Right now the halls, stairwells and elevators are dirty but we understood because they are fixing things up. The pool could have been warmer, it did get better as the week went on. The pool area needed more attention. There was one corner with cig butts I seen it there for three days it should be cleaned more often during the day. I don't like kids to be in the hot tub. It should be for adults only, or have another one for kids maybe not so hot. Its not good for children and I think adults need a place to go and relax. The happy hour was GREAT and the bartenders were wonderfull. There is no restaurant on site as of now. The breakfast was good enought to start the day a little more then continental. Small space to eat we took it up to our rooms most of the time. I did hear all this is gonna be fixed. Its A great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a families!”
Reviews.Author: Zoemack
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The shuttle service to Disney was very nice. It was great having 2 bedrooms for the price. There were a lot of restaurants within walking distance and we were close to Old Town which was neat. I was only asked once about going through their tour for free tickets or cash. I told them I wasn't interested and they were fine. They gave us the wrong room originally but they corrected it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: WALOhio
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for clean carpet do not look here! The floors were dirty, stained, smelly we had to wear shoes the entire time in our room because our feet were literally black & sticking to the floor-that was a pain for 10 days. I know they are in the process of putting in new carpets, we just happened to get the old room. So if you stay ask for the newer carpet, & if you need to complain to the front desk do not go to Jonathon he could of cared less when I complained & did nothing for me. We had a few other things in our room not work like the T.V, iron & a lamp when we told the front desk people (not Jonathon) These problems were fixed very quickly. All the rest of the staff very friendly. Breakfast was great-more than enough choices for a picky 8 year old girl. The pool area was very nice as well as the bar & the free happy hour. The other drinks I ordered were not watered down either like other places-they were good. The hotel seems to cater to families, my daughter made a few friends in the pool. The pool also supplied rafts & inner tubes for them to play in while we were there. Pool did not seem heated like they said it was- very cold. Hot tub was a little over crowed in the evenings (with kids)& the water was luke warm -at least the last 3 nights we were there They are in the process of redoing alot of things carpet, railings, furniture. The workers were very respectful & I heard very little noise going on, Lots of choices to eat around the hotel & to get to the parks was a straight shot-very easy & at the most drive time 10 minutes I do suggest if you stay they ask for the newer updated rooms. All in all not to bad. If you are used to the 5 star hotel do not stay here. If you are on a budget like us -it made do. My daughter loved it & she had fun

Reviews.Title: “Great for 2 small or 1 large families”
Reviews.Author: JMeadus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 10 min drive from Disney. The suite we booked had 2 bedrooms with 2 double beds in each room. There was a small kitchen and a family room with a couch and tv. It was ideal for us. We were 2 couples with a toddler per couple. The continental breakfast was great. We brought coffee, toast, eggs and yogurt back to the kids each morning. This place was great for the price. There is a nice pool with a tiki bar. I would certainly reccomend this place to people who require a nice clean room to come back to after a full day of fun with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Big Let Down!”
Reviews.Author: todaystraveler
Reviews.Content: We were not told that the hotel is going through a renovation. There were power saws running during the day, trash and beer bottles left in the hallways for days, rude bartender, the breakfast was a major let down and the last night we were there, Sunday they were installing carpet in the room above us hamering for hours. The next day when we checked out the bagage cart had a flat tire after we loaded our lugage. Stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: oztrane
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 10 nights at the Quality Suites and absolutely loved it. The accomodation is in a great location and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a one bedroom suite that comfortably acoomodated my family of 2 Adults and 2 children. Breakfast was well stocked, fresh and fulfilling. The only down side was the website shows pancakes(hotcakes) but they were never provided. Complimentary 2 hour free drinks every night was fantastic and the bar staff were very generous and eager to serve. The pool was clean and refreshing. This place is excellent. They are renovating at the moment but that did not interfere with our time. We did not use the free shuttles as we found the shuttle times to be inconvenient to our needs. Restaurants in the area were close by and I recommend Logan's Roadhouse across the street and Cracker Barrel down the road. Stay clear of Capone's Dinner and Show. It's a rip off! I've seen better amateur musical theatre!!!! I would definately recommend the Quality Suites maingate East to any travellers in the future. You can not beat the price or location to the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Luckythedog
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom suite. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and attentive. Service was excellent. The location was easy to get to and close to my business conference. I especially liked the fact that I had a refrigerator, stove, and coffee maker as well as microwave in the room. I did not have to go out for meals after a long day of business. I will definitely stay here again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaPhotobug
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to spend your entire day at the hotel, want a restaurant, spa and activities on site, this is probably not the place for you. It is not a five star hotel, nor do you pay 5 star resort prices. However, we found the rooms clean, beds comfortable and staff very hard working. Problems were fixed immediately. We complained about unruly children in the hot tub and the manager personally came to the pool talked to the kids and apologized to us. Many of the rooms are being renovated. The location was very convenient, it was within walking distance to a Walgreens drug store and a Publix supermarket. There are dishes, towels, dishwasher, microwave, refridgerater and a stove top in the room. We were upgraded to a two bedroom suite because there was a wait for the one bedroom rooms, with no additional charge. Great for families, breakfast is free, internet free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: tombo1881
Reviews.Content: Really liked this place. Clean room. Nice courtyard. Helpful front desk. Great price. We took advantage of the happy hour(free beer wine and pop from 5-7!) the night we arrived and sat at the courtyard tables enjoying our drinks. We spent most of our time in the parks, so we weren't able to use the pool as much as we would have liked. The room was always clean when we returned, our air conditioners were brand new and very quiet. The kitchen with mini-fridge, microwave, dishwasher and stove also came in handy. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Old and smelly”
Reviews.Author: alenas12
Reviews.Content: The room was large and the beds seemed to be clean, however everything was VERY worn and smelly. The carpet was not clean and smelled like urine. The furniture was very scratched up, old and the couch was so old and worn that the cushions were not cushions..but more like pads. We checked out an hour after checking in. There is no way we could stay even one night.I would never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, excellent for a family on a budget!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bizzymammabee
Reviews.Content: I hadn't originally booked to stay at this hotel but a few months after my booking our original hotel had closed so we had to make a change. I picked this hotel due to it's proximity to the parks, price and the value for the price. The staff at the hotel was very nice and accomodating. I had booked a two bedroom suite with a kitchnette. The kitchenette was very helpful to make a snack and keep some groceries. Things in FL are expensive and gets worse being there for 6 days with a family of 7 and three meals a day and snacks as well. The set up was a godsend and the price was excellent. The pool was kept very nicely. The offer a free continental breakfast which I saw but never took advantage of. The also had social hour where there was free sodas and beer. The pool area is nice and clean and the kids had a blast there. The hotel room itself was a bit worn but the maid kept it nice and clean. I did notice that there are renovations and upgrades being made. i would definitely stay there again. The value for the money was exceptional. It's a good deal for a family traveling that would rather spend the money having fun than on a luxury suite. We only spent a few hours there when we came back to change from our days adventure and to sleep a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: rifam
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our accomodations at the Quality Suites Maingate. There was a problem with our reservation at check-in which was immediately corrected. There were 7 of us so the 2 room suite was perfect, and we could see improvements that were being made to rooms adjacent to us while we were there. The kids loved the pool, but as parents we thought there should have been more supervision in the pool area to make sure the pool rules were followed. If the opportunity arose, we would definitlely stay there again, what we received for the price we paid was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TiffLife
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Quality brand hotel. I really enjoyed my stay. I had a 1-bedroom suite which was more than I could have asked for given the price. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The rooms open to the outside which was fine because it over looks the courtyard. The pool was pleasant with nice, comfortable lounge furniture. The complimentary breakfast was very busy with people in and out constantly, but they never ran out of food. The location was close to everything. I'll definitely be back next time I am in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jnuge1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days earlier this month. It was exactly the same as it was when we were there 6 yrs. ago, but the 1 br suite was roomy and kept clean. The place has begun updating rooms and it should prove to be very nice. The breakfast is a great way to start the day and we were very satisifed with our stay there. You cannot beat the proximity to Disney, Old Town, and highways. Also, anything you would need can be found in the area around the hotel: restaurants, shops, supermarket, etc. The nightly happy hour is a great bonus! Our stay was worth the money we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Mybails
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from the Maingate East and found it an affordable and convenient stay. We had a poolside suite that was large enough for the 6 of us to have plenty of room. The proximity to the pool was a definite advantage after a hot and sticky day at the parks. The staff were extremely polite and although the free breakfast could be improved on (a more diversified selection would be nice), the only issue that we had all our stay was that the bathroom tissue had not been restocked in the one bathroom and that was corrected as soon as it was mentioned. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Advertized”
Reviews.Author: MnMom02
Reviews.Content: This Quality Suites was a two star hotel NOT three star as rated. The rooms were clean but definitely very worn and in need of major updating. The internet was spotty and frustrating to use. The outdoor walkways were not very clean. The staff was fine but the accommodations were not what was expected and the stay disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around, and still great”
Reviews.Author: aSimpson
Reviews.Content: This my boyfriend and I's 2nd time staying at this hotel. And really dont have to much to complain about. Everything is still great. We stayed there from May 11-17.Rooms very clean, we did request a 4th floor room, just so we were not right near the pool, cause like other ppl have posted it does get loud. But the hotel has a very laid back fun environment. This time around i seemed to have noticed there were alot more children, the pool seemed to be filled with them some days. The hotel still offers happy hour, from 5-7 now. No longer 3-7. but hey still not going to complain when you get free Bud. lol. We did however find that going out for dinner was cheaper for the 2 of us then to really make anything at the hotel. We were kinda shocked really, food in the states seems to cost more than in Canada. Logans is an awesome restaurant. We both had huge meals, and it our bill came to $13 we ate there our first time staying here, and we couldnt wait to go back. Its right across the road, and its awesome! Anyways, still a great hotel, cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: NYAama
Reviews.Content: Clean place, attentive staff and coffee 24/7. Was suprised the efficiency kitchen did not have an oven.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: DarrenA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights while visiting Disney World and surrounding area. We got a 2-room suite for the 6 of us (4 kids). Very clean, good pool, and convenient location. Free drinks by the pool every supper hour. The breakfast was the biggest and best selection I've ever had for free at a hotel. However, it was very crowded. We seldom could get a table and had to eat by the pool or in our room. Front desk staff were not great. Seemed inconvenienced when they had to deal with a guest. Wireless internet was awful -- only worked about half the time we were there. When I complained the first time, the "expert" at the desk kept telling me to delete my cookies and turn off my firewall (which I knew would accomplish nothing) and after 10 minutes admitted the internet in the lobby was down too and he would call "their guy" to fix it. Never heard back that night, and never bothered calling about it again. Definitely not a place to stay if you're on business. Because it's cheap, different crowds come and go. Our first day the pool was taken over by college students, who didn't really make room for the kids. The second day busloads of jr high students invaded, running down the hallways and screaming with no adult leaders in sight. Complained to the front desk and they quieted down quickly. And by the 3rd day, the pool was full of families with kids. Sort of have to take your chances. So if you want a good sized room at a good price, and can put up with the inconveniences above, it's alright.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: CousinsIslandgirl
Reviews.Content: We were a little wary about staying here after reading some negative reviews, so I called the manager and talked to her. She immediately upgraded us to a deluxe suite, and talked us out of staying near the pool. That was good advice. People (mostly kids) are in the pool until 11pm and it's loud. We loved our suite here. We had a 2 BR suite with a kitchen and living room. It seemed palatial to us. We also had 2 baths which was great. The room was clean and well appointed. The maid service was great. Each day someone came in and straightened up and gave us clean towels. It was totally different from the negative reveiws earlier. I was thrilled with the accommodations. Don't believe the reviews you read about the breakfast. We thought it was great and quite hearty. It's not necessarily for those looking for a low-carb breakfast but there's plenty of healthy items like yogurt, fruit and juice. We thought it was great. The Manager's Reception is a treat too. The pool is great and the hotel facilities and staff are all friendly. Overall, I wholeheatedly recommend the Quality Inn Maingate East.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not fantastic, you could probably do better for the money”
Reviews.Author: Goodacre
Reviews.Content: Basically fine, no problems, but nothing to write home about. Major plus: the suites. If you are going with kids, it's great -- one kingsize double for Mum and Dad and one separate room for the kids. Two TVs (but one is in Mum and Dad's room! What?! Give it to the kids), two bathrooms, mini-kitchen, plenty of room, good maid service. The downside is that the hotel is trying too hard to be a three or four star when it is not. All rooms are accessed from the cement outsides, accessed by dirty lifts and back stairs, so it has a bit of a motel / Butlins feel to it. It looks great when you first arrive -- nice pool, palm trees and the like, but it feels a bit more steggy when you have been there a few days. When we went, it was packed and everyone is shoe-horned in. The breakfast is not a happy experience. You can't get a table, and it's pretty low quality; my kids just didn't want to have the breakfast at all and were thrilled when we decided to miss it on the last day and go to a proper hotel for breakfast. No major complaints -- this is a perfectly OK hotel and yo are paying for the pleasure of having the suite. But there is no question that you can get far better hotels, if you don't want the suite, for cheaper inside Walt Disney World. Oh, Happy Hour is quite good (free beer), but who is going to be there at 5pm each day? After the first day, we were in the parks every day. Go here if you want the suites; don't bother if not -- you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “The Suite Life”
Reviews.Author: steel5rings
Reviews.Content: Was a little concerned when I saw some of the reviews, but, everything was really fine at this hotel. For $116 I got a two bedroom two bath suite. Unit had a small kitchen and was very clean, everything was in good shape. Stayed in Room 116, while the room doors face an outdoor corirdor all the doors are enclosed by the courtyard, so really, not a big security issue. Room 116 was just outside of the pool area, was a little loud from 9-11 PM as folks got back from Disney, but, by 11 all was quiet. Parking was ample and free. Snack machines on site and a 7-11 store just next door. Free Cont. Brearfast was very very average, but mind you the key word is free. Best of all is the location. This place is as close as you can get and be off the Disney property. Great hotel if you need space to stretch out, have a big number of bodies that need beds and if you want to be close to WDW. We will return here.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Tughes
Reviews.Content: Visited the Main Gates East from March 18th through the 26th. Overall, it is exactly what it claims, a nice hotel. I booked the hotel direct (got a cheaper rate direct than through the online agencies) after reading all the trip advisor reviews. Both good and bad reviews are somewhat correct, and after being there, I can see their varying points. On the bad notes, a few spots could use a good pressure washing/cleaning externally, whereas, the rooms were exceptionally maintained considering the immense amount of people that move in and out of this hotel daily, it is large (large, high traffic rooms can also give you some expectations of wear and tear, especially since I understand this a favorite spring break hotel, but nothing more than a ding in the frig or a bare spot of paint, nothing disastrous in my opinion). Whereas the good reviews are correct, as I never used my vehicle until we ended our stay, everything inclusive or within close walking distance (Walgreens/Restaurants/Publix Grocery, etc., within a block). Since there are a number of reviews that state some of the obvious things, let me state, this is a nice "hotel", if you are expecting a resort, I suggest checking with the many resorts in the same area, some of which are extraordinarily lavish. Otherwise, if you are looking for a nice, prompt, helpful staff, with a LARGE room with separate bedrooms for two couples to split the cost, usable kitchen, and an endless supply of entertainment by watching the various crowds around the pool and bar at night, and anything your heart can desire within walking distance of the grounds, then stay here, you won’t be disappointed. With enough being said about the property, I thought I would mention some hints for those that choose to stay at Main Gates East. First, the shuttle is free, and only once was dead on time, but then again, was never more than five minutes late. Literally, with all the various stops, still only 15 minutes max ride time from everything. Every night, it seemed we had a different crowd returning to the hotel. Before you freak out, if you ride to the park in a small shuttle/van, a larger bus comes back for you, so do not call the company requesting two buses, a larger one will arrive, they have experience in this, they won’t leave you stranded, although you might stand on the ride home if there is a big crowd. But, I must admit, in our 6 days, one day, we took a van ride with a lady driver who gave us more thrills in her driving ability than any Disney ride, and the last day, our bus driver decided to remove the mirror from the bus next to us at the Disney toll booth, which caused a minor delay and I think got him a traffic ticket. Also I might mention the buses/shuttles/vans pick up people for about 5 hotels in the area. Quality East is always the first stop going, so you are guaranteed a seat, and generally the second stop returning back from Disney or wherever. I also might mention, in my little corner of the world, my culture considers it rude when you walk up to the arriving bus and jump in front of the people that has been waiting, but I digress. It does have a single going and return times for Sea World and Universal. For Disney, there are four or five trips leaving in the morning, and 3 or 4 returning at night, and the 7:30pm return was always the busiest for us. Other hints, never use the 1-800 number on the website. I literally stayed on hold for an hour, and then it finally hung up. Use the 407 number and you’ll get someone polite and get them instantly! As far as the breakfast, it is exactly as you have read. Those accustomed to eating in buffet restaurants will find it lacking, whereas those that have stayed in a Holiday Inn Express will find it bountiful. The only crowd issues is when a youth group or sports team check in and all hit the place at one time, otherwise, no problems, and even if so, do as some did, carry it back to your room! Internet access is available, but with the hotel capacity rising, the more people bring their laptops, and loosing signal is quite frequent, if doing something online, save as you go! Smoking is prohibited in all the rooms, but there seems to be a congregation of smokers that hang over the balcony every night. There are smokeless ashtrays located in every corner/floor of the building, but to keep from smoking out the people getting on the elevators, I might suggest bringing your own ashtray if you smoke. I am the only person in our group that does smoke, so I am not being hypocritical if I ask smokers to please not use the balcony as their ashtray, as this is what gives the bad reviews of the floor condition, there are ashtrays available, please use them! From my perch on the 5th floor balcony, I did find it quite interesting to watch families with small children enjoy the large heated pool/hot-tub and game room while sharing courtyard space with the 70+ year old inebriated golfers in speedos at the bar, but the hotel security does take their jobs seriously and I never noticed any problems whatsoever. Also, they patrol the parking lots, so high marks on roving security guys! The concierge desk is helpful, but if you don’t pre-purchase Disney tickets ( I recommend this highly), they are awful quick to offer you a breakfast tour of a local resort/condo for reduced prices. I literally hate condo tours for timeshare, but it literally saved us $400, so I went for the two hour breakfast, was honest with the salesperson that she wouldn’t be getting a sale that day, and the process was semi painless for the cost savings. But the desk was helpful with printed driving and walking directions to anywhere we wanted to go, and once you agree to do a timeshare tour, you instantly become their best friend and are extremely helpful. Be warned, $2.50 for a 20oz Pepsi in the gift shop, and $0.80 for two $0.24 postcard stamps, so avoid the ridiculous prices by simply walking across the parking lot to the adjacent 7-11 to the property. And, if driving, the entrance is between a gift shop and the 7-11, so look closely or you'll miss it! I hope some of this helps and you didn’t consider it too much of a ranting. Would I stay again? Of course, and I’d recommend it to any of my friends because most of my friends are value conscience, and this place exceeds standards to any economy listing. And, to me, just being first the first stop on the shuttle is worth any price differences from any of the immediate competitors to the area. Also, the coffee in the lobby is great. I don’t drink, so can’t comment on the free beer or wine, but as in the prior reviews, the cups did look 12 ‘ounceish”. Hope that helps! If you want the Gaylord Palms, go there. If you want a nice, clean place to stay during a vacation or business visit to Disney, you won’t be disappointed, a lot of bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “somewhat acceptable, but nothing great.”
Reviews.Author: Eileenp65
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at the hotel on a family trip to Disneyworld. I have been to Disney between 15-20 times in the last 10 years. Most of the time we stay on site with The Contemporary being our favorite, but this trip we needed a suite. I will try to make this short- PROS: 1- If you get a good rate (under $100) I would considerate it a moderate value. 2- It is close to all theme parks & many restaurants 3- The free buffet breakfast is acceptable and comparable to Holiday Inn Express with only cold items & the ability to toast mufins, bagels, waffles, etc. there's yogurt, fresh fruit, oatmeal, juice's, semi-decent coffee. etc......I have found that at any time of the morning, you have a hard time finding a seat. 4-The free beer/wine from 5-7 pm is nice, but some people drink too much & the atmosphere changes. CONS: 1-Small bathroom for a suite and the toilet is not separate from the shower/dressing area. So if someone is in the shower or getting ready, you're out of luck. 2-The elevators are somewhat slow & smell bad by the end of the day. 3- Outdoor corridors. 4- Housekeeping can be somewhat dissapointing even with a $5 daily tip................. 5- There's no place in the bedroom to get ready ( no dresser with mirror), so once again, if the bathrooms tied up, you're out of luck. 6-Pool maintenance is not frequent, so it is dirty more than it is clean. 7-Water (for showers) is not always hot, especially after 4pm and especially when your room is on the opposite end of the building from where the boiler is located. (That explanation is suppose to make you feel better???) Although it doesn't make your water hotter. 8- The blankets are old & some even have holes. 9-There is no other food available here after breakfast, you can drink, but you can't eat. 10- make sure you get a room that has never had pets if you don't like the smell of cat urine.( My sister's first room was like that, although they were able to change it immediately at her request). I must say management did try to address & resolve complaints in a speedy fashion, but they weren't always able to fix problems immediately ( no hot water for bath at 4pm, after 11 year old child had been puking all day). Overall I probably wouldn't stay here again, but if this is all your budget allows, than it's not the worst place in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gramma8
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel, I was kind of worried about my choice of locations to stay while visiting Disney World. My two grown daughters and five of my grandchildren were on this trip and my daughters are very particular. I needn't have worried. We had a suite that slept 10. This suite had a living room, dining area, fully equipped kitchen including a two burner stove, dishwasher, fridge and microwave, two large bedrooms complete with closets and two full baths. We have nothing negative to say about this location. It was clean, plenty of linens, silverware, dishes, etc. Large pool, gameroom, small "playground" that consisted mainly of swings and slides and a very good continental breakfast. The dining room seated 55 guests, but an alternative to that is to fix your plates and take them back to your room, which is what we did. By the time everyone woke up, their breakfast was on the table and they had a choice of what they ate. Apparently, there are two Quality Suites on W. Orlo Bronson Highway and we mistakenly went to the wrong one first. I'm so glad that wasn't where we were staying, because I'm wondering if maybe the negative reviews I read weren't meant for that one. The one we stayed at was in the 5800 block and was a short hop, skip and jump to Disney, as well as any restaurant you may want. What a great place to stay and we will be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, easy place to be”
Reviews.Author: SmileyHHI
Reviews.Content: We had a great visit to Disney due to the comfortable and easy setting of this hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated, very comforatble with great space for all of our things and great information on the area. We enjoyed their clean pool & hot tub and found it very easy to grab a quick breakfast at their continental style buffet before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Crotinger
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Quality Suites Maingate East in Kissimmee, Florida. We were so disgusted from our experience, we felt we must warn others considering this particular property. When we arrived, the property looked great. The pool area was very nice, and the overall appearance was very nice. Once we got into the building, it was a whole different story. The stairs, and area going to the room was filthy. Trash and cigarette butts were laying everywhere. The cement walls and floor was dark brown to black from dirt and grime. Then the rooms...Our door wouldn't even close correctly, we had to pull up on it for it to latch. The carpet was stained and sticky. The bathroom smelled like urine. There were hairs and dirt in the dresser drawers. The sheets were stained. The kitchen and bathroom floor was aweful. The grout was black. I almost burst into tears because we planned so long for this vacation, and refused to stay in something so unsanitary. We actually found ourselves looking for roaches. We called the front desk, and shared our concerns. They offered to let us stay in a deluxe room, which the only difference was a dvd player. We agreed, and it was a little better, but never again will we stay there. We also had issues with the key not working, but it was quickliy resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Screen-Name-11
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Quality Suites Maingate East was a real disappointment. I could see this being a decent place to stay if you had several kids and didn't plan to hang out there much but I found it to be dingy, with a slight odor. The furniture is college dorm quality and the repairs made to holes in the walls and doors were poorly executed. The included continental breakfast was also a disappointment - food selection was limited and of below average quality. I suggest getting there early since the family Disney rush left me standing while eating my bowl of cereal - for a couple minutes until a family left. Other than the breakfast, there is no restaurant service, no gym, and no business center. Certainly not deserving of a 3-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good value especially with kids”
Reviews.Author: Stouffviller
Reviews.Content: I have three daughters ages 5/8/10 so multi-bedroom suites are a bonus. We also stayed two nights at the Nickelodeon Family Suites. The kids said they liked Quality Suites better because the rooms were bigger and they liked the pool and breakfast buffet. That said, Quality Suites is definitely a two star hotel (with three star aspirations) while the Nick hotel is definitely a four star hotel. Quality Suites is ready to be gutted and redone into a four star: it's a bit run down. BUT in the mean time if you have multiple children you can pay just a few extra dollars to put the kids in their own room and still have plenty of room to stretch out. Good location beside Old Town and near Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very dirty hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dawnzy
Reviews.Content: We booked a total of 4 rooms at the Quality Suites and all of them were filthy. Mold all over the back of the bathroom door that would wipe off easily with a towel, but was totally overlooked by the housekeeping staff. We all came home with bites from fleas and God knows what else. The "free" breakfast that they offer is horrible. Lowest possible selection that they can get away with. It's pretty sad when you get excited about "bagel day"! I would not recommend a stay there. They claim 100% money back guarantee, but when you say something, nobody cares! There are plenty of better hotels in the area. They make their website look like it's the Ritz. Far from it!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: livsmeem
Reviews.Content: Spotted roaches last day of stay..was the icing on the cake. Room dirty, (including dishes and silverware), carpets old, dirty and smelly, couch old, dirty and smelly. We stayed in a standard room, per other guests, the deluxe rooms are where you'll find the upgrades. Very bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Dump”
Reviews.Author: Tourist_From_Canada
Reviews.Content: This place is a filthy dump. The bathroom was so dirty I had to buy a disinfectant and spray down the toilet as it hadn't been cleaned. The floor had not been vacumed and there were stains on all of the chairs. We requested a wake up call from the desk and they wouldn't phone in the morning. There were people swimming in the pool in their clothes and the pool was pretty disgusting. The door did not seal properly and you could see daylight at the bottom. Our reservation was for four days and we had to stay as they would not refund our money. When going to Disney World, save yourself the headache and stay at one of their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: leftyj1001
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from Christmas in Disneyworld.. Although the weather was not too good, and the lines were long, especially at Universal whose staff needs to take a lesson or two from Disney on how to move people, our hotel accomodations were one of the best. If you are travelling with your family(and we were 7), this place is clean, comfortable, conve iently located about a mile from the Disney entrance, and a terrific value ! Each morning breakfast was provided, and if you are around from 5-7 daily, there's hap-py hour by a nice pool .The staff is helpful in directing you to just about anywhere, and even during hectic holiday time, they were quite friendly. When we decide to visit Mickey and Minnie again, we will no doubt return to this suite, sweet location. leftyj

Reviews.Title: “Best value / Best location in Kissimmee ”
Reviews.Author: DOCTORTEE
Reviews.Content: BOOKED A TWO BEDROOM SUITE FOR 5 PEOPLE. SUITE WAS 830SQ/FT 2TVs 3SEPARATE AC CONTROLS.HOTEL SHOWS IT AGE BUT IS KEPT VERY CLEAN. FREE BREAKFAST HAD NICE SELECTION. I had read some negative reviews on this hotel but i think mangement is listening and has improved on the problems mention in other reviews.Location is minutes from all parks, resterants are all in a row with every type and chain all within a mile of the hotel. To get the best rate i suggest you look at all the check rate listing as the first rate may not be the lowest available

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..We're coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Fullhouse6
Reviews.Content: I took four teens with me to stay here. What a blast. Everyone had a great time. Do you know how much money we saved on breakfast? There was a great variety of food. Our room was clean and fresh. I can't believe what I am reading from some of these people. Seems like a different place. The staff was excellent, the pool and grounds were clean. There were shuttles to the theme parks, Old Town was a great adventure for all of us. We loved it. OMG the ground had dirt on it...give me a break. Do yourself a favour and stay. This is one of the best places we have ever stayed. We are going again in March 07 for 5 days. I trust we will have a great time again...will let you know......

Reviews.Title: “Quality Suites Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: she123
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was very clean. There was 7 adults and 2 children in our group. There was plenty of sleeping room. Having 2 bathrooms was also a plus. The swimming pool and hot tub were both very nice. The kids also had fun playing in the game room. We used the shuttle bus to go to Magic Kingdom. The bus was on time both times. The free breakfast every morning saved us alot of money and the food was good. We all agreed we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two Words: Disgusting and Horrible”
Reviews.Author: travel_troubadour
Reviews.Content: If what you are looking for is just some place to (almost literally) shack up for the night, then Maingate is your best bet. Yes, it is quite affordable, but that DOESN'T mean the service coming from the hotel staff has to be horrible. Upon checking in, my friends were sent to a room that hadn't even been cleaned! They were left standing there, shocked. They went back down to the reception area to complain, only to get a *SLIGHTLY* better room , minus the busted a/c unit that, while my friends began to unpack, two servicemen waltzed right in the door without notice and began working on. At checkout, the attendant charged us a "safe fee" for a safe we didn't use! The furniture at the hotel is nasty, it makes you not want to sit on it. The toilet had not been flushed by whoever previously used it and there was left over pizza in the microwave- and this was supposed to be the "improved" room. Doesn't look like a bad place from the outside, but inside is where the hell lies!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustgyrl
Reviews.Content: What I liked about this hotel is its price ($70/nt for 1 bdrm suite), its relatively spacious and clean accomodation with kitchen amenitites, its convenient location to restaurants and shops, its helpful staff, big breakfast, and free shuttle to Disneyworld. What I disliked primarily was a slight musty or smoke-like odor in the room plus their small fee for "safe insurance" whether or not you use the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: djfamily
Reviews.Content: We tried to save money by staying at Quality Suites, we were hoping that it would not be that bad, but we were wrong. The place looks like the picture from the outside, but once you come inside, the walkways are extremely dirty, the elevator smells, and the whole place was very loud (we stayed Sun thru Thur). The couch and carpet in the rooms are stained. The walls are paper thin, you can hear kids running up and down the hall, people talking outside and alot of noise from the very crowded pool area. We were woke up from banging noise in the room next to us, we had to call the front desk, which took over half and hour for it to stop. The door did not close correctly, so we used our dead bolt all the time. The breakfast was always crowded and not tasty at all. The shuttle was fine, except we had no place to sit and wait, (except for the parking lot ground) at Disney's Transit system. We will spend more money next time at a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Would come again!”
Reviews.Author: Bananabutt
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 from Winnipeg Canada. We were looking for a nice vacation, close to the Disney parks (but did not want to stay directly in Disney). Qualtiy Suites was in the perfect spot! The hotel is located on International drive, which is on the main route through Kissimme. This location has much to offer...many restaraunts of all price ranges and varities, tons of shopping, entertainment and very easy to get around. Location was great! We booked a poolside room, which was promoted on the website as "new". The original room we were given did have some problems, but as soon as we notified the staff, we were moved to a much nicer room in a better location. (The toilet was water was "running" constatnly, the phone didn't work, and the safe needed to be reset). My only concern was that I questioned why we were originally given a room with problems, when there was a perfect room in a better location available for us the whole time??? **Perhaps a suggestion that the hotel staff - please check out the rooms a little more carefully prior to new guests arriving....we were happy in the end, so no problem!
