The room was big! 2 big bedrooms with nice comfy beds, plus a kitchenette, living room, and 2 bathrooms. Everything was very clean and looked new . The room was cleaned quite well each day with lots of towels and pillows. Breakfast was free and there was something for everyone. Coffee, Juice, cereals, muffins, toast, waffles, and a little fruit too. There was a lot of people eating in the cafe, but also many who took the food back to thier rooms or ate poolside... Speaking of poolside...who doesn't enjoy free beverages by the pool each evening from 5-7? It was a lot of fun having a drink, watching the kids swim, and meeting other guests from around the world. I thought it was a very nice little bonus that this hotel has a free happy hour. Nice pool with lots of surrounding palm trees! Good experience over all, and great location. I would definately stay here again and feel confident that I would have another great stay. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: sacogal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our family vacation with five families and we all had a wonderful time at the Quality Suites maingate east hotel . The hotel has large suites with either 2 bedrooms or 1 bedroom plus a kitchen and living room. The 2 bedroom suites have two bathrooms and plenty of closets. It was just perfect for my son who has 3 teenagers, they each had their own bed. The free drinks at happy hour was a wonderful plus, and the free breakfast in the morning was great! They also have free coffee and tea in the lobby all day, what else could you ask for in a vacation. I can not understand how anyone could complain about this hotel for the price, it is well worth every penny. Old town is a short walk and there is lots of things for the kids to do at night, rides, foods and entertainment. My grandkids just loved going to Old Town at night. My room had a king size bed and my husband and I had 6 pillows for our comfortable bed. We are planning to go back for our 30th anniversary next March and I can't wait. Quality Suites keep up the great service

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Patr10t
Reviews.Content: The rate was reasonable. That should have been our first clue given the hotel's proximity to Disney. We booked two nights and stayed only one. The grounds were dirty with trash, cigarette butts, etc.. everywhere. The hotel and grounds didn't look anything like the pictures posted on travel sites. The door to our room wouldn't shut properly because part of the door frame was missing. We had to use the safety clasp to keep the door from moving back and forth every time someone walked by. We have children. The all night parties, community meetings in front of our room, and the older kids running up and down the floors all night kept our children up to well after 1:00 am. The dishwasher still had dishes in it from the last occupants. All four beds were like sleeping on a concrete slab. We booked a children's suite w/ video games, only to find out they had stopped that practice months ago. They double billed us for our stay, then double billed us again when we called to correct the first double billing snafu. This process took four days and about six hours on the phone with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Definitely recommended for families”
Reviews.Author: Helen77
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Quality Suites for 2 weeks in a 2 bedroom suite. In our party were 4 adults and 2 children (aged 10 months & 18 months). I just wanted to say how much we enjoyed our stay. The suite was fantastic. it was nicely furnished, kept immaculate by the housekeeping staff and i never expected it to be so big. It is perfect for families as you have a separate living room to the bedrooms so when the children went to bed early, we could go and watch tv in the living area, plus you need all the space you can get with young children!! The facilities were excellent too. There was a lovely pool, plus a childrens paddling pool which my little boy loved! There is also a small childrens play area which is good too. There is a happy hour between 5-7 at the pool bar, where all soft drinks and beer are free, which is another good reason to stay here. Breakfast was included which makes the hotel great value for money. There was always a good choice of food for breakfast ie toast, waflles, muffins, fresh fruits, pastries, etc. I would definitely stay here again. The location was perfect , being 5 mins from disney and within walking distance of Old Town and various restaurants. Thank u quality suites for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my gosh”
Reviews.Author: Romair
Reviews.Content: What a surprise. I had read the reviews of this hotel, and let me tell you they don’t do justice to what a great place this was to stay in. I had made reservations for our family reunion at the Quality Suites Maingate E. in Kissimmee. Upon our early arrival we What a surprise. I had read the reviews of this hotel, and let me tell you they don’t do justice to what a great place this was to stay in. I had made reservations for our family reunion at the Quality Suites Maingate E. in Kissimmee. Upon our early arrival we able to check into our rooms and get settled in before we did some site seeing. At the front desk, Angie greeted us like lost family, and this was a welcome site compare to some of the “more expensive” hotels we’d have stayed. Aaron Mohammed made our two days there the greatest yet. Thanks to Aaron and Angie and to your wonderful staff for taking great care of us. Our rooms clean and smelled fresh. Lots of towels, and the sheets and bed were very clean and comfortable. The grounds and pool area were kept clean and well maintained. We loved the way the hotel circled the pool area and it made for such a peaceful atmosphere. The free drinks from 5 to 7 were a real treat. Sitting outside by the pool and enjoying the evening, we were able to relax and get updated on family events. The breakfast was an added bonus, plus the 24 hour coffee served in the lobby. Another bonus was we were near everything. We were with 1 minute walk to Old Town, which we loved, and so many more places to shop, eat or just hang out. Just minutes from all attractions what’s not to love about the location. Five of seven siblings live near the Tampa Bay area and we have traveled most of FL. I know for sure when we come back to the Kissimmee area WE will stay at this hotel. Again, let me just say, this should be a 4 + + hotel, for quality and for best prices. Rosemary McILwraith and family

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dearmili
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days in June and thought it was great.The room was very nice and large(Like a small apartment.Our room was always clean when we returned,dishes were even cleaned in dishwasher for us..Plenty of dresser and closet space and a wonderful view of the pool area .You are away from the highway so you don't see it.The breakfast was great and plentiful every morning..Would be nice though to see a meat choice like ham bacon or sausage.The pool was great and the hot Tub.We also liked the bar by the pool and free soda, wine and beer for a few hours in the evening.Every night my daughter and I sat with a pina colada by the pool (it was so relaxing) Pool is opened late so you can swim after the parks.Staff is very nice.We all loved our stay and will stay here again when we return.The only complaint I had was the sofa bed it was very uncomfortable but when we told them at checkout they removed the charge for the room safe(That was nice considering we didn't even ask for money to be taken off..

Reviews.Title: “yuck!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we finally got to check in we found water all over the kitchen with we towels laid out. The fridge unplugged. After 2 hours they sent up a new fridge (left the wet towels) my food was bad. The showere had mold all over them, the faucets fell apart and the sprinklers were rusted (one fell on my sons head). This hotel should be more a 1 and 1/2 star. You get what you pay for here! We ended up double paying after the 3rd night to stay somewhere else. Quality Inn would only refund one night because the person we complained to did not enter it in the computer. We had to leave to take a shower and actually feel clean. We had a bug on the counter that stayed with us even after the maids came! I have lots of pictures but could not attach but more than willing to share!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So I read the reviews before our 1 day stay in Orlando. After checking into our 2 BR suite, we right away noticed a smell. The entire room smelled, dirty. It was a bit dingy also. There was food on the wall!?! We called the front desk and were told to come downstairs. We were "upgraded" for free, and our new room was not much bigger but it was actually clean. Had 2 extra tv's and newer A/C uinits. There were dishes (with water) in the dishwasher and 2 fridges. I dont think I would stay here again. i think it's terrible that we got a crappy room but were upgraded to a clean room. Everyone, no matter what price, should get a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for families, but noise is a problem”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadEE
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay, 2 adults, 2 children. 2-bedroom, 2-bath suite on the fourth floor (average rate paid: $102 per night) Pluses: Plenty of room to spread out, kitchen facilities, a very reasonable rate for the space, convenient location close to Disney, fairly clean room, fairly clean public areas, pleasant pool, free drinks, plenty of towels in the room and at the pool, breakfast buffet. Minuses: Noise from pool area. Rude and unruly guests late at night. Room smelled like chicken soup! Shower and sofabed needed updating. Overall Recommendation: Nothing luxurious or exotic, but quite adequate and functional. Not spotless, but fairly clean. An excellent value and choice for families who don’t want to be squished into a small room. However, even though we loved the roominess of the suite, unless the management addresses the excessive noise issue, I am not sure we would stay here again. General comments and info: Kitchenette has a few basic dishes, pots, tableware, coffee pot. Overall, the hotel is a bit dated, and our room was in need of updating – particularly the shower – which was rather shabby – and the sofabed, which was stiff and uncomfortable for sitting. I imagine it would have been very uncomfortable if we had needed it for sleeping. Free beer, wine, soda from 5-7 pm located near the pool was nice, and did not seem to detract from the family atmosphere of the area. Free breakfast buffet – nothing special, but handy nonetheless. I cannot comment on the shuttle service as we did not take advantage of it. Overall I’d say the hotel was mostly clean, thanks to the staff who worked hard to keep up the public areas (walkways, pool area, breakfast room) etc. But over the course of our 3-night stay, it was not uncommon to find walkways and especially the elevator areas littered with cigarette butts, small trash, etc. Because all of the rooms surround and overlook the pool area, they are subject to a lot of noise. In our 2-bedroom suite, the back bedroom was noticeably quieter, but it was very noisy in the front bedroom that faced the pool. Early in the day, this is not a big deal, but at night, the pool is open until 11 – which made it very difficult for the kids to get to sleep. Our last night the noise was worse – and quite noticeable even in the back bedroom. The pool closed at 11, children were running up and down the walkways literally screaming and screeching until midnight and later. I called the front desk to complain and was told they could not kick the guests out. I said that I was not asking to have the guests removed – just for someone to demand that they not make such a racket so late at night. By 12:30 a.m., things had improved. However, we had a very early flight the next day, and I was very annoyed that I got so little sleep our last night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and would stay again - just know where shuttle pickup is!”
Reviews.Author: karoline9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and were upgraded to the premium 2 bedroom after the first night, which was a nice touch. We probably shouldn't have moved since the only material difference was the size of the fridge, one more tv, and vcr/dvd - but it was very nice of the hotel to offer this free upgrade. The pool is a nice size and the kids loved it - we stayed at Disney's All Star Resorts 2 years ago and I had trouble keeping an eye on my kids in the massive pool - this was much better. The bar is located near the pool - free beer, wine and sodas from 5-7 p.m. - but this did not detract from the family atmosphere. The room was very nice -no issues here - it was clean, comfortable, and included a safe which aptly stored my laptop - my one and only complaint is that if you don't know where to get the shuttle to Disney, you're in big trouble - as we were. When we checked in, we were not told that you have to pick up the shuttle at the side of the building. Having gone on many tours across the US with hotel pickup, I naturally assumed that we would be picked up in front of the hotel. When the shuttle sailed by us, I went to the front desk to check - and we had been waiting in the wrong place! The front desk personnel called them to return. I looked at the shuttle times information sheet I had been given the night before - perhaps I had missed seeing the pickup site. Nothing was mentioned. I looked out front of the hotel. No signage in place regarding shuttle pickup. COME ON! I was informed that I should have been told when I checked in, which of course, I was not. At any rate, we did a wild goose chase to get picked up and to make the story a little shorter, it wasted a good hour of our time. Cedric was very helpful in resolving the problem, even said that he would have taken us himself if we hadn't gotten picked up, and stated that the signage problem needed to be addressed. Quite frankly I would be surprised if there would be any signs out front today. There is a little plaque in an interior hallway stating shuttle pickup, but unless you were walking down that way, you wouldn't see it and wouldn't know. This must be rectified - something so simple but so upsetting to travelers and soooooooo easy to correct. Comparing the All Star Resort to this property, I would probably stay here again. It's much nicer with 7 people to have a 2 br suite at a lower price than 2 separate rooms, the shuttle isn't bad IF YOU KNOW WHERE TO GET IT! - I would like to see a later pickup time added at 11:30 so that you can stay until the park closes instead of having to leave early to make the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Eagmommy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here in a 2 bedroom pet suite with my three kids, a friend and her two kids. Also, my two dogs came along. The room was clean, had a lot of room and had all we could have asked for in it. All of the kids loved the pool, especially the hot tub! We had two toddlers with us and they loved the kiddie pool! The breakfast in the morning was good, nothing fancy, but enough choices to make everyone happy. There was a nice pet walk area right outside of the hotel which was kept very clean! I saw atleast two security guards around in the evenings, which made me feel safe, and the hotel grounds were kept up very well. The hotel is close to Disney and has a lot of restaurant choices very close by. All in all, we had a terrific stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Swebs13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel at least twice a year over the past four years. This hotel is always making improvements. Their staff are always accommodating to our every needs. We have three teenage children, so the 2 bedroom suite is perfect for us. This time we had a room adjacent to the pool, which was perfect to keep an eye on our kids. Although it was close to the pool, the room was really quiet. Our room had recently been remodeled and painted, the beds were very comfy. My only complaint is that the carpet needs to be replaced, it was pretty old and stained. This hotel has something for everyone. A poolside bar which is separated by palm trees from the pool. A game room for the young at heart, a small playground for the little ones, a kiddie pool, a sparkling clean pool for everyone else and a jacuzzi. This hotel serves free continental breakfast every day. The location is about 8 minutes to all the Disney theme parks and located a few short steps from Old Town (which is a fun local attraction). There are many restaurants and shopping nearby. There is also a 7eleven store a few short steps from the west side of the hotel for convenience. I recommend this hotel for value and service. We are from Florida and choose this hotel every time we visit the theme parks. It costs alot less than staying on Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Very responsive management!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at this hotel for nine nights at the end of April, 2006. We had stayed here when we visited Disneyworld five years ago and returned again after reading the current reviews on TripAdvisor. One of the key factors in selecting a hotel is knowing what level or class of hotel you want or need. If you choose a 2 or 3 star hotel expecting 5 star service, you'll probably be disappointed. If you select a 5 star hotel, your expectations should be higher, because you're paying for that level of service and amenities. This hotel is rated a class 3 by TripAdvisor and we found it to be an excellent choice for our family. Is it a perfect hotel? No, it's not, but management is actively working toward that goal. In all the reviews I read on hotels outside the park in Kissimmee, Orlando and Lake Buena Vista, this is the ONLY hotel whose management took the time to respond to customer reviews on TripAdvisor, whether positive or negative. My impression is that this hotel is truly interested in hearing about customer issues and very concerned about improvements to its service and facility. Would we stay at this hotel again? Absolutely! The location is perfect - just a couple of blocks from the intersection of I-4 and Route 192. Literally only ten minutes from the hotel parking lot to Disney's, between 8 and 9 o'clock in the morning. Excellent selection of restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel - Bennigan's, Logan's Roadhouse, Ponderosa, just to name a few - and within easy walking distance of Old Town. When we were there, Ponderosa was offering an extensive hot breakfast buffet for $3.99, which is terrific if you're looking for more of a hot meal than the hotel offers. There's a great Publix market just across the road, which was handy for keeping the fridge stocked. Our room, a one-bedroom suite on the fourth floor, opened onto an outdoor walkway, which overlooks the courtyard, as I believe all rooms do. The room was exceptionally clean and always well-stocked with towels. It had been updated fairly recently and was in excellent condition. Perhaps there are other rooms in the hotel in need of refurbishment, but if this is a concern to you, you can always contact the hotel to inquire. As another hotel guest had mentioned in their review, one of our air conditioning units was a bit noisy, but we solved the problem simply by lifting the lid of the control section to stop the rattle. The pool and playground are located in the private, open courtyard - away from traffic and passersby. The pool is lovely and clean and our two kids (ages 11 and 7) spent many happy hours there. During our stay, we saw members of the hotel staff cleaning the walkways around the rooms, but the stairwells remained dirty. Part of this, I understand, is because all the walkways are exposed to the elements and people can easily track dirt onto the stairways from outside. However, I believe most of the problem lies with hotel guests who believe that since they're on vacation they have to the right to toss cigarette butts and trash anywhere. The hotel has numerous trash cans and cigarette butt containers around - if more of the guests used them, the staff wouldn't have such a tough job keeping the facility clean. My husband actually witnessed a young child become sick to her stomach in the area of the pool deck and the mother walked casually away from it. We can only hope she was on her way to report the incident to management, but I wouldn't count on it. I'm not saying this hotel wasn't adequately clean - it is. But I can see how difficult it must be for the staff to keep it up. Think how much nicer ANY hotel would be if more of the guests showed consideration for the hotel property and for other guests! One last comment about management response - the last night of our stay, when we were packing up and trying to get the kids to bed early, we had a problem with a malfunctioning lock on the main door. The front desk had someone there within ten minutes, but the problem was not easily solved and it was determined that the lock should be replaced. I called down to the front desk, explained the situation and asked if there were any other rooms available that we might move into for the night, since we wanted the kids to get a good night's sleep before our early departure the next morning. The front desk staff immediately found another room for us and sent a staff member up right away with a set of keys for it. No questions asked - and nothing but a positive attitude about it. So, if you're looking for an excellent mid-class hotel that offers families a terrific location, a free breakfast buffet, a clean, beautiful pool and an active management team, all for a reasonable price, you may want to talk to the folks at this hotel. Our thanks to Erik and everyone at Quality Suites Maingate East for a terrific stay - just as you had promised! The Hornung Family

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst in the world but...........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind pets are allowed at these hotels so of course there WILL be some stains on the carpet. I chose this hotel because triple A rated this a 3 star hotel and it was close to disney. When I first checked in, I did notice the carpet was stained. The kitchen is smaller but it didnt bother me since I would not spend much time in the room. There are also dishes and plates to use but I never used them. I bought paper plates and silverware and used them the whole time I was there. The beds are comfortable but I think any bed would feel comfortable after spending all day at the park. Bathroom was avg. The pool area was pretty good. When I was there it never got real crowded and a few times my daughter and I had the whole pool to ourself. The hot tub was out of order for 2 days. Apparently someone broke off the handle. The breakfast was so so. It was pretty repetitive and boring and wasnt worth standing in line to toast waffles. All in all, it wasnt the worst hotel but you kinda get what u paid for.

Reviews.Title: “This is not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Mistyfuji
Reviews.Content: If you're expecting a hotel that's perfect, ie) The Ritz, this is not the place. The rooms were relatively clean, though there were many stray hairs in the bathroom, especially the walls. I quick check and a good swipe with a rag, would improve the cleanliness dramatically. The carpeting is very worn and looks dirty...it definitely needs to be replaced. The beds were doubles, and if they were soft, worn, but we slept okay. The hotel provided a crib free of charge. The kitchen area is practical and useful, though there are many paint splotches on the countertops...no attention to detail by the painters. One night we returned to 3 towels and 1 bar of soap for 5 people. I went to the main desk the next day to complain, and they credited me 25% for one nights stay. The breezeways and especially the stairwells were FILTHY...need a good power wasihing. Good points...close to Disney, restaurants and grocery store. Nice staff, nice pool area, buffet was good, but Very crowded. For the $$$, I would stay here again, but if I wanted to spend a little more, I would definitely go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Would not really recommend ...”
Reviews.Author: SoniaMagdalene
Reviews.Content: Even as I write this review, I am watching this small cockroach stroll across the wall , looking for a hiding place .. this is the 4th roach I have seen in the kitchennette area. The hotel is in need of a good re-decoration, the lift areas need cleaning up, it just looks tatty and smelly -due to bins nearby. My suite has tatty carpets and stain covered chairs, the bathroom is looking tired with cracked doors, chipped painting, and just general disrepair. I think this hotel really should be a one or two star rated. The staff are friendly and helpfull, and the location is excellent for getting around. I am staying here for x 6 days - I leave Saturday 22nd April, and I can't be bothered to go elsewhere so just put up with it. But truthfully for the money - I am paying £546 for the 6 days, I really think that it should be much better, and there absolutely must be better places around for that price ticket! If you have children then they will love the pool areas, there's a lot of children having great fun, and you hear the laughter and chatter from your room, which is good if you are a family. This is not a hotel for couples or executives looking for a quiet spot, so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the week of April 7th - 14th. We had a one bedroom suite which consisted of 2 queen-sized beds in a separate room with a door, a kitchen area with microwave,fridge and dishwasher, a bathroom, and a living room area with a fold-out sleeper. We had a party of 6. Two teenagers slept on the fold-out sleeper. My wife and I and a four and five year old slept in the bedroom. Each bedroom had a television. General room impressions: Clean. Air conditioner in bedroom a bit noisy but both the air conditioner in the bedroom and the one in the main living room area were functional. Very good maid service. Bathroom was clean. Limited television station options. This was not a big deal for us because our days and nights were busy. General hotel impressions: Pool area was clean and attractive. A kiddie pool and a hot tub were also available. All suites faced the pool. The hotel felt safe. Only 1 time during the whole week were we not able to find a parking space very close to our suite. Free breakfast each morning was nice. Pastries, waffles, pancakes, fruit, juice was the norm. Only one morning was there scrambled eggs. Some mornings there were hard-boiled eggs. Overall impressions: Clean. Not elaborate, but a good choice for the money. Pool area is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but worn out hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachdudeAlabama
Reviews.Content: The location for Disney, dining, etc. is great. The pool and whirlpool are nice. The cleanliness of the hotel leaves much to be desired. Walkways outside elevator, except on ground floor, are dirty and need pressure washed. The carpet in room is very old. The bathtub was scratched and stained. Breakfast was good. Service was alright. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great price good location”
Reviews.Author: MICHELEOG
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 10 stay here. The rooms were clean and the pool area was very nice. The people at the front desk were very helpful with information about the area. Buffet breakfast was basic juice coffee danish muffins fruit waffles but good way to start the day. We even took a few apples and banannas to the parks with us for a snack. The supermarket is right across the street. Not far from any of the parks. If we ever go to Orlando again we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: marthamorin
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of 14 people who stayed at the Quality Suites Maingate East from February 18th to 26th. We stayed in 2 huge two bedroom suites. It was great. There was lots of room and the two bathrooms per suite was wonderful. The hotel shows some wear and tear but everything was working. Everyone in our group said they thought the beds were comfortable and that they slept well. We also got a good price through hotelportalplus. The entire hotel was full while we were there but it didn't seem overly crowded. The hotel staff were awesome. They let us stay in the pool/hot tub area for awhile after the official closing time which was great for when we got back from the parks late. The cleaning staff always did a good job of our room, they would leave our stuffed animals propped up on the bed so that they looked like they were watching TV. The kids loved that! They had security guards that would come and chat with us once in awhile. It was nice to know that they were around. The front desk staff were quick to deal with any concerns we had. The free breakfast was more than enough to satisfy the hungry morning people in our group. The location of the hotel is really good too. There are lots of restaurants across the street or at Old Town which is a block away. There is also a Walgreens and a Publix grocery store across the street. There is also tons of places to shop! Try the 250 stall flea market across the street. We didn't rent a vehicle so we relied on the city transit (Lynx) busses. These were GREAT! They run every half an hour to and from the Disney Transportation and Ticket Centre. We used them for every park and for Sea World. We never had to worry about whether we would get a seat or if we missed our shuttle. We bought 1 week passes from the Lynx website for 12.00 each and had them mailed to the hotel. This saved our group a lot of money as opposed to cabs. Overall we had a great stay and would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation-Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came down FEB18-25TH,06 and stayed at your facility. We had myself and boyfriend and 4 children and 1 guest total of 7 people. The hotel room was accomated for all. The sofa needs replacement,it is very uncomfortale. The tv needs more channels to watch. The room was cleaned when we got to it the first day.I mostly had to clean up, the maid service needs improvement, as I had to call almost everynight or leave a note to get stuff-(LINENS,DISH SOAP, ECT. I needed for the room. The toliets, and mirror I had to wipe down after few days had not been touched,or carpet vaccumed or floor swept.The beds were not changed everyday or other day. Seems like the maid did the bare minimum or less. For almost $1600 for 7 days should of been better. The grounds are excellent and drink bar and breakfast buffet but little crowded in the room for breakfast-unless takes stuff back to your room to eat. The pool was not as heated as thought pretty cold. The window in the elevator has a big crack in it. The ice machine on the 5TH floor was not working and had to go to other floors to get it. The front desk was very helpful and very efficient in providing someone to get the stuff needed to me at night when getting back from all our activities. for example-I left the sofa bed open with linens in pile to take and leave fresh linens. The great point about the place,it is very centralized near everything and close to disney parks and stores and attractions. Thank you, The Lords.

Reviews.Title: “It was just about what I expected, maybe better!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Impala guy
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before we went down and was ready for just about anything. The check in was fast and effecient and we got right up to the room---just as advertised. The free beer and wine was great, as was the people watching by the pool. Breakfast was better than OK and there were tons of people down there and the staff at the breakfast was trying real hard to do a good job. This overall place was clean, bedrooms were in nice shape, and showers/toilets worked great. About the only thing they need are new sofa-beds, and I guess they are working on that. Also, the TV channels are kinda slim, but we were not gonna be in the room a lot, anyway. We had six adults (three couples) and we got by just great. The fact that you can walk to lots of places is really nice. We walked to lots of stuff. This is one busy place, and they seem up to the task of serving lots of people. Its a little noisey in the hallways, but you are on vacation so it doesn't seem to matter all that much. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price but.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just stayed at the Quality Suites Maingate East and had a so-so stay. Mind you, I had read all of the reviews posted here and so booked the hotel with the thought in mind that there could be some problems. We had a two-bedroom suite which was set up very nicely with the kitchenette and seating area. All of the rooms were very clean and I commend the cleaning staff on a job well done. The carpet was very stained, however, and the sofa in the living room was very worn out and uncomfortable. There was also a large gap under the door to the balcony that made me feel as if all kinds of "things" could crawl in & sleep with us at night! Thankfully, nothing happened there. We were allowed to check in early on the first day we arrived and I thought that was a very nice touch. The second morning one of our toilets overflowed, however maintenance came quickly to fix it and to clean up the mess. The "heated" pool was very, very cold but then the weather was a little chilly as well. The hot tub on the other hand was blistering and I had the feeling we were all being cooked in a stew pot! The elevator in our corner was very scary with cracked glass and in general the rooms just needed updating. It was a good location for the price. The breakfast buffet was good. We also saved some money by cooking our own food on the stove, using the fridge & microwave and toaster. There were only about 6 tv stations, so that could also be improved. There was a dvd player, however, and that saved us on the day it rained like crazy. Overall this is a fairly well maintained hotel that needs updating (new carpet, furniture, etc.). Otherwise if you don't plan on staying in the room for too much time you will be happy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a weekend stay at the Quality Suites Maingate East, and we were very pleased with this property. I was a little concerned about staying here because we're pretty picky and we had read some mixed reviews. However, the group we were with had booked the rooms here because they had been pleased in their past stays. We had a 2-bedroom suite, which is bigger than many 2-bedroom apartments! We were poolside, but had no problem with noise. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. When you consider the roominess, it's an excellent set up for families because you can really spread out. This is not a brand new hotel, but it is a well-maintained hotel. Great place for an extended stay. The grounds were extremely well taken care of, too. The free breakfast consisted of various beverages, cereals, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, waffles, muffins and various breads, grits, and oatmeal. The eating space was large, but so was the crowd. However, there were tables set up outside by the pool where you could also eat. There were trays on which to carry your food. I was really impressed with the set up of breakfast. In some hotels, guests are tripping over each other to get what they want. Not here. This breakfast is set up buffet style and everything just flowed from one end to the other. Very efficient. Staff was pleasant everywhere we went. We stayed on the 3rd floor, but there are stairwells and elevators conveniently placed, so we never had to wait. You couldn't ask for a better location. There are things to do right around the hotel that are within walking distance. Keep up the good work, Quality Suites Maingate East!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, secure, helpful. We stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have a small dog and needed a place to stay for a week where it was clean and safe. We felt safe leaving our dog in the room when we wasn't there and she wouldn't be messed with. They had a dog walk and the whole place was clean, even with the pets. So if you didn't have a pet, you wouldn't notice they were there. Our tv remote didn't work and when we called, they were there in 15 minutes and brought us a new remote. You couldn't ask for better service. The breakfast buffet was ok if you like buns, frozen waffles, etc. but its across the street from Denny's so that was perfect. At the pool they had a bar where they gave complentary drinks between 4:00 - 6:00 and the kids were in the pool swimming. To sum it up it was a clean, nice, safe place to stay, everyone was friendly, staff couldn't be more helpful. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price, but not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I booked, I found the reviews for this hotel were two opposite sides. Since I have little kids, and the price and location look good, so I decided to give it a try. We stayed there for a week, right before Christmas. Overall it's just a so-so hotel. First I asked for a quiet room, the front desk gave me one right by the main street. I checked it out and just too noisy. So walking around, I found many rooms on the other side (away from the main street) were vacant. I went back to front desk, and specifically asked for a room over there. They said only one available was right at a corner. Other than that, not much hesitation from them (I told them that I didn't move in). It's good to me, I thought, all I need is a clean, quiet place to rest. This room faces the loft area by the stairway, so no view to the pool, which turned out to be great for me. Since looked like every other day (we stayed for a week, booked 2 month ago), there were some big parties going on by the pool side, till 11-11:30pm. Almost every other room on the floor faces the pool, definetly would be much noisier. But the worse thing was the bedroom floor next to shower room has about a 16" wide strip area, was soaking wet! And it smells stink! I liked the quiet corner, so just took it. Went to WalMart got a deodorizer, put a towel there everyday, and turn the condition on to cold (de-humid). Looks like a structure problem, walls were wet too. I've asked housekeeper to vacuum it, still wet. The breakfast was good. Quite some varieties. It's the room too small! It has table and chairs outside, but it's cold weather. My daughter never try the pool, too cold, and too tired. Also, first thing I settled in the room was to check the air filter on the condition units. As usuall, they were ugly. So have to rinse them. But I did see on another day, a technician replacing the filters on another floor. Maybe it takes them a year to replace a round. I think this hotel maybe OK for summer time, kids can use the pools. But a few suggestions to management, since management looks like do listening on the site: 1) make sure carpet is dry and clean. Fix any structure leaks! Wet and stinky carpet just turn people off. 2) stop the loudspeaker in the night, before 9:30. Many people here come with little kids. They need sleep. 3) better changed to light color carpet, and use brighter lights. The dark blue color and dimmed lights make the room feel depressing. It's far from the demo picture on your homepage. 4) if you can't get breakfast room larger, lengthen the time. Since management looks like listening to concerns, which is a plus, I may come back, but not after trying out other suites. Now I'm sure, there're some reviews on this site are not from people stay here before! That's disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “pretty decent place for the price”
Reviews.Author: MrsNesbitt
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a very pleasant stay here. After reading the mixed reviews I didn't know what to expect, but overall I was pretty happy with this hotel. I really wanted to stay in a suite so I could get up early and not have to tiptoe around or sit in the dark, and so my son could take naps when he needed to, and this place was perfect. When we first arrived I ran to the bathroom to make sure it was clean, and the sink was dirty - the best way to describe it was it looked as though water had backed up in it after someone ashed cigarettes in it, and it left a black-ish film on the bowl (the room did not smell at all like someone had smoked in it though). We called the desk right away and they gave us a different room (we didn't request it) and the second one was fine. The carpet looked very clean and not one bit worn and the couch didn't show any obvious signs of wear. I don't like staying at hotels much because I don't sleep well if it's noisy and this one was not. We didn't hear any footsteps or running in the room above ours, slamming of doors, or loud people in the halls whatsoever. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was also concerned that there was no internet access in the rooms but it turns out there is, you just have to get an access code each day from the front desk, so that was nice. The pool was heated so we got to swim even though it wasn't very warm while we were there. The location couldn't have been better! Close to Disney, within walking distance of a lot of shops and restaurants. We rented a car so we wouldn't have to deal with the shuttles and it was a short drive to WDW and easy to find. My one complaint: yep, the breakfasts. They have instant oatmeal, cereal, muffins, rolls, fresh whole fruit, canned fruit, english muffins, hard boiled eggs and toast. By our last morning there I would have given anything for a bagel and cream cheese or some peanut butter, just to change it up a bit. I think we got a great deal though and saved a ton by staying here, and I would definitely not hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: topsy234
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in florida. We loved every minute of it. I was a little worried about staying at the quality suites because of some of the reviews. But we are so happy that we stayed here. This is a very economical hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. My husband and I had our own bedroom and bath. My 2 teen girls had their own bedroom and bath. It was perfect after a week visiting disney and universal everyday. It gave all of us our own space. There were pots, pans, silverware, plates, cups, glasses enough for 10 people. We shuttled to and from the parks everyday. One night we stayed out longer then planned so we missed our bus. We would have to wait for another hour. But we were able to catch the city bus which only cost 1.50 a person. The buses go to magic kingdom everyday and the city bus route stops right at quality suites. We loved the breakfast. Especially me It was a week that I didn't have to cook. We were able to Eat out or in. Everything is close there are restaurants and shopping near. It was quiet after the pools closed, the beds were comfortable. We will be coming back. We didn't want to leave. You will save by staying here. There are few truths to the reviews the bathtubs have seen a lot of wear. And new carpet is needed. But over all this is a good stay

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Peggy55
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with 5 adults over the busy Thanksgiving holiday and had a deluxe 2 bedroom suite. The suite was very clean and our housekeeper did a great job, even had the beds turned down for us when we returned exhausted each night! Just a small thing, but it was noticed and appreciated. She even wrote us a thank you note for leaving her a gratuity each morning. My only complaint was that the carpeting was your basic indoor-outdoor type and stained in places, but this place is not marketed as a luxury hotel. The beds were comfortable, the sofa a bit hard, but the place was clean, and that is paramount to me. Whenever we asked for something, like extra pillows or cups, or someone to come and fix our safe, it was taken care of within a half hour. The pool area was very nice, and we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast 2 out of the 4 days. Heavy on the carbs, but a good selection! We have traveled to many places and stayed at many fine hotels. We were not looking for luxury this time, just a good setup that was clean and able to satisfy 5 adults with enough room to escape from each other once in a while! You cannot beat the price for the size of the rooms. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only because our hotel of choice had no availability. This hotel was twice the price of our other choice and was not nearly as nice. The housekeeping staff was lax in their details. Had to call the front desk for coffee two out of the three days we were there. The pool area was not looked after - wet towels laying everywhere and no clean dry towels in the bin. The rooms were adequate but need serious updating. There were dirty dishes in the cupboards, the dishwasher looked like it had seen better days and the fridge wasn't cold enough. The remote to the TV didn't work. There were two closets that were missing doors. The fixtures in the bathrooms looked about 20 years old (rusty). One of the fire alarms was just hanging by wires (makes you wonder if it even worked). To top things off, the houskeeping staff was very rude. We had a late checkout time, and they stood outside our bedroom window laughing and joking and when we asked for some quite because we had children still sleeping, they told us to "get back in your room and mind your own business". Management did compensate our charges because of this, but we will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “objective review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 11/10-11/14/05. We have kids aged 1, 4 and 10. We read the reviews about the condition of the hotel as being dates and did not have high expectations. Our expectations were met. We had a two bedroom suite and the price was cheap. The two bathrooms were very clean. The rooms could have been better maintained and needed some repairs, but we were in Orlando to be out of the rooms. The kids slept well, but the air conditioning unit in the parents' bedroom was very loud when it shut down. The kitchenette was adequate. The kids missed full cable, but they were too tired when they got back to make it a major crisis. The breakfast was average. We did not expect much fruit since the hotel was cheap, but the kids liked the waffles and cereal. There was sufficient food for everyone. The pools were not big, but they were just fine for a our short needs and most of the kids seemed to have a good time in the pool area. The afternoon free drinks were a great addition. Overall, the hotel met our exact needs. It was a cheap hotel for a quick jaunt to Orlando. I would stay again for a short time, but if you expect to get five star service for a two star price, your expectations are too high. You get exactly what you pay for in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Stayed here for two weeks. One bedroom suite was booked on line from a leading internet Hotel Site. The Hotel is 'masked' as a 3 Star Hotel... This is where the dissapointment begins. CONS - Fridge not Cold enough - Dishwasher did not work properly (Actually - it never worked period) - Shower Faucet cracked - Bathtub and tiles really Dirty from years fo soap scum (we bought our own cleaner and still got no where) - Count them 1..2..3.....11 beetles I had to put down that came in through the inch and a half gap on the front door... - Terrible shuttle service to the parks (once in the morning to Disney and once back around 8PM) No Fireworks Kids... - A Popular place for Ball teams. Every day they filled the pool area. They kept us up most nights with their woohoos and beer screams around the hot tub... - Beds were made half of the time... Complimentary coffee frequently overlooked along with simple wash towels... ect... We got tired of calling front desk so we laughed it all off and did not let it ruin our holidays... ProsThere were two pros - Comfortable beds - Satisfying free Continental breakfast This is an old hotel with basically new paint and dressings... When you open that door for the first time you feel like you have been taken. We talked to several families that also ecountered the same sort of trials... Will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Entire Family Enjoyed Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at Quality Suites Maingate. Overall - pleasantly surprised. Pool area, free drinks 4-6pm and breakfast bar were favorites. Stayed in a 2bdroom suite. Very clean, nice, pleasant staff. Only 'problem' was the couch had seen better days. For 4 adults & 2 kids - enough room for everything. Closer to WDW than we thought and could WALK to numerous restaurants, Old Towne etc. Well worth the $ to stay here than at WDW property. This is not a resort & doesn't pretend to be. Would definitely stay again & recommend. Kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “No quality here”
Reviews.Author: lakecity21
Reviews.Content: First of all the only reason we stayed here was because we were traveling with in-laws who wouldn't listen to our input or allow us to pay for anything so I really shouldn't complain, but I wouldn't want others to pay to stay here. Orginally we were only going to stay only 2 nights here, but ended up staying three because of hurricane Ophelia messing up our plans to go to the beach. The first two nights we stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath deluxe suit. Although it was spacious it was just ordinary. The hotel was suppose to have been competely remodeled a year ago. It didn't look like professionals did the work in this room. This room had definately seen better days. Around both bath tubs there was mold around it. I also found other people's hairs in the bathroom indicating that who ever cleaned it didn't pay close attention to detail. The third night we stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite that wasn't a deluxe suit. This room was the exact same layout and size, but didn't have a full refrigerator and a TV in the second bedroom. For this they charge a significant amount more. This room was worse then the first. The bulbs were out in the master bathroom and again both tubs had mold around it. In addition, there was a obvious significant amount of other people's hair in the bathroom. Therefore the rooms don't get cleaned very well. The second tub also had a drainage problem so the previous nights shower didn't drain competely by morning. Housekeeping did come by in the morning, but if you weren't ready to have your room clean they didn't come back later. The offer a continental breakfast which I have to admit has a wide selection, however everything was tasted terrible. Everything tasted like it was made somewhere else then reheated there. If you care about attention to detail and how nice the room looks this is not the place for you. For the same price you can get something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I signed up for!”
Reviews.Author: Jetandfooma
Reviews.Content: I was worried when I read bad reviews before heading to Florida. Was I relieved to find that the rooms were quite clean, there was no odor at all as some complained and the bathroom facilities were new and spotless. Housekeeping was conscientious and thorough and nothing in the room was broken as others experienced. The pool is fabulous and our 5 year old barely wanted to leave the hotel because of it! Breakfast was the biggest "continental breakfast" from a chain hotel that I've ever had and the staff seemed knowledgable and responsive. The kitchen is what they showed. A small place to make quickie, simple meals like spaghetti. A chef looking to create food art would be horrified. However, a mom feeding mac-n-cheese or hot dogs would be thoroughly satisfied. The gift shop has anything you might have forgotten as does 7-11 across the parking lot. Noise isn't a problem as long you are sleeping in the back bedroom. BUT, the early morning noise will rattle you awake if you are in the front on the pull-out couch/bed. Not good soundproofing with the doors. The late night noise at the pool could also be an issue for those who crash early in the front room. Finally, the shuttle, which is not run by the hotel, is unusable unless you are willing to commit to 10-12 hours at one park. I suppose that one's level of satisfation may depend on whether or not one receives a renovated room, however, that is pure speculation on my part. Overall, we were quite pleased, particularly with the cleanliness and our son thought it awesome!

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal”
Reviews.Author: marjbro
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a seven night stay at the Quality Suites, Maingate East, Orlando. I read all the reviews and was a little apprehensive but was pleasantly surprised. We did have a little trouble at first; the room they gave us (313) had a broken lock (didn't I read about that?) which (according to the neighbors had been broken for weeks) - so if they give you that room, decline. We were smack in the middle of a bunch of wrestlers (no pun intended) that were very noisy until early in the morning, but when we complained, they comped us a night (which was nice). the happy hour is great, the bartender at the pool Leah is wonderful; the breakfast was great, saved us lots of time and money. The suite was huge, two bedrooms and two full baths, it was very clean and we had plenty of towels. you can't beat the location or the price. the front desk staff was very helpful about restaurants (there are lots of them close by) and helped us make arrangements for one of our party to travel to Sanford Airport. All in all, it was a great stay, Quality Suites is terrific for families. I'd stay there again in a minute, only next time I'll be spending more time by the pool!!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag (but not all bad like some have said)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family, which included 4 adults and 6 children (two under the age of 5 years) stayed in a 2 bedroom suite at the Quality Suites Maingate East property from June 11-14th, 2005. I read the reviews with trepidation, but we were overall satisfied with our stay. That's not to say that there were not problems, but they were relatively minor considering the good things we experienced. The problems: As was written by an earlier reviewer, there was a water outage at the property on the evening of June 11th. When we checked in, the front desk staff stated it was a city-wide outage, but we found out later that it was limited to just that property. The problem was fixed overnight, so we had water for the rest of our stay (If it was NOT fixed, we would have left the next day for somewhere else). We also had problems with our toilets, which we ended up fixing ourselves. Also, upon checkin, I asked if we could upgrade our room to a 2-br Full Suite per our Choice Privilege membership agreement. The girl at the front desk acted as if she didn't know anything about the Choice Privileges program, and she took my paperwork to the back to "check it out" and left me out there for about 5 minutes waiting with my family outside in the pouring rain... I ended up asking the other clerk about the upgrade policy, and she told me it was from a 1-bedroom to a 2-bedroom (they wanted to charge me an extra $50 which was not MY understanding of the way the Choice Privileges worked. It would have been nice to have that extra space, as the room we were in did get cramped, but since we were in the room so infrequently, that was a minor problem). I also asked about late checkout on the day of departure, and they were equally clueless (the girl on checkout said it was limited to availability, but she gave it to me free anyhow after I told her I spoke to a Choice Privilege representative). Apparently the front desk staff need additional training in the Choice Privileges program. Though the pool was great, there were not enough towels in the evenings, so we had to hoard towels during the day to have some in the evening when we returned to swim. The Good Stuff: The Pool was nice, the kids enjoyed using it in the evenings after a long day of theme park adventures. The Hot tub was great for feet soaking after a long day of walking. The Continental Breakfast was GREAT - it had a wide selection of juices (orange, cranberry, apple), coffee, cereal, oatmeal, toast, waffles, pancakes, English Muffins, pastries, danishes, muffins, fruit (oranges, apples), fruit salad (peaches, pears, apricots, fruit cocktail type stuff), and there were even BOILED EGGS which offered a protein choice. The breakfast alone saved us approx. $30-50 per day in breakfast costs!! The housekeeping staff provided us with adequate towels for our room and they kept us in plenty of soaps, shampoo, coffee, etc. And though they had problems repairing our toilet to our satisfaction, they were quick to respond to any questions or complaints. And ond final thing - my sister needed to consult a security officer due to a problem with one of the other tenants at the pool, and he was prompt and courteous to respond to take care of the situation. All in all, I would stay there again, but the staff need to be trained to know how to handle Choice Privileges customers.

Reviews.Title: “Totally positive experience June 8-11, 2005”
Reviews.Author: Sask_tourists
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just returned from 10 days in Kissimmee and Disney World. We had a one bedroom deluxe suite. It was exactly as the website pictured. Everything was clean -- bathroom, kitchen, fridge -- plus plenty of towels. The front desk person was cheerful, positive and friendly. We were too late on arrival day for the free poolside drinks but the 2 for 1 drink coupon encouraged us to visit their bar that evening. We had a view of Old Town -from the bedroom window and of the pool area from the front door of the suite. Old Town, incidentally, is great fun; try the instant ancestors photo studio for a great souvenir. The pool was quiet in the afternoon (June 9 and 10) and later in the evening. We enjoyed breakfast around 9:30 all three mornings we were there. Yes, it is busy but we always managed to get a table (just two of us) and ended up sharing the table with two other adults. It was not so busy or noisy that we couldn't enjoy a conversation and relax over breakfast while making new friends. The breakfast is very good -- definately a great value. You can also take the food back to your room, including some fresh apples and oranges to enjoy later in the day. If you want something quieter, there are good buffet breakfasts available within a block or two, for about 3.95 per person. The free wine and beer was enjoyable on the afternoon that we spent at the hotel. It was not busy at all, and we chatted with another family while enjoying a couple of drinks. I had trouble with the key card one evening, and the front desk sent someone to the room within 5 minutes. ALso, the fridge was not cold enough on the first morning. I called the front desk before going for breakfast, and it was fixed and definately COLD when we returned an hour later. All in all, great service. The buses only run in the early morning and return when the parks close. I rented an SUV for just over 100 dollars plus tax for an entire week. Great location. Many good restaurants and buffets are reasonably priced and serve dinner until 10:30 or later to catch the crowds returning from the parks. The buffet across the street serves dinner for 8.95 -- less if you get a coupon for a discount. The only negative comment I have is that someone threw up in the outdoor corridor just down from our room. I didn't report it and obviously neither did anyone else, as it wasn't cleaned up the next morning. However, having said that, the rooms, lobby and pool area were immaculate. It's a good value, friendly, and great area. It's not a 5 star, of course, but it is a great place for a casual family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 children and I, just returned from our 6 night stay at the Quality Suites Maingate. I found this website the night before we left, and have to admit that I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. When we arrived, I was relieved to say the least. We had a 1 bedroom suite, which was plenty of room for the of us. Our room was very clean, smelled fine, and everything was in good working order. We didn't sleep on the pull out bed, but as a couch... it was great. The kids LOVED the pool, and we loved the free drinks at the pool bar during happy hour. I only spoke with the staff a couple of times, but they were very helpful in answering my couple of questions. The free breakfast was a great bonus, and we ate the food each morning that we were there. Get there early, because the tables do fill up fast. Overall, a great experience for families with children. The right price too!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Apocalypse”
Reviews.Author: xrhetor
Reviews.Content: To say that this hotel is terrible is an understatement. Everything about the Quality Inn Maingate East is pathetic. As I write this review on June 11, 2005, all of the hotel guests are experiencing a loss of water that has lasted (so far) five hours. The front desk staff told me that the problem would be resolved shortly, but nothing has happened. When I called the front desk at 6:30, they told me to turn off faucets because they did not want an overflow when the water comes back on. This is par for the course for what could be the worst hotel in Orlando (and I have stayed in many). The hotel management responds on this site with cut and pasted claims that they make every effort to meet guests needs and that they have remodeled the hotel. Well, I came expecting a much better room (given their claims on the website) and have never been so disappointed. The refrigerator is broken, with no switch to control the temperature (see attached pic). And I had to throw out many food items because of them being frozen. As well, the kichen is sub-par and will not work for cooking meals. There is no oven, and just a poor person's plug in two-coil stove. I consider the management to be engaging in misrepresentation of their property in stating that the suites have a kitchen. It is hardly that. As well, I was given a handicap room, even after reserving months in advance, and the shower overflowed every morning. I had to put towels on the floor to swab up all of the water. The carpert is also dirty and the overall feel of this place is of a gothic castle combined with a garbage dump. Oh, the advertised shuttle. It is a bus operated by Carribbean and it runs only once per day (pick up at the hotel in the morning and return from the paks after 8 pm). Also, the hotel staff is unprofessional. On numerous occasions, including once from the airport, they were unable to advise me on transportation.....I was disconnected twice when I asked for directions. Also, on June 9, 2005, a very rude attendant at the "guest services" desk asked me to "not use my suitcase wheels on the floor because we have justed waxed it." I picked up my suitcase and then she laughed and said "fooled you." After a long flight, I am not interested in pathetic jokes from an immature attendant. Still waiting on the water and I am not expecting to have it running again tonight. Don't listen to the management's cut and paste claims that will be posted in response to this or any other message....it is just gobblygook. Do one thing, avoid the Quality Inn Maingate East. If you don't you will have bad memories, an unpleasant stay and a terrible time at this Hotel Apocalypse.

Reviews.Title: “ok, for short trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel, the size was great for our five member family. Cleanliness could have been a little better. Bathrooms need serious attention as well as furnishings. It was OK for the one night we stayed during a quick trip through Orlando, but I would not recommend it for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Quality Suites Maingate”
Reviews.Author: travelingbat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay at Quality Suites Maingate, it was a very pleasent experiance. The suite was comfortable for 4 adults and 1 child. Everthing was clean and in working order and we got plenty of towels. The room was done each day before we came back for a swim around 3pm. The breakfast was good but a little crowded so we took the food to our room and ate in peace. We carried juice in the ice bucket and made coffee in the room and could then drink from real cup. The only thing that could be improved was the sofa bed. It has seen better days and we kept rolling into each other. We did not use theit buses because the times were not for us ,we came back each afternoon for a swim and dinner. The pool was always clean and had pleanty of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a dissapointed. My bathroom had mold on the ceiling. The shuttle service was unrealiable and the hotel staff seemed less than eager to address the issue. The breakfast was not what I expected. My room had a stuffy stale smell. And the worst was the view of the parking lot with the crowded highway just beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out well.....”
Reviews.Author: DJFCLF
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 7 night stay at Quality Suites Maingate East and I must say in reading a few of the reviews I had some concerns, however we were on a fairly strict budget and Quality Suites seemed to fit the bill. From my understanding the first week of May is usually quiet in that area so we encountered no problems with noise whatsoever. There were people staying next to us but we did not hear a peep. Upon check in we were greeted very promptly with no wait - took about 5 mins. Since check-in was not until 4pm and we arrived at 1pm they locked our bags in storage area beside front desk and enjoyed the pool area until room was ready. Elevators worked fine - but slow - we were only on third floor so were not opposed to walking. Front desk staff were very friendly & helpful as were staff at the "attractions" desk. Our room was very clean upon arrival - perhaps a little"tired" looking but can be expected with the amount of people traffic that I can only imagine this hotel sees. Housekeeping did an excellent job cleaning while we were there. Front desk called on second day to make sure all was ok with room- nice surprise. Pool area was busy at night after crowds returned from parks and a little noisey but to be expected as hotel definately caters to family & kids. Pool area clean and tidy - fresh towels, patio bar. Location was great= Publix supermarket across the street (busy street!) along with Walgreens drug store & various retaurants of all types and price ranges. Free shuttle service worked well - we did not rent a car so we were very dependent on this. Arrives as early as 7:45 for Disney and returns as late as 10:30 -check with driver or attractions desk for schedule, picks up & drops off at different Disney theme parks throughout the day and evening. Also picks up at 3 other hotels on the way so total shuttle drive to Disney takes approx. 30 mins. Breakfast buffet was adequate - enough to get you on your way early in the AM. All in all we found it to be "as advertised" and definately a step up from a "Days Inn" type hotel. I have definatley paid a lot more for much less in other areas of Florida and the US. Besides, we were there to spend time at Disney not relax by the pool or in our room....we were away from 8:30AM not returning back to th Hotel until 8:30PM - some nights 10PM. If travelling with a family and on a budget it certainly fits the bill....we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “It's was Okay?!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Quality Maingate East (2 bedroom suite). The downs were that they only had one desk person....So, there was always a wait for check in and check out or for any questions that you might have. The hotel rooms look NOTHING like the ones on their website! The floors in the hall were disgustingly dirtly.....cigarette butts and trash everywhere! It seems pretty simple to have someone at least sweep the floors daily! The rooms are old and run down....The couch in our room was ripped. The shower was broken in the masterbath and was made for a handicap person. The shower flooded the whole bath. The rooms are very loud.....bedroom window on hallway.... All night you could hear people coming and going. They should really put indoor outdoor carpet to buffer some of the noise! And it would make the halls look a bit nicer. The rooms were clean and the housekeeping did a fabulous job!!!! Leave them a tip and we got extra everything......they even did the dishes! The housekeeping was great!!! The pool area was well kept and clean. The kiddie pool is a joke.....it's about the size of one of those plastic kiddie pools that you buy in Walmart. The playgound is a joke too.... I guess that is why they are not in the pictures on their website! We stayed for three days....I don't think I could have stayed any longer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: fairyj
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about this hotel after reading the reviews here but all my fears were unfounded. I've just got back from a week at the Quality Suites and I found the hotel perfect as an inexpensive base for theme park touring. Literally no more than 10 minutes from any of the Disney Parks and 20 mins from the Florida Mall. The 1 bed suite was large and clean - we did not see one bug in the room which is pretty unusual in a Florida motel. There is a slight damp smell in the rooms but this is down to the air conditioning units. We brought a can of odour neutraliser and it was gone. The pool area is spotless with plenty of chairs and pool towels for use by hotel guests. Hotel is right near numerous restaurants and Old Town bars. The hotel can be slightly noisy but it is a family hotel and is a safe environment for families to let their kids run around. We had no children in our party and the noise didn't bother us at all. Their is 24 hour visible security. Finally can I say that the maids in the hotel supply each suite with more towels daily than you could ever use

Reviews.Title: “Quality Suites A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: mastmi
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Quality Suites Maingate East for a five-night Disney vacation. The Great: Ten minute drive (tops) to any Disney park. The Good: Lots of space for our family of 4; fully operational kitchen, decent free breakfast, nice pool and little playground for the kids. Close to many restaurants, Target and Walmart for picking up supplies or souvenirs. Walking distance to Old Town for entertainment, dining, etc. The Bad: Shabby hallways, broken elevator, somewhat nasty/old looking shower fixtures and broken drain. The Ugly: No hot water on our first morning there...although by the time we finished our freezing showers and headed to the front desk to report it, it was apparently fixed. Overall for the price we paid (around $90/night) I was hoping for a little bit nicer property, but the room was clean, functional and appeared to be safe. This hotel was probably very nice ten years ago, but needs a little refurbishing. If I could get a cheaper rate, I might stay there again. The location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in February 2005. This was one of the noisiest hotels we have stayed in. The room rate was a deal though. We had a two bedroom suite for less than we could get a single room at other hotels this close to Disney. If we weren't so exhausted from spending our days in the parks, we never would have fallen asleep with the inconsiderate people yelling at midnight. It was nice to have a kitchen with a dishwasher. However, the refrigerator was dorm-size and did not seal correctly. The housekeeping definitely needed some help. There was alot of hair on the bathroom floor when we checked in - gross! The kids loved the pool and there were plenty of kids their age to play with. Overall, it was a decent deal for the money but I would probably try to find somewhere else to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jabl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October 2004. Me, my partner, 10 year old daughter and my parents in a two bedroom apartment. For what we paid we did not expect the Ritz. However, what we got was a clean room with good facilities. Plenty of space and excellent maid service. The door was sticking a little and was repaired within 2 hours of our call. The reception staff were very helpfull, especially when we found the phone card we had bought was useless. The pool area was cleaned every day and the water quality was checked often. The free newspaper was a bonus and the afternoon happy hour/ 2 hours was great, beer, wine and soft drinks. You think about it, free drinks for the kids for two hours and no one stopping you taking a beer back to your room. The complimentary breakfast saved us quite a few dollars. Coffee, tea, nice fruit juice (it can we watery when its free) toast, cereal, waffles, fruit, yoghurt and eggs. OK, no bacon but come on what do you expect. The location is fantastic 7/11 just outside your door. Old Town is at most a five minute walk away and loads of restaraunts are within walking distance. We also walked to Water Mania. Across the road is a Publix supermarket, you can get almost everything there, cooked chicken, ready made salad and a great selection of pies and cakes for pudding. Would I go again, yes for sure and I have recomended it to friends and work colleagues. Bye the way this was not my first time in Florida it was my 5th and I have stayed in hotels, houses and apartment complexes. Enjoy your stay, just remember how little you paid, for a nice place to put your head down with great surrounding attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasures”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the whole a nice place. Parking is limited and no provisions are made if you can't get a space. Wasn't happy finding a pair of ladies panties (with turtles) lying on the floor of the living room closet. Also, there was no mention of a charge for the inroom safe. They charged $2.50/day....rip off. Rooms were very roomy.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We started our trip with a 2-night stay at a beautiful 4-star hotel in Clearwater and then came up to Kissimmee for the theme parks. We stayed in a 2-br suite at the Quality Suites Maingate East from 2/13 to 2/17 on the 4th floor. Our first room (422) smelled bad, the carpet was really stained, and both bathrooms were dirty (toilets, tubs, and floors). I was so disappointed because the rooms looked so much nicer on their website. The front desk was very kind and gave us another room (416) which was cleaner and smelled better. However, one of the bedrooms was missing closet doors, and the kitchen table rocked a bit, but it felt clean at least. Both suites we were in had shabby sleep sofas. The cushions were completely smashed and it was a good thing we weren't planning on sleeping on them. We covered the sofa with a bed sheet each day just to sit on it. The maid replaced towels and made up the bed, but I don't think he/she ever swept or washed the bathroom floors. The suite itself was very spacious which was a plus, and we had plenty of hot water and good water pressure from the showers. Breakfast was fine. The pool was nice, but not all that "heated". The front desk was always very helpful and kind. The hotel itself was in a great location - VERY convenient to Disney World, restaurants, gas, and even a local hospital. There's a Walgreens and grocery store across the street and a 7-11 next store. We paid $130 a night which isn't bad for all the room you get, but I don't think I'd go back unless they did some major remodelling. Final bit of advice - if you think you might need to do laundry at the hotel, go to a store to buy your laundry soap and softener. The gift shop charges $1.92 for a tiny box of Tide, and $.35 per dryer sheet. There are six washers and dryers, which are pretty nice and cost $1.50 each per load. Don't bother bringing your quarters, because you have to use tokens which you get in the laundry room.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this place”
Reviews.Author: gerry6166
Reviews.Content: Went for our Feburary winter break2005. The location was great, the room was perfect for a party of 4 moms and 6 kids! Good continental breakfast and, great happy hour. The pool area is beautiful and you did not know you were in the middle of a busy strip because of the way it is surrounded by the hotel and beautiful landscaping! The only down side was the constuction on 4 that closed the exit to 192. We will go again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read all the revues too and were a bit anxious to go there. But we loved the place! Our suite was on the 5th floor, and it was clean. A bit smelly, but clean. We bought an airfreshener and the problem was solved. The pool was nice, we had no trouble with noisyness, breakfast was okay, though it was the same every day. We really enjoyed staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with quick and easy drive to all major theme parks (or take the hotel shuttle) and airport. Walk to tourist shops nearby; grocery shop at major super market accross the street; eat at hamburger places, pizza, steakhouses, etc.; gas stations; pharmacy; etc. Free continental breakfast and poolside happy hour drinks. Nice pools and small playground. Felt safe and observed security checking the parking lot several times at night. Great staff! We plan to be back -we really enjoyed our 2-bedroom suite with kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, decent price”
Reviews.Author: MN_Bill
Reviews.Content: I'll try to be short with this. There is a certain amount of truth to many of the reviews out here. We just got back from a 7 night stay at this place and....YES, it is somewhat beat up, we had doors broken, and things didn't work. Also there was some noise, but the sleeping quarters are located on the back of the unit so unless you are a very light sleeper there shouldn't be any noise. The food is basic, the ammenities are fine also. We heard so much bad about the provided shuttle service that we rented our own car and that was a great decision.
