Allowed us to come and go as we pleased. I saw lots of bored, angry looking people waiting for the busses to come by as we were heading to the park. I did not hear or see lots of kids running around making noise like other said. Maybe that happens only during peak season when the place is full. We also had no problem with the elevators and I will say this..... The clientelle was a bit on the large size at this place and for that matter all of Florida so most could use a walk up and down the stairs. Overall this was a fine place, that was very roomy and comfortable. The staff was nice and helpful and the location was superb. For $110 per night try getting 6 people in a Disney property for that amount - Good Luck!!!. We toured the moderate resorts and all were in the $150-200 per room - and that was a small boxy room for 4 people maximum. We stayed at a Dis property a few years ago and unless you are on a monorail line property you will sit and wait for busses - trust me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Enjoyed our 4 day mini Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: SteveinMD
Reviews.Content: Summary: Not a bad place at all....We enjoyed our stay and would likely recommend the Quality Suites for budget minded families. We got direct flights to and from Baltimore, 5 nights in the Quality and a nice rental car for just over $1100 (3 people) on Expedia. It's not the best hotel out there but definitley not the worse. We stayed 10/12 to 10/17. Pros: Proximity to Disney resorts. It only took us 5 or 10 mins to get to any of the Disney parks or Downtown Disney. And of course, at the end of the day, it only took 5 or 10 mins to get back to the hotel. Proximity to restaurants. Rte 192 has every chain and franchise you have ever heard of. If you do not have a car, there are plenty of places to eat within 15 minutes walk east or west along 192. Nice continental breakfast as previously described here. We like to eat in our room so I would take the tray and the coffee caraffe from the room and bring back enough for me, the wife and our 7 year old. Nobody complained as I walked out to the room with my tray piled very high. Nice pool and hot spa. We weren't there in the busy period so the pool wasn't crowded as described elsewhere. We sat with our feet in the spa and enjoyed some cold ones after doing the Disney thing every day. Very enjoyable. Nice Tiki bar. Happy hour is from 4PM until 6PM every day - free beer, wine and sodas. Excellent. Met some great people each afternoon. Friendly staff. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. No complaints. Maid service was very good and we got a newspaper every morning outside the room door. Now the cons: Rooms are a bit tired and although clean, one gets the feeling that they're not because of the old fabrics, carpets, wall treatements, furniture etc. The bed linens were nice and clean though. If this place had a coat of paint and some new furniture, it would have got 5 stars from me. Two mornings in a row there was no hot water. We had to wait a while - apparently some boiler problems which I assume were fixed as the other days were fine. There is no bar before 4pm. After one of the days at Disney, we got back early 2PM ish and decided to sit by the pool. No beer! Walked to the 7-11 next door and bought a 6 pack. It miight be because we were there out of season. Not sure. All in all though, not a bad place!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality suites Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there during hurricane jeanne, the people where rude and poorly trained to handle a problem. No body came bye to see if we where all right or if we needed anything. The information we where giving was poor and inaccurate. They where not perpared for any problems that came up. The guess services was rude and non professional. When I contacted the main office they did not handle my complaint very well, they put it on the manageent of the hotel, which was not any better. I got a basket of chips and a soda.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll try to be fair... Hotel is hard to see from the road, but once we found it check-in was quick. Two bedroom/two bath was a nice size but very tired. Our room (318) was clean and everything worked. Linens and towels were clean and plentiful. Bathrooms were clean. I wouldn't go to 'spotless' but not a problem. Maid service was good. The furnishings could use some work (broken cabinets, chiped floor tiles, stained chairs, nicked tables, worn burners, loose bathroom door knob, etc). Nothing major ... just beat up a bit. Breakfast buffet was nice. Typical 'continental' items along with toasted waffles/pancakes, hard boiled eggs, and instant oatmeal. Courtyard and pool were very nice and looked recently upgraded. I thought the pool looked very clean and I have one in my backyard but we did not get a chance to swim. To busy enjoying the area. Tiki bar was also a nice touch. We were having a good time until Hurricane Jeanne chased us out of town. All-in-all a fair place if you want a little more space, for a reasonable price, very close to Disney. Just don't expect the Four Season at this price. The rooms are NOT what you see on the internet. If every room got new appliances, cabinets, furnishings and a paint job I would rate it above average. As is ... it's OK for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but terrible free bus service to theme parks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Quality Suites Maingate East was good value, and we even were there during Hurricane Frances. The one bedroom suite was clean, and the maid service was fine; even in the peak of the hurricane they came to our door with fresh towels, soap, toilet paper. The complimentary continental breakfast was also good. Plenty of food and a reasonable variety. The big problem was the free shuttle service to the theme parks. It is run by a private company, Caribbean Island. It never ran on time. At least 15 minutes late in the morning and they said you should arrive 10 minutes early. Some days it was 30 minutes late. The first night the pick-up from Epcot was 45 minutes late, the bus filled beyond capacity and people were left behind. I would recommend this hotel, but you should either have your own transportation or be prepared to use a taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Sunday August 30th, 2004. Everything looked pleasant. But then when we went to our room.........The hotel was not a good place. I travel and I know how to compare. The pool was dirty, I allowed room service once in the five days I was there and they left my room door ajar. Anyone could have had access to my room that day and to top it off they did a terrible job the room looked just as we left it that morning. The micorwave was inoperable we had no use of a microwave. There was no cable TV. The kids were not having a good stay we were limited to four local channels of which one was a sports channel and the other was CNN. My husband got an eye infection from the dirty pool. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family. Of all the hotels I've spent time in vacationing the best that I would recommend is the Sierra Suites. I so regret not staying with them on this trip. That is a mistake I will not make again. I was very very displeased. One last thing I did not feel safe. My 14yr old daughter said she did not feel safe at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Treck
Reviews.Content: pictures on the web make the hotel more grand than it is. you get what you pay for. this hotel was not bad. the rooms are large, clean and a bit worn out. a nice pool. a fun bar thats open late. close to shopping and restaurants. shuttles to all the attracions but only offer one leave/return time. other hotels offer every half to one hour shuttle service. if you have small children or older adults this makes for a long day. family had difficult time getting help from the activities director. we would stay here again. it is a good middle of the road hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the money. Very family oriented, and very clean. I liked the center court design... everyone had a pool-side view. I liked the location too. All major chain restaurants and fast food places within a two mile radius of the hotel. Great for someone vacationing on a budget. 10 - 20 minutes from every major attraction in Orlando. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “dirty place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thought the place was very dirty. Room was not clean. Tub was stained and just gross looking. Place is crowded and noisey.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our familyof 6 stayed here 8/16-8/21 2004. We were pleasantly surprised. The suite was big enough and clean. The pool was a great hit with the adults and kids alike, the hot tub was an added bonus. We arrived just after Charley had struck and were very grateful that we had somewhere to stay at all. The staff were friendly, the breakfast was very welcome and although not very varied it suited our needs. A great place to stay with a family, excellent value for money. Close to all the parks and an easy walk to Old Town. We didn't want 5* and we didn't get it, what we got was a comfortable and relaxing place to stay with plenty of pool activity for the kids, perfect after a long day at the parks

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: simone
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 year old daughter, 20 year old son and their boyfriend and girlfriend stayed at the Quality Suites the first week of May 2004. We loved our stay! Our two bedroom suite was always clean. We enjoyed the free breakfast daily and just relaxing around the pool. It was a bonus to have entertainment close by-ie: Disney and Old Town. We are already planning to return next year. Just to let you know this was our third time at this hotel. The first time our children were 6 and 8 years old. The second time they were 10 and 12 years old. Everytime we travelled to this hotel, we enjoyed our stay and and recommend this place to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, clean mid range property”
Reviews.Author: Southburian
Reviews.Content: This is a great value. We have stayed at the Polynesian twice and Holiday Inn family suites once and overal we liked this the best. It is great to have some room to spread out (staying at the Polynesian is like staying in a high priced camper). Our room was an upgraded 5th floor 2 bedroom suite with 3 tv's, 2 baths, a mid size refrig, microwave, coffee maker and a blender and 3 large closets with plenty of room to store clothing (on hangers or shelves) and luggage. The room was of modest decor, but was clean and cleaned daily except when hurricane Charley hit (they left a notice indicating that only limited staff was available and they would not be able to clean all rooms). The staff was friendly and responsive when we needed aid. The 4-6 pm free beer and jug wine was great and a tip to the bartender resulted in automatic drinks each time I showed up within eyesight of the bar. The pool area was very clean with nice landscaping, although more lounge chairs would be nice. The pool was noisey and full each night after 9 pm, but we found the crowds small most other times. The continental breakfast was about average. They had coffee, tea, milk, juice, toaster waffels (aunt jamima), muffins, mini cinamon buns, english muffins, toast, instant oatmeal packets, 2 types of dry cereal and oranges each morning. In addition most morning they had a bowl of hard boiled eggs. They also had a large bowl of canned fruit each morning they rotated between peaches, pears and fruit salad. I have stayed at many hotels throughout the world and this is definitely not the best or worst, but it is definitely the best physical room layout and best value. I have rated it average since overal it is an average room, but it would be rated excellent when compared to other mid priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived for one night at the Quality Suites on July 29. For some reason, we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite. This included two bathrooms, which was a nice feature with six of us getting ready for the pool, bathing, etc. The staff that we encountered during our stay were very friendly. I feel that they are doing the best they can. The continental breakfast was adequate for our large, picky crew. The pools was VERY crowded, mostly with kids and teenagers. The hotel has seen better days. Our room was clean, but it obviously had been repaired or patched in places. The bedding for the pull out sofa was ripped. I think the hotel must have a rowdy crowd often. My husband and I slept on the sofa and there was noise outside of the room until 1:30 a.m. At one point (around 11:30) someone knocked on our door accidentally. This place is BUSY, but for the amount we spent it was worth it. Our night there was not the most restful we've had, but it was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the money the Hotel cost it was fine. Although i would recomend paying a little more and upgrading to something alittle newer. The staff were great and the rooms were cleaned daily. The thing that let the hotel down was the old bathrooms and dirty carpets. The place is a friendly one to stay in with the afternoon happy hour bringing together lots of families to chat. There was a good mix of age groups and like most holidays the children made lots of friends. Good location for the Theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, VERY deceiving website photos!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't spend a dime to stay at this hotel that is actually a motel style hole in the wall. It was dirty, smelly, and truly a disappointment! They had rude signs in the dirty unpainted bathrooms about the use of towels and how it costs THEM $ to wash them , so hang them up! How rude!! The photos they have posted on their website are VERY deceiving. It is not a nice place at all! The vending machines are all out of order. We heard loud screaming and laughing into the late late hours of the night. We were actually afraid of having our kids go to the pool that was full of shady looking people. This is NOT a destination for the family looking to enjoy a family vacation. We thought we were saving a little money by staying here instead of on the Disney property. NEVER AGAIN will we make that mistake! Spend the extra $ and stay on the Disney grounds or research your hotel further than the internet, so as not to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I've been to better ones”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where to start I checked in 6/28 and there was a msg on my phone from 5/18 for the previous guest Kudos to the Housekeeping Supervisors. The older woman at the pool bar during the mang. reception was surly at best, plus she didn't even know what she was doing. Ask for a Bud Light and she said she was all out, so you took a Bud. Go back 5minutes later ask for another Bud she said I'm all out have a Bud light this went back and forth everyday to every other person, go figure. The pool was over run 20 hrs a day by teenagers. I felt like I was back in the bush, the security KID did nothing to restore order so he more or less joined in. Not good for kids under 6. Housekeeping service was good and the location was good. No cable, no VCR and no waher or dryer access. Call me spoiled but all of these items were at the last qaulity in Kisseeme that I stayed in. Search around you won't regret it but if you have no choice it will do.

Reviews.Title: “Family Budget Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at this property for a very cheap price via one of the major discount travel websites. No major problems. They're finishing up a refurbishing of the pool area which is long overdue. The pool was never closed though. The place is FULL of kids probably due to the cheap prices. The room was very quiet surprisingly. I was never bothered by the late night pool activities. The rooms are nice and large and the kitchenette comes in handy. This ain't the Ritz or a glitzy WDW property folks. Its a budget family hotel so if you're looking for a fancy adult setting with a quiet pool area forget that. The rooms are average for decor, but daily housekeeping and overall cleanliness is fine. I never went to the free continental breakfast, but did have a few beers at the complimentary cocktail hour. The hotel is very convenient to cheap eateries and next door to a 7-11 for snacks, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: Jhutch
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the entire staff was very nice at this hotel, and did try their best to correct any problems. Nevertheless, our stay with a 2 year old and 5 year old was less than enjoyable. After deciding to forego staying at a nicer hotel in downtown disney vs. having a suite, we were hoping for the best! We figured with a suite, the kids could go to bed and we could stay in the living room and watch our favorite shows. WRONG! TV problems every night, no ability to watch CBS or NBC without it being all noisy and lines going through it. They tried to fix it, but there is something wrong with the hotels cable provider or something. They did very nicely, adjust my room charge, but nevertheless it wasn't the vacation we hoped for (a little alone time to chill and watch TV after being at the parks all day). ALSO, the living room is the closest room to the pool, which has a radio blasting and children screaming until ATLEAST midnight, so forget this hotel if anyone is planning on getting a decent nights sleep in the pull out sofa. Finally, not the cleanest place I have ever been in - bathroom need serious updating and scrubbing (black marks all on the outside of the tub). And, just to complete our stay, the water was shut off in the afternoon just as we were trying to shower and get ready for my 5 year old's BIRTHDAY dinner!!!! Do yourself a favor, stay at a downtown disney or WDW hotel and forego going out to eat a couple of nights to pay for the difference!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from April 26th to May 1st. I was very pleased with everthing. We had one of the deluxe suites. I thought the staff was very courteous. Our suite was very clean and was very affordable. I thought the breakfast was good. The only thing I think would help was if the kitchen had 1 or 2 large bowls for putting the food into after you cook. I think the staff work very hard to try and keep it looking nice. I would stay here again. We even arrived an hour early and our room was ready, the left us go right up. They were very helpful with driving instructions. We didn't use the shuttle service because it leaves at one time and only returns at one time. Driving allows you to come and go as you please. I would highly recommend this place. Once we closed our doors and the air conditioner was on I couldn't here any noise.

Reviews.Title: “A Family Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After five successful years of staying at Quality Suites Maingate East with our 80+ group of elementary band students and their families, it feels like a "home" away from home. We originally picked this place because of its proximity to Disney where our students perform and because of its reasonable rates, but we now have many more reasons for continuing to use this hotel. The main desk staff is always very helpful. Lynn Evans and John Shreve, the sales persons we work with are the BEST! We come back from the parks to clean sheets and straightened rooms with added touches. The breakfasts are substantial and the coffee is great. The buildings surround the pool area which makes it much easier to keep track of our students. There is good parking for tour buses and large trailers. The rooms are large and spacious. The hotel staff has tried to accomodate our needs in every way. They are creative, flexible and gracious. We want to thank all of the staff for making our stays so enjoyable. We love you! The OakBow Concert Band

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is just a note to let everyone know that I was very satisfied with my recent stay at the Quality Suites Maingate East. We stayed from 4/13/2004 thru 4/19/2004 in a suite with my brother and his family. The room was just as it was advertised and was PLENTY of room. The service we received was great! The location of the hotel was perfect with so much within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to both friends and family. Quality Suites helped make my vacation enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Unsupervised Children, Noisy, Poor Security presense”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is extremely noisy, slamming doors, housekeeping carts being rolled back and forth at all hours of the day and night, paper thin walls. Children of all ages left unsupervised. The hot tub is supposed to be for adults only, yet it was always full of children from infants in diapers with their parents to teenagers. There was no hotel managment presense to enforce any rules. The 4-6 free happy hour consisted of the cheapest wine you can buy served in small bathroom sized cups, beer, and no gratis snacks. The rooms were drab but appeared clean. For a family with small ones it's probably a pretty good deal but don't expect too much.
